review_body: The Metro is a fantastic hotel. The central location allows me to walk everywhere as I explore this vibrant city. The hotel and rooms are adorned with stunning paintings and artwork. Each room is different, all full of character and immaculate. I pride myself in having the fortune of staying in a number different rooms during a few recent trips. The gorgeous people at the from desk are never too busy to make recommendations to optimise my stay, further my knowledge of the area, and make me feel at home. The hotel is also perfectly placed for delicious restaurants, cafe's, shops, and bars in the neighbourhood. A friend in London originally recommended The Metro to me and it’s a tremendous find. The price is reasonable and I haven’t found anything which compares in San Francisco. This is my go to SF hotel and home away from home. I can’t wait to get back there. Well done and a million thanks!

My partner and I absolutely loved this hotel! There are son many good points about it I've struggled to know where to start. The location is perfect, there are so many restauarants and shops around you. You're within walking distance to the painted ladies and there are multiple tram and bus stops only steps away. The people on the front desk were so friendly and helpful, saying hello and wishing us a nice time each time we came in and out of the hotel. They were more than happy to help us navigate the tram map they gave us for free. The artwork throughout the hotel was beautiful. We stayed in room 102. We were a bit worried that it would be a bit small but it was just right. Yes, the bed was the tiniest bit cramped but we didn't care. The view out to Divisadero street was lovely, watching the hubbub of San Francisco from the comfort of your room was awesome. Hopefully one day we will come back to America and back to San Francisco and we can stay here again. Thank you Metro Hotel and all of your staff for making our stay awesome!

We had three nights and enjoyed our stay!The staff was friendly and very obliging.The room was small, but big enough for two and very clean. Nothing to complain!We are looking forward for the next time!

Great location if you are planning on enjoying Golden Gate Park. Was able to walk to many SF locations. Great food in the area. It's no thrills, but rooms are cute & clean and staff is friendly. I was on the top floor and did not mind not having a lift. Would certainly stay again.

Originally very hesitant to book this hotel but so glad we did! Very clean & comfortable - no lift but knew this prior to booking so selected a 1st floor room (111). Great bed, small but adequate en-suite, small wardrobe. Ceiling fan/Heater. Would have liked a fridge but survived without one as most of our time spent sightseeing. MUNI bus stop very close by, approximately 15 minutes via bus to downtown. Lovely owners, helpful staff. Great rates. Would happily return & recommend to anyone looking for reasonably priced accommodation in SF.

We booked here for 4 nights after being recommended to it by a friend who had loved their recent stay. We even cancelled another hotel we had booked and we are SO GLAD we did because the Metro is fantastic!From our arrival, where we were greeted by the nicest lady on reception (I think her name was Angie), to our departure, where we were warmly seen off by, I think, possibly the owner (extremely beautiful lady with amazing make up skills who was a DELIGHT!) everything was tip-top. I must have mentioned upon booking that we were celebrating my birthday - when we arrived into our room after a long transatlantic journey, there was a lovely, bright birthday card and a big Toblerone waiting for me - what a nice surprise!Our room was a large one at the front on the second floor, with two huge comfortable double beds and a small but perfectly formed bathroom. The shower was powerful and with plenty of hot water any time we needed it and a lovely additional touch of Trader Joe shampoo, conditioner and body wash. A hairdryer is also provided, along with plenty of room in the bathroom for all our bits and bobs. A separate toilet is a great idea - no bathroom hogging in the mornings from my partner!All areas of the hotel were clean and tidy and the area felt perfectly safe, even at night. There are lots of great places to eat and drink a short walk away - our favourites were Black Sands brewery and 4505 BBQ. Some really nice boutique stores locally, too.The location is a great one to explore from - a bus stop is right around the corner for the 6 which takes you down to Market Street to get a cable car, for example. It's also quite walkable for Haight and Golden Gate Park and the Painted Ladies are not far (I say walkable, just don't forget all those hills!).Sleep-wise, despite being on a main busy road, we didn't feel it was overly noisy. In fact, thanks to the room and our flight times from the UK, we slid right in to great sleep pattern and no jet lag, which is not something we usually manage on our frequent trips to the USA!The room had ample space to store our clothes, a TV with lots of cable channels and most importantly in this day and age - great and reliable fast wifi!The staff were only too happy to make recommendations and suggestions for places to eat and things to see and everyone had a cheery hello or goodbye when leaving and coming back for the day. I genuinely cannot think of a better place to stay in San Francisco and that's before we even get to the financials - this is GREAT VALUE! San Francisco is one of the most expensive cities on the planet but somehow this place delivers on that front too. HATS OFF, GUYS! Overall, would and will highly recommend this place to everyone and of course, will definitely be back to stay again when we are next in SF. Thanks so much to all the staff for their efforts in making our stay a memorable one!

We stayed 7 nights at The Metro Hotel. Found it clean, quiet and friendly. Lovely shower and very comfortable bed.Ideal for exploring. Walkable to panhandle end of Golden Gate park. Bus stops very near hotel were easy to use and we bought a clipper card. Bus trips only $2.50 per time. Uber to airport on final day was $21.77.We stayed in Room 208. Fairly small but very quiet at back of hotel overlooking a small courtyard garden so away from road noise.No coffee making facilities in room but nice coffee shop 3 doors up from hotel which we used each morning. Pizza restaurant right next door was excellent but very busy and you can't book.

We have stayed at The Metro Hotel over the past five years whenever we have visited family in San Francisco. It is our 'go to' hotel because we feel safe, the rooms are spotlessly clean, very reasonably priced, and the staff is personable, friendly, helpful and accommodating. We always recommend this hotel to our friends that are visiting San Francisco.

This is a very good hotel in a great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room itself was spotless. As breakfast wasn't an option, a coffee machine would have been a nice touch, but that is a minor gripe. It was both a great place base for exploring San Francisco and to come back to in the evening, with numerous excellent coffee shops, bars and restaurants; check out Nopa, The Little Chihuahua, Barvale, Ragazza, Vinyl Cafe, etc, etc; all on the doorstep.

It was a lovely little hotel, and the staff were super friendly. Room was a little small, but we did see larger rooms so might be a good idea to request a big room when booking. Good location, right next to Haight St, I think it was about a 20 min walk or so into the city. But it’s nice to walk around the neighbourhoods. The Italian next door and the Thai across the road is highly recommend!

My husband and I stayed here during a consultation appointment at UCSF. The staff was WONDERFUL. They recommended places to eat that were affordable, remembered when we had to be at the hospital and just overall seemed to care that our stay was comfortable. I overhead them giving other customers great detailed information on tourist activities. They really go the extra mile to make your visit pleasant.

As others have said,this is not an Uber smart hotel and our room(114) was not big but everything was very clean and comfortable, particularly the bed. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful, whatever time of the day. We loved the location, close to the 1960s hippy district. Bus travel downtown is very easy and cheap. You can easily walk to golden gate park. There are some excellent places to eat and a couple of supermarkets close by.we would have liked to be able to make hot drinks in the room. There are no facilities to do this but there is an excellent coffee shop a couple of doors down which opens at 7 in the morning. This is a great place to stay for an ‘authentic’ stay in SF. Our room was very quiet and we cannot thank the staff enough for their kindness during our stay.

For the price paid, I would highly recommend this quaint little hotel for a short stay in San Fran. It is situated a very convenient 30 minutes away from most tourist spots via public transport and is in a very safe and nice little neighbourhood. Staff were very helpful during our stay which we appreciated. We also liked the little touches at the hotel including umbrellas provided on wet days! The room was a little small, but fine for the two of us for a couple of nights!

I recently visited with my grandparents to take my grandma for her chemo treatments and they were so polite and my grandma loves sitting and talking with them I even went down and talked the the owner and her daughter they are both so helpful I would recommend you to stay here fabulous service and full with super friendly people

I actually hate writing a review, selfishly, because I’m afraid to let people know about this place. The staff is upbeat, friendly and helpful. The beds are so comfortable and the location is fantastic. The hotel is warm and feels like home. I really can’t say enough about this place. We love it!

I would not classify this a hotel. It looks more like a hostel. The room was really, small, street noise was constant, walls are thin and the area of town was not as I would have pictured. The staff tried best, but this is a budget hostel.

Love everything bout our stay in the Metro. Peeps at front desk are particularly commendable especially Angela and Harold who are friendly and helpful with recommendations (best Mexican we’ve ever had and the Canopy View Trail at Muir was just the perfect choice for us) who gave us such great impression bout SF. xoxo

We stayed 4 x nights at the Metro hotel and absolutely loved our stay. The rooms are cosy, clean and secure and we cannot give enough thanks to Angela on the front desk who was so welcoming, smiley, polite and lovely from the first moment we walked in. Thank you very much Angela and the Metro hotel for making our stay in San Fran as perfect as ever!! <3

The Metro is a warm, welcoming family-owned hotel and my go-to when I'm visiting my daughter who lives in the Upper Haight. Just came back from my latest visit, where I stayed in room 206 for three nights. The staff, including Shayna and Angela, are so friendly that I found myself chatting with them on my way in and out, like you would with a friend. The key things I'm looking for in a hotel are cleanliness, comfortable bed, fluffy pillows, and comfortable sleeping conditions, e.g., ceiling fan, and the Metro delivers on all of these points. The bathroom and shower are clean as well, and they don't overlook the little things, like shampoo, body wash, hand soap, and tissues. Knowing I don't have to pack some of those things is really helpful. When I did have a little trouble getting the overhead light to turn off but wanted the fan to stay on, I called Angela at the front desk and she walked me through the troubleshooting (it was an easy fix). I highly recommend the Metro Hotel for those wanting a clean, affordable stay in a happening area!

I wasn't expecting much when I booked a hotel in San Francisco for a hundred bucks a night; but, in this instance I was pleasantly surprised. The room is small. Two people would find it a tight squeeze. Simply furnished, no bedside lamps but ceiling lights. Bed is small, but comfortable. Bath is tight, shower is small. Plenty of hangers, but no drawers. Shelves in closet are high but you are given a pouf to stand on to reach them. Twenty-four hour staff is young and friendly. Neighborhood is convenient, walkable and chock full of interesting restaurants and shops. Lobby is comfortable. Garden is usable only until five pm after which it becomes a part of a neighboring restaurant. No elevator and steep stairs. Overall, clean, efficient, affordable, friendly. I booked again for next June.

Who said chivalry is dead? When I booked the Metro (at 1/3 the cost of other San Francisco hotels), I never would have guessed that this old fashioned, brownstone style boutique hotel would leave such a strong impression on us.Its charm and comfort was second only to the owner’s attentiveness and genuine hospitality. Shana, thanks for making our visit so magical❤️ Wendy and Jon room 111

I spent 11 days overall, with my partner at the Metro Hotel in September and without a doubt, our vacation would not have been as good, if we hadn't. Aside from being everything you want from a hotel, in a great location for exploring this city and short walks from the Castro district and Golden Gate Park, what sets this hotel apart from the rest is the people who work and manage the place. From the moment we arrived Angela was so unbelievably welcoming, friendly and professional. We asked a lot of questions about things to do and using the public transport system and the help and advice we got allowed us to get around the city easily and see some amazing places. Shana gave us incredible trip suggestions both in SF and onwards to LA and personally helped make my birthday a fantastic night. Everyone who helps run the Metro Hotel went far beyond any expectations to make sure our stay was the best. We believe they all have such genuinely good hearts, that I can honestly say we miss being there. Book the Metro Hotel with confidence and have the best time, in the city we left our hearts in.

We only stayed one night, but my adult nieces loved the area, we took several walks, very convenient to restaurants and parks, makes you feel as though you're living in the neighborhood. We used the small back patio to have a glass of champagne, very pretty. No parking but easy rideshares to other neighborhoods available. Best thing was Shana, so friendly and helpful, whose father painted all of the wonderful art in the lobby and many of the rooms. Also a very clean hotel, which I much appreciate. Couldn't beat the prices of the rooms, either (we had 2). Definitely coming back!

This hotel is in a fab location. We had the largest room at the front of the hotel, which was beautifully decorated. There is also a terrace at the back to enjoy in the evening. The only thing that stopped this getting 5 stars was the parking. If, like us you are on a road trip and need to park your car then prepare yourself. We asked at reception about parking and were told oh you can use residential, just drive around for a little bit and you will find one! 2 hours after we arrived and we were still driving around looking for a parking space. We only managed to get one because we found a spot but had to leave before 6am. The staff / hotel could have been much more helpful. You guys are the locals - it would be helpful if you could give addresses of local 24 hour parking rather than being left to drive around for 2 hours. It left us no time to enjoy the evening and by the time we got to the room we were all fed up and wanted to go to bed. If you are not driving then this hotel is great !

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Metro.Two major pluses : the price and location. By SF standards, this hotel was very affordable compared to other hotels closer to the city center. And being right on Divisadero, we found a good mix of places to have coffee and breakfast and to have dinner. It was a quick walk to the bus stops we needed to get to. Our room was small, but comfortable and very clean. The shower was also small, but the towels were especially thick and plush.There is no fridge in the room, but the front desk was happy to hold food in the lobby refrigerator for us. If you need an ironing board, they have that too. Every staff member we encountered was super friendly. Returning at the end of each day, we were always greeted with a warm welcome. When in SF, The Metro is the place to stay.

Stayed here for 3 nights in September. Hotel is in a great area and costs about 30$ by Uber from the airport. Only on street parking nearby. All the staff without exception were so friendly and helpful. They were able to help us organise our trips out around the city and where to eat. The room was spotlessly clean with maid service each day. Toiletries were provided and a ceiling fan rather than aircon. There is no safe in the room or coffee machine which was a bind as having to carry your valuables everywhere. There isn’t a fridge either and the bathroom door slides on runners in the ceiling which was difficult to close/open.The hotel is on a main road and unfortunately at about 4am each day the main shop bins are emptied and a few minutes later the streets are cleaned. I appreciate this isn’t the hotels fault but something to be mindful of. The public transport is very good in the city and buses stop a short distance away. Get the 6 or 7 into downtown for 2-75$ each, you do need the correct change. When booking I remember that this hotel came up at a reasonable price compared to many others. I would give it 5 stars if the few points mentioned were addressed but again the staff were so helpful and I would like to thank them.

We spent four nights while in town for a wedding and it was the perfect jumping off location for all our adventures. The staff was super friendly and the rooms were clean and well equipped. We will definitely stay here again when we return for our next visit.

We were in SF for 3 days and chose this hotel since we were on a budget but wanted a clean place with private bathroom etc.... we were not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and I was able to borrow a plate and knife to use while packing lunch to enjoy at Golden Gate Park. Room 107 was small but worked for the 2 of us and had a good bed and a good sized bathroom with great water pressure (& Trader Joe shampoo, conditioner and body wash). The towels were replaced and room cleaned each day. It’s a bit far from some main tourist attractions but public transportation and Lyft are easily accessible. Felt perfectly safe even at night. We walked a lot - it was a great way to get to know the area. Tons of affordable cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. If we come back to SF we’ll stay here again.

About a 20 minute drive from the harbour, the Metro was a nice little hotel hidden away down one of San Francisco's streets.The staff we met were really nice and friendly, and were always on hand to give us tips about the area and where we should visit. Its also a short walk away from Golden Gate park, which worked well for us.

I live around the corner from The Metro and this is the hotel my mom stays at when she comes to visit from Florida. This is a fabulous place and I highly recommend it. The staff is fantastic and so accommodating. The rooms are cozy. This is a family business, and Ellen and Shauna are so nice and helpful. They always make my mom's visits so enjoyable. Thank you for taking good care of her.Cheers,Chris LaGrand

I had a pleasant stay at the Metro Hotel. Both of the front desk staff were friendly and fantastic. They offered helpful suggestions on places to visit in San Francisco and how to get there. They also gave us toiletries such as toothbrushes, toothpaste and a cleansing bar when our luggage didn't arrive with us on the plane.The hotel room was clean and the area felt safe. In comparison, downtown San Francisco can be a bit seedy with the amount of homeless people. It was only a short bus ride to downtown.

The staff made our experience wonderful. Matthew was especially great allowing us to checkin early. We had a wedding to go to at 4. The room was small but very clean. We enjoyed the little outside area for sitting and viewing the the plants and trees. Walking distance to restaurants and bars. Can't beat the price for San Francisco.

We stayed in the annexe which is just around the corner from the Metro Hotel. The hotel was very comfortable, clean and tidy. The location of Divisidero Street was excellent for our trip. There are many restaurants and cafes within the immediate vicinity. Public transport is very accessible in the area. The staff are extremely helpful and informative, not only for advice on attractions, etc in San Francisco but also for Los Angeles.

First, the iconic location: Divisidero and Haight (well, a block away : ) But more importantly, the attention to detail in this incredibly charming place: the magnificent contemporary artwork that the father (now deceased) painted that grace all of its rooms and hallways; the amazing bed and pillows; the nice windows; 24 hr concierge and most of all, its price. I'll definitely come again!

Stayed in room 115, which sleeps three and is located at the rear of the hotel. Pros: Staff is excellent-knowledgeable, friendly, helpful. Room was quiet (except at dinner time for the restaurant next door, that has a gazebo in the hotels garden). Nicely appointed room with enough room for 3 of us. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash were provided. The price of the room enabled us (on a tight budget) to stay in the city. The neighborhood was great, in that there were many restaurants within walking distance. Cons: Rooms are on the second floor and there is no elevator. Parking is a challenge. We could usually find a spot in the neighborhood, but working around the 2 hour max and street sweeping days was challenging. There are pay parking garages nearby, but they looked expensive. The shower in 115 was small. You will want to bring a shower cap if you don’t want your hair to get wet. And bring your own Charmin if you want better than commercial grade toilet paper.

All of the front desk people were incredibly helpful, kind, friendly and ready to make our stay as enjoyable as they could. They had excellent ideas about places to see and how to navigate the city. When we returned from a trip they always asked about our experience. The only inconvenience was the lack of an elevator, but that was very minor. We had a wonderful 4 day San Francisco experience, and this hotel was a major part of that.

We had an absolutely wonderful stay! The staff members are very welcoming and were very informative in helping us plan our stay by recommending things to see and do on a map and the easiest ways to get their by public transport. Our room was compact but very clean and comfortable with everything we needed, in addition to having funky decor. The location is excellent as there are lots of cool restaurants along Divisadero St. and amenities as well. We had a great time walking up and down this street and trying out a different place to eat. It's also within walking distance of Haight Ashbury, Painted Ladies and buses to get you downtown. This place really has everything we needed for an excellent price, would highly recommend! Thank you to the amazing staff who made our stay that much more pleasant and smooth!

Stayed for 3 nights. We stayed in the largest room for 5 people. Very big and comfortable beds. Was very quiet . A couple of restaurants nearby. Next door is Ragazza. Good pizza. Their is also a little supermarket about block away. We didn't take transportation because we ubered. It was cheaper for us. We walked to Chinatown. About 3 miles. Definitely will stay again if we are back.

Stayed at The Metro for two nights with my family of five. From my booking, trying to accommodate five people, to giving us exploring/restaurant tips, Shana went up and beyond your normal advice to make sure we enjoyed our first trip to San Francisco. You can tell she really cares about The Metro, it’s guest, and the city. The hotel itself also has a great vibe with its historic charm. I worried about the location not ever traveling to SF, but it ended up being perfect. The lower Haight location gives you that spot when you get up in the morning you have 5-10 cafes or bakery within a 1-2 minute walk. While we enjoyed every part of San Francisco walking around this area (painted ladies and Golden Gate Park) may have been the best part. Love this place!

The Metro Hotel is a nice clean place to stay. They offer great attitude, energy, and a safe, clean place to stay. The room was cozy and the bathroom was clean. The bedding was crisp and comfortable. There is great food close by in all directions. You are walking distance to some of the best parks on earth here. I hope we return to SF, and when we do, I hope to stay here.

My husband and I along with our best friends stayed at this boutique hotel for our wedding and honeymoon. Most of our time was spent away from the hotel exploring the city so the ammenities were perfect for our needs. Any issues were incredibly minor and immediately remedied by the wonderful staff. We stayed in room 101 at the front of the hotel. Great people watching spot through the beautiful ceiling to floor windows. Comfy beds, extremely clean. Fresh fluffy clean towels everyday. We returned to wine and chocolates in the room along with a super sweet card upon our return from our wedding.Great breakfast, brunch, coffee/tea and lunch spots within close walking distance. The Italian restaurant next door has some of the best pizza around. HUGE thank you to Shayna and the staff for being so helpful with suggestions and directions. You guys were huge in making our wedding trip a great success. Will definitely recommend and return whenever I'm in the city. Many Thanks!,Mary & Jeff Sellars

We took a family trip to San Francisco (needed two rooms) and were so happy to find ourselves at the Metro Hotel. The neighborhood was safe and had many amenities including retail, restaurants, and a laundromat in the immediate vicinity. These things made our stay that much easier.The room sizes were efficient without feeling cramped which is what we expected. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. One room had a view of the street with bay windows that could be opened for a cool breeze.The service at the Metro was outstanding. It is a family owned and operated hotel which is always appealing to us. Every one of the front desk attendants were friendly and knowledgeable. The owner's daughter was a joy to speak with. She helped us with parking solutions (no parking tickets... yay), restaurant recommendations (tasty), and an idea for getting around the city that was simple and cost-efficient (saw so many great sites).If we return to San Francisco, we would definitely book at the Metro again.

If you want a delightfully authentic San Francisco experience and you don't have unlimited funds, this is by far the best place to stay. That's why many of the guests, like me, stay here every time we come back to San Francisco, which for some of us is our hometown. There's a beautiful garden in back that provides peaceful relaxation. The rooms are very clean and nicely appointed with the sort of very comfortable beds and high quality bedding travelers rarely find except in 4 star or better hotels. The free WiFi is fast. Gorgeous, original art works created by Ted Soulis, the famous San Franciscan whose family still owns the hotel, decorate the walls in the public areas and the rooms. You can ask for and get a very quiet room, yet you are in a lively neighborhood filled with nice cafes, restaurants, bars, and shops. You can get very inexpensive and delicious meals at many nearby restaurants and two excellent delis, Falletti's and Bi-Rite, ideal for anyone who wants fresh local food with no preparation hassle! The attentive desk clerks (on duty 24/7) treat you like a dear friend and can advise you on where to go and the easiest ways to get there. Several popular tourist attractions are within walking distance. Within a few blocks there are many frequent service buses that can take you almost anywhere in The City and to various BART light rail stations. The prices are comparable to -- and usually better than -- those of short term rentals in any reasonably safe areas, and you are never left on your own to deal with problems, the way you are in a short term rental apartment. For those who care about the homeless, you can sleep guilt-free at night knowing you have not contributed to San Francisco's housing crisis by selfishly occupying an apartment that has been taken off the rental market. The Metro makes it very pleasant to do the right thing!

We arrived at the Metro very late on our first night in San Fran. We were met with a very friendly front desk attendant. The rooms were comfortable clean and affordable. The hotel felt homey! I had mentioned it was my boyfriends 30th birthday in the booking as the reason for our trip and they went out of their way to give him a birthday treat and a birthday card welcoming us to the city and signed from all their staff. It was a much appreciated and unexpected personal touch. We only spent one night here but wished we had stayed longer!

I stayed at The Metro for 3 nights in May 2018, choosing it largely because it was so affordable for San Francisco. Having stayed now, it’s clear this gem of a hotel is incredible value.There was a lot to like about my stay, but the wonderful staff working at the hotel are what made it so enjoyable. Radiating warmth, so friendly, full of advice about San Fran & areas to visit, but also just happily sitting down & chatting with guests to make them feel welcome. They added a lovely personal element that is just lost on many hotels. I would stay there again based on the staff alone.As to the hotel itself, the location to me was ideal. It is out of the main city area, but the Haight Ashbury area is a lot calmer & safer than the city center, & the public transport options so close to the hotel meant you could get anywhere quickly. There are plenty of great restaurant, bar & cafe options nearby, & the hotel is well located for a quick trip to visit some key areas like Golden Gate Park, the Painted Ladies, & the Castro.I stayed in room 201. It looks out on the street but I didn’t find the light or noise too bad. It was a bit of a climb getting to the room as there is no elevator, but the hotel is very clear & up front about this on their site & in email correspondence & it wasn’t a concern for me.The room was a little on the small side, particularly the bathroom. However it was well decorated & attractive, & immaculately clean. The extended bar/table with chairs overlooking the street is a good touch.If you’re mobile & happy to climb stairs to get to your room, I would whole heartedly recommend The Metro. I will definitely be staying again if I get the chance to visit San Fran again in the future.

Pre booked this hotel months ago after reading good reviews on here. At the time of booking there were only a limited number of rooms left, and it showed you online which rooms they had with a description of each. The hotel was in the Haight-Ashbury area of San Francisco which is the hippy area. The hotel had a large bed and although the room was quite small, it had a wall mounted tv and a large bathroom with full bottles of shampoo conditioner and body wash. There are no lifts in the property so you will have to carry bags up the stairs. We arrived at around 2pm (an hour before official hotel check in) but the receptionist Shanna checked us in straight away and gave us vouchers to get discount on the big bus tour. She also recommended loads of places for us to eat and drink and how to use the public transport. She was so lovely and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to first time tourists like ourselves.

The Metro Hotel is everything promised and more. It's not luxe, in that there is no elevator nor coffeemaker in your room (who needs one, there are fabulous coffee options on every corner nearby!) and the rooms are on the smaller side but that did not detract AT ALL from our stay. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the shower was the best! If TV and wifi are your thing, both are available and free.The location is convenient--we walked and affordably ride-shared wherever we needed to be but there is bus service nearby as well. Shayna was so helpful in her recommendations and made us feel welcome every time we walked back in the door.Best value for money and we will return on our next visit to the city.

In my opinion, The #1 Best Boutique Hotel in San Francisco. Located in one of the safest areas of the city, with plenty of busy coffee houses and right over a fantastic Italian restaurant. The owner, Shayna, is a rare person who loves making people feel welcome, as do the staff, Mathew, Angela, Marco, Lori, et al. I loved my stay, appreciate the numerous wonderful paintings by Shayna's father, obviously the fifth member of the "California Four" that grace the lobby and rooms. I really enjoyed the triple-pane windows with blinds between the glass, high ceilings, self-dimming lighting controls, Japanese garden, wonderful bed. I would say the quietest hotel room I have ever had in SF. Rooms are small, but so is the price. I observed many guests were returning for their second or third stay, and it is obvious they love the place, too. I will definitely be back. My first choice.

It's not fancy but the rooms are clean and the one we had was a good size. The bed was fine and other facilities such as bathroom perfectly adequate. It's not the Ritz but the price is definitely better than you'll find anywhere else in central San Francisco. The location for us was excellent since it was only two blocks away from our son's condo. Note there are no elevators so you have to carry your bags up a flight or tow of stairs. There are several rooms in the back, so there is no street noise.

I don't write a ton of reviews. The places I do end up writing about are the ones that I feel so strongly about that I can't imagine not singing their praises to help their business thrive. This place is such a good value, balancing price point, quality, and service, that I really can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. Not only that, the neighborhood is not very tourist-y. If you want to be near the cable cars, Wharf, or Lombard Street, you may not want to stay here, but if you want to visit the city and enjoy it while you pretend you're a local, this is the spot. Just a lovely, friendly place at a great price.

For our first visit to San Francisco, we couldn’t have picked a better hotel. It became our comfortable, welcoming home base. The hotel’s own description is accurate, so if you want a boutique hotel and not a big chain hotel with unneeded amenities, this is the place to choose. Parking a car would be a hassle. Uber anywhere (we did), or use abundant public transportation (we didn’t).

I stayed at the Metro last week for a vacation I took with my son (9) for spring break. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was friendly and very helpful. I had read the reviews prior to arriving, so was expecting a small room. We stayed in room 202, which is on the 3rd floor with 2 twin beds. There was no elevator, so we had to walk up the stairs (which was fine for us, but just a warning to others). The room was big enough for two people to sleep and store their luggage, and included a TV with a few channels. It reminded me of what a standard European hotel room looks like. The shower was about the size of a broom closet, which worked alright for us but may not work for someone much bigger than me (5'5" and roughly 150lbs). The shower also had an issue with getting the floor sopping wet and unfortunately the offered rug sucked it up and stayed wet throughout our stay. There were a few issues with stains on the blankets (small black stains, I'm assuming ink of some sort) and there were some hairs in the bathroom that were not from us. Neither of these things bothered me, so I did not tell the hotel about it. I just want to provide an honest and complete review. We faced the street and did not have any issues with noise pollution. The room did have a tendency to feel very stuffy in the afternoons when we returned, but opening the windows and turning the fan on high seemed to work well. I would definitely stay at this location again, it was a great price and super convenient to access public transportation.There are a few reasonable restaurants within walking distance. Takes about 20-30 minutes on the bus to get to the Fisherman's Market.

My daughter and I stayed here for two nights. The rooms are small, but clean and fresh. Would have preferred a room with two doubles but none were available. We were busy while visiting, so not in the room a lot. It is in a great location, the staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of frills, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a nice place to hang your hat while visiting family or friends, it's a great spot.

Drove in from the valley to have a procedure done at UCSF and needed a comfy place to rest and somewhat close to hospital, before returning home. Couldn’t of picked a better place to stay! All the staff were extremely helpful from the moment I called in to book. They selected a very cozy room for us, and it was immaculate. We woulda never know a family had just stayed for 5 days in that room before us. The first thing you noticed (besides all the amazing art on the walls) was the scent of clean, but not overpowering, which was very ok with me! The beds were so cozy, and the additional heaters in the room were handy to aid in my recovery. Check in was a breeze, where she issued me “real” keys and assisted with my bags up the stairs. Even after a procedure they were easy to climb. The shower came stocked with Trader Joe’s full size, tea tree shampoo/conditioner and body wash, and extra simple amenities were available upon request.. like irons, razors, qtips. The towels smelled fresh, too! Our room had a little bedroom off the main one, Room #110 and I can’t wait to return with my family to this little hotel for fun and more of the best pies from Ragazza pizza, right outside the hotel doors. The evening proprietor even handed us a little map of the convinces on the block! Would been nice to have a little fridge to hold the left overs, but that In no way takes away this hotels charm! Still a 5 star review, in my book!

this hotel is very near fishermans wharf it's oldy worldy with very helpful staff, it has shared bathroom facilities which wasn't a problem,it's very affordable for the san francisco area and well worth going to

Very pleasant staff. Not so cool with the shared bathrooms and toilets. We were lucky that guests were quiet during our stay but if we would have had noisy neighbours it could have been hellish to sleep

Quaint old fashioned Great place. Small rooms but staff excellent and location excellent. Restaurants and supermarket near by. Tea coffee ready made. Happy to store luggage. Late checkin is good maps available

We last visited San Francisco in 2016, and since then hotel prices seem to have gone through the roof! It was whilst searching for something a little cheaper that we came across the San Remo Hotel. It's situated very close to Pier 39, maybe a ten minute walk, so it's perfectly sited for all your SF adventures. Inside, it is probably the quirkiest hotel we've ever visited. The walls are lined with historic pictures and furniture and you could spend a fair while just wandering the corridors looking at these. Some of the rooms are internal, with their windows looking out into the corridor, which is brightly lit by skylights. Ours was at the front of the hotel with a view of the street. It was small but comfortable and clean, with a quiet and efficient ceiling fan and a period sink.There's no ensuite, instead you share toilets and shower or bathrooms with the rest of the floor you are on. This sounds like a downside but in practice there are plenty of them and we never had any problem finding a spare facility when we needed one. In fact, both toilets and showers are quite lovely in their detail, and both supply quality toiletries. Also, at the end of each corridor we found a lay-z-boy massage chair, free to use, which was most welcome after a day cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge!If you are after a budget hotel in SF, you pretty much can't go wrong with this place, so long as you know what to expect.

My partner stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of June 2019. Great location in the Fishermans Wharf district, North Beach. Good location to hire a bike just around the corner and cycle over the Golden Gate Bridge, amongst other things. The hotel staff were great, friendly and helpful with any query. The rooms and shared showers were exceptionally clean. You had everything you needed on hand, all the way down to ear buds and make-up wipes.. Hot drinks, sweets and chocolates were free to. Great hotel, just like something out of a movie, it's got that typical movie feeling. Can highy recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon from Scotland. Room is small but it’s fine. Shared toilets/showers I was worried about but they were clean and you never saw anyone using them. The shared showers you walk in a small room and lock the door then the shower is in a next compartment so they are very private to use. Our room was right across from the showers/toilets which was good. The location is fantastic a 5 min walk from fisherman’s wharf/pier 39.The staff were fantastic, we arrived at 10:30/11pm on our first night and the man behind the desk with the longish hair (dark hair I never caught his name) gave us his discount card for ordering a pizza to the hotel this was very nice of him. They also have free coffee,tea, water snacks everyday! I would 100% stay here again.

I fell in love with this hotel the second I walked in! The check-in staff were very nice and gave us advice on location, breakfast places where to rent bikes, etc. The hotel is historic and so unique I loved all the plants growing throughout the hotel and all the historic decor. I was hesitant at first about the shared bathroom situation but learned quickly I did not have to fret - the bathrooms were always clean and stocked with warmed towels and so many complimentary amenities (including qtips and makeup remover wipes which was handy). This hotel also has cheap coin laundry and unlimited hot/cold water, tea, and coffee. Also a massage chair!! (After walking up to Lombard street I needed it) I had a outer wall room (meaning I had an actual window) - sleeps were a little rough due to the loud garbage truck every morning at 7:30am but mattress was good, minimal noise from other hotel guests, and my room had a standing fan and ceiling fan so comfort was no issue. Overall this hotel not only provides amazing prices, amazing location, and amazing staff - you get to experience such a unique and quirky hotel.

What a lovely quirky hotel. Staff are excellent. The rooms very clean and reasonably sized. Plenty of toilets/showers/baths located round the hotel. The beds very comfy. I spent 10 nights there and will be staying again on my next visit I promise you that. The location is just perfect. Located only a 5 minute walk away from fisherman’s wharf and the world famous pier 39. A 15 minute walk from pier 33 which is the location of Alcatraz cruises. The Italian restaurant and bar downstairs was beautiful which in my opinion serves the best pasta I have ever had. I can’t recommend this hotel enough. You won’t regret it.

It's hard to rate the San Remo as its pluses and minuses are very clear and have been well-articulated.It's charming, well located, clean and inexpensive with some nice touches like the drinks/snacks bar.At the same time the rooms are small, lugging bags up and down the narrow stairs is difficult, and our internal room was very stuffy, made more so because our small window opened to the area in front of the desk/drinks area and so had to be kept closed.Fans aren't very effective if they are just stirring stuffy air.Some air conditioning would improve the San Remo a lot.

We loved staying here! So much character, very clean rooms and bathrooms, comfortable pillows and mattresses. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We plan to stay here again next time we come to San Fran. Now, it's not your Hyatt, or Marriott or other big box hotel, which we liked, but may not be what some people are looking for. Rooms are pretty small, since that's how rooms were when the hotel was built.We very much liked having a room with a window to the outside.Superb location in San Fran, and nothing comparable price wise in the area. We were out most of the day into the evening so the room size didn't bother us at all.

More than a hotel, it is a type of hostel with a boutique style. Things to know before you book San Remo: 1) Bathrooms are shared, I have not had any problems while using them. I only found human hair during one shower. But other than that, I think they keep them clean. 2) You have to keep in mind that the rooms are extremely small, they do not have air conditioning and the walls are very thins so if you are a light sleeper this could be a problem for you. 3) Also keep in mind that being an old hotel they do not have an elevator, you need to carry the suitcases up like three floors. I would not stay again at this hotel. I would pay a little more for more comfort.

I absolutely love the San Remo Hotel!! It was a perfect place to stay. I felt like I was going home everyday. The bathrooms are always perfect for use. I never had to even wait. The staff is fabulous in every way! I wish there were more of these hotels everywhere I travel!! I look forward to our next visit to San Francisco!

Stayed for 4 nights as part of a trip away with friends. Great hotel, very cute with lots of added details and finishing touches. Beds super comfy and slept great, never heard any of the other guests. Plenty of showers for everyone in the morning. Would definitely recommend!!

Overall I did like this hotel. It was cheap and had character. The staff were lovely. We had a family room but couldn’t get into the room with 3 suitcases. The hotel was a little bit noisy when the European guests awoke from their jet lag after midnight. There was often a wait for the toilet or shower - I must stress that this didn’t really present a major problem. Everything was clean. Great location for fisherman’s wharf and all the tourist hotspots. For value in SF it’s worth a solid 4 but paying $100 more a night for more comfort might still only get my 4 because of the price.

The San Remo Hotel covers your basic needs and, for the price in the area, is a decent deal. Our room was very small (we couldn't open our bags on the floor), but the bed was comfortable. The toilets and showers are at the end of the hall, which worked out alright since you could go upstairs if they were full. The main issue I had was that there was only one sink on the floor, which led to several backups with people brushing teeth, washing hands, washing face, etc. The location was great for exploring Fisherman's Wharf or walking to Coit Tower. There were several good restaurants around as well. The street was also calm enough to pull up a car quickly to unload. The person at the front desk was friendly and understanding when we were running a few minutes late for our checkout as well. I also appreciated the fresh water and coffee at the front.

We spent a week at the San Remo for my mums birthday this March. The hotel is beautifully decorated with period features and the staff were all really helpful and friendly. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms without a sink or bathroom, it was clean and cosy, the shared bathroom facilities were great with everything you could need for your stay. Everything was always clean and well looked after and the WiFi was really great from our room. It’s a little gem right near the waterfront we will definitely be back.

So special and unique; reminds me of our small hotels in Italy. Coffe and tea waiting every morning. Guest were all of the same like minds, quiet and respectful. The bathrooms were spacious and updated but still retained Victorian charm,

Clean and efficiently operated and why I will return for my 7th time. The massage chairs on each floor are wonderful and the shared bathroom facilities are immaculate. The front desk is extremely attentive to guest's needs or concerns.

This hotel has been well cared for over the years and has a special charm inside. It is detailed immaculately. Each room is special, small and unique. The bathrooms and showers are very nice and have a historic feel with the black and white tile, subway tile and original wood details. The location is superb and close to most SF tourist things. The neighborhood is cool and has a nice vibe to it. As long as you are ok with the restrooms being outside your room, you will love it.

We stayed here for several days, when we 1st arrived, I wanted to kill myself, because I noticed that we'd have to share bathroom and showers. I was like...am I back in college or, even worse...a hostel (granted, I've never stayed at a hostel, so my worries are just in my head. Lol). Then...after a few days in, you get used to everything, greeting other guests in the hallway and on the way to the facilities. The customer service is impeccable too! Very kind and knowledge, of what to do/see/eat, in the area. I believe a staff member lives on-site too, so checking in late isn't too much of a hassle. The downsides:-rooms are tiny, only enough to move around in. Most have individual sinks too.-no tv, but plenty of wall plugs, for electronics/beauty appliances.-walls are THIN. You will hear your next door neighbor's convo, even at regular speaking levels. You will hear many outside sounds too. -parking is several blocks away, at the Safeway grocery store. -there is no valet/luggage person, to help you bring stuff up and down, the several stairs.-nothing for kids/teens to do - like a pool or even lounging area. After a certain time, they will get bored or antsy. -community bathrooms and showers, but like I said earlier, you do get used to it all. The decor is fun and unique. You always run into some fun surprise art piece. They serve plenty of coffee/tea/hot cocoa and CANDY all day, with madeline cookies and brownies, in the morning time.You are within walking distance to The Fisherman's Wharf, a bunch of eateries, grocery stores, little Italy and Chinatown. It's great!

I love this hotel and restaurant. It has so much history and personality. While it is quietly tucked away in North Beach, it is still walking distance to so much. The staff is always friendly. But today Alex saved me and went above and beyond the call of duty. I hands down recommend it and if you meet Alex, you are in great hands. She is the best! Thank you, Alex. I owe you one.

The San Remo was truly one of the best experiences of my whole trip. There is no hotel like this one! A wonderful hotel in a very central location (north beach). We stayed there for two nights during our trip and felt very well taken care of. The decor and atmosphere of the hotel is incredible. It is decorated with such eye for detail - every room is designed differently and in an individual charming way that tells a unique story. The hotel was built in 1906 and it has preserved a lot of its history. It is well worth walking around the inside and taking in its unique charme and atmosphere. There is free coffee, tea and pastries in the morning, and one of my personal favorites were the massage chairs that are free of charge and a perfect way to unwind after a long day of sightseeing! The staff is very attentive and was really helpful (i had an issue with my return flight and they helped my call the airline and sort it out for me). Make sure to check out the downstairs restaurant too! The pasta is great and it has a cozy atmosphere. All in all, an absolute wonderful stay! I will definitely be back!

This hotel is great. It feels like a little step back into old San Francisco. The location can’t be beat. Waking access to fisherman’s wharf, cable car, and bus stops less that a block away. The shared bathrooms were very well kept and we never had to much trouble having to wait for people. This feature keeps the rooms extremely affordable for the location. We plan on staying there when we get back to SF.

rooms are small and with no restroom and shower, but everything is clean and special. free coffee /tea/ sider, and helpful staff. Might be a great option if you want to save money but yet sleep well and stay in a great location.

My sister and I spent one night in San Remo to take in the sights of San Francisco en route to Phoenix. We were a bit apprehensive as it was our first time staying in an hotel with shared bathroom and shower. Well ..we needn't have worried!!! There were so many showers and so many toilets on each floor ..but not only that! there were beautifully decorated little alcoves with hand painted sinks providing mouthwash dispensers and cleansing pads, cotton buds etc and soft towels and face cloths. Something interesting to look at or read around every corner. Our bedroom was reminiscent of my granny's that enveloped you with comfort and warmth and having a peek into other rooms they all seem to be individually decorated. There is tea and coffee and snacks available 24 hours. There is even a laundry room. Every member of staff we encountered was so nice and helpful ..especially Aaren who I had been dealing with while booking. She even gave us lovely little momentos of the hotel when we were leaving. The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing as you can walk to all the interesting places. If you are looking for your typical modern cloned bedroom that you will find in every hotel in the world ...then this is not for you. If you want a unique beautiful charming warm hotel ...this is it!!! Our only regret is that we were only staying for one night!!!!

So much character, I'll be back again! The rooms don't have their own bathrooms but there is a sink in every room. The bathroom are communal and there are several on each floor. The location is great and the rooms are extremely comfortable. The decor makes you feel as if you've stepped back in time.

The hotel is a very budget friendly hotel for where you are located in the city. It’s excellently located beside The wharf, Chinatown, and main downtown area. The hotel property and area is safe. It’s a good location to get to the pier should you wish to take the ferry. Good restaurants near by as well. The hotel is kind of like a hostel for adults just cleaner and quiet. It’s quaint and vintage and has an old world charm. The showers are outside of the room but there are plenty washrooms and showers and they were clean. So you would not have to wait to shower.One thing I would recommend is to bring a laptop or tablet as they do not have a tv in the room. For me that was one thing I didn’t really like. There were few days it rained and we had to stay in and there was nothing to do. It’s a good hotel if you want to simply lay your head at night, but a TV would have been really helpful. The other tip is that there is carpet in the rooms and if you have allergies it may bother you. I would also recommend having some fresh fruit in the front lobby area in combination with the sweet candies. The water, coffee and tea was nice to have after a long day.

San Remo is a nice old-charm boutique hotel. We stayed 3 nights here. The hotel has a nice old colonial vibe to it. It is located in a nice place, just few blocks (5-7 min walk) away from Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms were quite small and there was no AC. Our room particularly had no window as well, so we had to open the ventilators which made it very noisy from the people in the corridor. They have nice refreshments near the reception. Washrooms were common, which was a downer, but it was well advertised like that - so we were aware of what we were getting into.

Celebrating a retirement, three of us stayed at the San Remo in October. It was like a throw back to college years. Built only months after the big earthquake in 1906, the hotel was quaint and small, but the location was exceptional. Staff were always friendly and helpful, even offering to help us schlep our big box of wine down to our ride to the airport. We appreciated the coffee and water and sweet treats near the reception desk. Although the rooms were tight, we found the beds comfy, the hotel clean, guests quiet and friendly, and there was plenty of conversation starters based on the framed posters, pictures and art work in the hallways. The shared bathrooms and showers were not a problem. Enjoyed the nice Italian restaurant on the ground floor. Just be aware that there is a flight of steps up to get to the reception desk and hotel.

Such a good location to piers and a few bars and shops. This is a really unique hotel, it has lots of character and the staff are ever so friendly. San Francisco is one of the most expensive cities in the US so its really hard to find something within budget, but i was happy with San Remo. Although the bathrooms are shared, i really didn't find this an issue, they are so clean and have great amenities. I would recommend this hotel for its great location and great staff.

Great location close to the piers and commercial area.There is shared bathroom and showers. That is a bit annoying, but ok.Great decoration of old times. Good help from staff.Expensive room but that is common in SF.Restaurants and pubs in the area.There is paid parking, but you can leave the car overnight in the street.

Absolutely loved this hotel, rooms are old style with no TV and bathroom is separate but thats all in with the theme. I would definitely return here if i was to return to SF. Free hot drinks machine is available as this isn't in your room.

Think of a hotel from an old western movie and you'll get the drift of San Remo.Many guests, including us, left their door open in the evening. My wife said that's because it's like staying at someone's house.Built in 1906, the decor seems largely original. Electric lighting and power outlets have been added but no a/c, T.V., or elevators.3 blocks from the Embarcadero, you shouldn't expect cheap. Our price was higher than Google advertised and does not include $20/night parking garage. Our room (#1) has a full bed and a sink. Toilets, showers, and a tub are down the hall. That may be off-putting to some but it's easy to make an argument against a toilet in your bedroom. Being 1 floor above the street, we had to deal with outside noise but most rooms don't have windows to the outside.I was reluctant to stay here but I'm glad we did. Much more interesting and memorable than a traditional hotel.

Stayed here for 5 nights, initially was surprised at the old style bedroom with musty smell but got used to it very quickly. Beds were comfortable enough however got woken up by the garbage truck most mornings around 5:30am which made the sound of a thousand glass bottles smashing. You could do a lot worse than this place, staff were friendly enough and selection of teas coffee and hot chocolate was great.

Very close to a lot of attractions like; Pier 39, Pier 33 for Alcatraz, Fishermans Wharf Lombard Street. Two minute walk to the cable car terminal which takes you to Union Square. My partner and I stayed in room 1, which was a fair sized room with a double bed and sink, I expected it to be smaller because of the other review's. It was clean and comfortable, sharing bathrooms wasn't an issue, they were very clean too and enough of them. The decor is fantastic

Close to the Fishermans wharf and other sights, this hotel had a cosy and charming feeling to it. The location was nice, on a rather quiet street with some nice cafes and restaurants in the vicinity. The style was quaint but it felt nice. The room was on the small side, but I did get a good deal on it. There were enough shared bathrooms and showers so no queing there. Would gladly stay again.

We just stayed here and the location was spot on. The hotel room is just that a room, but certainly comfortable enough. You have to share the toilets and showers but don’t let that put you off. There are plenty of showers and toilets throughout the hotel. They go above and beyond.....there is completementry coffee, tea all day, plus in the showers you will find shampoo, conditioner, combs, mouthwash, body lotion plus more.

This is our 2nd visit to this hotel for our anniversary. The vintage and antique feel throughout the hotel provides much more than just a place to lay your head, when you stay at the San Remo, it’s like your time traveling back in time. The hallways are lined with old photos and San Francisco’s history. Most importantly the rooms and bathrooms are the cleanest I’ve seen. They are cleaned almost every hour it seems. The staff is the best and the most friendliest! They even signed our court documents as a witness! Not many people would do that! We will be coming back for sure! Wouldn’t want to stay anywhere else! Almost forgot, if you stay during Halloween, it’s very cleverly decorated throughout the hotel! Much to see on each of the floors! You won’t go wrong with the San Remo Hotel!

Just received came back from San Francisco great city ! I stayed in the San Remo hotel which I thought was very quirky and neat The reception staff very helpful and informative and the maids were top notch with they’re day to day roles ! P.s The massage chair is great for when you’ve had a long day and want to wind down with a herbal tea or coffee :)

I absolutely loved my four night stay at the San Remo Hotel. It is a strange building, built to house construction workers after the 1906 earthquake, which means that there are many small bedrooms leading off the corridor and its spurs, and some of those bedrooms have internal windows only (though natural light does come in from skylights to most). The showers and toilets are shared, though were immaculately clean. Therefore, this hotel will not be for everyone - it is certainly not a bland corporate hotel. However, I thought it was brilliant. Though the rooms are quite small (not as small as some reviewers would have you believe), they are individually themed and furnished with care, giving the place an 'old world' feel. The beds have blankets and quilts, rather than a standard issue duvet, meaning temperature control at night is easy. The corridors are lined with interesting things - posters for old movies, old photographs, maps, 1900s furniture, an old writing desk, a massage chair (free to use), and a host of house plants. There is free coffee, water and various hot drink materials with brownies or madeleines next to reception. The staff are extremely helpful and uniformly friendly. The very nature of the place means that it can be a little noisy - but earplugs are provided in each room, and these are the most comfortable earplugs I have come across. Certainly, with one earplug on the side I don't sleep on meant that my sleep was uninterrupted by noise. Top tip: if you are able to book a room with a window and a sink, do - but if those are all gone, I would stay in the San Remo anyway.

Stayed here for two nights. An amazing old hotel which is full of history. Lots of old pictures on the wall and old furniture. Rooms are a little small but it adds to the charm. Walls also must be quite thick as didn't hear any noise from other guests. Yes you have to share bathrooms but the toilets and showers were cleaned regularly and also quirky. Ask for a room with a window of you like natural light as some of the rooms are internal. They also provide free tea and coffee and a printer which are nice touches.Next door there is an Italian restaurant which appears linked to the hotel and this is in the same style. Are here on first night, good service and great fresh pasta. Definitely recommend staying here, great location, 5 mins walk to fisherman's wharf and right next to the cable car stop that takes you into the city.

We had a 3 nights staying at the San Remo it was the first leg of our holiday. Our bedroom was small but very clean and our bed was extremely comfortable even though you had climb up for some reason we had 3 mattresses on ha ha. It wasn't a problem having to share the bathroom, they where kept lovely and clean and there was always plenty of fresh white fluffy towels available. I used the hairdryer from reception and the staff where great giving us ideas on where to go for breakfast and directions.

We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. I was sceptical at the thought of a shared bathroom but they was never a queue for a toilet and shower and they were all kept exceptionally clean. I also really liked there was little extras at the sink including cotton wool and hand towels.The location is perfect, a 5 minute walk to fisherman's wharf and in a good neighbourhood. Try the cafe across the way, I can't remember it's name unfortunately, but it does great breakfasts. Overall I would stay again if I was on a budget as all the other hotels in this area are nearly double the cost.

Everything was fine. It's an inexpensive hotel in a nice part of town that is suitable for people who only intend to be in their hotel to sleep and shower. The rooms are tiny and the bathrooms and showers are shared but private when you use them. Sinks for shaving, brushing your teeth and washing your hands are not private, however, and are in the middle of hallways so when you pop out of your hotel room, you may see things you'd rather not see. The paper towel dispenser sticks out pretty from the wall in the hallway and I clocked my shoulder on it pretty good; I'd say it is in a dangerous spot. Many doors are on angles; I slammed my finger on a door when casually closing a bathroom door because the hinge was on one wall but the latch was at an angle on another wall and I was not paying attention to that.Internet access was very good.When I booked an airport shuttle at the front desk, I intended to book the shuttle advertised in the hotel's binder in our room. I had to pay the front desk a deposit for the shuttle and pay the driver the rest. The lady at the front desk told me, though, that the shuttle service listed in the hotel book was no more, and they had another service they booked with, "at the same price in the book." Yet I was book for a $17 shuttle, rather than the $14 in the book. I was told that they just hadn't gotten around to updating the book. However, I suspect that they just didn't want to list the name of the new shuttle company in their book so no one could research it before booking at the front desk. It's American Airporter Shuttle and it has one of the worst ratings I've ever seen on TripAdvisor. Unfortunately I trusted the lady at the hotel desk. The shuttle was half and hour late, the van was rickety and I was lied to about pickup times by the shuttle service. I was half an hour late getting to the airport. The hotel gets a cut of this serve and in no way should they be recommending this shuttle company. If their being shady in one area, they're probably being shady in others.Caveat emptor.

Quirky comes to mind to describe the San Remo. A hotel with a touch of hostel about it. It's characterful, like staying at an eccentric Aunt who hasn't modernized her appt but it's in the best part of town, spotlessly clean and you have great memories of the place. I suppose the question is can you cope with a bathroom down the hall and as a consequence gave to see the other residents in various stages of undress. Actually it's fine and adds to the experience. The location is why you stay here, about 5 minutes from fisherman's wharf. There are great eateries all around and a trader Joe's down the block. The rooms are small but who cares when you're in San Francisco. There is free coffee during the day. The staff are helpful and everything runs smoothly.

this was our first stay at san remo and will do so again. its a paradigm shift not having your own bathroom and sharing..but we got comfortable to the concept after 2nd days..what really makes this shared bathroom concept work is the attentention the cleanining staff gives and the courtesy your fellow guests in keeping it clean and ready for the next person to use and enjoy. we stayed 7 nights in july 2018. and will do so again. you cant beat the price and location in the wharf area. but, the overall hotel is a joy to stay in an truly a history lesson just walking the halls and looking at historical photos and memomabilia.

We really enjoyed our 6 nights in San Remo. The hotel was spotlessly clean, including the communal bathrooms. There is a great ratio of bathrooms to guests which meant you were never waiting for the shower.I’d really recommend this to anyone who hasn’t been to San Fran before and wants to be a good central location. The rooms are quirky and individual and compared to other hotels in the city provides good value accommodation. Thank you for our wonderful stay

it is a charming hotel, actually, more like an upgraded hostel. I love the interior decoration. However, the room assigned to me and my husband is right above the restaurant. it was so noisy till 2 or 3 am in the morning. Hotel provides earplug, but I still couldn't get to sleep till very late. it is a huge disappointment for me as I specified in my hotel booking request that i need a quiet room.

Hotel was built in 1906 so you have to like old world charm, and history, including shared toilets and showers. We had outside rooms, so that we could look outside, and only a short walk to the toilets etc. Hotel was only a couple of blocks walk to Fishermans Wharf and about 15 min walk to the Alcatraz Landing for the ferry to Alcatraz. There was a supermarket etc in the Northpoint shops. Would highly recommend this for a budget conscious traveller. Rooms were small very adequate, bed was very comfortable. Didn't hear any noise either from other guests or outside, apart from bins being emptied about at about 6am, but didn't really disturb us. Just a word of warning reception is upstairs so you do have to carry any luggage you have up there.

Charming hotell with chared toilets/showers. We had a twin bed room. The rooms is quite small and there is almost not place for two big bags together with two persons. We were on the second floor and heard nothing at all from the outside. Most noise was from people talking in the corridor outside the rooms. Free coffee and the was avaulable in the lobby. There is no elevator and all rooms is at least in floor up. Alcatraz Cruises and Fishermans Wharf is under 15 munutes walk. The hotel is very charming and I will probably stay here again if returning to San Francisco.

We stayed here for two nights in May and we loved it. The hotel is a historic building and worth paying a visit. The small corridors and rooms, filled with plants, antiques and baseball items are very interesting. There is so much to see. The shared bathrooms are clean and have many amenities. We hardly saw any other hotel guests so don’t worry about waiting lines for the bathroom or running out of hot water. It is not a campground.Although I read in other reviews that the hotel was noisy, we did not experience that. On walking distance of the hotel you can get breakfast. The location of the hotel is wonderful, within minutes you walk to the waterfront.

The San Remo hotel provided us an affordable way to see San Francisco. The rooms are small, the staff is friendly, the showers are hot, and the coffee in the morning is fresh. Our room provided enough privacy. We needed to check in after hours because of our flight time, and the staff was accommodating. I would stay here again!

I recently stayed at the San Remo Hotel for 3 nights on my first visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have chosen a better location. I could walk to loads places around the wharf and I enjoyed the neighbouring eatery for Mexican food most nights. My room was cute. Smallish but completely fine and standards were very high for cleanliness. The help-yourself bar for hot and cold drinks was a nice addition and staff were great. I'd head back there anytime.

5 stars for the price and location. The narrow corridors are nicely decorated, and the rooms aren't as small as many here suggest, with room to maneuver around the bed and space underneath or on the wardrobe for your cases. Having a sink in the room is a bonus, although that costs extra, and we rarely encountered full showers or toilets. If you did, you moved down the corridor to the other ones. It was good having free coffee throughout the day, although it didn't appear until around 7:45, which was later than we'd prefer. There are a couple of supermarkets within 2 or 3 blocks and quite a few cafes and restaurants nearby. Walking up to much busier Washington Square to eat out only takes 10 minutes or so. Same for Fisherman's Wharf. Even walking to Union Square only took around 35 minutes. Highly recommended, if you can cope with a separate bathroom.

Travelling for work I was able to find this lovely B&B in a gorgeous Victorian home. The host was amazing and even made me a brown bag breakfast since I had to leave too early to enjoy the breakfast offered. The room was amazing. Fabulous wallpaper, comfortable four-posted bed, turret with Victorian era appropriate seating, stained glass in my bathroom door, and a gorgeous lobby/sitting area. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed 6 nights in the Montez suite. Friendly innkeepers. Great Coffee! Our trip was to meet our new granddaughter, so we were only there for sleep and breakfast. It was very quiet at night and comfortable. We were in a walkout basement suite with interior access and exterior access to the street. Very convienent! We would stay there again. No complaints!

Lovely property full of charm and style. The ensuite room was characterful with period fixtures although a bit dimly lit due to all the dark furniture and fittings. Breakfast was a substantial help yourself affair and the 4pm wine and cheese serving was a nice touch. The neighbourhood seems to be safe area with no local bars or restaurants but a 15 minute walk will bring you to a decent choice of eateries and drinking holes. The property is a fair way from downtown San Fransisco but only a cheap 20 minute bus ride to the harbour and pier 39, and the Painted Ladies are 5 minutes away. All in all a good stay and worth a visit

This was our second hotel whilst on a two week trip to SF. I booked this based on reviews, location and the style. Upon arriving, we were met by David, who was an exceptional host for our relatively short stay. He helped us with our luggage, showed us around the beautiful hotel, and was incredibly patient in answering a million and one questions we had about the area, and places to go while in SF. We stayed in the Mark Twain suite, which was stunning. Almost large enough to get lost in, the rooms were beautifully decorated, and it felt like going back in time (while still having all the modern luxuries). We had no complaints at all here.During the week, a simple continental style breakfast is served, this includes fruit, cereals, cold meats and cheeses etc. This was more than enough for us, and it was a nice place to sit while chatting to other guests and sharing stories from the previous day. At the weekend, they offer a more substantial cooked breakfast. The location is fantastic, just a couple of blocks from Alamo Square. There's an easy bus service (no 5) to the downtown area too.We really had no complaints or issues at all, and if and when we return to SF, we will definitely come back again.Thank for for the memories!!

There cannot be a nicer place to stay in San Francisco. The house has an amazing history, which is well documented. The owners have recreated the musical artistic feel, with fine furniture and works of art. The bedrooms are themed (we had the Enrico Caruso room) and have excellent bathrooms and showers.Between 4 and 6pm, complimentary wine and cheese are provided in the lounge, giving visitors the chance to share experiences and create new friendships.Continental breakfast is more than adequate.David, the manager, and his colleagues, could not do more to make people welcome, also offering good advice re places nearby to eat and visit. The restaurant we chose from the list provided was first class.

This historic Victorian is beautifully decorated with the artifacts and photos from its years of entertaining theater performers famous in their time. It feels like they are still here with you :) The breakfast is outstanding, rooms are very comfortable. Most have private baths, but I made a last minute reservation and could only get one of the rooms on the upper floor with a shared bath. It turned out not to be a problem at all, since there is a bathroom on the main floor available to all guests. It is just a block from the Painted Ladies and Alamo Square Park and an easy walk to Japan town and also to several UCSF medical buildings. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to San Francisco.

My friend had stayed here before and recommended that we reserve a suite for Sunday and Monday. She requested the Mark Twain Suite, but it was booked so we chose the Luisa Tetrazzini Suite named after the Italian coloratura soprano. Beautiful rooms and furnishings and a modern bathroom that included a double (two nozzles) shower. We enjoyed playing chess and snacking on the wine & cheese served in the parlor. Chatted with some interesting people from New Orleans and NYC at the continental breakfast served by Bridget Monday morning.

This hotel is one of the least expensive by SF standards and it is a little gem. The rooms downstairs are beautifully decorated and are like a haven from the crazy world outside, and it is crazy outside. There are only 9 rooms which makes it more personal. The staff do everything to try and help, providing coffee or just chatting about the area. All staff were friendly. The happy hour is just fantastic with wine, cheese and biscuits located in the lovely historic room downstairs. Breakfast is available and most people sit together at a big table. Sunday they offer a special breakfast with champagne. We had the room at the top so would not recommend for people with mobility issues as there is no lift. I believe there are rooms downstairs as well. Room was lovely bed a bit small and shared bathroom outside which is not an issue. It was a bit of our town near Alamo Sq but there is a vibrant area nearby and it is pretty easy to get into the city by catching the bus at the top of the block. I would actually stay here again because of the service and the comfort.

My husband and I recently spent several nights at Chateau Tivoli. The house is gorgeous and the rooms well appointed. I broke my ankle recently and the staff went out of their way to help me get around.
