I will come back again to this hotel for next time, too! Pipというとても人懐こいホテル猫がいます。部屋はトイレ＆シャワー付きの部屋と、共同トイレの部屋とあり、予約のときに選ぶことができます。特におすすめなのがエレベーター。映画でしか見ないような手動ドアのエレベーターでこれに乗るだけでもホテルに泊まる価値あり。

We were only in town for a day and night, but I would definitely look to stay here again. The place is very charming. The rooms were small, but clean and very nice. It smelled like cookies when we arrived and we popped back in briefly just at tea time to sneak one before dinner. Location is great - just 1 block to cable car and tons of options for eating in the area. I think the price was very reasonable for the area and they do have a parking option right across the street that was easy. My only complaint was that the woman that checked us in was new and seemingly flustered by 3 rooms I had booked for the group. But service was otherwise great (and a kitty to greet you in the lobby so how can you beat that?)

We stayed for two nights and were so lucky to find this place as there was a huge conference of 180,000 additional people in San Francisco. All the positives by other reviewers are true, it's charming, friendly, has a great breakfast & comfortable beds. It's not noisy though .. not sure where that's come from. Yes you have to share bathrooms but it wasn't a problem and the big fluffy robes are lovely. The place is spotless and staff were so friendly. It's also cross the street from a car hire place which was amazing as we just moved our luggage easily to hire our car. I'd definitely recommend it. The area is great, near to Union Sq, the metro and not too far from the Pier area.

It was my second visit to the hotel November 2017. The previous one was around April 2017. The staff is very kind. Thumbs up to Halim who grabbed me some breakfast before going to sleep because I had to wake up earlier than the regular breakfast hours.I'm very pleased with my experience both time I've been there. A preference for me would be the room on the main floor not facing Bush Street.

Though located on very noisy Bush St., this hotel is itself unique and comfortable. The staff members are warm and flexible, and there are tea and cookies available for guests. Parking is conveniently located across the street at a discounted rate of $30/day for hotel guests. The mattress was a bit firm for our taste, but the room was well appointed in the Victorian style. We lucked out and got a free upgraded on our room and the manager was super flexible on a late check-out. I recommend staying here, as long as you can put up with the noise on Bush St.—and San Francisco in general, I suppose.

Golden Gate is a boutique hotel. Accessing rooms on higher floors requires using a small old elevator. I found it fun and charming. If this is a problem then make sure to ask for ground floor.The hotel is about 1/2 mile from muni stop, nearer to Bart stops, easy walk to both. Steps away from a market and Uncle Vito pizza.The rooms were small. Bed was very comfy and plenty of warm blankets. No fridge or closet in room, just a wardrobe. No air conditioner or fan made it a little stuffy one day.We loved interacting with Pip the house cat. He came up with us one night and was always at breakfast.Prepare to gain weight from the almond or chocolate croissants at breakfast along with muffins and rolls, no hot choices. Spencer told us where to eat and was very helpful. He packed us a go bag of croissants before our early flight so we got fed even on our last day. Spencer helped us store our oversized boxes of wine that didn't get in the elevator. He and the others at Golden Gate were wonderful hosts. I would definitely stay here again. A good value in an expensive city.

First visit to San Fran & this gorgeous hotel made it even more special. My son & I shared a room with a bathroom complete with a claw foot bath! The room was quiet & located on the 4th level with access via an old fashioned 1920's lift. Location was perfect to access everything the city offered with cable cars on the corner! A memorable visit

Our second stay at this hotel. Brought our friends with us this time and they enjoyed their stay as well. Great location in San Francisco, close to Powell Street, Union Square and the cable car. Rooms are nice and the owners and staff are very personable and attentive. Nice continental breakfast in their front room each morning.

The best place to stay in SF. If you want to visit San Francisco and want stay at a comfy place that feels like home: here you go...In the heart of the city, exactly were you want to be as a tourist, you'll have a basecamp that will provide you with all you need.Been first time to San Francisco, and will definitely come back. And guess what... I'll stay at golden gate hotel...And if you stay there... have a beer at the last drop tavern down the street,

We loved the Golden Gate Hotel. We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of a trip through California. The ambience was lovely - there are a lot of stairs, but there is an old fashioned lift if the stairs are too much or your bag is too heavy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. One morning we were leaving a bit earlier than 8 for a tour we had prebooked - breakfast (lovely coffee, muffins and croissants) is at 8am but they kindly brought it out 15 mins early. The location is good - about 30 mins walk to fisherman's Wharf and 5 to union square. Lots of public transport options as well - very close to the famous tram line on Powell Street. Great bars and restaurants nearby too. And of course, have to mention Pip the cat, who became your best friend when food was about!

We stayed here for a few nights in August. This was my second stay and I will definitely be back. The building is old and full of character, the rooms are beautifully furnished and the service is low key and effective. There is a nice atmosphere in the dining room at breakfast time, with guests sharing tables and chatting over croissants and coffee. And the piece de resistance is the lovely ginger cat who wanders about at his leisure. This is a totally charming hotel in a great location and I can't wait to go back.

The Golden Gate is a charming little hotel with a family-feel atmosphere. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and very clean. The hallways have trompe-l'oeuil paintings, frames with old views of San Francisco, cozy-looking desk lamps in the corners, and soft carpets. Riding the the old-fashioned elevator, just opening and closing its double metal gates, was fun. Even the walls of the elevator shafts were painted and made for an enjoyable ride. Breakfast was served by the owners in a small and cozy room by the reception. Some of the tables are for sharing which makes it easy to strike up conversations with other guests. The entrance area was presided over by a dignified-looking cat whose preferred resting place seemed to be the New York Times paper on the desk. He looked like the real owner of the place, with his likeness etched into the glass-door hotel entrance, printed on the bathroom soap wrappers and even the shampoo labels. His presence, the antique decoration and the friendly owners made us feel very much at home. Add to this the excellent location close to Union Square and a cable car line, and right across from a car rental station, and it makes a place to be highly recommended.

Cute and charming hotel with a homely feeling! The rooms are quite small, but very clean and the service is great! We loved that they have a hotel cat and that you can bring dogs too. If you are not fond of animals, this is not the right hotel for you! Be aware that the breakfast is light - coffee, juice and croissants.

This little hotel / B&B is a great choice. In a really good location. We found a few good bars within 2 blocks (and a couple of not so good ones. Lol) and good restaurants and diners nearby as well. Chinatown is just a few very walkable blocks away and there's a tram stop at the corner. We had a room with a bathroom but friends staying with us had the shared bathroom and only found it in use once when they needed it. There is a shared bathroom on each floor.Continental Breakfast was included but we ate at a diner on the corner as we were heading out early each morning for tours. If I'm back in San Fran, I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Loved the Retro atmosphere. My daughter and I spent 4 nights. We loved the tea and cookies every afternoon and visiting with Hakim and other residents. Small rooms and "antique elevator "added to atmosphere. We walked about 3 blocks to Chinatown and Hakim gave us wonderful guidance to various places. In addition to all this lodging prices were good

I moved to GGH after a bad experience at other accomm. What a fabulous choice that was! Adorable hotel with warm welcome, cosy room that I didn't want to leave and extremely clean. Lovely staff and great location at amazing price. Definitely recommend!

Chose this B&B based on Frommer's recommendation. 2 nights here with my daughter. Just a lovely place. In Paris it would be a great little 2 or 3 star hotel. It has an original working bird cage elevator which guests operate. There is a friendly house Manx cat named Pip and a friendly house retriever named Cookie. Staff is so friendly and helpful. If you want to be downtown the location is excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable. No concerns or complaints. Would stay there again.

This small hotel boasts a great location, just off Union Square. It offers a bed&breakfast atmosphere in a quasi European setting. The continental breakfast includes freshly baked pastries and muffins as well as coffee or tea and orange juice. There is also afternoon tea with homemade cookies. Our room was small and only had a view of the fire escape. We shared a toilet down the hall but had a shower and sink. . Our TV wouldn't work so we were upgraded to a much nicer room with a private bath.The staff was friendly and helpful. Kip, the cat is the mascot of the hotel. He was formal at first but warmed up to us during our stay. I can recommend this place and would stay there again but would make sure that I had a nice room.

This charming place is halfway between a hotel and a bed and breakfast. It reminds me of some places I've stayed in in Europe. It is not for people who want everything big and modern, but it has what we needed. We booked a room with two twin beds and a private bath. The bath included a large clawfoot tub, and this was a major plus for me in a city that invites and requires a lot of walking. There are lots of antique touches, including an amazing cage elevator and something I've never seen before: a toilet with a round tank. There's lots of interesting art throughout the hotel as well. The armoire had a generous number of hangers and the room included two chairs, a couple of tables and a dresser. I was worried that the street-facing room on the third floor would be noisy, and there is definitely traffic noise. But the windows shut out a lot of it, and it quiets down after nine more than I would have expected so close to restaurants and bars, even on Friday and Saturday. I didn't need the earplugs I brought. The staff are friendly and professional and the owners are charming and helpful. Pip the cat is delightful as well. The breakfast is fine; they were able to accommodate us with some gluten free toast. They offer a discount for parking in the garage across the way and it is much less than you will pay anywhere else. There are also two car rental agencies in that garage. We rented a car just for our last day to travel out of the city, and then dropped it off at the airport. You really can't be the price for the location.

Changed hotels at the last minute to Golden Gate and glad I did. It is located right up from Union Square and Chinatown and right on the cable car line. The building is a bit older and has an ancient, but working elevator. Room was clean and comfortable, but smaller than you would find in a chain hotel. the hosts are great and try to help however they can. Location is right in the middle of a ton of great restaurants.

I spent one night at the Golden Gate Hotel on a business trip. Pros: great staff that bend over backward to meet needs; clean and cozy room; nicely decorated; friendly cat; easy walk to many great restaurants and shopping; near cable car line. Cons: room too small for business work; unable to connect with printer; breakfast too late for my need to be at a business by 8 am; hearing people talk in room next door to late in the night; expensive parking across the street (but not too bad for SF). Overall, I would stay here again if I was with my husband on a leisurely trip.

Stayed here as it was reasonably priced, and found room to be clean, though small. Location convenient. Stayed during fall, so temperature was not an issue. Small functional elevator, but nice stairs makes use unnecessary.There was a pleasant welcome, afternoon tea and cookies were great. Unfortunately, as days started early, was unable to try and comment on breakfast.Yes there is a resident cat, and the one thing that was noticeable was the overpowering smell - possibly cat urine, every time you came and went. That is the only reason will likely consider elsewhere next time. Could be dramatically helped by a refreshing of the carpets.

My husband and I needed emergency accommodations in SF, and we immediately thought of the Golden Gate Hotel, where we had stayed on a previous visit. They accommodated us with warmth and concern for our situation. We stayed the first three nights in a room with a shared bath, which proved to be just like staying at a friends house without a private bath. The room was charming and comfortable. We then moved into a room with a private bath, and it was comfortable and quiet. This place goes out of its way to make you feel welcome. If you are traveling for a good length of time, you will be pleased to know a laundromat is next door on one side, and a dry cleaner is on the other. Not to mention all the great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Don't rent a car - use UBER or walk! We also enjoyed their breakfast and tea and cookies in the afternoon. If you're looking for a respite in the city, you should consider this lovely hotel.

I loved this little boutique hotel/B and B. It has a wonderful feel the minute you walk in. The staff is very accommodating and they make you feel instantly at home. The great surprise is the antique elevator that works perfectly but takes you back fifty or so years. I absolutely loved the elevator with its beautiful engravings. I can still hear the gate close to signal you are on your way up or down. The rooms are tastefully decorated but a little tight on space. We stayed at the beginning and at the end of our California adventure. When we arrived at the end of our trip we had suitcases and bags enough for a two year around -the -world adventure. (The shopping at second-hand boutiques is AMAZING in California)The staff quickly and promptly helped us and delivered them to our room without a second thought. Breakfasts were limited to croissants, juice, tea and coffee etc. I feel that is something they could improve on. Lastly, the location is fabulous. Macy's and the tours buses are just a short stroll around the corner and down the hill.

Loved our stay here. It was so nice to step away from hotels and get the personal touch of a B&B. The staff were all so welcoming and friendly, we felt right at home with a nice cup of tea and cookies. We had a room with shared bathroom, we never had to wait to use and always felt clean. We loved the decore of the place and the breakfast was great. The staff really couldnt do more for us. Like I said this really made our stay in San Francisco and will be part of the trip that really stands out.Great hotelGreat locationGreat staffGreat nights sleepLoved the old lift!Thank you!

The Golden Gate is a charming hotel, very conveniently located, with wonderful hosts. Breakfasts were included and they were excellent Principle tourists sites were within walking distance. This will be our hotel of choice for our next visit to San Francisco.

I arrived mid-evening after a long trip. The lovely gentleman at reception took my bag up to my room then delivered a pot of hot tea and home-baked biscuits. This made me very happy indeed – that and the upgrade on the room. Thank you very much! The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in and the shower was terrific, too. At breakfast, I chatted to the other guests over pastries and many coffees. I encouraged Cookie the dog and Pip the cat to say "hello", missing my own ginger cat at home. I borrowed a guidebook from reception and was given a few helpful tips on where to go. I have only good words and thoughts about this hotel. A real gem in the centre of the city.

My daughter and I spent three days at this cosy, charming boutique hotel that is very well located near the prime San Francisco shopping district of Union Square. This was my first visit to San Francisco and I will always remember it for its beautiful bridge, fantastic shopping, multiple sights, and the Golden Gate Hotel. We had a room with its own bathroom that was decorated in a style reminiscent of earlier last century. The bed was very comfortable. There are plenty of fluffy white towels, and reliable free wifi. Tariffs include a delicious continental breakfast of croissants and muffins with tea or coffee and fresh orange juice. Afternoon tea of fresh cookies and delicious blackberry tea served in the gorgeous lounge room in front of an open fire just top off a day in this beautiful bay city. The staff are exceptional - capable as well as personable. A special mention to Spencer, and to Halim, who were a major part of our utterly delightful experience at San Franciso's Golden Gate Hotel.

Incredible Location. Few hotels have this hospitality. Had the tea from 5 pm to 7pm and share experiences with different nationalities people. Administration is formidable and the look inside the rooms makes you fill a hundred years ago. A lot of good taste in decoration, PEP (Adorable pet) welcomes you every time you go to the entrance of the hotel. We had a very good experience if you are looking for something not to expensive, old style, breakfast and the tea time every afternoon, without no more expense. Once you get there, is not far from the train and not from Labor Square and all the big stores.

We stayed here for four nights on our first trip to San Francisco. The hotel was built in 1913 and retains many original features including the lift. There is a Manx cat called Pip who patrols the reception area and, one day, miaowed outside our door with a view to inspecting our room. The staff are charming and helpful and you can leave your car in the car park opposite - very convenient. The bed was comfortable, the plumbing serviceable and the location very central. Breakfast was simple but ample and the tea and biscuits at 16:00 are a civilised touch. I hope to return to San Francisco one day and, when I do, I will definitely stay at The Golden Gate Hotel.

We arrived after 11pm but we were dealt with very quickly and we were in our room on the 20th floor in minutes with a great view of the cable cars going up the hill beside our hotel.The room was big, bed was big and comfortable and a great shower in the bathroom. We were even surprised to find a fridge in our room, a godsend for us as the wife drinks loads of water.There is also a coffee machine in the room which was great.We went for breakfast the next day and the breakfast room was quiet (everyone away to the gay pride parade i think). It was a bit steep in price at 24 dollars each but it was good but not great.The next few days were good and we were only 2 minutes walk to Union Square.on the day of checkout, I asked for a late checkout as our flight was at 20-40 that evening but it cost me 110 dollars, again a bit steep but we only had the 2 minor quibbles.

Stayed here for 4 nights, what a great hotelReally friendly staff, especially Geoff on the concierge desk, very helpful guy.Rooms were a bit on the small size but we are a family of 4, 16@12yo boys so that probably made it feel smaller, beds were also double so smaller than we were use to.Great location for the shops, trams, unions square, transport. Starbucks, Maccas, and chemist Over the road, handy for drinks and snacks.Didn’t eat in the hotel at all.Wish we’d booked longer

The hotel is in a great location for downtown. The rooms are new, very comfortable and the beds are amazing. The gym is fairly good by hotel standards but there isn’t much else available in the hotel in the way of amenities. I didn’t eat at the hotel so I can’t comment on the food quality. Overall, an enjoyable and very comfortable hotel to stay at.

We stayed here for 5 days and would definitely return. Our room was spacious and comfortable with lots of drawers for storage in addition to a generous closet. I especially liked having a drawer in the bedside table. The location was excellent, many interesting and reasonably priced restaurants within a 2-3 block radius. The staff was friendly and accommodating.

I arrived late and was praying it wasn't a total crappy hotel. Not only was it not but it was delightful. My room was spacious. My view was solid (with a lovely chaise to lounge in to take in said view). It was super clean. And... the bed was COMFORTABLE. The lines were great (soft!), too. I was so pleasantly surprised. Thank you!!!!Plus, this is RIGHT across from a Starbucks (you can order through your app and save a ton of time) and the trolley and Union Square are RIGHT there. Seriously, I am not sure a hotel could get much better. Thank you!

Conveniently location at Union Square, easy access to restaurants and Macy. Room was fine, we got upgraded to a high floor corner room, but hubby found it smelled musty so we moved back to lower floor.

Pros: The rooms and bathrooms are very clean, the beds are very comfortable, the service in the concierge lounge is very attentive and the front desk staff is friendly and efficient. Mobile checkin and mobile keys work perfectly here. This is a great business hotel.Cons: This is not a hotel with a ton of amenities so if you are on vacation just realize you are paying for a terrific location.

I am a dedicated Marriott customer and have enjoyed my stays at all of the properties I've stayed at thus far but I think Marriott Union Square is at the top of the list. The service was excellent and the friendly doormen made it feel like I was staying at the Ritz Carlton.We arrived early on a Sunday morning and were only hoping to store our luggage until check in but the desk agent said our room was ready and immediately assigned us our room and provided a key. We didn't expect it at all but were very grateful.The room was well decorated and the perfect layout and size. We loved the peaceful views from our room.We really loved our stay here and will definitely be back whenever we return to SF. I even bought a candle from the Marriott site when I returned home because I loved the scent of the lobby so much. A nice reminder of a fun weekend getaway.

The San Francisco Marriott Union Square is in a excellent location near, you guessed it, Union Square. I arrived at the hotel in the evening, and, as a Titanium Elite Bonvoyer, I was informed that I was having a room upgrade. The person who checked me in was very friendly. I went to the room, on one of the upper floors and was startled as to how small the room was. I know big city hotels mean smaller rooms, but not only was the room small, the bathroom was absolutely tiny. That said, I had a very comfortable sleep in the Marriott bed. The concierge lounge was fine, and it provided the standard Marriott fare. I like that they are not offering bottled water in the concierge lounge. Rather, they have glass bottles and a dispenser of still and sparkling water. It would have been nice if these bottles had lids, but it's good to see them reducing the amount of plastic they use. I was very eager to order some lunch through room service, but surprisingly, they only do room service for breakfast and dinner. I'm not sure why I could not have the turkey club at 2 pm that they are willing to bring me at 5 pm. But everyone I dealt with at the hotel was friendly and courteous. I'm not sure if all of the rooms were this small, but I still stay at this property again.

I'm a very loyal Marriott fan and have stayed at most of the properties in SF and been very happy with them. This isn't one of my favorites, although in fairness the location is handy and the room was updated and large, but there was only a shower. At check in, I wasn't offered my Lifetime Platinum automatic upgrade at check in and I assumed that I received it. My room was low and right over the cable car, which made it extremely noisy from early morning until around midnight. The HVAC fan was so loud, even on the low setting, I had to turn the system off to be able to sleep and was very cold all night long. I was too busy to be able to request a room change as this was a work trip. At check-out I asked if they considered my room an upgrade and the desk clerk said, "definitely not" and said I didn't receive one because I checked in online - in response to the two messages I received from Marriott urging me to do so. He said that resulted in my receiving the "first available" room instead of the upgrade I was expecting (why the desk clerk didn't ask if I wanted that instead of an upgrade, I don't know). A few months ago I stayed at a different SF Marriott, checked in online and was offered an upgrade at check in. So it seems this is a property issue, and it's bad policy and poor customer service. If these things don't matter to you, this hotel is fine. But for the price, I will choose a different Marriott next time I'm in the city.

Stayed 2 nights due to proximity to conference at another hotel. Further away from union square so not quite as busy, but still convenient to walk to any place. Excellent front desk staff and concierge lounge service. Standard light breakfast and happy hour snacks. Good setup with water fountain and available water bottle that can be taken to room. Hotel wasn’t busy so got upgraded to a junior suite as part of rewards. Excellent spacious room. Recommended.

This is by far the WORST Marriott I have ever stayed. The concierge staff is so RUDE. I never again will stay at this hotel due to customer service and general cleanliness. It made me want to leave the Marriott family. Strong suggestion to the Marriott brand to do a deep dive here. Lots is wrong with this hotel.

I am a big Marriott fan. Usually stay at a JW or the other Marriott (Marquis) while in San Francisco. Marquis is good, but a convention center. I found the service at Union Square to be excellent, all the way from check-in, requests, lounge and check-out. While I am not a regular here, there are apparently many as i watched the door man greet many people by name. Clearly familiar service. As a regular business traveler I really appreciate such things. Rooms are updated, overall a great experience.

We stayed here on a 4 night trip to the city by the bay -- were upgraded to the 24th floor with great view over the city. Although we had the view the others we were traveling with had equally large rooms but no view. The hotel is on corner of Sutter + Powell so right on the cable car route to Fisherman's Wharf, many nearby restaurants catering to any food preference. Easy walk to the BART on Powell + Market and a block from all the shopping on Union Square. Staff were great. No down side at all. Highly recommend for location and value.

It is absurd that a hotel of this size does not offer Wi-Fi free for its customers. They charge $15 per day for wifi. Accommodations are simple and in need of an update. only offer a valet option at the cost of $ 80 per day. the location is good but it does not make up for the amount charged. Im very disappointed.

From check-in through my four-night stay, everything at the Marriott Union Square was just perfect - my new favorite hotel in San Francisco!I arrived a little bit before check-in time, and my new buddy Jeff at the front desk not only arranged to get me into my room early, he tap-tap-tapped away at the keyboard to upgrade me to a lovely corner room, a spacious junior suite-sized room with huge windows on two sides, making the room feel even bigger. (Thanks, Jeff!!!)The layout of these corner rooms is great, with a small entryway (complete with small bar area and fridge). There's a sliding door separating the rest of the room from the rather large bathroom having a floor-to-ceiling window, big sink and vanity, and a nicely sized shower with rainfall shower head. Most impressive was the new décor - this hotel has obviously been renovated recently, having a much more modern feel than the Marriotts of years past. This sense of design extends throughout the hotel, with artwork in the hallways and a small yet nicely furnished lobby. With only 18 rooms on each floor, the hotel has a nice boutique feel to it, very very different than most large city properties with hundreds of rooms. The small size also makes the hotel remarkably quiet, a big plus when it's time to visit slumber-land.Just like Jeff, all of the staff I interacted with here was great, including the kind folks in the Concierge Lounge who made sure we were well-taken care of from breakfast through evening snacks, as well as with helping us use the automated wine dispenser - tap your room key and hit 'pour'! The hotel is also quite eco-friendly, offering bottles that you can fill up with either still or sparkling water and take back to your room. No having to lug bottles of water from CVS or Walgreens here! The lounge has a nice view of Union Square and points south, especially nice in the evening when everything's lit up.I really like the location of this property. Unlike the larger properties south of Market, this hotel is just one block north of Union Square, making it a really good location for doing anything around the Square (including shopping and going to the San Francisco Playhouse, a must-do while in town). It doesn't take long to get to Chinatown, the Financial District, North Beach, or the Ferry Marketplace, and it's a short walk to the Muni/BART stations. (Use Montgomery rather than Powell - a nicer walk.) The Powell Street cablecar line is quite literally at your doorstep, making trips to Fisherman's Wharf (Powell-Mason) and Ghirardelli Square (Powell-Hyde) quite easy... and I have to admit to being like a little kid in the late evenings, looking out the northerly windows of my room to watch the cablecars go by. After my four nights here, this room was hard to say goodbye to, but now that I've discovered this gem of a Marriott right in the center of the action, I know where I'll be bedding down on future trips to San Francisco. My thanks again to Jeff and the entire staff for a wonderful stay!

Visited this hotel one more time, but was really disappointed with the remodeling. The hotel used to be a warm, inviting place to visit. It now feels cold, modern and decorated with hippie movement decor - not our taste at all. This was probably our last visit to this hotel.Staff is still good, rooms are comfortable with good views, and the main reason to stay here is the great location.

Staff at check in were very professional and accommodating. Was upgraded to a corner room with multiple views of the city (see morning pics). By far one of the most comfortable beds I’ve had in a hotel. Concierge club had a good selection of snacks throughout the day. Breakfast was standard, but the quality seemed better than most Marriott’s. The entire staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. It was also very safe and access to hotel was monitored. Rarely do hotels exceed every expectation, this one did. Worked the whole time so didn’t get to visit surrounding area, but it is in a great part of town.

The Marriott is a good option for your next SFO trip. Central location, easy to walk around and find great shops and restaurants. My room was a handicap but it was super spacious and gave me lots of room.

It was combination business and pleasure trip to San Francisco to celebrate my birthday. We want to stay close to Union Square and picked JW Marriott Union Square Hotel.At the front desk, we were warmly greeted and welcomed to the renovated JW Marriott Hotel. To made this trip extra special, a bottle of wine and selected cheeseboard was delivered that evening to make the visit more festive.Our room 1104 came with two queen beds; large sitting area sofa, bar chair & high table; desk and chair; large 55-inch HDTV screen; and coffee maker. We requested a mini refrigerator (no charge) to hold our toddler food.Our room had gleaming rosewood and cherry finishes. The wallpaper was a shiny dark grey color. The view was on to Mason Street with a great view of the building across the street and its occupants as well as rooftops of other buildings.There were 1-USB port and 2-electric plugs on the 2 bed posts next to night stand, 2-USB and 2-plugs on the clock, 1-USB and 1-plug at desk.The bathroom has spacious area around sink vanity with quartz top, expansive walk-in shower & spray, and beautifully decorated marble tiles on the floor and walls with accent offset running border of quartz, metal, and glass. The water closet is a separate alcove with shiny dark grey wallpaper.The room was very comfortable.There are four elevators and they are super fast. Once inside the elevator, I had a bird's eye view of the entire hotel interior core as the elevator goes flying up to the upper floors. The elevators are super quick and quiet. The central core of the building is well design with guest rooms on the exterior with inside walkway all around. There are no interior rooms, but from the walkway you can look upward to the rooftop where natural light streams into the building and look downward to the lobby & restaurant below. Natural lighting provides a very comfortable atmosphere.The fitness gym is good size with good variety of equipment along with HDTV, towels, earplugs, magazines, hot & cold water dispenser, and fresh apples. There is a separate room with large floor space ideal for group exercises, pilates, yogi, and other activities. The lobby level have their all day dining restaurant along with bar. The lounge area was especially nice since it was on far side of lobby level away from the front desk, restaurant, and bar making it a more intimate setting for sitting & relaxing. There are 3 square tables with seating for 8, one rectangular table and 4 alcoves with seating for 4, and 2 tables for 2. This is an ideal place to work solo or in groups with a quiet atmosphere. In a nutshell:Bed mattress - firm and comfortable Pillow - several pillows per bed & fluffyBathroom - very roomySofa & Chair - comfortable & no sunken spotsElec Outlets/USB ports - 7 outlets & 5 USB portsView - rooftops & building across the streetNatural Lighting - eastern exposureElectrical Lighting - good for relaxing & readingRoom Cleanliness- YesFresh Linens & Towels - YesStaff - very friendly & helpful Public Space - very relaxing and comfortableLocated in Union Square, the hotel is central to many of San Francisco's notable points of interest, including Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and the Financial District. There is easy access to the cable cars, trolley buses, and motor buses.Early morning or late evening walks are ideal on the steep San Francisco hills to burn those calories. Yet, the hotel is located at the bottom of the hill with EZ access to the Union Square department stores, the many highly acclaim restaurants, and the theater district entertainment options.It felt like a luxury retreat in the heart of downtown. Yes, we enjoyed our stay and plan to come again to the VERY, VERY, NICE ... JW Marriott Union Square Hotel.

Stayed for 3 nights while visiting family. Picked hotel because of the good location. Service was more than accomodating and cheerful. Offered a suite when we checked in (husband is platinum) and it offered great views and plenty of room. Only issue I felt in room was when I tried to close the blackening shades in the evening, it was hard to reach the pulls as they were right behind the big TV & desk. Not very convenient. Went to Concierge Level Sunday evening - disappointed in sliders (bun, piece of lettuce, dry cold bacon), so just had nibbles. Otherwise we were very satisfied.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 night stay, the hotel is in a great location, five minute walk to Union square, we had a room on the 26th floor with an amazing view of the river and surrounding area, the hotel is very modern, rooms are spotless and cleaned every day, staff at the reception were friendly , the bar staff were so friendly, shout out to Jay and Steve, very friendly and chatty, we had a wonderful stay at the MattiottAlan & Adriennne O'Reilly

Marriott rarely disappoints and this hotel did not! You can not ask for a better location. The cable cars stop right at the intersection outside the front doors. And it is only a block to Union Square and a few blocks to China town. The beds are awesome! The rooms are small, but newly appointed. We even found a filtered water station in the lobby to fill up our water bottles.

I travel a lot for work (Marriott Platinum) and stay here when I am in San Francisco.The hotel is at a great location and is in the center of the city. The rooms were clean with a nice view of the city.My only wish is that the Lounge has more food choices. This hotel Lounge usually has some kind of sandwich dish, a hot finger food dish, cheese, and hummus. I wish they had a soup and maybe a salad leafy greens dish. When in San Francisco for business, I usually pick the Marriott Marquis first, solely for the better lounge food, but this Marriott Union Square hotel a solid choice also.

The positive about this hotel is clearly the location and to some extent the renovated rooms as they are of good size. But the check-in experience, the cold lobby and the hotel common places are not attractive enough to make me come back. This is more a tourist hotel but for the price it makes it quite expensive.

We choose Union square as that suited us for most of our sightseeing places, the hotel was very accommodation with all our queries every morning at the help desk. Room was very spacious and clean with a good view of the city. Breakfast spread was also a foodie ‘s delight. Otherwise a very busy hotel, would love to come back

This Marriott is centrally located in San Francisco. The reception was polite, courteous and efficient.The room was a very good size, well appointed and with Bay glimpses. The bed, pillows and linen were crisply clean, comfortable and sleep conducive.The public rooms were jaded and undergoing a much needed makeover. This was not a negative as there are plenty of good breakfast diners and excellent restaurants nearby.It was just a stopover on our way to NYC and worked really well.

I’m with my daughter for a Week of business here. I’m witch my little grandson. They are super attentive and the room is clean and quiet. Every day the price is jumping due to the lunar near year., but it’s all good. Great spot!

we stayed 4 nights last week - excellent location to good shopping , easy walking to many things , cable car stop outside . would recommend here for sure pleasant staff . I'm a marriot gold member and the service was great

Just a block away from the Union Square and lots of shopping and entertainment nearby. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous. Rooms are modern and comfortable. With platinum status one can get to the concierge lounge which is really good. Nice views of the city and buffet breakfast. Really like their water bottles, you can pick up a bottle and fill it with the type of water you like and take it to the room. Much better and environment friendly option.During my stay there was some maintenance work on the same floor as I was staying, it was bit noisy and inconvenient. But other than that everything is great, and they have a person who opens the door for you at the main entrance and greets you nicely.

We stayed here for two nights while we were in San Francisco to meet up with family after Christmas. Nice hotel but the best thing about it is the location. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Union Square is just up the block and we caught the cable car around the corner. We were traveling with 3 young children and there was a McDonalds right across the street. We were able to avoid the expensive parking fees by finding a lot off site at half the price. The driver had a 10-15 minute walk to get the car but since we didn’t need it during our stay it was no big deal. Rooms were very clean. Service was great. We will probably go back next year.

We’ve booked a Concierge room which included Continental breakfast and a happy hour with wine and some snacks in the afternoon and just when we checked in we were told the lounge was closed our whole stay (4 nights) because of Christmas. The staff at the check in was not very friendly and after some discussion they offered American breakfast for 2 (we were 2 adults and 2 teens) instead.Wi-Fi is 14 dollars a day if you are not a Marriot member (21st Century and they still charge for WiFi ??), it’s free on the lobby.Rooms are very large, clean and comfortable.Parking is more than 40 dollars per night but there is a parking lot nearby for half of the price.

Stayed here two nights on my way back to Sydney. Was a good location (close to Union Square) and had nice rooms. Had an upper floor (22nd) which was high enough to drown out street vehicle noise and late night bar shenanigans. Room was clean and furnished nicely...only minus was the blue light that the bar fridge (if you can call it that as it was empty) gave off at night and lite the room with the temperature of the fridge...bit annoying when you like a fully dark room at night. Ended up laying a pillow between it and myself in the bed to block it out. Front desk (checkin and checkout) experience was pleasant and had a positive experience all around. Would stay here again when next in SFO.

My husband and I stayed here a few years, and as we had a good experience, I thought to book here for a business trip. I would not have done that while the strike was ongoing, but fortunately the strike ended about a week before my trip. Perhaps because the strike led to some very poor reviews and/or turned off prospective guests, I got a very competitive room rate.Through my Marriott app, I told the hotel that I would be arriving around 1. Much to my surprise, not only was my room ready for occupancy upon my arrival, but the staff person who checked me in offered a slightly larger room on a high floor! This hotel’s location is perfect for those who come to San Francisco to shop, and it’s incredibly easy to get an Uber. For me the best feature (new since my last visit) was the excellent gym. It includes 2 spinning bikes, connected to a screen that offers professional teachers leading a wide variety of “classes.” Additionally, there are several treadmills, elliptical, weights, kettlebells and mats.

Stayed here for a conference. The hotel was okay. Nothing spectacular. I expected better for the marriott chain. The room was extremely small. And in this day and age, they wanted 15 bux a day to get on the wifi. Pretty much everywhere I have stayed in the last few years, Wifi was always included in the price of the hotel room, even in like Low end hotels. It’s just surprising that Marriott would not include free wifi. The area around the hotel isn’t the greatest either as the city has undergone a huge decline. The second you step outside the hotel you see a lot of homeless people sleeping on the streets and panhandlers begging for money.

Just spent three days at this Marriott and it was greatThey are doing a bit of a remodel but are moving fast. On check in system went down so we went in the restaurant to wait.Restaurant was closed but Manager Robert went and made a fresh pot of coffee and took great care of us while we waited, Received an awesome corner room and the staff at the desk, the front door security guard and bellman at the door were very helpful thanks Marriott

The new rooms are very nice. The lobby restaurant is under repair but the have a temporary one set up. We had a reservation screw up on one of our group which I don’t understand, but they fixed it. The big disappointment to me is the lounge, it is the least I have seen of any lounge in years.

Even though the strike was in full swing during my stay the staff were very understanding and provided me with a room on the 'quieter' side of the building as I was on a layover after a very long flight. Services were reduced, but given the location so close to shops and restaurants in the city it really wasn't a problem. Would not hesitate to stay here again despite all the activities going on outside. And just a note, the strikes are also active at other hotels nearby so if you don't want to cross a picket line do your research.

arrived today and faced similar surprise as other reviewers. Active strike going on with very loud protesters at hotel entrance. Lobby under renovation and no meal service available except breakfast. Front desk staff were incredibly understanding and professional. Immediately cancelled my reservation but now paying much higher rate at another Marriott. Disappointing not to have known about this in advance. Normally very positive experience at this hotel and highly recommend in future once things have settled.

This place was disgusting. They don’t only abuse their workers (who are rightfully striking) but their customers as well.The place is a dump. No cleaning, no room service, no nothing, yet they charge full price. For what?!Greedy chain with no morals. Never again!

Came here with my family for 4 nights over Thanksgiving holiday. My husband is a platinum SPG/Marriott member so we used hard earned points. A never ending strike is happening so the front entrance is ridiculously LOUD with hostile strikers. Then we had to show our identification and key cards every time we enter the building despite the fact it’s the same guy. Skeleton crew in restaurant and no room service. Vending machine not working properly but front desk wouldn’t refund our money and said we have to go to manager.... seriously!? This place ought to refund part of our points as it certainly didn’t deliver more than minimum of a much lower end hotel. Very disappointed!

Recommend avoiding this hotel until the workers union strike is over. Hotel has good location & employees are nice, but strike has curtailed many services & strikers actually swear at you as you enter. Additionally they screech from 0700-2200 daily & SF laws allow it, so any room on front of hotel is so noisy.

This is a nicely located and maintained property with well appointed rooms that are comfortable. Public spaces rather limited and rather cold. There was a local union strike in place so services were limited. The reviews that are critical of management are not well based in the facts of the situation that is impacting many hotels in the city.

A sign of a great hotelier is their ability to provide impeccable service through a happy workforce. If the latter aren't happy the former falls apart. This inevitably means the customers at the hotel suffer. Let me ask any of you reading this review - why settle for compromise when your money can get you better than this experience?This was the first time I've ever stayed at a Marriott. Seeing how poorly the senior management staff have handled these strikes has left such a negative impression on me that I shall take my future custom to hotels where staff are respected much more than this.I've been left hugely disappointed, I'm afraid.

I stayed here several nights while the union hotel workers were on strike (and still are 30 days later). The location is terrific and tucked into downtown near Union Square. There was no housekeeping truly offered and no room service. Minus the mess with the Union strike, this is a good hotel to stay at if you want to be near Union Square. The hotel feels old-Marriott, "it's time for a remodel" at this location. The lobby is old, the rooms feel older and not sure I will stay at this property anytime again soon. I love Marriott properties, but the SF locations sure could use an upgrade!

We arrived during a staff strike. So badly handled by Marriott. Carried our own heavy luggage to ou room and found a note informing there would be no bar no restaurant no room service no cleaning in fact no services we were just paying full price for a room and basic breakfast. All of this would have been acceptable in the circumstances had there been a hint of how we would be compensated. Such bad customer relations left a bad taste and we will never use a Marriott group again. They have since refunded 1 nights stay , little to late. If this is how they treat their customers it is no wonder the staff are striking, good luck to them

Great location close to downtown and easy access to transport very comfortable room with the Starbucks at the lobby and breakfast, different restaurant around the customers service is good, the only difference I see from other hotel is you need to ask for some products like the body lotion if you needed.

We stayed over a long weekend. This happened to be while there was a very long, and loud, strike going on at all the local Marriott hotels. When we checked in, we were treated exceptionally. The room we were given was perfect, a corner room which was a little larger, on a high floor with a great view of Union Square. We could still hear the strikers, but barely. The location was perfect for our needs. We had access to the Concierge Lounge on Thursday night (it's closed on Fri, Sat, Sun), and met Geoffrey who was a perfect gentleman. We've stayed in the Marriott Courtyard on Post, which is fine, but the rooms are very small. This hotel was much better. Overall, we were very pleased with our experience at this hotel.

The unionize staff are picketing from 700AM to 1000PM making enough noise that they can be heard for blocks. The hotel services were impacted - no food, no laundry, no bar service. The hotel did not warn me at the time of booking that they were under strike action for the past month. I was essentially told at check in of the issue and given the last minute nature of the information had no choice but to grin and bear it. I was forced to cross a picket line and harassed as a result. To top it all off there were no towels in the room and the shower drain was clogged. There was no compensation or accommodation by the hotel staff. The lack of notification, in my opinion is their strategy to avoid customers choosing alternate accommodations. Despite expressing my dissatisfaction management did little and aside sending a patronizing email promising to bring up the issue with management have done nothing to retain my business. I recommend against staying at the Marriott chain while the strike action continues unless they make customers aware especially of the reduced services.

We visited for 4days. Arrived to protestors outside the hotel, the staff were on strike, the noise was horrendous from 7am-10pm. Our room was great but the service was lacking due to the strike. We had to ask for toilet roll and towels on numerous occasions. We tried breakfast one morning, food was good and service was attentive. The location was fantastic, 1 block from union square. Whilst the strike is on there is no room service, or restaurants at lunch or dinner. We did complain on check out and had money deducted from our bill. Unfortunately outside their control.

Stayed here in both 2016 and 2018. This is a fantastic hotel in a great location. The rooms are spacious, and The View bar is brilliant. Staff were very attentive and the gym was also very good.Will visit again!

We stayed here for 3 night. Excellent location. We had a lovely room, very clean, breakfast was nice albeit the breakfast room needs an uplift as it was very dark. There was an egg station where they made anything you wanted. Good buffet style with a large selection. The concierge desk was helpful.

The strike made for a very difficult stay. You needed earplugs as you approached from a block away. At check in we requested a room off the street and that was honored. The doors are such that trying to close them quietly is impossible which added to sleep issues from neighboring rooms. The first indication regarding the strike and lack of service was a letter in the room. It offered 500 points to rewards members if daily cleaning service wasn’t provided. Our tv didn’t work but was fixed the following day. It appeared that only a couple of 4 elevators were working. If you were on the 8th floor or lower and needed to get to the lobby you were pretty much out of luck. Our room was cleaned one day but on Sunday someone showed up at our room around 8pm to ask if we wanted clean towels. No cleaning that day. At check out we were told that we had 3 days of internet service to pay for but they would comp it. My husband said it should have been included as a silver elite member. The clerk said his number wasn’t noted and waved us on our way. I had thought I supplied the number when using Chase points for the reservation. I’ve never been at a Marriott property where they didn’t ask if you were a rewards member so we assumed it was on file. So no 500 points for no service either. The strikers we could handle, the front desk staff made it worse.

The striking Marriott workers / protesters out front begin there assault at 6am. So this negates sleeping in. I cant enjoy the breakfast because the hotel staff cranks the music to try to drown out the loud speakers, drums, cowbells and chants but it doesn't work. It also does not make for a relaxing breakfast. I would have checked out and went somewhere else but with the Oracle conference in town that I am apart of, every decent place is sold out.

A nice hostel in the heart of town. Very busy with tourists and families since accommodation is very expensive. Great breakfast on offer - but again very busy. A lovely theatre room to watch Netflix on a rainy day - which happens often in San Fran.

Decent enough hostel. Hostel is located reasonably close to public transport and buses - it's pretty easy to get there from the airport. It is located a bit far away from a lot of tourist sites, but they are reasonably accessible through public transport, and it's close to a lot of good, cheap restaurants. Breakfast is provided, although it is quite basic.The rooms are good. Power points at beds and under-bed lockers (mesh design, bring your own padlock). Linen and towels are provided, showers and toilets are shared, there can sometimes be an availability issue when it's busy.Only major issue was that the hostel is under-staffed for it's size. Waits at check in and check out can be quite long, but it you're arriving outside of 'peak' times, it's probably not an issue.Complaints about location are all correct. It's located close to the Tenderloin, a neighbourhood with a poor reputation, and at night and during the day, there can be a lot of transient people around. That said, it's not exactly unsafe, sometimes can just be a bit unpleasant. If you've lived in a big city before, it's not exactly something that's going to be unfamiliar. I'd keep in mind that there are definitely some streets nearby that I wouldn't walk down after dark if you are obviously a tourist.

Nice hostel with friendly personell, good service and a nice price compared to other places in SF. However, it can be crowded sometimes with groups of people checking in and out the whole day. This makes the service less available and can be annoying when you need to take a bath, are kept awake or want to have breakfast (which is pretty poor). Allthough it lays in downtown San Francisco, the location is not very good for visiting tourist attractions. For shopping it is, but that is mostly not where you take a hostel for. At night there are a lot of homeless people on the streets, so when you are a smoker... be prepared. Alltogether a good choice when you want to do San Francisco on a low budget or spend your money different.

My first tentative hostel experience was made comfortable at this well run establishment. My check-in was smooth, my bed was adequately comfortable, the shower was good, the facilities were superb and the Union Square location was really useful.The breakfast time was busy and somewhat cramped but that was the only slight negative.

With SF hotels being more than a little expensive, this was a great option for me.Got a private room with en-suite. Room could do with being repainted i think- the photos suggested something a bit nicer. Cleanliness was ok, but could be better.It was secure, with friendly staff and decent amenities.There was some noise but earplugs were provided and it is downtown SF!

This was my first time in a hostel and I didn't know what to expect. When I first came the staff were very friendly. I stayed in a four male dorm, which has a sink and a locker, make sure you bring a lock. The bed frames have USB ports, powerpoints and lights. Each day has a unique activity so you can mingle around with the people around the hostel! They also provide after checking out luggage services, which is great if you want to explore the area more! The location was great and made the trip to San Francisco enjoyable!

This place was quite nice and staff were all very helpful. The rooms are a little dated and ours didn’t have aircon or heating. The lift is very slowly so be prepared to use the staircase a lot. The theatre room was a nice surprise!

First experience in a hostel so was slightly sceptical. Booked a private room with an en-suite bathroom and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a budget hotel in San Francisco downtown. All other hotels are anything but budget friendly unfortunately. A block away from Union square so great location. Security at the door at night and can enter by showing key card. Good breakfast available in the common room.

The best thing about this hostel is it’s location right next to Union Square and the Powell St transit hub. There are plenty of late night and 24 hour food options all around this place. Really, the location could hardly be better.The accommodations were OK. My room was clean and roomy. Breakfast was limited but nice to have. The bed was a little annoying because the sheets wouldn’t stay on it. They need new sheets that fit the mattresses. Otherwise, no complaints.

It was my first time in a hostel, and I didn't know how it will be. Before I arrived here, I walked to another Hostel. So please be careful about which Hostel you're searching on google or maps.me.The employees are very kind, and the hostel is clean. I had a four male room. You should bring your locker. They all have a sink in the room. The bed is ok as it is a hostel. So don't expect a boxspring bed. They have activities, sometimes for free, a big lounge and a theater, where you can hang out. There are enough plugs everywhere in the room to charge your devices. They offer a generously complimentary breakfast with bagels, oatmeal, fruits, and coffee. The location is perfect. The nearest Subway to and from the airport is Powell Street station.

We opted for the hostel during our short stay at SFO and were impressed by the efficient no-nonsense nature of the facilities. The hostel itself is conveniently located from the nearest BART station (we disembarked at Powell St and walked up) so the commute to/from the SFO international airport was not much of a headache. The private room allocated to us was on 2nd floor facing the Niko hotel and it was well appointed. The front desk staff briskly ran us through the usual do/do-nots and off we were to settle in and go about on our business.The usual revelry and noisy nature of hostels is absent here - which is a great thing. The general noises from the street have never been a bother and in fact it is something that adds a bit of life to the general stay in the room. Housekeeping staff do a fantastic job of cleaning up the room and turning it around. Lots and lots of good eating places and other tourist-y things abound. The hostel lobby has a proper schedule of activities which can sign up for and participate. The staff and hostel guests go a long way in eliminating the feeling of a sterile place and instead there is emphasis on celebrating together and swapping stories.

I stayed here twice, before and after taking a connecting a flight to Tahiti. It is so so convenient if you need a place to stay before flying on. Just a short journey away from SFO airport. Take the bart directly to Powell str, walk about 10 mins or less and you're there ! Nice breakfast, everyone I spoke to staying there was friendly. As a solo traveller who just wanted to rest, i liked that it had a vibe where everyone sort of kept to themselves. It's quite big so this makes sense. However there seemed to be plenty of bar crawls, bike tours etc if you are feeling social. Sometimes the showers were cold so I would go on a hunt to find a hot one and was usually successful. Staff were so helpful and friendly. Bought a padlock for 5 dollas. Chill areas were supet cosy. Grocery store like 2 doors away. Would stay again.

Please see the email below that we sent management about our experience at this hostel. We have had little response hence posting it as part of the review. On a side note the lift facilities are downright dangerous for a disabled traveller. Sometimes the gap between the floor level of the lift and building was up to 5 inches too high or too low and impassable on a mobility device. Hi,My name is Stephen Abraham. I am a disabled traveller visiting with my wife and son from Australia and current staying at the Hostel International San Francisco Downtown.I'd like to report an incident last night which has left us in distress.This is our first experience in a hostel and we have been looking forward to it for over a year. As we were driving into San Fran I rang the front desk to ask if there was somewhere we could disembark and then park the car temporarily. I informed her I required disabled parking. The lady on the phone told us there was nowhere to disembark and told us the nearest garage was at 525 Jones street - a very long way away for someone on a mobility scooter with cases and mobility aids to carry. After 30 minutes driving in circles looking for somewhere closer we pulled up illegally outside the hostel on Mason Street and I told my wife to cross the road the Mason O'farrel Downtown Garage and ask if we could park there. She ran back and found out we could! We had been driving in circles in heavy stressful traffic for no reason!When we checked in yesterday (31st of December) there were two people on staff and quite a queue so we waited patiently to check in. We were given our keys, asked about where best to view the New Years Eve fireworks, and went to settle in after a stressful time driving in in our hire car. We were given the wrong room names and my son had to line up again to sort out the problem. All of this we could write off as New Year's Eve pressure at a busy time. But our next experience we could not.When we arrived back at the hostel after the midnight fireworks and an awful Uber driver who challenged me about my disability, we came back to the hostel. There were many people arriving too. The office person (Ernesto I think) was yelling at people to show their room keys. As we had not been told we needed them to enter the building after 12pm (despite asking at check in about viewing the midnight fireworks) I had left my key in the room. My wife (taken aback to being yelled and told that her disabled husband couldn't enter the building) went to tell Ernesto that we hadn't been told this. He yelled back that was for our safety and that I couldn't enter without my key. My wife again taken aback at his forceful attitude went upstairs to get it for me. She came back and as she showed it again went to say that we hadn't been told this. Ernesto's response was awful. He told my wife she has a bad attitude and he wouldn't speak to her because she was being abusive. All she wanted to say was that we weren't told about the after 12pm key policy!We went to our room shaken, in tears and unable to sleep after this incident.I am sure that it was stressful for Ernesto being the only person on staff whilst many were attempting to come in the building. However: 1) it is not our fault that he was the only person there. 2) It was not our fault that he was stressed.3) It was not our fault that we weren't told the policy. We would like to formally complain about this treatment. My wife is a professional educator who deals with stressful situations everyday. She is carer for a disabled person. She does not deserve to be treated in this way.I'd like a response within 48 hours please and don't want to have to take this matter further.

The best thing about this hostel is the location. I only stayed the night because I was passing thru SF before heading out of the country and I wanted to explore the city before I went. Unfortunately, I was there during SantaCon, traffic was shear madness and drunk people were everywhere. I say unfortunately because I almost missed my flight because the shuttle could not pick me up due to the gridlock traffic. This was not the hostel's fault. They were kind enough to get me to the subway so that I could make it to the airport. Okay, so about the hostel. It was clean, there is an elevator for your convenience or for anyone that is walking-impaired. They offer various activities on what seems to be a daily basis. Each bed has a light and electrical outlets along with USB ports. My room was somewhat clean but I will say I did arrive very late into the night and had roommates already in the room. However, when I dropped something behind the bed and I reached down to grab it, I noticed a few things left behind by previous tenants. I had a 4-bunk, female only room with a shared bathroom and even though the bed was fairly comfortable, the room was cold and you can hear just about every goings-on in the room next door or outside the room door. The bathroom seems like wasted space and could use more hooks on the barren walls. No soap given nor was there any soap in the dispenser in the shower. I guess it is a good thing I travel with soap, just in case. Regarding breakfast, there were some decent offerings (oatmeal, toast, bagels, cereal, juices, coffee, etc...) but get there early because it is like a feeding frenzy. You are expected to wash your own dishes though. Small price to pay for a bit of free breakfast. One improvement would be curtains on the beds for privacy, especially when your roommates have different schedules than yourself.

We spent almost two weeks in this hostel and it really exceeded our expectations. The staff was super friendly and helpful, they speak lots of languages. There are plenty of free events that they organise from sightseeing tours (run by locals) to movie nights, cooking classes, parties with free food and drinks!

I have stayed in Hostelling International in NYC on previous occasions as a solo traveller and really enjoyed the experience. This time round I chose HISF travelling with hubby and son and was not disappointed.Although the triple bed room ( bunkstyle) is small (really too small for 3 people) it was still great value for staying in downtown San Francisco near Market Street attractions and shops. It also provided basic continental breakfast to start the day and staff were friendly. It is mainly serves the purpose to provide a bed and did not disappoint although 2 consecutive days of rain in SF holed us up more than we would have liked in the small room. Only downside besides the small room, was how muggy the room were and that the mattresses were a bit worn out, resulting us having, after a 3 day stay, some sore backs. But all in all a decent facility providing a safe and clean place to stay in SF at very good pricing. Will certainly choose it again.

I liked the friendly staff. The well-preserved interior and exterior were really gorgeous. Ang the big kitchen and breakfast were plus.Water pressure was really low. The staff gave me a wrong piece of information about the locations I asked about. It is located in a really bad neighborhood that should have been mentioned. Having to do bed making upon arrival was a big turn-off as well as the windows unable to be completely shut and the heater being disabled.

We stayed here for 6 nights in September, we wouldn’t normally stay in a hostel but the price of other hotels were so high so we decided to try it. Check in was smooth and the staff were very helpful throughout our stay. We booked a private double room with ensuite. The room was very clean and the bed was really comfy, the room was quite loud from street noise but staying in the heart of the city that will happen. The room was an ok size but we never had a lot of storage space just a really small alcove in the wall with a small rail where you could hang about 5 things up. There was 2 communal areas on our floor which were well kept and also laundry machines to use which came in handy and were cheap to use. We had breakfast here one morning but it was very busy and obviously being a hostel you had to do your own dishes etc. The hostel is a great location which is what sold it for me. There was security on the door which they asked to see your pass every time you entered the hostel which I liked. For our first Hostel stay I would say it exceeded my expectations and I would definatly recommend.

We stay 3 nights in this hostel and it was very nice. We were 3 people, so we had the private room with 3 beds (actually, it was a bunk bed, but the bed in the bottom was for two people). The room was clean and had a lavatory and hair dryer. There was enough bathrooms for everybody in the building. The breakfast was very good and they recycle the waste from the kitchen and the fist floor. The staff is very friendly. We arrived early and they let us leave our luggage in a special room so we can explore the city until the hour of our check in. The location is very good, but keep in mind that San Francisco is a big city so you will have to walk A LOT, even if you are in downtown.  It is very easy to go to and from the airport in the BART.

Stayed two nights, girl dorm with 4 beds. Great staff, gave me good tips and told me about the breakfast. Bed was comfortable, badroom in the hall was ok and is was clean. Breakfast was good, bagels with spread and coffe. Cool view. Parked the car in a garage 2 blockes down, ok price. Good diner across the street.

My husband and I spent 5 nights here. Our first choice would have been a hotel but prices here in SF are crazy! When I checked in staff was really nice and helpful. Our room was 318, located in front of the stairs and looking out on the alleyway, I got really scared of the traffic noise but walls and doors are thick and could barely hear any noise. Bed was comfy, daily cleaning of our room, common spaces clean as well. Free breakfast is included but we never tried it. Location is great because you can walk to everywhere BUT you are 100m from the Tenderloin (worst neighbourhood) so you see a lot of homeless, drug addicts, mental illness. I arrived solo the first night and was prettified. The only one thing that tinted our experience is that the room was charged twice on my credit card. You can imagine it’s a good amount when you spent 5 nights. The blonde girl at the front desk looked at me like I was either stupid or annoying so she referred me to her colleague. He did try and find the info but didn’t solve the problem. In the end visa had to call them to cancel tat duplicate.. pretty annoying to spend an entire day of you vacation off the phone. A part from that it was good! Feel we paid too much for the room but hey it’s SAN Francisco right?

We aren’t usually “hostel people” but due to the price of this hostel in comparison to other hotels in the area we thought we would give it a go. I am so glad we did. We had a private double ensuite room on the 2nd floor. The room was clean, and it was so cosy, much more personal than a hotel it felt like we were staying in a bedroom. The room was a good size and plenty cupboard space for our suitcases. I also liked the fact a hairdryer was provided and linen and towels too. The hostel also has several communal areas which were clean and well kept. We did attempt breakfast once but it was so busy we didn’t return. There was a big convention on in SF and I know the hostel was fully booked so that is nothing against the hostel and just bad timing of our visit. Staff were helpful and booked airport transport for us when requested. The hostel is centrally located and a 5 minute walk to Union Square and close to many bars and restaurants. I felt safe in the area, and in the hostel and they had security on checking the passes of everyone who was entering the building. Yes the area is noisy, but it’s the middle of a city and in an old building. Ear plugs were given and we both felt we slept well. We were glad our apprehension about staying in a hostel was proved wrong and would stay here again if ever back in San Francisco.

It was a good hostel to stay in,it did us well for two days but has room for improvements and the price began creeping towards that of a hotel, but with less comfort. It was nice having the lockers under beds and supplying sheets, douvets and what not.One of the main issues for me was food, I have allergies to nuts and as I was about to have some jam(jelly) on bread, someone grabbed the knife from the peanut butter and stuck it in the jam to create a PBJ.Really made me think what else I can't eat.Overall I think I would stay again, but if it was more affordable or the price we paid reflected the service.

Stayed in a private room. The room size was great and the bathroom ok but the carpet was filthy and very stained and there was a lot of mold on the bathroom window. Even though it is a very old building for the price I was expecting at least a clean room. The room is serviced daily but sometimes the towels were taken and not replaced. Some front desk staff are very friendly and others quite rude. The location is ok but there is a lot of noise from the street all night and bright lights shone in from the parking lot next door since there is only a thin curtain. The free breakfast was tasty but there is not enough seating in the kitchen.

On a budget, and want to visit and don't mind sharing with fellow travelers, then this is the ideal place.I was very reticent when booking, but the Hostel exceeded my expectation.Service was great, the amenities are well maintained and it really was not bad sharing with other travelers.If you a snob don't go, otherwise it is a no-brainer!I really loved the experience!

The location is perfect and easy. The staff really really nice: I must mention I got my flight canceled last minute, I emailed them and there were able to adjust my booking without me having to pay!!! Breakfast included and awesome, just like the kitchen and all shared locals. The interior (colors, furnitures, decorations etc..) is stunning! Everything super clean and well maintained. A lot of activities going on too! Just the best hostel I’ve ever been to!

We stayed in San Fran for a few nights and decided to stay in a private room but shared bathroom. The hostel itself was mostly clean, and the WiFi was pretty good until around 9pm where I assume everyone started to use it.The facilities were mostly clean, and the showers were a good pressure and nice a hot. We had mixed reviews with the staff, when we checked in the person checking us in was quite cold towards us but then later on in the week we had another woman who was really lovely and helpful! Breakfast is basic, just bagels but it’s free.Overall, it’s good if you are backpacking as it’s safe and mostly clean. I think if we came again we might try an AirBnB for a different experience.

Highly recommend it! It does not appear to be a hostel but a hotel ..clean ... spacious, friendly staff, perfect location. We stayed in a private room with bathroom .... excellent. Congratulations on the team and thank you very much.

This was a great place to stay if you want to meet new exciting people. The staff were all great happy and helpful. The hostel was very clean and greet place to stay. The room was nice and clean. It was a good price for san Fran. The hostel was in a good area for getting around and eating/ drinking.

PROS: I stayed at the private en suite room, and must say that the cleanliness and functionality of the room exceeded my expectations. The bathroom was super clean, and the queen-sized bed was comfortable enough. I stayed on the third floor, so had close proximity to the kitchen and water cooler - a definite plus! The location is quite good - central and accessible to most sites. Oh, and make sure you check out Cafe Mason, which is right next to the hostel. Would highly recommend their Croque Madame and pumpkin pancakes. CONS: The only downside to my accommodation experience here was the noise. Be warned: if you stay in a street-facing room (mine faced Mason Street), you will be in for a racket at night. There were several nights when a dude played drums right outside Pinecrest Diner, which is right across from the hostel, and did so for two hours plus from midnight to 2 AM. Needless to say, then, I didn't have great quality of sleep during my week's stay at the hostel. Yes, there were free earplugs in my room, but they did not quite mitigate the loudness coming from the streets. It's not really the hostel's fault, but if I were to give a suggestion for improvement, perhaps the hostel could make the walls and rooms more sound-proof.

Stayed 4 nights in this hostel at the end of June. The room itself was nice and spacious. We stayed in a twin room with an ensuite. The bathroom was clean and had good water pressure. We were able to store our bags on the day we checked out as we had a late flight, this was very helpful and convenient. The not so great is mainly to do with noise levels. We were in a room at the back, which we initially thought would be quieter.. not so much. The lane that we were looking into was a hive of activity.. noisy activity each night. In addition we saw peope shooting up and smoking drugs in there. Additionally, there was music that kept coming into our room from early in the morning. It was not coming from the room next door or the common room.. it was coming out of the floor. Totally bizarre. It was loud enough to record on my phone and play back clearly. The hostel is clean, beds are comfy and room was spacious. The area, whilst close to things is not so desirable, however there are far more expensive hotels in exactly the same area with the same smell of wee and homeless people hassling them too... I wouldn't stay here again, but more because of the area, not the hostel itself.

The staff was super friendly, it was very clean and not very noisy. I felt very safe and there are tons of yummy restraints near by.
