It was great that I could keep my bags locked away in a safe area before and after check in. It is also super convenient to shopping and the tram, along with the metro station.

Stayed in a private room, which had plenty of space, was clean and comfortable enough for us. The location was the highlight- we could walk pretty much anywhere and access public transport within minutes. Shame the staff were so unfriendly and unhelpful!!

The actual room, cleanliness, location and general facilities were very good. However I was greeted by the most unimpressed staff member who would not give me any extra information I might need unless I asked for it. The laundry facilities are cheap, but no instructions are given in the room as to how the payment/dryer works. There is a change machine so that you can buy detergent from the vending machine, but then the washers and dryers require you to swipe your card to activate them? I also found out later that you pay for as many dryer cycles as you require, and that one cycle doesn't just do the job. So I spent the rest of my night trying to air dry my clothes in my room, which I'm sure my dorm mates didn't appreciate. The bed light did not work for me and when I brought the issue up with reception, she wrote it down and said she would get maintenance to look into it. Later that day when I went back and the light issue still wasn't fixed, I went down to reception to ask them again. I was met with the same unimpressed lady who could not give a crap that something was wrong. She said 'oh if it's been reported to maintenance that's all we can do'. If she had been a bit nicer about it I don't think I would have minded so much, just that she was absolutely not bothered with any issue irritated me.

Centrally located about 3 blocks away from Union Square is this location, location, location hostel. The double room with enclosed toilet is bright and clean though a little bit noisy with a pair of ear plugs on the light desk provided, very considerate. Of course the noise will not border us because our own apartment in Hong Kong is three times nosier than the hostel. The common area is very cozy with breakfast is very good with lots of varieties. The reception is friendly and helpful, the price is a little expensive $185 per night. Will go back if the price is cheaper.

We had a great stay at this hostel! It was extremely clean and all the staff were very welcoming. We were a group of 3 and got a private room which was the perfect size. They allowed us to store our luggage in a secure room until check in which was awesome. One staff member that really went above and beyond was Zoey at the front desk. We parked our car in a garage that wasnt 24 hours and had a 6am flight to catch. Zoey called the parking garage and our car rental place for us and wouldn’t get off the phone with them until she received a resolution for us (about an hour). She was so helpful and kind, we couldn’t of asked for me. She truly went above and beyond and made our stay very special! It awesome they had an employee who truly cares! I definitely recommend this hostel to friends, families and couples.

We loved our time here. We booked a private room with ensuite and it far exceeded our expectations. It’s so much cheaper here than most other SFO accommodations plus a great location for Union Square, cable car, BART. We are going to rebook for our return trip in a few weeks. Bagels, oatmeal and fruit offered free for breakfast. Lots of space and a good atmosphere throughout. You feel really safe because the staff always check security tags when people enter the building to go upstairs. Recommended for any age - just note you do need to climb stairs. There is a lift but it’s verrrrry slow. We gave up waiting after our first attempt.

This place is exactly what I needed for my trip. I stayed in a four bed girls only dorm and all the girls were lovely and respectful. There are lockers under the bed which easily fit my giant suitcase. Not entirely cheap but a really good location so it’s worth it. Linen and a towel is provided. Plenty of showers and toilets on each level. Breakfast included offers unlimited bagels with spreads plus fruit, OJ and coffee. They allowed me to store my luggage after checking out and also allowed me to have a shower before checking in. Reception staff are really friendly and knowledgeable. Would recommend.

The place is safe, also in a reasonable area of San Francisco, breakfasts are free and available 7-10am. They also store your luggage after checkout and can print your boarding passes. It was not very noisy and we enjoyed the stay.

GDC attendees informally call this the "Indie Hostel," as indie game developers from all over the world stay here. You can find them hanging out in the lounges, at breakfast, etc. It's great! Free breakfast, WiFi, coffee, earplugs. Coin-op laundry. Short walk to Moscone.

I stayed here for a week in two different private queen rooms.The first was on the fourth floor was very basic, outdated but clean. They could do with double glazing as the windows did nothing to stop the draughts or block any of the sounds from the street. The bathroom was large and had lots of hot water.The second was nicer on the 6th floor. It had double glazing and a nicer finish to the room. But the hairdryer was broken.The hostel is a big one so it’s up to you if you want to socialise or not. They do various activities each day if you want to get involved.I didn’t find the reception staff particularly friendly or helpful to be honest. One time I stood waiting for the lift for 10mins to take my bag to the 6th floor. I checked the lift was actually working with reception staff and they spoke to me like I was stupid then chose to ignore me for a further 10mins as it still hadn’t arrived. Eventually one of them reluctantly helped me with my bag. The breakfast was great though. Bagels, bread, toppings and juice.

Location wise this place is perfect, I had a private room with a bathroom. The shower was hot, plenty of water, bed comfortable and room clean. WiFi was spot on better than I have at home ! Down side is it is on the noisy side from the outside, but the windows really are on the thin side, they shake with wind and my bathroom window doesn’t close, it has a hook to pull it semi shut, which still lets the noise outside in I (can’t blame the hostel for outside noise). But apart from that I’d come back.

Me and my friend went to this place last week end.The position was good but there was a smell of pee in the hall, the breakfast was poor and we were at the 5 floor and the elevator was out of service.The best part is that we pay a lot for three nights.We won't come back.

Central location makes it easy to get around, especially to/from the airport. Great facility for a hostel. Everything was pretty clean. I got lucky and was assigned a bottom bunk. Good kitchen set up. Felt safe as a solo traveller.

This was the first stop on my 6-week trip across the USA. After landing at LAX, then finding out my flight up to San Francisco was delayed, then cancelled, then I was rebooked on the next flight which was also delayed, meant I arrived about 4hrs after I expected too. Upon check in my card kept declining (plenty of money on it, turns out that card would only work at Starbucks and a few food places haha, don’t even know why) the girls were lovely and asked if I had another card after trying a couple times. I did and everything was good. They were really lovely and when I mentioned I was from Melbourne, one of the girls mentioned she had been there earlier in the year and we had a good chat about how the two cities were pretty similar in a lot of ways (which is legit Melbourne and San Francisco are the same vibe it’s great) and this was a great start to my time in San Francisco as I was absolutely exhausted after the long flight from Melbourne, plus the flight cancelation/delays, definitely helped perk me up a lot to have a friendly chat!The hostel itself was clean and comfy, and loved that the beds each had a panel with a light, USB ports and a power point too. Plus lockers under the bed are handy. And being a tall person, it was nice to be able to sit up in my bottom bunk and not be hunched over or hitting my head, as they gave ample room! The room I was in had a sink which was cool, made for a quick teeth brushing/face washing easy. Breakfast was lovely. A variety of fruits and oats, plus toast and bagels, and juice or tea/coffee. The location itself is very good, just a short walk down the Powell street station, which is where the BART from San Francisco airport stops so it’s good if you’re catching the BART from the airport. Close to lots of food places and bars, plus the Westfield if you need some retail therapy. The historic cable car is just around the corner near the train too, which I recommend to any visitors, it’s a lovely ride down to fishermans wharf!The building is safe and secure, with staff checking your room keycard upon entry to ensure only guests are coming in. I highly recommend this hostel to anyone visiting the SF area.

Stayed here for 3 nights, I can say that this is one of the good HI USA Chains I have stayed during my USA traveling. 1. Room rate per night was not cheap, but for all HI Chains, this was quite normal in San Francisco and in any other HI USA Chains.2. Breakfast was good you have banana and apple and all sorts of breads, as well as tea, coffee, and orange juice.3. Kitchen was well equipped, so you can cook your own meals4. This is centrally located hostel, near to Union Square and Powell St Cable Car Turnaround -- one of the attractions you have to experience when you are in SF.5. Staffs were nice and helpful. They let me use the kitchen and stay at the hostel waiting for my late night Megabus to Los Angeles6. The elevator was old enough so you have to be patient when waiting for it coming down and get you upstairs7. I always think that this hostel has some kind of weird smell, it was like i really am not sure, but a bit of smoking weed smell?? not sure

Kind and helpful staff, funky decor, cosmopolitan and young crowd, and EXCELLENT location. They got all kind of activities going on all of the time, plenty of opportunities to make friends/travel buddies. Highly recommended.

I guess it's fine as far as hostels go but I'd look for somewhere different next time. The room looked inwards to a few grungy walls. Bed was comfy. Basic modern furniture. But there was a damp and orherwise unidentifiable smell. The shared toilets and showers work fine and are kept clean. The shared kitchen and breakfasting works fairly efficiently. Close to central Union Square zone, so good to walk to shops, restaurants and tourist meet points. But it also borders on a gritty area you might want to be cautious getting through after dark.

FYI: I stayed in a double room with en suite bathroom.This room was not cheap, but importantly it was clean and the location was convenient. You might think that this would be like a hotel room but in a hostel, but that wasn't quite the case. The room didn't quite have all the things a hotel room might have such as an iron, a fridge or a TV but that didn't really bother me too much. I didn't visit to watch TV. In the shower, instead of little toiletries, I got a soap dispenser that cheerfully suggested I should give it a try (I don't remember the wording but I'm pretty sure it had an "!" at the end).The bed was comfortable enough, with bedside lighting, and there were power sockets to charge my phone. The wifi was string in my room and nice and speedy. The walls were roughly and colourfully painted as you'd expect in a hostel. But let's move on to the windows.These single windows could be opened upwards and were large and let in a decent amount of light. However they were only one pane thick so being in downtown SF and only one storey up, it was VERY noisy. In the window sills outside there was a bed of various detritus - not a nice thing to look at or even to stand near. None of these were deal breakers - the noise might have been but flights and touristy activities meant I was too exhausted to miss out on sleep but if you're a light sleeper consider asking if there's a more suitable room - or go elsewhere.The hostel itself was okay, communal areas are okay and breakfast is provided. Here you walk into the kitchen and take some fruit or a bagel and spoon on a topping. Cutlery is freely available but you are expected to wash it all yourself once you've finished. It's actually very well run - such a thing could easily descend into chaos but supplies are regularly replenished and washed up things are put away promptly.The staff are friendly and helpful and the cleaners do a thorough job around the building. There is a very handy convenience store right next door. The location of this hostel is extremely central, but it's a fair walk to the docks over some steep hills. The trolley service is right next to you though so that's one way to crest the hills.

Great value for money. Nice place. Very clean, free wifi is always available. Thanks so much for your hospitality. I stayed here for just one night and my experience was nice. A perfect place to meet with people who came from different parts of world.

Clean hostel and rooms, 4 bed dorm but with large bathroom, safe, good breakfast, nice fellow travellers and friendly staff, all in all really good experience! Only one thing: bring your own lock for the storage under the bed as otherwise you have to buy one.

I booked a private room to stay with my wife. bed was a bunk bed, we had a bathroom sink in our room which was good. Shower and restroom were shared.Breakfast was included. Basically: bagel (jelly, peanut butter, cream cheese), juice, coffee and a fruit.The location is great since the metro is 10 minutes from the hostel. Luxury brand shops and cable cars are around the corner so it is very touristic. Vibe of the hostel is good. They plan different activities during the week. Walk tours, movie nights, etc. just beside the hostel you could buy drinks, snacks, etc.Staff was friendly. If you have a car just in front of the hostel there is a parking place. It is $30 per night while there is another one just 2 blocks away for $20 per night.I suggest to pay the extra $10, I research the other spot and a lot of people claim the area feel dangerous. For an extra $10 you have your car just in front of the property.Be safe and enjoy!Cheers,David

Overall great experience, great breakfast, you serve yourself bagels, coffee and juice. You do clean up after yourself no biggie you get that at home feeling I loved it. I met great people, I will definitely be back.

Fantastic well equipped hostel - safe, friendly, well positioned, it really ticks all the boxes. I stayed in a four bed female only dorm which had its own bathroom which was great. The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day and having the kitchen facilities allowed me to do some cooking for dinners too. The staff were super friendly and helpful - one standout example to me was inviting a couple inquiring about accommodation to take a seat and use the WIFI to research their options, no pressure to choose HI but such a nice service and offer for people who seemed a bit lost and exhausted. Keep up the great work!

Good price (which in San Francisco is like finding water on the desert), lots of people, constant activities and great location.I was hoping for more nightlife but I guess they party strictly twice a week in most places in the USA.

This is a fabulous hostel for you travellers because not only does it include a free buffet breakfast including porridge, Bagels, fruit and you can make your own pancakes but they also give you a clean towel! May sound silly but this means the world when you’ve been living out a bag for a while. The location is fantastic as it’s right in town, a short walk from bars, restaurants and Union Square. There’s a lobby with iPads and music playing if you don’t fancy sitting in you room. They also have lots of information on location attractions. I highly recommend, one of the best hostel I’ve ever stayed in.

Stayed in a private double room with its own bathroom. Price was reasonable which is why we chose to stay there. Hostel is in a good area close to Union Square and public transport. Plus there are a couple of decent eateries opposite and sine bars close by.The reason the review is not higher is the damp odour that greeted us in the room. We got used to it but was a bit off putting every time you entered the room. Toilet was fine with a good flush and the shower was warm and worked. Bed was comfortable and the TV worked. A ceiling fan meant that the room temperature could be maintained. Shops hostel facilities downstairs in the basement such as washing machines, ironing boards etc. The common area seemed like a good place to meet fellow travellers. Did not try the breakfast.

Nice, clean and tidy. Friendly staff and great location. Stayed in a 4 Bed female dorm, it even had the classic bay windows a la San Francisco. Super cool basement with kitchen, bar, TV area, library and laundry. Great free breakfast included!

We enjoyed the stay at USA Hostels....we had a private room with attached toilet. Breakfast is served in the basement wherein you wash your dishes after eating and it gives a typical hostel experience. The place is conveniently located and it is good value for money.

This hotel is very good because in this hotel freedom is powerful and whether too much and excellent customer service Super fantastic , very good So I can say for this hotel very beautiful and excellent

I travelled to San Francisco with my sister for a trip to the West Coast. San Fran was our first stop. It’s a pretty expensive city to stay in and this hostel was just about in our budget. We booked a private queen room with a shared bathroom. The room was really tidy and clean when we arrived- with some towels and complimentary shampoo. Our room was a bit muggy so we had to keep the fan on most of the time. We also couldn’t turn the heating off which came on most nights! The breakfast was okay, not much choice, but it’s free so can’t complain! They take security quite seriously and you have to show you room card every time you enter reception for them to let you up to your room- always good to feel secure in a city you’ve never visited before. The showers were a bit grungy and there’s not much room to put your clothes, towel, etc. But it’s easy enough to put up with for a few nights. Overall, the room was really cosy and the WiFi always worked!

I booked an Eco Room here at the USA Hostels for two nights for roughly $100. These Eco rooms are the same size as standard rooms, but may be located in a less quiet area of the hostel. I did not experience any increased noise levels compared to my previous stay in a standard room.I arrived before check-in time, but Connor was super nice, allowed me to store my bags and made sure I had any needed maps or inquiries he could assist with, which was great of him to offer. After later checking in to my bed in a 4-bunk room, I situated all of my belongings and it was time again to head out to see the city. Rooms:Free Wi-Fi throughout the property, large in-room lockers with charging stations inside!! Bed linens and towels were provided. The bunks are comfy and there is a privacy shield near the head of each bed along with an outlet and reading light. There are numerous showers and separate toilets (always clean) on each of the floors. Amenities:Free daily breakfast, Wi-Fi, game room in basement (pool table, table fussball), reading room, TV room, laundry room, use of kitchen, storage fridge, nightly planned activities.I have always enjoyed my stays here. The hostel is located just a few blocks from Union Sq., the place is always clean and kudos to the great staff. Connor, at reception, was really awesome during my visit. I left some parting articles for him when I departed. Thanks Connor. A great stay. Highly recommended.

Booked a private room with private bathroom because of the cost of booking a hotel in San Francisco. The location of the hostel is fantastic - a couple of blocks to Union Square, close to local amenties and felt very safe walking around during the day and night. The private room was small but very serviceable - good sized bed, mini fridge, full length mirror. The bathroom was tiny but good water pressure in the shower, and the sink had some space to store toiletries. The room seemed very hot most of the time, but we slept with the fan on and the window open and were comfortable. It was also a bonus to have a TV in the room so we could relax in private. We didn’t use much of the hostel’s provided activities but there were plenty of things happening everyday. It was great to have an on-site laundry and washing powder provided. The hostel was very secure and quiet at night. Highly recommended!

I stayed in a female 4-bed dorm, as it was most affordable option in pricey SF. The hostel exceeded my expectations, great location within walking distance of most attractions (took me about 25 minutes to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, factoring in the hills!). the rooms and bathrooms were really clean, good general facilities such as the laundry room and kitchen. Breakfast was pretty good and staff were lovely. I didn't stay long enough to take advantage of the tours and activities but they looked great. Would definitely stay again.

The location of the hostel is very convenient, not really hard to miss. The staff were really nice as well. I enjoyed the walking tour with Poonam as she took as to good spots around SF. The bathroom were a bit small but not really an issue.

Not quite sure how to rate this. The place itself is ok enough, but when you get in a room with a sketchy man who is snoring really loud, making the weirdest and most uncomfortable sounds all night long, for so to take a big dump with the toilet door open in the middle of the night. I dont even...Left at 5 pm and did not get my money back for the next night.

The hostel is in a great location not far from union square. It was nice and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful too. There is a free breakfast its not great and the coffee is poor. Our room was good, The bed was very comfortable, great pillows, there was a tv and a fridge and plenty of plug sockets. The bathroom was very small but the shower was great and there is a hairdryer too.

USA Hostels in San Francisco is centrally located - just a few blocks from Union Square. Staff were friendly and helpful. This is a big hostel! There are several floors, each with lots of rooms. My room, the mixed 4-bed dorm with bathroom, was quite nice. The room was quite spacious and had two sets of bunk beds as well as en-suite with shower and toilet. The bed was small and a little uncomfortable. Though, the bed does include a nifty shelf and light and power socket. Each level also has communal toilets and showers. The rest of the facilities were great too. Only issue I had was that the showers didn't get powerful or strong enough. Also the lift is one of those old-style lifts with roller door. While cool, it doesn't function well.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at USA Hostels. If I'm ever back, I'll definitely return.

I was surprised how comfortable it was unsafe. Nice parking and accommodations. Good safe location. I found the staff to be nice. And a high-quality amount of security for the safety of all. Had a very nice smell Decour. The rooms were more than clean with high-quality shampoos and amenities etc. I also enjoyed the numerous selection of TV channels in high definition etc. etc.

Pros:the location is handly,nice staff and clean,good for summerI stayed at this hostel the locaion is good but the common area it wasnt socilize and for budget tavelar like me it was expensive and the heater wasnt work well

Came here to stay on a business trip was perfect clean very friendly always happy to.help and very informative on things to Do in the area and directions to were I needed to go perfect place and will stay here again

I stayed at this hostel for almost a week and had and incredible experience, friendly staff, clean rooms, well located, close to Union Square, activities for the guests everyday, places to relax and make new friends from all over the world, great wifi connection, nice breakfast, I would definitely come back.

The hostel is very neat and tidy. Bathrooms are shared but is not a troublesome issue since there are plenty of them and are frequently cleaned.Good place for students and academic personnel. But, has no heaters or blowers in winters and a/c in summers. So be prepared for this.

...because there are simply so many pros and cons to weigh up. Cons first: very close to an incredibly sad, dirty and sketchy area; no atmosphere in shared areas; incredibly expensive, almost unbelievably so (though everywhere in SF is in fairness). Pros: very friendly, helpful staff; central location near bars and restaurants; super clean and comfy rooms; meet-up events every day. So overall, 3* seems fair.

I went to hostel and stay 5month. There is a lot of event. Especially I like pub crow. We met at lobby with other guest and neighbors. I went to pub with other guest and stuff who is Sean. He was really kind guy, I went to two times per week. There is different stuff, both of them were kind. I was really nice experience because I could talk with a lot of people who came from a lot of country.

Good place to stay for few days, it's clean and quiet at night. They push a lot of animations for guests and the location is perfect, only 10 minuts away from union square. We've stayed in a room for 4 people and did not have any problem !

Stayed there for 2 nights with 7friends. Nice rooms with private toilet and shower, lockers and there are outlets by every bed. There were also public showers and toilets. Simple free breakfast as well.

Reserved a Private single bed room for two nights with the hostel online weeks in advance. Turned up and was told I’d reserved a 4 bedroom dorm, which definitely wasn’t the case. I showed my confirmation and was told by the person on the desk even though i was right, there was nothing he could do about it (as apparently his system was more right) and that i’d have to pay the same price to stay in shared accommodation! I ended up taking it further to the manager, who then gave me one free nights stay in a 4 bed dorm but still charged me the private room rate for the second night! The manager promised to look into the issue of what happened but I never heard back on this.Don’t bother staying here. If you reserve a bed in a 12 bedroom dormitory they will probably downgrade you to sleep outside on the street. It’s in a good location and I did end up having two good room mates, but it certainly isn’t worth the stress borthering with this place as you don’t know how they can mess you around. Next time i’ll pay the extra for a proper hotel!

Trust me when I say... I will never stay here again. Every hotel on their block has a police looking security. This place has a all night staff member that doesn't even know her way around the hostel never the less someone able to help control a drunk person physically attacking me in their lobby. The next day the lady who said she was the manager, Alana, went from pretending to be nice to freaking out and yelling... watch out for her... with that amount of sores on her face, she either has an disease or is using heavy drugs. God bless anyone trying to stay alive at this place.Do yourself a favor and pay for a hotel... these guys are way too expensive for how dangerous of a circus this experience was. and of course no refund

USA Hostels was an overall good experience. The facilities are good, personal light and socket on the beds is a brilliant idea. Charging points in the lockers is also very handy!They had plenty of free or cheap activities on each day although I only managed to do the pub crawl. Was good and met plenty of people on it.Location is good, a few blocks across from Union Square. About a 30-40 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf but up and down some huge notorious San Francisco hills.Only slight negative is the staff didn't know which public transport I could use to get to Fisherman's Wharf, I had to work this out for myself.I would recommend staying here and overall a positive experience.

when i went this hostel some old man In underwear was looking at me funny and it made me feel unsafe then when i was sleeping he was at my bed side petting my shoe and now he's in my dreams but overall it was a pretty good trip

The staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful. They lead the tours and are very approachable and chatty. The location of the hostel is amazing! just ten minutes from Union Square and maybe a half an hour stroll from Pier 39, I felt like I was in the city centre! It was easy to explore SF from here! The breakfast spread offered here was the best I have seen in a hostel so far! A good variety! The bed linen needs serious updating, it diminished my comfort during my stay! The bathroom could do with some updating too.

I’ve stayed in lots of hostels and this is definitely one of the better ones.Pros: rooms and bathrooms were clean, free towels, beds were pretty comfy. Staff are friendly and helpful. Some great activities organised every day and night. Would really recommend the free walking tour; we went with Poonam and she was amazing, really friendly and knowledgable.Free breakfast is a little busy but a good idea. Central location. Also book the airport shuttle, really affordable option to and from SFO.Cons: It's pricey, but not many good hostel options in SF so I guess it's expected. Also, I asked one of the reception staff about a Napa wine tour and he didn’t have any info about me apart from the flyer, which said it was $139. I went online and found the exact same tour for $105, so shop around when it comes to tours!

USA hostel is in great location (walk distance from BART station) . It’s clean, bunk beads are well equipped, bathroom has everything a traveler need. I felt like I’m a student again. Breakfast classic, coffee american.

Had a great time at this hostel. They offer a lot of activities like a free walking tour usually hosted by Poonam- who was such a down to earth tour guide! The place is clean and has a nice San francisco feel to it. Decent walking distance from many restaurants so that was a huge plus for me!

We stayed here for 4 nights recently in a 4 bed dorm. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and beds were comfy enough. Our room did get very hot and there wasn’t much ventilation other than 2 small windows so we were sleeping without any blankets.Was a good place to stay location wise - handy to the buses and cable cars although we did walk to most places we wanted to go which was usually no more than a half hour walk.

We got a private room with bunk beds and attached bathroom. The mattresses were surprisingly soft, had no trouble sleeping. Only half of the outlets attached to the the beds actually worked, but it was still nice to have the phone right next to me. The heat in our room wouldn't fully shut off, so it got too warm the last two nights. On a random note, they provide towels but not washcloths. I would stay there again because it is close to everything we wanted to walk to.

This hostel was probably the best value accommodation we could get in San Francisco. We had our own double room which was nice and clean as were the toilets and showers. We also felt safe at all times and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. Elevator was a bit old fashioned, some decor needs modernizing Location was great for access to main city sights and transport. Breakfast was basic but making our own pancakes was fun. Some meals are also available in the evening which was a good option. Would recommend for anyone looking for a basic but decent place to stay.

Overall its a good hostel. The location is handy, the staff were in general very friendly; one or two not so much but out of the dozen plus that's to be expected of anywhere.The rooms are also good with regards to the storage, the in room sinks, charging ports both in the lockers and handily by the beds. Common areas are nice and there is good WiFi reception throughout.Unfortunately cleanliness is where this hostel takes a hit. I saw two cockroaches in my brief stay there, one of which was in the common area next to the kitchen. This is not something I've experienced before in other places from numerous stays in the city. In the private room I spent a couple of nights in there was still also rubbish on the floor from the previous guest and the washroom facilities could do with a little better attention.

Great location, staff are so welcoming and will help with anything. Room very clean & comfortable. Very chilled out & friendly atmosphere throughout. Activities are put on by the staff for customers. Really loved this place.

Stayed in the 3rd floor and it was great. My shared bedroom had its own bathroom which is good since you don't have to wait outside for one of the bathrooms in the hallway. Staff is very friendly and they always organize walkarounds and events. I joined some people to watch the San Francisco Giants game, about 30min walking distance from the hostel, and it was awesome! They also did pool-table games and Argentina dinner night on other days! They have shared rooms as well as private rooms with a queen size bed.

This hostel near Union Square was in a great location at a great price. Took the walking tour with Poonam and had a great time. Would highly recommend. The common rooms were very busy with a tonne of activities hosted by the staff. Rooms were cleaned daily. Would stay here again if I come back.

I was on a business trip, went to a conference but needed a cheap place to stay near the Moscone Center. I stayed here for a week (Sun through Sat) and had zero complaints. The crew is super nice and the rooms are clean, so are the showers. They have complimentary breakfasts (toasts and some fruit basically) which saved me a couple of days. Great vibe and cool guests. They have a common area on the basement which I really liked. Would definitely recommend it.Cons: This place is located close to the Tenderloin. You will see a lot of homeless people in the area which was shocking for me. The mail area is wide open and people could easily sneak in and get some of your stuff. I was very worried cause I did some online shopping. No elevators and stairs everywhere, beware if you have special needs (like a wheelchair).

It's a nice place, very cleaner than most I've been to, the 4 bed female dorm is big and there's enough space. Just the lockers are so loud, the hostel itself has average breakfast and there aren't enough activities for a social vibe.. but it's good if you explore on your own and need a place to crash. They book you an airport shuttle which is much appreciated and cheaper than uber and spending too much time taking BART.

Stairs at high sleeper bed were dirty.Load sounds in pipes wake you up in the morning.No milk at breakfast and no cereals.Private shower: water did not leave the shower.The beds were too small.Quite pricey for what you get, but comparable cheap in a city like San Francisco

This was my first time solo travelling and in a hostel and I am glad I picked this one. The staff were very friendly and the activities given were really fun. I went on the walking tour with Poonam which was really good, and the other nights offered in the hostel were well organised and fun - if not always at the time stated on the advertisement. The location is great, good for shopping and public transport. There can be a few sketchy people in the neighbourhood but you just have to be sensible and the hostel feels safe. The rooms were really good with the privacy pods, and the bathrooms were always clean.

Central location, close to union square .... almost daily activities are being organized by the hostel to engage the people staying there. Made friends there as well.A bit costly for a hostel. Besides that everything was up to my expectation.

Good hostel, stayed in 4 bed female dorm which was fine. Breakfast and activities good. Lots of amenities there. Locations good for sightseeing. WiFi good, bedding and towel provided. Take a medium or small padlock for the locker.

Stayed here for a couple of nights at the end of a 6month world tour. The staff were helpful and organised a few day trips at a good rate. Met some cool people here and everyone was chilled and helpful. The rooms are clean and good value. It’s in a good location for shopping and is. Lose to the main sights. Would recommend and if I was to go back to the city I’d stay here again

Stayed here for 4 nights in 6 person mixed dorm. The location is good, hostel is really clean and the staff are helpful. The free breakfast every morning was a great perk and there are lots of events always going on. Went on a walking tour with Jessie which was excellent and really brought San Francisco to life.Would definitely stay here again.

The place,the facilities,the activities,the people were really good!! The free walking tour with Poonam was fantastic!USB chargers everywhere!If you are traveling alone, and you want to make some friends and do some organized activities, this is the right hostel!

The hotel is good, its location is greatThe only disadventage is the shared bathrooms.. It was so hard to manage (for me)But the staff was so welcoming and helpfull so it was good!Onther thing, if you do take breakfest included-you have to make it your ownBut it was a good expireance:)

Staff were very friendly and helpful, great location at walking distance to Union Square. Location was quiet even on weekends and the free earplugs provided are always a plus! It is my first stay in a hostel and I stayed in a female only bed room of 4 with our private bathroom, which was kept very clean daily. Comfy beds, linens provided and I loved the privacy shelf especially. Free breakfast is always a plus and you can bring in your own groceries to cook in their huge kitchen as well. We also had a free meal on the first day.

Friendly staff.Clean area (really enjoyable for a hostel + you regularly see cleaning staff). Offering different activities (free or charged) during the day or in the evening. Has a large kitchen, and offering breakfast, good but could be better, maybe just cereals or coffee (even instant coffee?) and more than one sort of jam (I took the breakfast quite early, just to say it was not because I took the rest), however fresh fruits were appreciated. Good wifi. However maybe not enough plugs when you are 4 in a room. My personal plug didn't work, neither my usb hubs. Hair dryer at the 3rd floor didn't work neither. A very nice hostel located near Union Square + you have many buses nearby that can bring you everywhere in the city.

I stayed for four nights. Check in was easy and I was even lent a laptop to help me figure out my credit card issue. I was in a female only four bed room and although it was small there was enough room for suitcases etc. I really enjoyed the privacy screen and lights. Unfortunately I had a head cold so didn’t participate in any hostel activities. However, there were a lot on offer plus a $5 meal each night. Another thing to note is that by having the kitchen / hang out space in the basement meant no sound reached my room (second floor). Only thing to note is that although it says no smoking at the front people smoked nearby which was not nice walking passed!

Great location and great staff. Always happy for a chat and happy to help. Turn right out of the hostel as that’s where the good side of town is. Comfy beds, linens provided and one night was a party with free drinks. Would recommend.

Great location, very central to Moscone and the rest of the central San Francisco. Very friendly staff made the check-in and stay pleasant. The room was decent, not very noisy, small bathroom but big enough. The best hostel experience i've had in San Francisco, will definitely be staying here again when I'm town.

The hostel is in a great area, there is a good variety of food available for breakfasts and events going on in the evenings. While I mostly slept and had breakfast there, spending most of the day either site seeing or going to GDC, I had a good time here.

On my second night in this place a guy tried to force his way into the room because under the obvious effects of drugs he thought our room was his room. We managed to take him out and gave advice to the receptionist of the situation but she looked at my friend as he was lying and did nothing, he tried to get into our room like two more times ,obviously we went again to the receptionist and she told us she was calling her manager to see what she could do, on his third time trying to enter into the room he broke my nose. The hostel never called the police, I went to the hospital because obviously I was under pain and my nose was bleeding and I had to pay 1000 usd to be attended in the hospital. I lost my entire night going from the hospital to the police. I had the worst moment of my life and you know what? the guy went back to the hostel and they let him stay there as nothing happened. On the next day they told him he should go, and that’s all. the worst attention I had in my entire life was here and the only thing they did to try to mend the situation was: we are sorry and they changed us to another room, they didn’t give me the money I payed to the hospital back or at least the money of the stay here to cover some costs of the problem they should have managed from the beginning. So if you want to travel safe and stay in a place where if something happens the place you are staying helps you or respond well to the situation don’t go to USA hostels you won’t be safe.

I have stayed in many hostels in Europe and USA but this is by far the best I have been to. The staff is so nice and you get to see their hospitality as soon as you check in. I stayed in a mixed dorm with a shared bathroom which was clean and well maintained. The breakfast spread was quite decent, they event let you make pancakes! There was a party on the house the day I got here, which was great! The location is great with super market, restaurants and bars close by. It is walking distance to the Union Square. Would definitely consider staying here again!

Stayed here for three nights in a twin ensuite room. The location is excellent, very well placed for getting on the BART and local buses. We arrived at around 8:30am after getting the overnight Megabus from LA, and despite check in not being til 3pm we were able to grab a shower and then leave our bags allowing us to go and explore the city. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The free breakfast every morning was excellent and the evening food events in the kitchen allowed travellers trying to stretch their budgets the opportunity to grab a tasty meal. The free walking tour with Wolfgang was ace! Highly recommended as a way to find your feet in the city. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks!

The hostel is Very clean and comfortable. I recommend it for holidays or business travel. A lot of bathrooms, no matter if you share, there is always one free. many people to talk with. Have all the facilities needed. Good beds and lockers.

The staff is really cooperative! The hostel organises a lot of activities and provides discounts on places to visit. Alcatraz tour is usually sold out months in advance but I could get tickets to it just a day in advance only because i was staying with them!

This hostel was brilliant. Fantastic industrial sized kitchen, amazing breakfast including lots of different types of toast, pancakes and fruit. The beds were comfortable enough and included little privacy pods with lights and chargers. The activities ranged from pub crawls to free pizza nights, games, trivia, $5 pasta nights to walking tours. The shared bathrooms were clean and well maintained and the staff were friendly. Everything you could want in a hostel!

Stayed here for two nights so didn't have the time to socialize that much, but can imagine this to be a great place to meet other travelers. The hostel has a big basement where you can cook food, eat, chillout, drink, play pool, listen to music, do laundry, buy stuff you need from machines and get free coffee/tea. The hostel also arrange different activities/tours each day you can join into. The hostel provides a basic breakfast with different type of bread, fruit, jam/cream cheese and juice. There's a lot of bathrooms everywhere, so don't be afraid of booking a dorm that doesn't have one of its own. The hotel is about 7 min walk uphill from Union square, and is a bit on the side of the center. But there's one bus passing on the same street and another one 4 blocks away (Van Ness) that takes you down to the fishermans warf. There's also two small shops with drinks, snacks etc. just outside the hostel.Last but not least, the staff in the hostel seemed really nice!

The rooms are really good with individual power outlets and lockers but you have to make your own bed. The breakfast is make your own pancakes. Location could not be better. The reception staff was not the nicest.

We had a private room with ensuite. This room was so much better than a lot of hotels I’ve stayed in! We had a comfy queen size bed, big bedside table, lots of space for luggage, coat hangers and hooks, full length mirror, a fridge, microwave and tv. Plus the ensuite was a good size with a shower over bath and a hairdryer! There is an on-site laundry with free detergent, a library with book swap, massive common room and kitchen. Lots of activities at night and breakfast includes make your own pancakes! The location is great too - a safe area close to union square. Great value, especial for San Fran! Can’t recommend this hostel high enough!!!

Was a good hostel very secure and clean. Very helpful staff and plenty of activities to do within the hostel to meet other travellers. Few issues were the lights and USB connectors didn’t work in the bed compartment and also it was a challenge to find a spare toilet and shower when you wanted to use them. Forever waiting for a free one.

Cool staff, clean hostel and a good opportunity to meet new people. It was my first time to stay in a hostel and I just loved it. The location also is great , very close to union square. I will definitely book there again.

Excellent hostel in great location for tourists, a few blocks from union Square. Our private room was small but clean and comfortable with clean bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. They have lots of organised activities and great chill spaces and areas, including a small yoga room. Nice big kitchen and pancakes for breakfast. The area is also great for a tourist as it’s near the subway, with lots of buses passing through, and you can use the street trolley there to access places like the wharf and crooked street. We would definitely stay here again.

Not a great experience. I shared a room with volunteer staff and they were on shifts at all hours coming and going and waking everyone up. Our room was boiling on the ground floor and talked to other guests on the fourth floor who were freezing. While I was there their were 2 nights with free alcohol and people were partying all through the night and the sound came through the walls and no attempt by staff to keep the rules about noise.They don't provide soap so bring your own. Only 2 toilets on my floor but 3 showers which was ok. Breakfast very basic eg oatmeal but no milk. Toast and bagels limited spreads just peanut butter and cream cheese. Can make your own pancakes.Would suite people wanting to party and being close to city bars. For people wanting quiet relaxation and family accomodation Hi Hostel Fishermans Wharf is the go.

Great place to stay if you want to meet people and see the sights. Good for partying and relaxing. Loads of activities on offer, either for free or heavily discounted. Very clean and comfortable and the staff are the most friendliest and helpful I've met.

I have spent 5 nights at the hostel in SFO and my experience has been great. Clean rooms, super kind staff, clean and no noisy rooms, nice sharing spaces. The position is pretty good as well. Recommended for solo travellers

Rooms 3/5 - 6 bed shared dorm. Clean, safe, basic. It is, what it is!Beds were clean and comfortable with access to lights and power sockets. The lockers were safe. Facilities 2.5/5 - Shared bathrooms. Clean-ish!Shared bathrooms were large, clean-ish and with hot water. Toilets were also clean and generally well stocked. Breakfast was self-service and pretty well stocked. The cleanliness depends on the guests there at the time.Service 3/5 - Nice and helpful staff at front desk (when you spoke with them). Location 5/5 - In the heart of SF. Near bars, restaurants and public transport.The hostel is down a questionable looking alleyway. However the alley itself is clean and safe. The location is great because you can take a nice stroll to virtually anywhere in the main city area or grab a bike/tram nearby for ease. Some may feel a little anxious due to the number of homeless people in the vicinity, but this is the hardship of the city due to recent evictions, and not the fault of the hostel. Let me be clear, the homeless there are non-threatening and the streets are safe.Overall 13.5/20 : Basic but convenient

It's the second time I've come back and the good opinion I had last year was confirmed. Good location, very friendly and helpful staff. A good choice for visiting the city, I definitely recommend it. The price for a single room with bathroom is comparable to what you can find in hotels nearby but be careful because there are hotels that are very old and dirty whereas this is clean and well maintained.

Excellent staff, very friendly and set up a great Halloween party. Made it very easy to meet people and make friends. Would stay again. Great location, lovely rooms, can't fault it! A bit pricey but that's San Fran.

Stayed here for two nights, was my first experience in a hostel.Really didn't mind it, was with two friends and we all were in the same room, we did have another random in our room but they kept to themselves. Showers were very accessible, bunk beds were great with power points and lights for each bunk, lockers didn't lock which was annoying, meant we had to lock stuff in our suit cases. I would stay here again for sure though.

Friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in a private room which had a bunk bed and its own small but clean bathroom. I liked the bedlights and USB ports at each bed. Location for us was good; lots of restaurants around and we walked from the hostel to many of the city's sights but there are also bus stops nearby. It is true that there are many homeless in the area but we never felt unsafe. The breakfast was good but the breakfast room, although large, was very crowded. Perhaps they can change the layout of the room a little bit so that there will be a more natural flow of people getting breakfast and returning their plates. I would stay here again and would recommend to young and old.

This hotel has a good vibe and personality. Receptionists were friendly.We had a problem though with check in as their system was down, making us wait in the lobby for about 2 hours or so.If you want to check out then checkin for the second booking, you will be asked to get your stuff out first before you check in. Pros: basic breakfast is served from 7 to 10 am in the basement lounge with flowing tea. During peak season the prices here are just a bit less than in a more upscale hotel so you might want to consider upgrading a bit to a better hotel.

Hostel is very nice. Walk distance fo Union square. Staff is very friendly and the most important: bathrooms are clean! Internet available in the rooms (and very fast) also power and light close to the beds.

The hostel was quite clean and safe, but I would probably pay a bit more for a hotel next time. The breakfast was okay, but the tableware was dirty because you have to wash the dishes after eating. A dishwasher would be more hygienic.

I'm not into hostels, but this one was clean and safe. I liked the individual lights and the separation besides every bed. It gives you the privacy you need. The breakfast was good too. Good hostel location, near many attractions.

I stayed 4 nights in USA hostels and If I didn’t have a prebooked flight I would’ve definitely extended my stay. Everything about the place is great. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. The breakfast is very good compared to other hostels I stayed at and the staff is very friendly and helpful. There is always activities happening and the common room is full of stuff to do and interesting people to meet. It might be a little expensive compared to other hostels but its definitely worth the price. Also the location is great, being a two min walk to union square and plenty of restaurants are very close by.

It’s was annoying have to put the sheets on the bed and them taking it out and bring all the way to to the reception. I also wish there was more showers and a new elevator, because this one was bad and looks dangerous.

Arrived in Hotel in SF on intersection of Golden Gate Avenue- and immediately decided to cancel the room there. I didn’t feel safe at all around the area! So I decided to stay at the hostel. Nice Staff, rooms are clean and ok and you meet immediately new people. Climate would be good though.

I stayed at USA hostel for 4 nights. My friend and I totally agree that we made a good decision because it was only 15 mins from Union SQ on foot, staff members were so friendly and facilities were well organized. I will definitely choose this hostel in the next trip.

Staffs were very friendly and knowledgeable. Plus, everything was clean. Considering the price in san franciso , maybe this hostel is the best option u could ever choose. If i go back to SF, i'd definitly stay here again

Hostel was great. Lots of hot water, comfortable beds, cool staff. I highly recommend it. It was located in a good central location, too, and lots of tours were advertised. It was very well-organized and had many other friendly people.

USA Hostels - San Francisco brings the highest caliber staff, coupled with an unparalleled experience with travelers around the world, into a tightly knit experience that is at once both welcoming and wonderfully unexpected! This is my first "hostel" experience and from the moment I set foot on this property, I was met with engaging, authentic and caring staff and patron travelers, willing to share there travels, experiences and lives over a "pizza" you make yourself during "pizza" night, or a warm bowl of past. The staff are friendly, engaging and authentic to a point where one feels "adopted" into their family/community. I had the pleasure of meeting, talking and breaking bread with caring patrons from around the world. Most these travelers were half my age and yet full of interesting stories, wonderful experiences of world adventures. Folks from Switzerland (Florist and a nurse), New Zealand, Australia, England, South Korea and many other places - all finding a home and friends during their travels at this wonder cross road in San Francisco called "USA Hostels"

USA Hostels San Francisco is the best hostel I've ever stayed at. The location is perfect, just a few minutes from the main places in the city, including transportation lines and subway station. The private rooms are very comfortable and clean, much better than some standard hotel rooms. It also has an excellent breakfast, and you can also cook your own food at any time 'cause they have a spacious and fully equipped kitchen. And the best of this hostel is their staff: the people are so friendly and kind, always ready to help the guests; and they prepare so many different activities during the week that you will always have some funny thing to do during your time in the city, for sure. I'll come back to this place with no doutbs!

Unfortunately USA hostels fell a little short of expectation for me & my partner given all the great reviews. The location is decent although a bit of a 15-20min walk uphill from the Powell St Bart Station with heavy luggage- we had friends stay at the Parc 55 hotel which was much more central and better value (in terms of cleanliness, proximity, sound proofing)- we really wished we had stayed there as we heard from my friends that Parc 55 was only a little bit more expensive than our private room. Upon arrival, check in service was fine and efficient. The lifts were much needed although lift doors a bit awkward to negotiate with heavy luggage (old building). We stayed on the 4th floor in a private double room with private bathroom. The room was very small, smelled of sewage and carried a lot of noise from downstairs when the window was open. We had to try and open the window for air as it was very hot even with a ceiling fan- however this meant that we had barely any sleep at night (from staff/residents/guests/neighbours- talking outside meant the noise carried up) or in the morning. We couldn't sleep until 12 am most nights and would be woken up at 6am by the noise of people (unsure if USA Hostel Staff) working downstairs. We had to shut the window one night in order to get any sleep. The bed linen was very rough and worn. Our one window also faced directly opposite someone else's room who was probably only 2-3 metres away in another building which interfered with privacy and and I needed to keep the curtains closed most of the time, but got very warm in the process).We had one episode where I was woken up and kept up from 11.30pm-1am in the morning due to the next door guest/neighbour playing very loud music, being very drunk and loud with banging and crashing that made me very concerned. I actually had to call the front desk at 12.15am as I was too afraid to go outside of my room to report it downstairs- it sounded as if the people next door were high on drugs with a mix of alcohol and I was wary of how they would respond in an inebriated state if I were to ask them to keep the noise down. Unfortunately the Front desk staff reported that they were unable to do anything as they were the only staff on duty but said that they would pass it on to the next staff member. When I reported the incident in the morning, this information had not passed it on. However, the staff member who I reported it to later said that he would deal with the matter.

Great hostel! Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Rooms are clean. We had a privateroom with our own bathroom. Enough choice for breakfast, pancakes are delicious. Good location. Would deffinately stay here again.

I stayed at USA hostel for a few nights on my own, before and after going to Burning Man festival. The hostel is very big so people are going and coming all the time, but it was still relativly quiet in the rooms which was good. The breakfasts are included and are nice - as long as you aren't gluten free which would definitely be a problem! The staff are helpful and personable, although I did get the impression that they are used to a younger crowd (I am 36) and so they did not suggest any of the events they organise, although they did recommend them to younger travellers, which seemed a bit strange. The hostel is well kept and clean and the dorms were fine (I stayed in 3 during my period there). It is relatively expensive but I think that is an issue with San Francisco generally and not this hostel particularly. Overall I would probably stay again :)

I loved it there. I have never stayed in a hostel before so I was a bit dubious initially. I travelled across California for 3 weeks and found the hostel to be my favourite place to stay. I definitely would recommend it to anyone. The social aspect as well is amazing and it is great being able to meet new people.

The Hotel gets its name from the film It has pleasantly been refurbished The reception has a nice clean fill about it.The rooms are nicely decorated with tea/coffee making facilities.Although on a slight hill what isnt in frisco you can still walk to China town or Union Square.Tram Cars are nearby for 7 dollars pp but stop short of fishermans wharf so a little walk is necessary.UBER offer a good service.

Well located . Good service. Clean and caleNearby the cable car lines 10 minutes walk or the buses lines Great morning breakfasts in local restaurants To be recommended for a Three night trip in San Francisco

Booked this one last minute. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was an issue with my room and it was promptly resolved and I felt very taken care of. Rooms are cute and I love the decor. Highly recommend!

I was really excited to stay in this hotel, being a big film buff and it’s link to Vertigo. But I was disappointed in the ‘boutique’ hotel. The walls were paper thin- on the first night we had to turn the tv on to drown out our obnoxious neighbour who then proceeded to wake us up at the crack of dawn the next morning with his loud voice- bare in mind we were jet lagged too! The lift is painfully slow and there was no cafe as advertised on the website and the area was a bit rough. Wouldn’t stay again. Cool bit of history though.

Awful hotel. Claims to be a boutique hotel, but is shabby beyond belief, and including white and orange accessories doesn’t make it boutique. Everything about the hotel feels old and tired. The furniture is cheap and tacky, the windows haven’t been renovated in years and let in loads of noise. The walls are paper thin. The lighting, power points and fan ( yes no air con) are all like something from the 80s. The quality of the bathroom fittings are poor. On the plus side the bed was comfortable and the staff were friendly, but $400 for an unpleasant room in a fairly dodgy part of town - never again.

I was in San Franciso for a business trip for a week and stayed at the hotel but mostly out the whole day. But I'm glad they made my stay very comfortable, especially Joan who was very friendly and went all the way to bring me some extra towels when I needed them. Place is also not far from everything. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, its a good location although close to Tenderloinwhich has a unbelieveable amount of homeless people hanging around. In all my travels abroad I've never seen a place so bad. The rooms are large and very well decoratedwith some classy touches.When we were there the hotel didn't have any facilities for breakfast so we had quite a walk to the nearest cafe. On the whole the staff were very good one or two need customer care courses but it was ok. I enjoyed my stay there and if in San Francisco again would stop again

Stayed in this hotel for two nights last month. Lovely comfortable room in a good location. I loved the history of the place being linked to the movie Vertigo. A very warm welcome when we arrived and couldn't fault the friendliness of the staff. Would highly recommend staying here.

Stayed here for 4 nights hotel is beautiful bright and clean. Check in was easy and staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were big and spacious they have a safe for your valuables which was great. Tea & coffee making facilities in your room and these were refilled every day when the room was made up. As it was warm while we were there it was great that the room had a fridge to keep our drinks cold. Hotel gave us a map of the area when checking in which was very helpful and also gave us information on best way to navigate our self’s around. A walk to Pier 39 is around 30-40 minutes from the hotel. Great stay and would recommend staying here again when visiting San Francisco. Thank you

I've stayed in a lot of "affordable" hotels in San Francisco, and none can match my experience with Hotel Vertigo.The room itself was well designed, comfortable, and clean. Everything was modern and updated, and the space provided was sufficient for both vacationing and getting some work done. The room has a work desk, TV, and even a mini fridge, helping drive down those expensive going-out-to-eat-for-every-meal costs. I'm a stickler for water pressure, and the standing shower provided the perfect amount. The room also had its own coffee machine, which is always appreciated.The staff was welcoming at both check-in and check-out, offering helpful tips and services. The location of the building was quiet and clean, unlike other areas of the city.All-in-all, Hotel Vertigo is a place I'd choose again and again when visiting SF.

Fantastic experience! Jamie and Greg at Hotel Vertigo are absolutely amazing and took great care of three Canadians in San Francisco for vacation. Definitely recommend. Hotel was cozy and clean and we were able to walk from the hotel to Fishermen’s Wharf. It’s a bit of a hike (1.5 hours) but great way to check out the city.

Hey, a nice hotel in a great location. Spacious room with good facilities and very helpful at reception. Bathrooms are a little tired but work well, and our room is easy to get to. Would be happy to stay again, so have enjoyed our stay.

Nice alternative to the big hotels and a better value. Neighborhood is fine if you’re an adult, but not great for young kids. I was solo on business and liked it. The lobby cafe was not inviting but the room was great. I’d stay again.

Great visit. Close to restaurants and convenience store. Walking distance to Union Square. Very helpful staff, when ordering a taxi. Would have liked a hotel restaurant. Would have liked breakfast provided.

An excellent option to stay in downtown San Francisco. Located at 5 - 10 minutes walk from Union Square, in a really quiet area. The room was truly awesome, and the hotel has its intriguing history. Totally recommended!

It was a short stay but for a short visit such a pleasant stay. Vertigo is a Very nice hotel. Needless to say my favorite color orange is everywhere! Love the theme! My family and I enjoyed our stay. Front desk reception all very nice, Jessica so sweet and friendly showed us places to go and almost checked off everything on the list! Thank you for such an amazing stay. My family and I really enjoyed ourselves!

We stayed here for 4 nights . Great history to the hotel loved the colour scheme true to the era of the hotel. We loved the hotel but it's not for everyone. Our room was fine, cleaned everyday big walk in shower. toiletries Ok coffee machine and fridge. Tv worked ok. No problems we only used the room as a base as out all day. Reception very pleasant.

Very unique and nice hotel. Beds are comfortable, room size is decent. front desk staff amazing and very helpful(Joan and jessica), when asked questions or for recommendations of things to do and places to go eat, they gladly helped. Thank you for a nice stay.

Great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great location to everything. It was within walking distance to everywhere I wanted to go. This was great, as I didn’t rent a car for the first time traveling and was worried about getting around. Didn’t have any issues staying here! Great value. Cute room. Would definitely stay again if I was in the area.

We arrived from the UK at lunch time and made our way straight to the hotel. Our room wasn’t ready which wasn’t a problem they kept our suitcases and waisted no time heading into San Francisco. The hotel is located in a good area there are plenty of things close by with a convenience store a couple of doors away and a nice coffee place also a pizza delivery across the street. The hotel is a short walk of about 10 minutes to Union Square and shopping and also the start of one of the street car routes to Fisherman’s Wharf. Also if you are using the hop on/off bus the nearest stop is less than 10 minutes away.The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel clean and tidy. We needed advice on getting to an emergency room (which is a block away) which they were only to happy to advise on.There was only one thing that was a little hazy about our stay when we arrived they took a swipe of our card which then we later noticed charged money from our bank account this is a held fee in case you charge anything to your room. If you don’t it gets refunded not a problem but the lady that checked us in didn’t explain this as soon as we questioned it this was explained.Overall a great hotel for exploring San Francisco if we visit again we would use this hotel.

I get in and out of San Francisco every month or so. I love finding my wat through the boutique hotels at the edges of tourist land. Vertigo met or exceeded all of my expectations. The rooms are standard international size and quality. The hotel oozes charm.It was the music and the guy behind the desk that won my heart. Greg exudes the kind of presence that makes small hotels really work. And boy, does he pick great music.

The locate of this hotel is the best.Near to everything that this city can offer to us.Joan is the best receptionist, very carefully about our stay.Next year I'll be there again, but this time with my fiance

We love exploring boutique hotels in San Francisco and Hotel Vertigo was a delight. They have taken a Hitchcock movie cameo, added quirky and bright modern decor, and an extraordinary staff to create a memorable experience. We especially loved meeting Greg Bland at the front desk who knows even more about music than about making your stay wonderful. And that's saying something because the rooms were comfortable, the location and parking easy to navigate, and the feel of the place was charming and fun. We will definitely be back.

The wife and I recently had the opportunity to experience more local history at this hotel. We never thought that this hotel was anything more than just a tribute to a great movie. First used as a speakeasy during prohibition with an underground entrance in the 1920s, the venue took the (Plush Room) Cabaret Theatre name in 1926. It was located in what was then the Empire Hotel. While the plush room is no more today, there is a side-entrance door off the main lobby to remind you of what was once a wonderful experience to San Francisco’s past. Not only were all the people who worked here very nice, but also very helpful with any needs or questions. -They made us feel very comfortable. Our room was small but very comfortable and met all our expectations to include a very comfortable rain-shower feature which was great after a long day of walking. This hotel is one not to miss, and sure to please any history-buff. Don’t miss out. These types of Hotels won’t be around forever.

I got items that had sentimental value to me I had them inside my bag so someone went through my stuff during cleaning process, I contact the stuff about my problem and they did nothing to fix or resolve the problem. Very upsetting

Nice staff. Very clean room every day. We lived there for seven days. Will do it again.One of our chair brook due to the lack of two screws. They replaced it and compensated us with a good bottle of wine one night free of charge.

Disappointed. The website states 'begin each morning with coffee & tea service hosted daily in our lobby'. There is the skeleton of a cafe but when I asked about it I was told it doesn't open any more - no explanation, no apology.'Complimentary morning newspaper' never appeared.'Business center in the lobby' is one PC, printer and chair.I made a point of emailing before I visited to ask if cards for deposit payments are just authorised or if payment would actually be taken then refunded - they confirmed payment wouldn't be taken but when I checked out, big shocker, the funds had been taken from my card so I'm now waiting for the refund.My room was clean and the size I expected but not the standard - see pics for unsightly wiring/trunking and an exposed threshold into the walk in wardrobe/safe area which is pretty painful to step on/stub your toe on.Dark lower wall and carpet colours make it feel dingy and dull. The heating system is awful - unit build into the wall which can be set on 'fan' or 'heat' ... and there's no middle ground for either so the room was cold and then after 10mins set on 'heat' it's stifling. Only 2 or 3 of the channels on the TV consistently received signal, the others repeatedly dropped out. Don't know if you'd class it as a motel but it's definitely not a hotel.Location wise if you're a tourist I'd recommend being in the Fisherman's Wharf area instead (unless your budget allows for a Union Square hotel)

Hotel Vertigo is in a fun location near downtown and although I was only there for one night the room was clean and well furnished and the concierge/staff were very helpful. Also got a kick out of the Vertigo film-themed decor in the room and the lobby.

We were very early for check in at this hotel as we were coming off a cruise ship. We had been the day before and asked whether it would be possible and a note was made. Thankfully on arrival our rooms were ready. This was really appreciated, as it meant we could check in and continue looking around San Francisco. The staff behind the desk were all really helpful and friendly and very informative. Our room was really large and all clean and tidy, with a lovely bathroom and overhead shower. Good amount of toiletries and towels, clean and fresh.They also organised a taxi for us to take us to the airport for a set $50, which between 4 of us, worked out really well. Thank you for all that you did for us, if we are ever back in San Francisco, we will definitely come back to this hotel

We were in town on a trip. Unfortunately didn’t stay at hotel vertigo but figured while in town let’s check it out, being that we’re HUGE vertigo fans. The receptionist jessica (I believe was her name) was so friendly and welcoming even let us take pictures of the stairs and took one for us. We loved everything about the hotel. It’s amazing! Hope to come back next year and hopefully book a room here.

Hello.. stayed here 31st Jan and check out 3rd Feb.Arrived later than scheduled due to queues at border. Shared shuttle straight to this fabulous boutique hotel - a short walk from union square. My friend and I were met by Christina at reception. Warm and welcoming. Which is great after an 11 hour flight. Smooth and easy check in. Great recommendations for food in the local area and given a map for directions around the city. We chose to upgrade to a 2 bed room. Great facilities in room. Coffee, tea, shower over bath, fabulous quality of toiletries. The shampoo is amazing.safe and ironing facilities. Water is $2 a bottle but that's the average price for a 500 ml bottle. After the jet lag kicked we were wide awake so stepped outside for some fresh air at 02.30 am. Welcomed back into the hotel by Sam the lovely night desk watchman. As our next flight changed schedules once again reception staff Christina and Cynthya service shone through and assisted us with shuttle bus bookings and recommendations for things to do whilst we have a few hours left in San Francisco. The housekeeping teams have kept our room nice and clean and topted up with refreshments and toiletries.So our stay has been even more brilliant, as the hotel has felt like a home from home. With there excellent service with that added human touch which has made all the difference. I will happily stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you to you front line ladies and Sam. You've made our stay such a joy and has made our trip here that extra bit special. Keep doing what you do. You are all a credit to this hotel and company.

The Hotel Vertigo is outdated, cramped, and lacks the additional amenities that are expected of a hotel. They are in the process of renovating, but from what I could tell the changes were superficial. When I was there, the coffee shop was closed and there was no onsite restaurant. Had I spent more than a few hours awake in the hotel I could have been bored without easy access to coffee, limited tv channels, and slow internet.

This hotel was somewhat better priced than the larger chains, so I decided to book and was glad I did. The business center is very basic. However, the lobby is comfortable, and the WiFi is reliable. I was able to get my work done. The architecture and decorating are fascinating. Although I visited during an unusually rainy period, the views are very nice. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I had a heating issues in my room that could not be fixed, so they promptly placed me in another room that was very comfortable. The cafe was closed, so they recommend Mr. Holmes Bakehouse around the corner. The coffee and pastries were delicious and quite reasonable. The surrounding neighborhood is safe and has many conveniences such as a variety of restaurants, drug stores, and fitness studios.

Excellent service, friendly staff, clean and crisp rooms and definitely my money's worth/value for the service and room quality. However, not keen on the additional urban/amenity fee. Would stay again at this hotel.

I had booked a room at Hotel Vertigo for a local conference I was attending. I had done my internet research on affordable hotels in the CBD in San Fransico and came across this hotel. The history and nostalgia of the hotel prompted me to make a reservation. Wasn't sure what to expect having flown 14 hours from New Zealand to San Fransico. When I had arrived I was greeted by a friendly staff who made my check-in seamless. The room was small but adequate for my 4-day stay. You could feel the history oozing out of the walls from when the hotel first made its debut in the 1958 Alfred Hitchcock movie, 'Vertigo'. The hotel was perfectly located in the heart of San Fransico making it easy to get to restaurants, stores and attractions. The highlight for me was walking down to the fish market at Fishermen's Wharf and enjoying the freshly caught seafood and a glass of wine. I love the character and history of this hotel and would definitely stay at the hotel again when in San Fransico next.

My husband and I stayed here for the first few nights of a trip travelling in California, for our stay in San Francisco. There was a nice welcome from the hotel and the staff were friendly. But the room that we were put in to start off with was pretty awful. It was on the ground floor and whilst decorated nicely, the bathroom was very strange and the 'view' was of the fire escape! I couldn't reach the floor whilst sitting on the toilet, I'm not a short person but I thought this was quite strange. So we asked to change rooms and the friendly lady at reception said yes of course but not now. So we asked when we came back, only to be told we needed to ask in the morning! We asked again in the morning and eventually got moved to a much better room - with some daylight as a starting bonus. It wasn't an upgrade and from what they said at reception they had spare rooms, I can't imagine why you'd put anyone in our first room when there was another room free but hey ho. On the whole our stay was good but I felt a little disappointed with being crammed in the basement at the start. Tip for travellers - ask for a room on one of the upper floors, the lift is a bit of a pain but at least you feel human.
