This hotel was a great place to stay. Location is good, close to some very good restaurants. Hotel! staff is excellent and very helpful! We had a very nice trip, glad we stayed at this hotel!We chatted with the front desk a few time, very knowledgeable of the area, very friendly.

Great overnight stay at hotel vertigo. Reception staff great. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Shower was great. Powerful and hot water! Nearby lovely crepery called honey honey. Shared a savoury and sweet crepes between the two. Would recommend for breakfast. Would stay again. Thanks hotel vertigo

Very nice one-nighter. Bed very comfortable. Front desk staff friendly. Very close to the theater district and Union Square. The café was closed for renovation, so that wasn't available. Nice décor. I recommend. Perfect for tourist travelers or lovers getaway.

This was great stay in an iconic hotel. Were the beds and amenities perfect, like you might expect at the Four Points Sheraton...NO! If you want a plush hotel, go stay at one. This hotel was affordable, close to so many things, and clean. Slept better in this bed than many a more expensive hotel. Id stay again.

A nice affordable gem. Neighborhood had restaurants within walking distance. Friendly staff. Clean spot. Slow elevator was the only issue, but really not a big deal. Room was comfortable and clean. I would stay there again.

This is typically a 3 star hotel. Personally i wouldn’t highly recommend it. It’s ideal for its position, close to buses, trams, cable car and a short walk to the BART. We saved $ by getting the bart from the airport to Union Square. The hotel room is big enough for a couple and the bed is very comfortable with white fresh bedding. However there is no view, just a brick wall. A coffee machine with cardboard cups, a fridge for your use and USB ports are available free of charge. All ideal for us as we were out from 8am everyday not returning before 8pm. If you wanted to spend any length of time in the room it’s probably not for you. Nice shower with shampoo and body wash, clean towels and flannels everyday. Gym on site that we didn’t use. Receptionist helpful for local information.

Around a 40 minute taxi ride from the airport Sutter is a long street that can take you from Union Sq. to Japan Town.I did'nt find the reception staff to be overly welcoming or overly eager to help at any time although they did order a couple of taxis for us despite on one occasion one of the girls saying quietly to the other but not quietly enough "or you could just walk". The rooms are quite nice and clean, comfy bed, walk in wardrobe with safe, tea/coffee making facilities, t.v. and some toiletries provided. The location was quiet and we had good sleep quality. Don't bother trying to have breakfast at the hotel although the coffee was nice they had no tea and the food offerring was scones, croissants and muffins but no butter or jam ! plenty of places to eat close by though.$15 for a taxi to Fishermans Wharf if you don't fancy walking.I would stay at The Vertigo again despite the above comments due the location and the rooms.

We stayed in the Hotel for 3 nights as part of a family tour of Western America. At first we were unsure of the location as it is right on the edge of the Union Square area. Once we got settled we were happy that it was in a good spot. The hotel looks really stylish with a strong link to the film Vertigo (constantly played on the screen behind reception ). The rooms were a good size and functional with the same colour scheme as the rest of the place. The staff were very helpful and sorted us out with places to eat and transfer to the airport. We went to the top of the hotel to get the Vertigo feeling looking down. This was very impressive even though the hotel should be called acrophobia! There wasn’t a lot of food on offer and we didn’t try it but really good places nearby for breakfast etc.. we would stay here again when in San Francisco.

This hotel is clean and okay as a last minute place to sleep when everything else is full.Lots of little details added up to a less than ideal stay. Neither the tv nor the phone in my room worked - not a big deal to me, but it might matter to someone else. The trim on the lamps was worn out, the shower valve leaked, the toiletries were minimal and low quality, the molding was grubby...all small things but they added up to a depressing ambiance. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the room was quiet. The staff was fine - polite when checking in, but no greeting whilst I was coming and going - again, didn’t matter to me, but it might to you. As I was checking out, the clerk was eating a biscuit and jam at the desk - that did matter to me - it was sloppy and unprofessional. There are worse places to stay....

Hotel clean and rooms clean , service very good and helpful.Safe to walk at night near the hotel we walked back from union square and China town ever night no issues used the cafe across the road for breakfast every day very good. Did the bus tour very good and Alcatraz fantastic. Pier 39 is good to eat and plenty to choose from. I would stay again .

The staff really wants you to have a good stay in San Francisco and the hotel.They took care of a good parking place in the area, during the time we brought our luggage to the hotel room they kept an eye on the car, they were able to answer all our questions abouit the city, they were VERY friendly in general.We had some documents to scan and to mail, this was not a problem at all.In particular I want to thank our maid Yaneth, terrific job!!

I am staying at the hotel Vertigo and wanted to write about the great experience thus far. The staff is amazing and I'd like to single out Cynthia - which went above and beyond help at the front desk to ensure my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. She is greets all of the guests when the walk through the doors which adds to the overall experience... Thanks Hotel Vertigo and thanks Cynthia!!

Myself and my partner are just back from our stay in San Francisco, we stayed in Hotel Vertigo. We found the hotel very clean . Staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially Greg who was based in reception. Would definitely stay here again. Close to Union Square and all other amenities. Marie and Frank from Ireland

My Fiance and I traveled from San Diego to San Francisco to celebrate my birthday. This hotel is quaint and charming. It lacks some in-house amenities you would find at a major resort or box hotel (ie Restaurant, Room Service, etc) but that was OK since the location was great and we were there to tour the town. The room we stayed in have lots of natural light and was very comfortable and cozy. All in all we left satisfied.

Myself and my wife stayed here from 4th october till 8th. We picked this hotel.because of location and reviews and it was the right decision in the end. 10 minute walk to union sq. A lovely cosy hotel that had a very friendly feel to it. The front desk people were so kind and helpful and were always on hand to help you. We stayed in room 321. Very cosy room with the most comfortable bad ever. Bathroom was lovely with a great shower. Location of hotel is perfect. 10 min walk to union sq and on 1 of our days we walked to Mrs doubtfire house which took us 35 minutes which took us up a lovely Pacific heights. No doubt i would stay here again. Thank you for making our trip from Ireland so welcoming.

For the most part, our stay was fine. I was disappointed to learn, though, that the "coffee & tea service hosted daily in our lobby" is a service to be paid for rather than offered as a courtesy. I did purchase pastries there and they were quite good. On the other hand, the barista informed me the coffee machine wasn't working, so all they had to offer was espresso. Mind you, I like espresso, but a single shot doesn't replace a cup of coffee, so I opted for double shots. In addition, I was surprised to learn that Cafe Vertigo is "separate" from the hotel, meaning items purchased could not be charged to our guest room.

This is a very nice hotel with clean and well presented rooms in a good location for trolleybus and cable car services across the city. It's a long walk from the waterfront, about 40 minutes, so the transport links help a lot. There's plenty of places to eat a short walk down the hill, restaurants and takeaways. Our stay was only really let down by the guy on the front desk the first couple of mornings we stayed there. He was reasonably helpful until he realised we wouldn't buy tickets for the open top tour service (that we assume he got commission for), and then resorted to vague grunts and avoiding eye contact to give us directions to the nearest bus stops. HIs directions were useless, but thankfully we found out way around ok with his help. A real shame!

Nice clean hotel very quirky . Excellent price ,friendly staff very helpful. Great location for geeting to union square for buses cable cars etc.Union square was a hive of activity. Of to mountain view today to see Stone Sour and Ozzy Osbourne. Loved San Fran

San Francisco for me has to be the most magnificent city in the world. It holds such a special charm. On this occasion the Willows has been my default place to stay. I’ve stayed before in the past. The Willows is a very humble bed and breakfast nicely decorated, amazingly clean, safe and well managed by a great team who are very polite and helpful. If its a five star hotel your looking for the Willows makes no claim to be so but there is five star service. There are a few things the guest needs to know before considering booking and I want to be honest with readers. The city of San Francisco has had for many years a large homeless problem which is visible in this neighbourhood. Some guests may find this off putting. It’s a fact of life in this city and not confined to areas around the bed and breakfast. The Willows has shared bathroom/shower toilet facilities. There are no en suites. These facilities are spotless.The business is well managed. There is a nice lounge sitting area and also breakfast buffet is laid out in the kitchen in the morning. I love this place. When out on the street it’s walking distance to the Castro. The MUNI, BART and Bus system is extensive and easy to use.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We stayed at the Willows for a couple of nights. Gary and the team were great hosts, the beds were comfortable and although there was not a full en suite facility,the showers were spotless with plenty of power and hot water.Breakfast offered a good choice and was well laid out. Trams and subway just outside, we were given Clipper cards (like an Oyster Card) by our hosts to help us use the city transit system. Nearest car park is 3 blocks away at the local hospital but quite a walk as it's all very uphill- fortunately one of the local buses can help with this. Would recommend for a short stay in SF.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: A wonderful place from which to base your San Francisco adventure. Castro area an easy walk, and all public transportation literally a few feet away from the front door. Management and staff provide a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere, and guests from all over the globe make for very interesting breakfast companions! Highly recommended.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: After climbing the long entry steps, we loved everything about the Willows Inn! Lively Castro District location; cozy, clean, safe and comfortable home base for my girlfriends-from-around-the-world reunion. Can't say enough about owner Mike and his friendly staff being so helpful and kind during our week's stay. Very reasonable prices on the 12-room accommodations in this refurbished mansion, with lovely antiques and mini fridges in each room.  Transportation, many ethnic restaurants, atmospheric taverns, Whole Foods, and even a 24-hr Safeway are within short blocks of the Willows Inn front door.  Our favorite group excursion over the last weekend in October was to get tix for a 2-day plus 1-night Hop-On Hop-Off Big Bus tour, which has 20 stops all over the city, and a live guided tour translated by earphones into 10 languages. Make sure to hop off in Haight-Asbury to walk the beautiful, historic main street filled with interesting shops, and hop off at Golden Gate Park to visit the Science Center, Imax, plus Aquarium for one price. And you can't miss Fisherman's Wharf to hear the sea lions argue and play with each other while you sample seafood.  Then, what a treat to retreat to our separate rooms back at the Willows, and convene in the Library/Sitting Room for our own happy hour before deciding on a dinner restaurant nearby. Our favorite was the very popular, delicious Spanish restaurant Picada down the street.  The 5 of us gals (plus one grown son who helped navigate us around) give 12 thumbs up on the Willows B&B Inn.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This Bed and Breakfast Inn is very nice. The actual entrance is a door at street level. It was difficult to find at first. Once entering, there is a beautiful staircase leading up to check-in. The owners were wonderful and made us feel welcomed. There were historic, framed photographs from around SF on the walls and older furniture. Our room was another flight up but we had help with our luggage. Note: there is no elevator, so if you have special needs, you may want to make sure they can accommodate you. Our room was cozy and welcoming. Plenty of closet space and 2 robes available. There is a refrigerator in the room and a sink. There were nice toiletries. The bed was comfortable. We loved the thick Roman shades that really darkened the room in the morning. A short distance down the hall were water closets. They were very clean and private. There were also private showers. Although we didn't use them, they were also immaculate. There is a kitchen on second floor that had snacks available. In the morning, this is where the breakfast is served. We did not have time to try the breakfast but previous reviews have raved about it. The B&B is in the Castro area and convenient for enjoying the area or taking public transit to other areas of the city. I rated the place a 4 because parking is difficult. This is so convenient without a car. I wish we had left ours at home. The nearest parking garage is quite a distance away. And, the streets were having public works working on them. Also, there is a street cleaning schedule. So, easy to get a ticket in and around the local streets.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: we stayed there last July. The room was ok, a bit too small I would say and the toilet/shower were in common with the other guests at the same floor (spotless clean. The breakfast a bit too small and poor. The location really good, in the middle of Castro district. The staff very friendly and gentle
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: My annual trip to San Francisco is just unthinkable without a stay at the Willows. Comfortable cozy rooms, an excellent continental breakfast, an always helpful and courteous staff, and a great location in the heart of SF. What more can you want?
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We particularly liked the friendliness of the welcome, the location and the individuality of the rooms etc. Before arriving we had some concerns about the shared bathroom facilities but there was no problem of availability and they were kept spotlessly clean. Nice touches throughout the Inn included many plants, pictures and original features and fittings. Very enjoyable
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I stayed at this place during the July long weekend and beyond. When I booked, the owners sent me an e-mail with the directions to the inn from SF Airport. I followed the directions to the T, and had no problem finding the place. It takes almost 30-45 minutes in train/subway to reach from SF international airport to this place. Just make sure to have enough USD in cash with you, as the machines at the stations are not very friendly with credit/debit cards. (In fact, there is a man that makes money from tips by helping visitors on how to operate the machine)The location is very close the Church Street subway, plus you can take the bus/streetcar from the street to access SF downtown. I was given a room at the second floor. The room was clean, with fresh sheets on the bed, a table, drawers, a cupboard , a small TV and a basin with toiletries. The Wi-Fi speed is adequate.The staff was very friendly and helped me with directions to nearby restaurants and attractions. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance of this place. There is also a Safeway opposite this place. So finding a place to eat is not a problem, even if you happen to be a vegetarian (I am one).The place serves breakfast every morning. Yogurt with all the helpings of dry-fruit, all kinds of bread with spreads (I had my first taste of vegemite), cereals, cheese, boiled eggs, juice-coffee-tea and a freshly baked treat every morning (Although after a while it could get repetitive). I wish they included more savoury treats in the morning, but I know American breakfast doesn't include savoury/salty items.The washrooms and bathrooms were clean. No complaints there. I liked the request card about not wasting the water.The payment was upfront when I checked in. I found it bit odd, but on hindsight, I was in hurry when I was leaving and the payment process would have just delayed my departure. So don't regret having an upfront payment.During my stay, I saw people from all demographics. This place does not serve to just specific clienteles.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this place.The reasons why I didn't give a 5 rating to the property1) This is an old house converted into a residence. So if you are carrying luggage with you, you are on your own when it comes to carrying luggage to your room. I have a bad back and wasn't happy carrying my bag to the room.2) The house is old and has that old carpet smell.3) There are no central or window AC. So either you keep the window open at night or use fan. Luckily, it didn't get very warm at night when I was staying. Opening window at night invites street noise.4) There are some shady characters loitering near this place during night. I am not sure if there is any care taker during night and the possibility of trespassing. (Yes - I am being a bit paranoid here)5) They gave me a key form the main entrance and the room. In case you lose your key and you come home late at night, I am not sure what would be your options.6) The washrooms were clean and had a hand sanitizer, but having to walk to your room to wash your hands just seemed a bit odd.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The staff were very helpful, especially at getting us in late. They were able to provide a parking space for our rental car (extra $15/night). You would never find the place if you didn't know what you were looking for, but the location is very convenient.The breakfast was excellent. Lots of choices; nicely laid out in a small pleasant breakfast room. The sleeping room was just big enough. The shared bathrooms were always very clean and available.However, I was bitten both nights. Four days later, I still have itchy red places on my arm.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The Willows Inn was the perfect place to stay for our San Francisco trip. We were able to walk or take the streetcar to everywhere we wanted to go. The Inn management were welcoming and helpful and kept the place spotlessly clean. We slept well and always went out full up and ready to go with a healthy and tasty breakfast and good coffee. Reasonably priced (for San Francisco!) and overall a very good experience.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I and my family stayed and The Willows Inn for 5 days end of April. It was a great pleasure and exceeded our expectations.Enviable location, just in front of a trolley, bus and metro stop, closed to Mission and Castro districts which are two of the most beautiful districts of Frisco.The hosts were so kind since the time of booking, helping us to find the best solution for our accommodation. The rooms are spacious and clean, restrooms and bathrooms in the common spaces are not a problem at all. Priceless the square chocolate you find in your room when you arrive. Really appreciated.Excellent breakfast where you can find all what you want, including a lot of organic food. It was also a pleasure to meet and have a talk with other guests during breakfast.I will absolutely come back to the Willows Inn when I return to Frisco and will recommend it to everyone asking me a suggestion where to accommodate in the city.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This place is so welcoming. The rooms are large and updated. Water closets and bath rooms down the hall. Fill out what you want for breakfast night before. Afternoon tea each day and wine and cheese each night. When you go out for night they turn down the bed and put a glass of port on your nightstand. Free transit passes and close to Church and Market Street BART station.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: It was a delight to check in here for the 3rd time within two years.Handy to lots of local public transport and within walking distance of the centre of Castro, the Willows Inn nevertheless provides a quiet and cozy home away from home. The rooms are charming and very comfortable, and there is also a lovely living room in which we can read, watch TV, watch a movie or chat with others.Please do not worry about the shared showers and toilets, as they are close to all rooms, and they are immaculately serviced, cleaned and maintained at all times.There is plenty of information available about the specifically GLBT attractions of San Francsico, as well as about all the many other fascinations of this amazing city.The breakfast room is small and friendly, and the cold buffet selection is excellent - breads & muffins with toaster, spreads, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, beverages. And for the Australians, they have Vegemite available!Above all, our hosts welcome us with very friendly courtesy, really valuing our patronage, and making guests feel at home over and over again, and being eager to help whenever they can.The F-tram, operating from Castro through Downtown and to Fisherman's Wharf, leaves from across the road, whilst MUNI trams and buses are also just across the road. In short - I just love this guest house, and can't wait until I can stay here again!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: For the second time I spent a couple of days in the Willows Inn. The staff is friendly and very attentive. I love the breakfast buffet in the kitchen, a good place to meet the other guests. They announced an aperohour in the evening, but there was nothing. The inn is very clean and the rooms are cosy and you feel comfortable. The Willows Inn is located close to the market street with good public transport or you can walk in a couple of minutes to the Castro street.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Great location, a hidden gem. Don't let the shop front put you off, once you enter thru the side door you find an old world charm. The guys that operate the property are helpful and know what they are doing. The rooms are good and the breakfast s fantastic. I Highly recommend.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The guest house doesn't look much from the outside, but the inside is lovely and the staff are very friendly. We liked the way breakfast was served with lots of fruit and bread laid out in the kitchen which you could put on a tray and take back to your room or eat in the kitchen if you fancied a chat with other guests. Was a bit worried about the shared shower rooms and toilets, but it wasn't a problem and never had to wait to use. The guest house was just round the corner from the muni station and trolley bus stop which meant it was very easy to get anywhere in the city. Also was just a 20 minute walk from the Castro.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We enjoyed our stay in September very much. Excellent service, very clean and tidy, a very familiar atmosphere, nice breakfast. Good starting point for all events you want to do in Frisco. The tram stops only few steps from the accommodation. Not negative, but to say, you haven´t your own bath and restroom - you have to share it with the other guests. But it wasn´t a problem for us. We will come back again, hopefully soon.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing. Between the comfortable rooms, the friendly staff, the great location, and the reasonable price, I cannot say enough great things about the Willows. The staff were friendly and helpful, always ready with a suggestion on where to go or what to do. Their dining recommendations were always on point. Different people had different styles (some pointed us to their book of restaurants in the area, others suggested their favorite places to eat. They joined us for the wine hour in the library, which was a wonderful and relaxing way to get to know them better. Breakfast had a lot of options for us, which was good. The kitchen was a bit cozy, but we were always able to get in to get food without a problem. One morning we decided to eat in our room, just because of the space concerns in there.The rooms were clean and our room was quite big. We had gotten one of the larger rooms in the place, and the space was good for us. We did get to peek in some of the other rooms, and while they were smaller, they were not unreasonably so. The bathrooms were always clean, the showers were wiped down in between uses. We had a sink in our room, which was nice to cut down on lines to use the bathroom to brush teeth. You cannot beat the location. Right in the center of the city, with easy access to all forms of public transit available in the city. Most of it was right outside the door, and the BART was just a short walk away. And we're still blown away at the price. We had looked at hotel prices in the city and didn't think we'd be able to afford a trip to San Francisco, but then we found this place and it was like a dream come true.We absolutely will stay here for all of our future trips to San Francisco. I've recommended this place to friends of mine and their opinions have been the same.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Very well located in San Francisco, near to bus stop and underground station, the Willows Inn is a quiet place to stay next to Castro and Mission. Several restaurants are nearby and it's not too far from SFO international. The bed and breakfast has very charming rooms, wide and clear, but not all of them. I stayed in a family room which was a little bit narrow for three and less confortable than other rooms I saw. The room was not very clear, we had a view on bins, but very quiet; the closet too was too small for three travelling with big suitcases. The strong points: the b&b has bathrooms and showers to share but everything works perfectly and it is very clean. Breakfast is very convivial in the kitchen and rich. Special thanks to Mike who is a really lovely person very helpful and patient. I will go back but I wiil ask for the queen size bedroom next time.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The best little guest house in the city by far.Wonderful staff and comfortable clean rooms with great breakfast, all for a really reasonable price .Centrally based on 14th near Castro and the old Mint building .A short tram ride down market to the wharves.You won't be disappointed .Anything u need- just ask the staff. They are excellent .
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: It was a comfortable stay of 9 nights in SF from 12-21 Aug 2016. The place was nicely furnished, coming across as comfy. The room I stayed in had enough space to not feel cramped in. Staff were professional and helpful.Great location, less than 1 min walking distance from Church station, and good eats around the area. A downside to road-facing rooms is the noise level at night, which is contributed by frequent muni metro/rapid transits, and bar clients from the 2 adjacent bars, the latter of which dies down by 2+am. Not recommended for light sleepers.All in all it was a good stay.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I knew I was in good hands when I received very quick confirmation for the dates that I wanted and this set the tone for a great stay. My room was scrupulously clean with a really comfortable bed and for people with worries about shared showers/toilets - don't! Both were always available when I wanted them and always very clean. All hosts were friendly and they provide lots of written information about local transport and how to get where you want to go. I stayed just before Pride so there were lots of friendly gay/bi guys to talk to at breakfast who also gave their own recommendations of places to go. It was my first time in San Francisco and I hope to come back. If I do, I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We stayed in the Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn for a total of 11 days (a weekend away over the period) in April-May 2016. It suited us perfectly. We loved the conviviality of chatting with other guests over breakfast (great variety - lots of fruit, cereals, pastries, breads, yoghurts, etc), and, when we could, relaxing with our hosts and other guests over a glass of wine (or beer) in the sitting room / library before going out to dinner in the evenings. Willows is located in the vibrant Mission / Castro district, and a few dozen metres from excellent buses, trams and metro - very easy to go down town or elsewhere in the city, or to the BART, CalTrain or highways to head out of town. We stayed in room 32 for our longer period - on the top floor, beautifully decorated and spacious with a bay window facing south, so lovely and sunny in spring while we were there. Double glazing helps keep street noise down if windows are closed, and windows can be opened for cooling breezes. The WCs and showers are separate from the rooms, with two of each on each floor and are not a great difficulty (at least while we were there over a relatively quiet period) - robes provided for each guest and there is a basin in each room, and toiletries provided. This means the room price is relatively low for the quality of the rooms, service, convivial atmosphere and the location in this expensive city! Thanks, Mike, JoJo, Mark & Gary!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: If you want a fully contained room ie shower etc the Willows is not for you but if you want a B&B which is in a great location , reasonably priced, clean and well maintained with Friendly helpful staff then the Willows Inn is for you
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: What a great B&B! We always try to stay in a B&B on our travels because they provide the most personable experiences. We were a little apprehensive about The Willows because the nightly rate for our room was so much less than we expected, and they only asked us to pay for the first night when we made our reservations. In a city like San Francisco, we expected much higher room rates and to be charged in total up front. Just the beginning of a great visit! I just have to mention that what really makes this place SPECIAL are all of the little touches such as robes in the room, small baskets filled with shower essentials including a shower cap to take to the shower, oversize towels, room service daily if desired.We made these reservations in May 2015 for our visit the last of Feb and early Mar 2016. We were first attending a "Destination Wedding" in Cancun Mexico and decided to fly on to San Francisco from there for a few days. We had never been to S.F. before, so this was our first experience. We absolutely loved it and our four days there.The Willows Inn is sort of hidden between two businesses with only a sign and a door with a bell to ring. Once buzzed in, we were greeted by one of the four guys (Michael, JoJo, Mark, & Gary) who operate the Inn. We were faced by a long flight of stairs up to the next level where the B&B was. Seeing those stairs made my heart sink because I knew I could not possibly carry my bags up those stairs (I am 70 and have had two heart surgeries). Thank goodness the wonderful man who greeted us took our bags and bounded up the stairs. Our room was actually on the next level (LOL!), but it was not yet ready. We checked in and took the innkeeper's suggestion that we go get a bite to eat first. He gave wonderful directions and recommended a great place for lunch. Upon returning to the B&B, we found that he had moved all of our belongings upstairs to our room, and he gave us a tour of the full place.There are so many things I want to mention about this great place! First, the location is perfect. It is ideally situated with easy access to the underground trains and to the surface transportation. We loved riding the "F" streetcar line to the Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf and then the opposite direction to Castro Street. History was just everywhere!Free WiFi was excellent. Our room was cozy and very clean with a queen bed, tv, minifridge, and a wash basin in the room. All rooms shared shower rooms and water closets that were very clean and private with four of each on both floors. There is an expanded continental breakfast each morning in the breakfast room with a wide variety of foods and a local newspaper. The breakfast room is available to guests 24 hours a day. Early each evening an innkeeper serves complimentary cocktails in the sitting room. We only took advantage of this once because we were always on the go, but it is a very nice touch. One of the highlights of our stay was meeting other guests for breakfast and chatting with them and the innkeepers.We cannot wait to return to San Francisco, and you can bet we will be at The Willows!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The Willows Bed and Breakfast is a wonderful experience. It is close to all public transportation . The entire staff is warm and welcoming, always eager to provide useful information for an authentic San Francisco experience. The room was large and immaculate. The breakfast was healthy with its many choices. The sitting room provided nice opportunity to meet other guests.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I was recently in San Francisco with a friend and we searched for a modest place to stay on the business/play trip to the City. We found the Willows on line and booked two rooms (none have private baths but there are plenty and super well cared for. Showers and toilet rooms are separate and rooms have skinks). It was only later while further reviewing the website that I discovered that I had been their with my husband and other family members also 40 years before. The place was much the same (it is not at all handicapped accessible and it is a steep stair case up. Even at my 70 some years, it was not that daunting). The place is filled with books and books. The staff is super helpful but that there at night. We enjoyed complimentary wine in the library one night and that was very nice. Right next door, by the way, if a Vietnamese restaurant (we French when we were there before) and it is well worth eating there. Another plus - transportation is just down and up and street. Maps are available and directions by bus and muni right on the table by the office.Breakfast is self serve and continental but it is generous with fresh breads, hard boiled eggs and loads of fruit. Good coffee too. We will go back.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We spent 10 happy days at this warm & welcoming b&b in the heart of San Francisco. The Willows is centrally located a few blocks outside the Castro and steps from the Muni and buses to Golden Gate Park, Embarcadero, Fisherman' Wharf, Cliff House and all parts of S.F. The Inn is on 2 floors, has a large comfortable sitting room filled with books, tv, movies and during their daily cocktail hour, interesting people. Each day we had a large healthy breakfast in their sunny breakfast room & had great conversations with people from Chile, Portugal, Santa Fe and N.Y. The 3 owners have decorated the Inn beautifully and keep it spotless. Our room was spacious & comfortable. Each room has a sink but the bathrooms & showers (2 of each on both floors) are in the hallway. I was concerned this would be a problem but in our 10 day stay, I never had to wait for the facilities. The Willows offers a friendly, comfortable home in the heart of S.F. At a great price.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: My partner and I planned this trip to SF to celebrate our 8th anniversary. The Willows Inn team was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Especially Giorgio and Mike. Knowing that this is a B&B, and not a hotel, we felt like as guests in a friend's home.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This was a really good accommodation choice in San Francisco. The rooms are large enough with comfy beds, the staff are really helpful, and the included breakfast is superb. I liked the fact that they had a complimentary cocktail hour between 6-7. The location is about ten minutes walk to the Castro. I would definitely recommend this place for a comfortable, friendly stay.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The room was perfect -- clean and well maintained. Fresh towels and bathrobes and little soap bottles refreshed daily. The continental breakfast was far better than the usual stale bagels and toast -- fresh baked goods and an assortment of better than average granola and cereals. Splendid on all counts -- I'll be back!!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in San Fran. The price was good in such a expensive city. Location was good room was clean and nice and breakfast was ok.Friendly staff and we used there parking which was all ok. It was really warm whilst we was their and the room had no air con.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: My wife and I stayed four nights in the middle of August. The location was very convenient. The staff was very attentive. The room was nice. The breakfast was excellent. The location in the Castro was very convenient. The other guests were interesting and friendly. This B&B has two floors and 12 rooms. We stayed on the top floor which was very close to 2 water closets (WC) and 2 shower rooms. We never waited to use a WC. My wife waited for a shower room one day for few minutes. The first floor had the same setup. The high temperatures were in the high 80's for a couple of days. There was a nice rotating fan in the closet, which we used a couple of nights and that worked perfectly. We had a very enjoyable stay and will go there again.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Willows Inn. The inn is very clean and cosy. Our room was spacious with a comfortable bed. The breakfast that was provided daily had a lot of fresh fruit which was very appreciated along with a lot of other breakfast choices (breads, cereals, pastries etc), along with coffee, tea and juices. The washrooms and showers are communal, but we never had to wait for either and both were always very clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The inn is located close to the tramway and metro so it is easy to get to and from.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: mike answered our call after we arrived at our airbnb rental and had to bail because it was not clean. he reserved us a room, helped us with our bags, gave us tips on where to park, gave us a tour of the property, and rocked a smoking hot kilt every day. the inn was spotless and the rooms were so cute. it is a nice, clean, quiet place to stay. it is european style accommodation, which means that each bedroom has a sink and the bathrooms are shared. the toilets and showers are immaculate and the linens are fresh and it was no bother at all not to have a bathroom of our own - and it meant that the price of our stay was much more reasonable than it would have been if we'd had to pay for a room with its own washroom. centrally located, within walking distance to the castro and the metro, i would definitely recommend willow's inn to visitors to san fran.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Very thoughtfull service, nice, clean and quiet accomodations, the Willows inn benefits from an ideal location (close to public transport, the Castro area and downtown) and offers very sympathic and organic breakfast. Highly recommanded!What else? :)
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I spent three nights at the Willows B&B. Its location at Church & Market Streets makes it only steps away from the Muni, and a short walk away from Castro Street. The place is very affordable, and the area is a nice change from the crowded downtown Union Square hotels.I stayed in a two-room suite with another couple. In retrospect, I would have preferred to book two separate rooms, because I had to pass through their room in order to use the bathroom and shower down the hall. The two-room suite would be perfect for family members, but it was a little tight for two couples.That said, the place was very clean, and I never had to wait to use the bathroom or shower rooms. Each bathroom and shower was private and clean. During office hours, I noticed that a staff member went in to each shower after its use and made sure to freshen the room. Nice touch.The continental breakfast was also nice, although the room could be a little crowded. The place was very quiet, as well. My only small gripe was that the pillows on the bed were flat as a pancake. I'd advise them to get new pillows soon! Otherwise, I highly recommend the Willows if you don't mind the shared bathrooms situation and a steep stairway to the guest rooms. NOTE: I'd request a third floor room next time, because the bathrooms upstairs are much brighter because of the skylights.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I spent 4 nights here after camping in Yosemite, I had a rental car and they offer parking if available for $15 a night at a nearby parking lot if not available you can find some parking I streets nearby. I wad happy to have the car I drove everywhere which made sightseeing more efficient.I stayed on the top floor,a room to the back with a queen bed very comfortable, sink in room loved that,nice closet, small fridge,desk with chair,having the window was great for fresh air as the room did not need a fan or ac, the room was cleaned each day,there were 2 shared toilets and 2 shared showers which were always clean and there was never a wait to use.the breakfast room,amazing to have eggs,yogurt,cereal, various teas and coffee. You can also buy public transportation cards, 3 days unlimited $26 which connects you to subway on the corner market stop,there are buses and you can ride the trolley with this card also, they also sell maps @ $3.Overall,I great place to stay I found it very each to go everywhere driving and lots of options for dining in this neighborhood in the Castro.I would definitely say stay here and it will not break the bank either.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Was looking for an affordable place to stay, and for the price I was more than pleased with the Willows. Friendly, helpful staff, clean rooms and great breakfast. Best was the location steps away from the Muni and just a few blocks from Castro. Was initially worried about the shared bath but as it turned out there was no need to worry. Very private and never busy even though the house was full. Will stay there again.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I've stayed at the willows at least 6 times in the last 20 years.It was alway a good time to remember. The big plus at Willows is the friendly staff, great Location and the "feeling Home". The interieur of Willows is quite unique. Lots of Victorian furniture, nice vintage photos on the walls... and lots of willows furniture. Normaly i prefer more modern places but in this victorian building it all fits very well. All staff i extremly friendly and professional. Allways some good advice... restaurants...places to go etc. Breakfast is served in a little kitchen with a "join me table" Every more you can meet fresh fruit, cereals and very nice and interesting people. A gread place for singles to stay as there is always a chat in the morning. Shared bathroom is normaly a "no go" for me but willows tought me other. The 4 Bathrooms are always perfectly clean. I never ever experienced any problem. Its almost magic ... how do you do this guys?. I stayed in one of the smaller rooms. Good Bed, big fridge, and very good Value for money. Location close to market castro... and a huge safeway across the street.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I had my second visit in a year to Willows B&B. The staff is friendly and helpful, it's clean, it's perfectly located, steps from the streetcars on Market Street and it's in close proximity to Castro district experiences. They provide a simple, healthy mix of food for breakfast. I always enjoy the conversations around the breakfast table.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: As my daughter lives in the Castro, we wanted to stay in the area during our stay in the city. So we chose the Willows Inn. Good choice, I have to say. We were received very friendly, our room with two beds was conveniently sized and adequately equipped (but only had a rather small window on an alley, where there can be some noise at night). The beds were very comfortable. Everyhing is meticulously clean and the people there are very helpful. Bathroom facilities are shared. Although that never caused an issue (keeping in mind that the inn did not seem to be very busy at the time), that is the only thing I did not like about the place. We didn't eat breakfast there as our European systems need another type of coffee in the morning, so we can't judge that one. Fair prices!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The Willows Inn offers nice rooms, service and amenities at a reasonable price. Although there were occasionally homeless people loitering near the front door, the Inn is in a great location for both walking and public transportation. Breakfast options were fresh, healthy and plentiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: The Willows is a friendly, clean and homely B&B. From the outside it looks small, but looks can be deceiving as inside this is a large two storey dwelling. Staff are friendly and on hand should you require anything. Bathroom facilities are shared, but this was never a problem for us, so you shouldn't worry about this. Continental Breakfast was plentiful and had a nice selection of fruits, cereals, yogurts and breads. Likewise Tea, Coffee, Milk and Juices are all provided, and they even wash the dishes for you. The only problem we encountered was with noise at the rear of the property where our room was based. We booked the 2 bedroom suite and this room sits next to a large fan from the restaurant below the B&B. The droning of the fan/exhaust stopped me getting an early night on the first night we arrived. The fan eventually gets switched off around 11pm. So if you're noise sensitive, I would avoid this room, which is a shame because it's a great room otherwise. Overall we had a great stay and would definitely return. However we would choose another room away from the restaurant below.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We traveled to San Fran for a long weekend and stayed in the Castro so we could be in the middle of everything but not pay the expensive rates. Our stay was amazing. The Inn was super clean and the guys were so friendly, and the breakfast was the best I've ever had for a self-serve. They had so many options and the best fruit and yogurt! I loved that we could make tea at night or get juice and not have to bother anyone.We didn't have a car and took public transit everywhere (buses, trolleys, subways, and cable car). We had no problem getting around. The Inn is perfectly situated so that you can get anywhere reasonably fast. We found an amazing breakfast spot around the corner (Duboce Park Cafe) and were right next door to Safeway where we could buy lunch for our day trips. Ice cream is just up the street and ample places to eat at night. The nightlife is fun and only a few blocks away but the Inn is quiet enough that you don't notice the hustle and bustle.Overall, a 10!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Cannot speak highly enough about the staff at The Willows. Very friendly and very helpful and really makes the stay here memorable. The location is fantastic and the rooms homely rather than stuffy or sterile. A good choice of foods for breakfast each morning as well as teas and coffees available throughout the day. Drinks at 6pm for those interested in being social and a good opportunity to speak to the staff. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in SF after staying here.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: I spent five nights at the Willows a week ago. The place was like a home away from home. The staff was very welcoming and the other guests charming. If shared shower and toilet facilities scare you off, don’t be. They were immaculate (probably a lot cleaner than mine at home). The breakfast wasn't fancy but more than enough to get you to a good start before exploring the city. Special thanks to Mike for shipping back the jacket that I left behind. I’ll definitely stay at the Willows when I visit San Francisco again.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This is a hidden gem. We could not have picked a better place. We were planning our honeymoon vacation and were stuck for a place to stay. We finally checked the reviews and booked the willows. Mark was very helpful and accomodating. From the minute we got there, it was apparent the hotel was excellent. Little touches like ghirardelli chocolate, magazines to read, happy hour with free drinks, a binder with local menus, muni passes for sale, and an innkeeper on staff to provide concierge service made our stay enjoyable. We were pleasanly surprised at the quality of breakfast provided. We expected muffin and juice. We got fresh fruit, selection of toast, coffee, greek yogurt, boiled eggs, cheese, juice, cereal and pastries, served in a bright and clean kitchen.We thoroughly enjoyed the cozy, thoughtful, clean, and friendly hotel and would love to return.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: We stayed with the lads a wk ago, on arrival exterior didn't look promising, but a different story when we got inside. Before we arrived Mike and the lads sent us clear instructions on how to get to the address and also enter the building. Lovely place and top marks to the lads spotless, like as stated by others no en suit wasn't great but we had no problems and shower and toilets were kept clean and refreshed. breakfast area was a little small for the amount of guests but you had a choice of having breakfast in your room as well. Really enjoyed our stay and totally recommend this Inn for a holiday break, the staff were so helpful and gave great info on the area. The inn was very close to Castro area and also the metro and trams, and shopping street Market street.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Willows Inn was an ideal base for my recent week long visit to SF. Conveniently situated just off Market Street with easy access to Metro and street car transport and in an area packed with cafes and a nearby branch of Wholefoods, this was a great find. I stayed on what the Americans call the 3rd floor (2nd for us Brits) and my room (like the place In general) was cosily furnished, a trifle old fashioned perhaps, but a pleasure to stay in. The wifi works, the communal kitchen/breakfast room is stocked with juices, fruit, yogurt and teas ideal for a late night return if you are peckish - lovely. There are books on the landings and in the sitting room which is a nice touch in these gadget obsessed days. Very tasteful indeed. The cocktail hour between 6 and 7pm is a great way to meet other guests, though my busy sightseeing schedule meant that I only got to it 2 or 3 times during the week. Friendly and helpful hosts too.  Altogether I was very pleased with my choice.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: 40 y/o husband/father: Our stay at the Willows was great. 2 room suite was spacious and well-maintained. Bathrooms and showers were down the hall, but individual and never full. Staff were friendly and helpful, and rates were reasonable, especially given how expensive San Francisco is. Great location, too. My only complaint would be that there were no hot items at breakfast, which Bed and Breakfast usually implies there will be. Still, overall just a great experience. 41 y/o mother/wife: Great location for a very reasonable price. We really enjoyed our two-room suite. The staff were helpful and attentive. It was quiet, by and large, for the city.13 y/o daughter: This place was awesome. The rooms were nice and clean and the beds were comfortable. There wasn't a lot of noise from the street, which was really nice. Everything in there just gave off the feel that it had been done very thoughtfully. They set out shower caddies and robes and had tons of other little things that you wouldn't think to do that made our stay better.
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This involved a spontaneous trip to the West Coast, which is a whole different story! My first time in San Francisco. I decided to go with this one after arriving and noticing that I SHOULD get a room. LOL. I was so happy with my choice! The reviews are right. I'm glad I did this instead of a Hotel because the place was very convenient; Castro is just a short walk away. The place is very, very clean. Comfortable Beds.The guys who work here are really, really great and helpful. Super friendly. Loved the bars & the AWESOME Mexican restaurant nearby. I also felt safe here. Another thing, it's very 'people' friendly, doesn't matter who you are, you will feel at home here. The breakfast was neat, and I liked that they had a cocktail hour. I fell absolutely in love with San Francisco and staying here. such a beautiful place! Would stay there AGAIN and AGAIN! :-)))
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: Relocated to this B&B after hotel I was staying in Oakland overbooked and didn't have opening. Great location, JoJo and Mike are awesome hosts, clean, fun, fresh, convenient. Most definitely will return again for longer stay next time around!
hotelName: 9    The Willows Bed and Breakfast Inn

review_body: This hotel is a bit out of the way, but it is more economical than many other hotels in SF. It's your basic motel, with room doors directly to the outside, not in hallways. It does have a somewhat older appearance, which is slightly daunting at first; however, the room and bathroom, although small, were clean, and the sheets appeared to be newer. The staff was also very helpful- the general manager sat down with me the first day we arrived, after we checked in, and gave me a map and drew out all of the bus routes we might need during our visit, and showed me how to buy tickets on the Muni app. Other staff also booked a shuttle for us to go back to the airport, since we did not have a rental car. Breakfast was somewhat limited, and the breakfast room is small. You'll probably need a snack a couple of hours after breakfast.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: one thing that people might like about this place is one thing we didn't, more about that in a minute. We stayed twice in SF, once without a car and once with so this property is ideal for those needing a car spot. Its a no frills kind of place and in a very expensive city, its room price is what you expect for the location.Staff are friendly and a approachable and willing t help and advise. Breakfast is included - its low key but meets all needs. The breakfast room is small but people don't tend to linger so just wait for long enough and you'll get a spot. Rooms are clean, the bed is big (which makes the room small!) but its comfortable and has everything you need. There's a great pizza place and a supermarket just next door and the Presidio is a lovely place to walk.Now to the "be aware" point. I am not used to lodging places that are so dog friendly, we had three in a row in our stay. This is not the norm in Australia and I am not keen. The room next door had two very large dogs, one a German Shepherd and one something else. One barked some time after 10pm when it wanted to go out. It did the same thing at 4am. It didn't bark for long but then in a small place it only takes one or two barks to wake everyone around it up. It did about 4 or 5 before its owner managed to quiet it -4 or 5 barks are very loud in the room next door at 4am. The future learning point for me is to find out how dog friendly my accommodation is and make my choice accordingly.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Raymond is fantastic, he spends extra time making sure your days and nights are full of adventures. Over the decades we have stayed in several places in SF, this is by far best bang for your buck. Don’t hesitate book it now.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: This Travelodge is a GEM for families visiting SF with their pup!! The staff are excellent (Raymond and Nicky)... they are very knowledgeable with what’s going on in the city, and very attentive to your needs to make your stay more comfortable If you’re looking for a reasonably priced hotel, comfort and convenient I would highly recommend this!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: No-frills motel located just outside the Presidio and within walking distance to restaurants. The staff is friendly and efficient. Room is clean and bed is very comfortable. The continental breakfast was a plus. Highly recommended for business travellers who do not care much for the aesthetics and amenities in a 4-5 star hotel.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Very disappointed. We ended up paying $180 for a very nice room at the Fairmont in San Jose. The location was ok but there was zero parking in the lot, the key didn't work, room was so small that one of us had to sit on bed or in chair while the other got dressed. People above us were loud at 6:30am on a Saturday and there was a loud humming noise on and off throughout the night
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Location is very convenient. It is close to Lyon steps, The Presidio, Chrissy Field, Palace of fine arts. There is a Muni bus stop right outside and a neighborhood convenience store next door. Parking is very limited but free. There are 7or 8 total parking spots and 1 handicapped parking spot. There seems to be free parking on the streets, but not sure how long one can park there and how safe it is. We were lucky to find a parking in the hotel lot. And then we left our car there and use public transport and rideshare till the next day. Breakfast has very limited options - Coffee, fruits, toast, cereal, yogurt and boiled egg. The rooms are tiny. There isnt much space to move around. The rooms were clean.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: You're close to almost everything and yet this location is quiet both during the day and night. Rooms are clean and comfortable. And, wifi is included. Staff are friendly & helpful. When in SF this is my choice for lodging.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: for a one or two night stay, this motel was adequate. Nothing special. Bed too hard. Room too small. Breakfast pathetic. location was adequate. not really close enough to walk to anything, but close enough to catch a uber/lyft and not cost a fortune.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: The Travelodge at the Presidio is an older hotel but it is affordable and clean in a quite, convenient location. We were not interested in paying outrageous SF prices for a room where we would not be spending a lot of time. Free parking is limited but we did get a space, left our car in the parking lot for our entire visit and used cabs instead of trying to drive and park. We were told that parking would cost more than a cab. Complimentary breakfast is basic but adequate and saved us the price of a meal. There’s a good deli right next door to the hotel. Now to the best part of the stay, the employees. All of the employees that we had contact with went above and beyond whenever we had questions or any need. The attentiveness of the employees was worth what we paid for the room.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Staff are friendly, location is good. neighbourhood is safe. but facility is not good. It's pretty much a low end motel. doesn't worth the money paid. Will definitely choose some other hotels next time.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: This motel is fine for the price and the area in San Francisco. It has all the facilities that are advertised and is generally in decent condition. What makes this place worthwhile is Raymond, the general manager. Nothing is too much trouble for him - in fact he appears to love his job and it shows. He took a great deal of time to explain to us how and where the Muni runs, drawing on the free map in many coloured lens. He really made it easy to get about the city without getting lost. Thanks Raymond, you made for a great stay
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Absolutely brilliant stay I couldn’t recommend it enough. Raymond was out of this world always there to answer any questions and sit down and to through where we were to go step by step. Bob was always so friendly and great fun to chat too! The area was perfect the waterfront near to go for a walk or run. And buses available all the time. San Francisco is the place to go!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Loved the location of this hotel. Did not want to be downtown. Expected more from a Wyndham property. Needs renovating. Continental breakfast was disappointing. Comfortable bed however. Need to update to in room Keurig. In room safe gave me the combination?? Don't use it!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: An excellent place to stay with reasonable prices, a decent breakfast, convenience to public transportation and walkable distances to scenic places (Presidio, Crissy Field, Palace of Fine Arts, Lyon Street Steps). The Management/ staff team is solid, competent, knowledgeable of the city, and extremely helpful.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Nothing but good things to say. Very helpful. Hospitable. Reasonable room rates. Went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Would highly recommend to anyone traveling in the San Francisco area.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: A budget hotel some way from Downtown, but a free (off peak) PresidGo bus regularly travels to Embarcadero BART. There are Muni trolley bus stops nearby. Ray at the hotel is a mine of information regarding transport and the other staff are very obliging. A basic breakfast is included and the are plenty of restaurants in nearby Chestnut Street.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: The staff sold me on this place. From check in, providing directions, good places to eat, and checking out. I would come back again. Great place to lay your head, clean, good breakfast. Easy to get around.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Room is clean, fresh and the bed is awesome. I'm a guest speaker at the Walt Disney Family Museum and this is very close to the venue. All the staff is warm and friendly and they offer a free continental breakfast.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We choose this hotel because of his location. Walking distance to the presidio and Golden Gate Bridge. The rooms where normal standard, a bit old but clean. Parking was convenient.Absolutely outstanding was the staff! Fantastic tips of the beaten track and all the time beyond friendly and helpful.I would always choose this hotel again!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: If you're traveling to San Francisco and want a clean, quiet place to stay then book here. Rooms are remodeled and very comfortable. Book early. Parking can be a little tight - if you have a large vehicle ask about alternate parking.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We stayed at Travelodge on Lombard near the Presidio. We received excellent service from Travelodge employees, Raymond--who expertly imparted fantastic tips on sightseeing, Bob--who works using a A+ work ethic, and Daniel --who demonstrated strong capabilities. We highly recommend this hotel for a great value, cleanliness, friendliness and putting customers first!~CeeJay& Chas. H
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: A soon we both enter both room is the room is very small and asoon we enter the room its smell bad and to far to all restaurant area the parking is first come first serve so if left you will lost your parking spot.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I recently stayed in this hotel with 6 friends and the Travelodge was perfect for us. Here’s why.Price: I wanted to stay in San Fran at an affordable price and this fit the bill. I wanted to be in the city for easier accessibility but not pay hundreds a night.Location: Perfect! I loved the location as this hotel is within walking distance of beautiful beach views of the Golden Gate Bridge, along a great walking path. In fact one day we walked down to the Golden Gate Bridge and walked the entire length of it! The hotel is also in a nice, safe area where we felt comfortable walking around. There was also quick access to a grocery store, Walgreens, bars, and restaurants all within walking distance so you did not need a car or Uber.Parking: First come, first serve free parking was awesome because we did have a car that was necessary for some activities on our trip and rides to/from the airport. We did not have a problem getting a spot as we came and went. The free parking appealed to me as I did not want to incur any extra costs on top of the hotel per night cost.Staff: Absolutely wonderful, helpful, pleasant. Raymond the manager was fantastic for city recommendations. He knew his stuff about the city and genuinely enjoyed sharing his knowledge and helping you out and plan your day. We also had multiple rooms for a few nights and the staff was great to accommodate different people coming/going at different times, charging different credit cards, putting rooms near each other, etc.Room: The room was very basic accommodations, clean and comfortable. Don’t expect luxury, but you’ll have everything you need for a good night’s sleep. Some rooms seemed a bit smaller than others so space was a little tight, but we were literally using the rooms just to sleep so it was exactly what we needed.Breakfast: Having a small selection of breakfast goodies with coffee each morning was a nice bonus to rely on each morning before we headed out.Overall, I think this is a great hotel for the value we paid. While not the fanciest hotel, it’s a great budget option with a few hidden amentities that really made it worth it for me and my friends.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We arrived late on a Saturday night. The girl at the front desk was super helpful and friendly! She quickly got us checked in our 2 rooms and even helped carry our luggage up the stairs. We were quickly settled in. The next morning when we went down to breakfast their was a manager there that was extremely helpful answering questions and even took us in to an office and outlined a route we needed for later in the day getting back to the hotel. The staff also allowed us access to a microwave later in the evening to warm up some food. In the afternoon they had hot chocolate and cookies available. Much appreciated! The hotel itself was very basic and a place to sleep which was all we were looking for. There is a deli and pizza place just down the block. We also were able to walk to a Walgreens that was several blocks away. The neighborhood seemed fairly safe, although there was loud voices outside our room one night. We later learned someone had wondered onto the property and the police had to be called because they were knocking on doors and wouldn't leave. We did feel safe while we were there. Overall, the staff made our stay comfortable and went above and beyond on what that did for us!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I stayed a couple of nights. The free parking and location were two of the reasons. It was surprisingly quiet for being a block and a half off of Hwy 101. Dining was within a short walk. The local bus stop was around the corner.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: This is a good accommodation for its star rating - I wouldn’t bank on the breakfast, it’s a typical American breakfast sweet cereal and sweet pastries. It’s a fantastic location and would stay here again!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Good value for money, clean, walking distance to palace of fine arts if you are attending a conference there, and to beach. If you dont plan to spend much time in the room except for the night, this would be a good choice. Book early to avoid disappointment as rooms seem to get booked up fast.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Comfortable but dated rooms. Bed very comfortable and great shower. Within easy walking distance to the Wharf and it’s amenities. $25 a day to park car. Don’t bother with breakfast it’s more of a snack bar served in the lobby!!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Service was very good. Breakfast was basic. Room was clean. Location was excellent. Several nice eating spots were easily walkable. Early mornings were a little noisy. It was really nice to have parking available. The front office was helpful and attentive. We would stay there again primarily because of the location.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: The staff is very friendly and the room was very well kept and big enough for me and my wife. The Travelodge is located a little bit away from Fisherman’s Wharf however is about an hour walk to the Golden Gate Bridge. The parking lot is relatively small and you are not guaranteed a space in the lot as there are more rooms than spaces. However, upon arrival, a staff member rushed out to make sure we could find a parking spot. If there are no spots in the lot, they help you park on the street which is free. The outside isn’t much to look at (as another reviewer put it) but don’t let that fool you. Once you’re in the room, it’s clean, spacious and great for a night stay in San Fransisco.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I cannot recommend Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco enough. Although the building itself can use some updating, It is a cozy, absolutely quiet, and very clean hotel with surprisingly nice rooms. The staff was beyond amazing and very professional. Make sure to check out the free breakfast as it is definitely worth it.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Located nearby Presidio, walking distance to Palace of Fine Art, and Presidio. You can see Golden Gate Bridge in the park, there's a Starbucks inside good to get a coffee there in the morning. The reason I stayed there because it's pet friendly, my dog need to come with us. Also it's FREE parking, it's very expensive to park if you stay in downtown San Francisco. About the hotel, it's cleaned, compliment breakfast in the morning. Have little snacks and coffee available during daytime. Little issue is not enough parking, you may need to park on the street. Also the air conditioner inside the room is bit noisy when it's on. Somehow it affects me to sleep. There's no microwave inside the room, but there is a microwave around the breakfast area that you can use without problem. Overall I like that hotel will stay here again.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: The hotel was quiet and clean. Room 302 is a closet. It had one small window in the back. The bathroom fan was as loud as a leaf blower. When you first walk into the room, it definitely had a musty odor. The mattress was lumpy and bumpy, as if it were old. The gal when I checked in was terrific. I just wished she would have told me the room was tiny.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Great location, incredible staff and most knowledgeable concierge, Raymond, in all of SF. Walking distance to stop #13 on Big Bus on and off bus tour, walking distance to good restaurants and hiking trails in presidio and crissy field with incredible views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We were only in the City for one night for a medical appointment. I chose this property because it was near the marina district. Although it was a bit of a trip we walked to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 and back. Although the appearance of the hotel may not knock you off your feet, it was a friendly, clean, quiet and pleasant experience. There is a nice market next door which was a plus for us.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Property is old and our room smelled of old musty urine smells. I know it’s not the Ritz , but this hotel should be better maintained. Only positive is free parking, but knowing what I know now I would pay $100 a day for parking before staying here . We were uncomfortable for the duration of our stay and unfortunately we were stuck here.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Great staff who are very knowledgeable and helpful. Great location for Presidio Parks and not too far a walk to Fishermans Wharf, can be done in about half an hour, so long as its not too hot. The number 30 bus will take you there which is located at Walgreens, just a few blocks down. This was my fourth stay at this property, although the decor is a little tired now, and the mattress could be better, the many positives of this place far outweigh the few negatives.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Hotels was very accommodating it was more on the older scale ..over all nice quiet and clean with great customer experience.Needed a room to stay for ucsf sone medical testing..location was about 2.75 miles good location.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: This is my favorite location to stay in all of San Francisco. It's convenient for parking, our room had a fantastic view of the Golden Gate Bridge, and you are within walking distance of the Fisherman's Wharf as well as North Beach, Chinatown, and Union Square. The hotel is quiet, clean, and offers a complimentary breakfast.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I was very happy to get a place that was quiet and away from all the city noise, tucked away to get a good rest. Not a great amount of things surrounding this location, but that also is what made it really nice. Slept great and had no complaints.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I'm always weary of hotels where you access the room from the outside but I never felt unsafe at this location. The staff was super friendly. The breakfast was basic....really basic....since I was staying a full week it got old quick. The bed was not that comfortable. Overall I do recommend this hotel if you're looking for a reasonable rate in SF.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Oh, where do I start? I was literally impressed from check-in to check-out. I’m a person who is very big on customer service. This hotel staff from the front desk to maintenance/housekeeping knocked it out of the park!! When I was planning my San Francisco trip, I was blown away by the cost of a lot of the hotels. Typically, I stay at hotels within the Hilton network when I’m on an extended vacation and hotels that fall within the Wyndham network for one night stays. I didn’t want to spend a lot of money on a hotel because I planned to spend money elsewhere so I decided on this hotel because of the online reviews and the fact that parking was free unlike many of the other hotels. Our flight arrived way ahead of the check-in time (9:15 AM) to be exact BUT the staff was willing to accommodate us with an early check-in. My husband was given recommendations on where to eat and he even got a map of San Francisco that outlined the location of various attractions. Again, customer service was nothing like I had ever experienced at my usual 4 star hotels. I tip my hat off to the management here because it is apparent that EXCEPTIONAL customer service is a requirement at this establishment. For example, I left my suitcase by the stairs and I think the guy was the manager, he brought the suitcase up the stairs and to my room door. I thought that was so nice of him because he probably saw that I needed help and he jumped right in to help. So, this is my honest review of this hotel and keep in mind that I am hard to please. 1st, customer service is EXCEPTIONAL. 2nd, the location is within a 2-4 mile radius of everything that you may want to do in San Francisco. 3rd, parking is free but the parking spots are limited (TIP: Park your car after check-out and use Lyft/Uber/BART to get where you want to go it’s not expensive. That’s what we did for some stuff.
