On the other hand, you can avoid a car all together.) 4th, BART runs right in front of the hotel. 5th, this hotel is NOT rundown as stated by the person in the previous post. This is coming from a picky person. It has that old San Francisco charm like a lot of the other buildings in San Francisco. 6th, the hotel is located in a safe area. 7th, the hotel has a good continental breakfast, 8th, the rooms are nice, clean, and spacious. They also have a nice size fridge and a microwave. The beds are very, very comfy. I definitely will stay here again on my return visit. The service that I received here surpassed any service that I have received at a Hilton. Please don’t be deterred by the fact that it’s a Travelodge and rated a 2 Star because it does not paint a true picture of the quality of this hotel. Lastly, if you are staying at the Travelodge like I, chances are the other hotels were out of your price range so don’t get on here trying to bash this hotel when you know that this was all that you could afford. Your hopes shouldn’t be as high knowing that this is a 2 Star hotel. I personally didn’t know what to expect but I was on a budget and I didn’t want to break the bank. However, it worked out perfectly for me because it surpassed my expectations.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We loved the location next to the Presidio. However, the room and hotel seemed a little tired.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Have stayed there on yearly vacations for about 10 years. Next to the Presidio, Marina District, Crissy Field, Chestnut St. restaurants, even Ft Mason and on to Fisherman's Wharf. Bus (#45) around corner from motel (Lyon St) takes you down Union St (many shops and restaurants), then over Russian Hill to North Beach (base of Telegraph Hill), through China Town and finally to Union Square. For seniors the bus is $1.35 and you get a 90 minute transfer. The 300+ Lyon St steps just a few blocks away are a popular exercise area for younger persons (we climb them once a trip). A modest breakfast is provided. Rooms 207 and 301 are the best double accommodation in our opinion. Prices are reasonable and Travelodge does offer bonus opportunities.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We stayed here March 18 for 4 nights, we had room 205 on the first floor and it was clean and acceptable. The Hotel is situated about 2/3rd of the way between downtown SFO and the Golden Gate Bridge. Parking is limited in the hotel car park but is available outside on the road also. Buses, shops and restaurants are only a 5 min walk away. The hotel is in a very safe neighbourhood. The hotel staff (Ray and Bob) are very kind and friendly and eager to assist you to enjoy your stay. They are very knowledgable on the local area for buses and places to visit, etc and worth talking too. The cost of the rooms include unlimited continental breakfasts always a bonus for hungry family. two Petrol stations are about 1/2 min from the hotel. I would highly receommend this hotel as a base for SFO. The hotel has been awarded several recommended hotel awards from 2010 to date and I can totally see why. I would have no issue staying here again without hesitation. For those who remember the Mrs Doubtfire film, the house it was filmed at is only a couple of blocks from the hotel and it is also only a 5 min drive from the Golden Gate bridge
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Very reasonably priced. Very close to the Marina and just a couple of miles from Golden Gate bridge. Very safe neighborhood. The room was reasonably clean. A bit small. Bathroom was very small but functional. Bed very comfortable. The breakfast is not much of anything...cold cereal, yogurt, prepackaged sweet rolls, coffee, milk and juice. For the price, a good stay.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: I love this hotel a lot. We stayed a few hotels this trip, and this is one of the best. Room wasn't as big as others outside the city, but you have all you need. Hotel staffs were friendly and welcoming. There is breakfast and afternoon tea available in the dining area. I love the coffee and tea selection they have. Their hard boil eggs were nicely done, we even asked the staff how they do it. The bed and pillows were awesome ! The toilets paper in the restroom was soft and thick which is different from other same chain hotel. There is bus 43 right outside, you can also take the presidiGo to the city center which is free. Other bus 41 also near by.The motel is only few minutes away from the palace of Fine Art , PresidiGo free ride to Golden Gate Bridge, or take 28 bus there (10 mins walk). I'll love to come back here if next time I visit San Francisco again
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Stayed here in September of last year and also February of 2018. The staff makes this place a five star rating. The rooms are nice and clean and the motel is in a good location. One of the buses literally stops at the front door.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: This hotel is ideally located not far from center of town, yet close to the Golden Gate Bridge, ocean front and down town. The staff was excellent and so helpful. Pet friendly a real plus!
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We were traveling to San Francisco during a very busy period so prices were very high through out the city. This hotel was clean, quiet, affordable. The beds were comfy and the staff very helpful.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Our trip was in 2016, not 2017. We had a car rental but was able to park free in their limited lot or on the street. The front desk staff were extremely helpful with information and how to use public transportation to get around. The employees were NICKY, RAYMOND, HOPE AND DUILIO. We received color coded town maps for the public transportation and was informed to obtain a MUNI pass which saved us a lot of money. We were in town a week and had a blast exploring using public transportation. The hotel was clean and location quiet.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Not close to downtown, but close to Presidio and Plaace of Fine Art, nice to walk and nice view of Golden Gate Bridge. About the motel, clean inside, the staffs are very friendly. The room has no microwave, but you can ask to use one at the front desk. Breakfast is so-so but don't expect much. Overall will stay there again next time.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: Location is unbelievable, parking is plentiful, concierge is extremely knowledgeable and friendly and the neighborhood is terrific. Best place in the city for a night's stay.
hotelName: 10    Travelodge by Wyndham Presidio San Francisco

review_body: We recently stayed at the Parker Guest House for almost a week. We could not fault the room, the service, or the location. The staff were wonderful - Phil, Matt, Michelle, and Scott, all warm and engaging, who assist with various requests but who also give you space. The location is fantastic - take the J or F train line just up the road to down town, the Ferry Building from where you can catch ferries across the bay to various places, or to Fisherman's Wharf. We have stayed in some very nice and high end places across the world. The Parker GH is a standout because of the warmth and professionalism of its staff. Bravo PGH!

We stayed here about a year ago and loved it so much we booked again for five nights coming up at the end of this month. It's charming and relaxing and within walking of everything, including MUNI. The included breakfast is a great way to start the day and there's even a wine social hour to get you in the mood to go out for dinner. Can't wait for our upcoming visit!

The Parker Guest House was such a warm and welcoming place to stay. From the moment Michelle checked me in (thanks Michelle!) I knew it was going to be a marvelous stay. The house and grounds are beautiful. The pantries in both houses on the property are beautifully laid out, with coffee, tea and water ready to enjoy, and a fridge for our use. I really loved that they had an evening wine social, which gave me an opportunity to imbibe and enjoy the lovely garden. The room was darling and very clean. The bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve slept in. The neighborhood felt safe. It’s a stone’s throw away from lots of great Mission eateries like Tartine Bakery, Craftsman and Wolves and Bi-Rite Creamery. It’s also just down the street from Dolores Park. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you to everyone at Parker Guest House for making our stay so lovely.

We enjoyed our stay at the Parker Guest House.It was great to park the car and explore on foot or Uber. Our room was spacious with all necessary amenities and the staff made us feel at home. The gardens and lounge areas are inviting, and the wine hour and breakfast allow for meeting fellow travelers.

We found this through Trip Advisor for our first visit to San Francisco and the West Coast and it spoiled us for the rest of the trip. This boutique B and B consists of two houses close to Castro with peaceful gardens, a bright breakfast room and lovely sitting room with a fire and a decanter of brandy. The room was fine with a comfortable bed and excellent linen. But it was the people who made it for us. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful and we met some fascinating fellow guests at the wine social each evening with nibbles and bottles of local red and white to sample. There's a tram stop at the bottom of the road and - once you master the public transportation system - it's not difficult to get downtown and to the parks and museums. Two minor quibbles. The quality of the breakfast and wine social nibbles seemed to depend on who was on duty. One morning's buffet breakfast featured a very poor selection compared to the usual big bowl of fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, toast, yoghurt and very decent coffee. And don't try and walk from the BART station with heavy bags. Take a taxi. Apart from those very minor issues, we couldn't recommend this more.

It is a compound of two historic buildings surrounded by extensive outdoor seating space and gardens. It features spacious public rooms with operating fireplace and piano, breakfast sunroom, garden areas and steam room. There are 21 guest rooms some with private baths, down comforters, robes, cable TV, free WIFI and first class bath amenities. Great location for eating out and public transportation. Wonderfully friendly, comfortable and convenient place to stay in the Castro District adjacent to the mission District of SF. Includes extended copious continental breakfast and afternoon wine social with cheese. On-site parking available. Affordable rates by SF costs. Scot was a wonderful host!

we stayed 3 nights here ,every thing you wanted great staff who were so helpfull and curtious , the rooms were very clean and spotless and the bed very comfortable, You could use the gardens and the living rooms so you relax out side your room What were beautiful ,and help yourself to tea and coffee through out the the day, breakfast was self service (continetal ) what was all you needed, the Parker Gest house is in a quiet spot , but trams busses are on the doorstep so it was easy to get around oprox 20 mins into main town San Francisco , and not exspencive, the Castro ( famous gay area ) is in walking distance about 6 to 7 mins walk , we rate this Guest house highly and defently would stay there again and we will recomend it to family and friends, 10 out of 10

The Parker Guest House feels like home. The beautiful property, flowers, trees, comfy outdoor seating and the house is gorgeous. I have been staying here for years and always feel welcome and at home. I always appreciate the friendly welcome and evening happy hours with other guests. Location is perfect to catch the muni or bart, walking distance to many wonderful restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries and of course my favorite grocery, Bi Rite Market!

Parker House is in the heart of SanFrancisco, with the trolley stop one bock away. Easy access to the transportation system. The property is actually two old houses that have been converted to a great bed and breakfast. Has a backyard with comfortable places to sit and chill out. Breakfasts are served buffet style, all you can eat. Wine and cheese hour every afternoon. Just a few blocks from the famous Castro district and a short walk to Market Street where you can catch a bus to downtown, Fisherman's Wharf, the Ferry Building where you can board the ferry toSasalito. We've already reserved for this coming fall again. Reserve early- it's affordable (for San Francisco) so it fills up early.

We spent week at the Parker Guest House. The location is 1 block from the Muni, and minutes away from Mission Dolores Park, the Mission and Castro. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Breakfast is very good and the evening wine social is very nice. We will stay here again.

Always clean and well appointed, with very helpful staff that do a great job taking care of everything. While you can hear other guests if they are loud, most of the time I have been there it has been very quiet. It is in a lovely part of San Francisco, and a very convenient distance to Bart, a variety of restaurants, and just up the hill from beautiful Dolores Park. A relaxing break from busy conference and meeting work.

My husband and I enjoyed 2 great nights. I have read some of the previous reviews regarding the room and the reception (friendliness) during their stay. Yes the corner room may be a bit noisier - but it is the city, and a city that is well known to have trolleys and other traffic that is noisy. Personally I think it is not unexpected to have noise. A recommendation is to either bring ear plugs (they are cheap to buy reusable ones) for staying in cities or other multi-use places (like hostels, Airbnb, hotels, etc) - or have available at the front desk for individuals requiring them. I did not have an issue with the noise. The bed was very comfortable. We were also very impressed with breakfast options: there was a wonderful selection of choices including fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, hot porridge, coffee and other options. I was quite pleased with this, as I had not expected this wide of selection and had not mentioned a dietary restriction of no gluten. The fresh fruit, yogurt and coffee were great for me. Staff was friendly. All areas were well cared for and clean. The outdoor area was beautiful and well cared for as well. As far as heterosexuals not feeling welcome - this surprises me. We felt very welcome and comfortable there. We were sad that they didn't have availability for an additional night! We decided at the last minute to stay another night in San Francisco and it unfortunately didn't work out to stay another night. The place was quite interesting and beautiful, with all the woodwork that was well maintained.

My husband and I recently returned from a two night stay at the Parker Guest House and it was great! The staff were excellent, particularly Patrick, who we had more interaction with when checking in and during the evening social hour. We felt welcomed there and the accommodations were convenient for getting around the city. We parked our car and typically either walked or used an Uber to get around and it was quite simple.Thanks for the great stay!

The location is great - a block from Dolores Park and an easy walk to dozens of bars and restaurants on Market and Castro streets. The room was cozy but very comfortable and clean. The free wine social each evening was a great amenity and a fun opportunity to chat with other guests, some of which had stayed there previously. I would definitely stay here again.

Loved Parker Guest House. Location is excellent- Mission- away from tourists. The 2 houses were immaculate, modern but still had period accents. The staff was warm and welcoming. This is my new place to stay in SF. Afternoon wine and cheese and communal breakfast were a great way to meet other travelers.

off the crowded downtown, still 10 minutes taxi to the Moscone conference center, or better - 5 minutes walk to the mission bakeries and the bi-rite creamery.Clean spacious rooms, super friendly hospitality, descent breakfast.Highly recommended!

It was a great location, close to the Castro and several amazing restaurants. The room was great, cozy, and comfortable. The houses were both beautiful, and the share spaces for quiet time were quiet and well-appointed. I will definitely stay there again.

Just returned home from a lovely two night stay at Parker Guest House. This charming Guest House was the perfect choice for us while we visited our son who lives within walking distance. The room was beautiful, the bed heavenly, and the private bath with shower excellent! The grounds were pretty with many different outdoor seating areas, flowers, and fountain. The staff - attentive and kind. We enjoyed meeting and conversing with other guests during breakfast or the complimentary wine happy hour. Coffee, fruit, snacks, and healthy breakfast items made the stay that much more enjoyable. This will be our first choice during future visits!

My brother and his wife and myself stayed at the Parker House for a long weekend in San Francisco. All of us agreed that it was a wonderful place to stay. I found the staff (Ed, Scot, Michelle, and Patrick) to be very helpful and friendly. My favorite amenity of Parker House was the gas fireplace in the sitting room. It felt so nice after an evening out since the weather was cool. Slept well there. Clean and comfortable. Great location.

Very nice place with a friendly staff and clean inviting atmosphere. Beautiful outside garden areas and inside relaxing areas. Every morning was an adventure meeting new people in the breakfast lounge and really enjoyed the wine socials and brandy by the fireplace before turning in for the night. The location is terrific, easy walk to catch trolleys. Top notch all the way around, a strong recommendation to add this to your must do list!

Can't say enough good things about Parker Guest House. I was there on business but can see it would be the perfect place to stay for business and leisure travelers. The location was great - in Mission which is one of the best areas of SF (in my opinion). Rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. The property has a lovely garden area to relax in, and the communal areas are nicely decorated and very welcoming. The staff were lovely and breakfast provided was delicious. Would 100% recommend!

I recently stayed at the Parker guest house for the second time, and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Firstly, it has a great location, being just a few minutes walk from the Castro area with great Cafes, restaurants and funky shops and bars. I've always felt it is a safe area to walk around and the area has a great atmosphere. Secondly, while the Parker is not located in the middle of downtown, it is only a short trip downtown, and I'd rather have the better location and atmosphere! There is a Muni stop right at the door, several lines run to the Castro, there is the heritage trolley car, as well as buses and Ubers. And it's only a 15 minute level walk to the Bart station if you want to take the train to SFO. And most importantly, staying at the Parker really feels like a home away from home. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the living room areas are really nice to sit and read or work, especially in front of the open fire in winter! The breakfast room is filled with light and I've met some amazing people to talk to over breakfast. After a long day in the city, it really does feel like coming home. And the staff are just amazing. So if you have a chance to come to SF, stay here. You won't regret it.

Great staff, friendly and helpful. They even had umbrellas available.Very clean establishment, and I look thoroughly. If you like old but refurbished houses this is the place for you. (which we do, so it was perfect for us). Location was perfect for us too. I only wish it was not raining everyday of our stay so we could have enjoyed the patios.

It had a vey elegant and freandly fiel. The staff went out of there way to accomidate my needs. My only issue, was stairs. I had a arthritis flair up and that slowed me down. The staff quickly recognized my issue and quickly took my bags.

The Parker House was so welcoming and an amazing haven. Beautifully decorated, inviting, immaculate and hosts that attend to every need. The inner garden and fountain are the perfect place to sit and enjoy the outdoors. An inviting fire welcomes you in the winter when you arrive. Truly a gem! Can’t wait to stay here again!

Can’t say enough good things about this charming B & B! Such a warm staff— comfortable rooms —delicious continental breakfast with fresh fruit—lovely gardens—outstanding neighborhood close to the park and great restaurants—happy hour—candy bowl—brandy—chocolates! When can I go back?!

We had a wonderful time here. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They had very good advice on local eateries and local attractions. The room was well appointed, very clean, small but delightful. A very relaxing time was spent here in the heart of the Castro.The garden is beautiful. We took advantage of the social drinks at 5:30pm where we met fellow travellers, shared stories and made new friends. The continental breakfast was superb and served in a lovely open room with views to the garden. We highly recommend this as a must stay and intend to return on our next visit back to this beautiful and vibrant city.

The customer service and amenities were down right perfect, like a home away from home. All areas, indoors and outdoors, were clean, picturesque, and peaceful. Will never stay at another place again when in SF, this is it!

Wonderful oasis in safe surroundings, lots of things to do on foot, yummy and healthy breakfast, friendly staff pampering guests with snacks and drinks, cosy lounge with chimney and lots of books, room rather small but comfy.

Located close to everything a visitor would like to see and public transportation. Staff was very friendly and was a big help in arranging parking for our late arrival. Thanks again and we look forward to another stay!

The Parker Guest House is an easy walk to great restaurants and bars in the Mission District and an easy ride to other great neighborhoods. The Guest House staff were superb: friendly, courteous, and ready to accommodate requests and needs. The outdoor patio areas are lovely, and the rooms are comfortable and clean.

Can't fault The Parker Guest House. The friendly accommodating staff made the whole experience feel like we were staying at a friends house, rather than a business. Perfectly located for the Castro night life, or day time wandering. Start your day with breakfast in the cosy conservatory, and end it with a glass of wine sharing stories of your day with other guests.

a prefect little hotel in a superb location eveybody was really nice, the place was speckless clean, and very pleasant in general. breakfast was good, the outside terrace and garden beautiful to sit at and enjoy the view

Charming. Great staff. Everyone here, staff or guests, very friendly. Breakast is the place to meet and chat with guests, Beautiful terrace and garden. Close to Castro Street and wonderful Delores Park.

First let me say, Great Staff!!! The Parker Guesthouse is a real gem in San Fransisco. The guesthouse is two properties next to each other with a courtyard in between. The grounds are nice and on nice days you can have a relaxing afternoon or evening. The staff here is friendly and if you need anything they try to help you. Wine is served from 5:30-6:30 each evening and offers a nice opportunity to meet fellow guests and travelers. We met several nice couples each night. In the lobby sitting room a decanter of brandy is always available and provides a wonderful opportunity to meet people. We have come down each night and have met some very nice people and enjoyed the evenings. I can't say anything wrong about the guesthouse. I can't say enough about this place, trams are out the door and a block away or if you want another one it is 5 blocks easy walk. Restaurants are all around again within just a few blocks. Again I found this to be a real gem. I have seen the reviews and met the people who stay here and many have been coming here and staying for years. I think that in its self says a lot. If we come back to San Fran. This is where we will stay.

I spent a week at the Parker Guest House and would recommend this B&B to anyone who likes a comfortable, well organised and relaxing place to stay. The staff are brilliant and go to great lengths to be welcoming. I was travelling alone and it was really nice to be treated like a friend. The breakfast menu was substantial and had a wide variety of food items - from cereals, muffins, bagels to fresh fruit, yoghurt and coffee. The service was excellent - menu items were replenished as soon as they were running low.The room I stayed in had a great corner aspect - with two windows looking out onto Church Street. It was a bit noisy with the tram going past, but I consider that part of the charm of San Francisco. I got used to it pretty quickly. My room was attended to every day - and it was nice to get some Parker dark chocolates in my room when I returned at night. A nice touch.I chose the Parker at random when I was booking my stay - and it was the best decision.Thanks to all the staff at The Parker Guest House for helping to make my stay in San Francisco FANTASTIC.I’ll DEFINITELY be back!

would definitely recommend this hotel it was great. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean room, comfortable bed. Excellent selection of breakfast buffet food.The only tiny blemish was that they asked us for a feedback form and in the envelope was one for a gratuity which we thought unnecessary as the room was not cheap. Everywhere in USA they expect tips.

Fantastic little hotel in a perfect location in San Francisco. Their pre-visit communication was great. I read that there were two buildings so I requested that our daughter's room was close to ours and when we arrived she was just across the hall from us. The rooms are very nicely furnished. There are two buildings - originally two neighbouring residential homes - which share a lovely patio garden. They are very organised and had very good systems in place with very nice touches such as fresh brew coffee in the second house's kitchen if residents there didn't want to go across to the breakfast room. The breakfast was great - 'continental' but definitely sufficient, with plentiful baked goods, fresh juice and fruit, oatmeal and yogurt and coffee and tea of course. It didn't bother us but the only drawback I could envisage for anyone considering booking would be the number of stairs; there are quite a few up and down between the houses and accessing the main building. The staff are absolutely lovely and will assist with luggage etc but it's not ideal if you have any real mobility issues. The location of this place is also great; you can get on and off the yellow J line from just up the road on Church Street and the J line takes you into the main centre of town and access to all other lines so we bought a 3-day clipper card from Walgreens and went everywhere by tram. It's also only about a 10 minute walk from The Castro area and we also walked from here to Mission, which was a bit further but not too bad. The ubers are also very reliable and cheap here though. Overall this was a great choice and a perfect end to a great vacation. And we will definitely stay here again if we go back to SF.

The Parker Guest House is actually two Victorian houses, side by side, with lovely accommodations and a terrific, welcoming staff. Our room was a spacious king fronting on Church Street. Although the trolley runs up and down Church, we didn't find the noise to be a problem (we enjoyed hearing it pass, in fact).Those who think they might be bothered should request a room in the back.The trolley is actually a great reason to stay at The Parker; just steps from the front door,it can take you directly or by transfer to just about every corner of town.We enjoyed the breakfasts, which we shared each morning with an international clientele (visitors from Germany, Spain and Australia while we were there.) Afternoon wine and snacks was a plus.When we left after four nights (we really didn't want to) we were even given farewell hugs by the staff!Can't wait to get back to San Francisco--and The Parker.

We had three rooms, all very bright, airy and clean. Location of two perfect, third could have been better away from main stairs, as you left the room you found yourself meeting with stairs, I suggested a little hallway outside door for privacy and I would imagine they are already planning this. We were located in the Castro district on one of the main streets and across the road is a tram stop which is frequent. Approx. 20 minutes to centre.

It was our first trip to California and it began with four nights in San Francisco at the The Parker Guest House, before heading on down the coast. We wanted to stay in a location with more of a feel for the real San Francisco and not just the touristy side. The Parker Guest House was perfect. Within walking distance of Castro and Mission District with many shops and restaurants and so close to Market Street. The staff greeted us and showed us around the property and to our room. I would like to say that we felt the staff were very professional, friendly and made you feel comfortable from the minute you met them. Our room was in the building adjacent to the main house. After reading some reviews about noise along the street, I specifically asked for a room in the back when I made our reservation. We had Room 40 on the 3rd or 4th floor (depending on which door you entered from) with private bath in the back section of the building and it was perfectly quite. The room was a bit small but it accommodated us fine. Ample space in the bathroom and it was very clean. No elevator so be prepared to walk up stairs. The cleaning staff always did an exceptional job of keeping the room neat and tidy. The bed was very comfortable with quality linens and pillows. There was a small kitchen area in the front of our building where you could make coffee or tea. It had a refrigerator and we left an unopened bottle of champagne in it for a couple of days and no one bothered it. We walked over to the main house for breakfast in the mornings and a couple of afternoons we stopped in for the wine and cheese social. It was nice meeting and talking to people from different countries and states. And the outside grounds were great. With the private gazebo, fruit trees and fountain. They had private parking for our car (which was a little tight) but very secure. The hotel was completely secure. You had to have a key to enter the grounds/property. We enjoyed the city (except for the crazy drivers) and we opted to take Uber for the most part. We walked around the neighborhood and really enjoyed the feel of the area. Be sure to check out the Clarion Alley Mural Project. It was fantastic! We drove ourselves around exploring the city one day and drove over to Muir Woods, Stinson Beach and Sausalito another day, but you should get familiar with their traffic laws first! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here would definitely choose The Parker Guest House again on our next visit.

We stayed at Parker Guest House with our two daughters at the start of our mini-tour in California. We arrived from the U.K. after a long flight but right from the outset we were made to feel right at home. That for us was the best thing about our stay; the hospitality. It was faultless. That’s not to say there was anything wrong with its location; in fact that was ideal too; right on the J Line and only a few blocks from BART and the historic streetcars on the F Line. It was lovely to escape the crowds and live like a local. No shortage of places to eat and drink locally either. That said, after the amazing breakfast of fresh fruits, yoghurts, pastries, bagels etc it was a while before we needed anything! At the other end of the day, the wine social was a great way to start the evening.The main guest house building where we stayed is a 1907 building with plenty of features and character. The only slightly adverse comment I would make about our stay is that in our downstairs rooms (20 and 21) we heard footsteps from the public lounge area above at around 5am which seemed a bit early. That said, this is still absolutely a 5* establishment and this was only a very minor thing.We look forward to having an opportunity to return to Parker Guest House.

Greetings! Our son recently moved to San Francisco.This was our first visit and we wanted to stay near his apartment. Although this is billed as a guest house, I would consider it more like a boutique hotel.We were bummed when he moved from NY city,as there were so many cool hotels in the area. But we found a gem in San Fran! The Parker guest house probably has around 30 rooms. The home is beautiful as are the rooms. We stayed in 2 separate rooms,neither in the main building,and they were both clean,nicely appointed,with up-scale toiletries,water pitcher and chocolate.They were also able to accommodate our daughter with a rollaway bed. There is a lovely wine hour in the evening with snacks, and breakfast is provided. There seemed to always be coffee and sweets available in the kitchen.We loved all the areas to relax.... the beautiful den with fire place and brandy available,all the cute little sitting areas outside! I believe I sipped coffee or wine in every outdoor space!! You must see the beautifully landscaped back yard to believe it! Being from Baltimore, I was amazed by the lemon and apple trees! Having traveled all over the world, and being a self proclaimed" hotel snob", This property can hold its own against any luxury hotel. What stood out the most was the staff!! Kind without being phony,professional without being too formal or stuffy. They were always ready to chat,answer any questions ,and help in any way possible. Scot was the best,as was the young gentleman who worked during the day and the lady at the front desk( I'm sorry I don't remember their names)!! I have found my home away from home when I go visit my son! If you have the opportunity to stay here,do it, you are in for a treat! Cheers and happy travels! Robin

After having stayed here in 2015 I came back for another few days in April 2018. The good quality as I remembered was well maintained. The staff is super friendly and the breakfast fantastic. I will certainly come back a 3rd time!

This was our third visit to this brilliantly located guesthouse and we were disappointed. Previously we have stayed in the main house in two different, lovely rooms. Both rooms had a decent amount of space and were really nice places to be. This time, however, we were housed in the second building across the garden and our room (Room 35) was extremely small. To move around the bed we had to negotiate past our suitcases as there was no way to put them out of the way. There was not even room for a solitary chair. The bathroom was a good size and was fine. Perhaps we had been given complimentary upgrades on our previous visits but we presumed that all their rooms were of that standard. We would not have paid the high price to stay in the little room we were given had we realised that the Parker Guesthouse had rooms like that. The bath was not clean when we arrived and did not appear to be cleaned during our four day stay. Getting out of the bath with other people’s long hairs clinging to your body is not good. The wine social was fun and is a generous addition to a stay at this place. The continental breakfast offers a lovely selection of pastries, bagels, toast, eggs, cereals and yoghurts. Very good. This guesthouse is perfectly located as the J line is just outside and The Castro is a short stroll up the road. The staff is friendly, the garden pretty and the building is gorgeous. Our two previous visits made this one of our favourite places in the world to stay. This time, however, was a disappointment on a number of levels. We will probably look for an alternative when we visit this great neighbourhood next year as we don’t want to pay $250+ per night for a room that is too small to be comfortable.

To really get to know am area or specifically a neighborhood within a larger city, live in the neighborhood - at least for a few days. Walk the neighborhood, eat in the neighborhood, and sleep in the neighborhood. We had a great time in this lovely, old home in an area of San Francisco we had only driven through. Friendly, attentive yet non intrusive hosts explained the all the necessary information for property entrance after hours to complementary breakfast. We walked to restaurants. Public transit is very close by, but we elected to Uber. I could return here again and again.

Really loved staying at the Parker in during my stay in SF. I used to live in the city so loved how close it was to great areas in the Mission and the Castro. My room was very spacious and the staff was very nice and accommodating for me. This is a great option for anyone not looking to break the bank while visiting the Bay.

So sad to see another great gay business over run with straight people. We stayed in the King Deluxe Room very clean and stocked with shampoo, conditioner, lotion etc. with great location to the Castro District, Street car and the bark. Continental style breakfast and wine cheeses and snacks in the evening. Yes I would stay here again the staff are very friendly and helpful. PS. To the staff, It's great to see your pride for this wonderful country we live in. show some Pride for a wonderful gay Business and put our flag up alsoDavid

We are usually hotel users rather than guest house so was looking forward to our stay. This is a beautiful old house, great location for The Castro. We booked the King Deluxe Room was clean and good sized, no air con and we had to prop a window open with a book to get some air circulating. Staff were great and extremely welcoming and helpful with local knowledge and advice. Garden area was very nice to relax in. Negatives - trams pass by and can be quite loud, if your a light sleeper bring ear plugs. Breakfast - simple but basic, if your staying more than two / three days would be a bit repetitive. No tea/coffee making facility in room, although available in the kitchen, first thing in the morning having to traipse downstairs in your nightie to get a morning cuppa was a pain.

We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff were helpful, friendly and very welcoming throughout. The room was clean, comfortable and well appointed. Breakfast was fantastic - plenty of fresh choices of fruit, cereals and pastries. The wine social was also a lovely touch - we got to meet some other guests and have a nice, relaxing time.The location is very convenient for the park, the Mission and the Castro, and the Muni public transport links are very good too - just half a block away. The area also felt safe enough to walk home in the evening.If we return to San Francisco, we'd definitely stay again - this was a great choice to start our holiday.

I just returned from a delightful stay at The Parker Guest House in San Francisco. A bit larger than a B and B, it still had the charm and personal service that one receives in smaller accommodations. Staff was engaging and helpful, rooms were immaculate and location was just ideal for me. I was visiting a new granddaughter and it was a nice walk to where I had to go. My only issue is that it would have been ideal if they had a mini-fridge and coffeemaker in case one wanted a late night glass of wine , yes, coffee or soft drink—- or needed to store meds that need refrigeration. Other than that, you can’t go wrong. Just lovely!

I’ve lost count of how many times I’ve stayed here. Each time I meet such wonderful people from all over the world. Scot is amazing and it’s great to see him here each time I visit. Great to see a lady on the front desk too this time. The staff are so welcoming and friendly. The rooms are well appointed and it’s the small touches that make this palace a delight to stay at. Definitely one of my favorite places in the world to stay. It does appear to be becoming more mainstream though and less and less gay guests over the years. Not sure if I was imagining this though as that would be a shame. Didn’t see a pride flag - but I could have missed it. Great to see the guest house is so popular among travelers. Looks like the secrets out. All our love to Scot and the team. Daemon and Coralie x

We stayed 5 nights at the Parker in early July and really enjoyed it. Our flight from Australia came in late morning and we really appreciated being given an early check in. Our room was charming and very comfortable, and the garden areas are just gorgeous. The staff were really friendly and helpful too. We enjoyed the breakfast and wine social, and loved the location - right next to public transport to the city centre with links to other lines, and a short walk to vibrant Castro village centre. All in all, an excellent place to stay - highly recommended.

This was a lovely place to stay. It's a low-key bed and breakfast with a big shared kitchen, shared bathrooms (for some rooms, including ours) and lovely gardens to relax in. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the breakfast is simple but lovely and there's free wine and nibbles between 5:30 and 6:30!It's location is perfect too, just between Castro and Mission; two highly underrated districts to walk around and enjoy!

Located a block off of Union Square, the Donatello was a perfect base of operations for a week in San Francisco. The 1970s ('80s?) concrete exterior did not prepare us for the large, beautiful (and recently updated) room. Staff were welcoming and helpful at every point. As timeshare owners with another organization, we found a number of things that exceeded what we get with our membership (e.g., daily maid service and evening events in the club lounge). We talked to non-member guests who were equally happy with the choice of staying there. The Donatello will be our choice for suture trips to the city.

nice property. close to everything. rooms large for S.F. standards. concierge good. check in easy. parking affordable 42.50 plus tax with in and out privileges. would stay here again. on the 4th in the club BBQ was nice simple hot dogs, hamburgers, salads. good job by staff.

I had stayed at this hotel/timeshare about 10 years ago. Rooms have been updated since then, and we had a fairly large, comfortable room on the 7th floor, (king sized bed, pull out sofa, desk, chairs, small mini kitchen area, and nice sized bathroom). Bed was comfortable and plenty of space to unpack, (large closet area w/ shelf space), for our week long stay. Plenty of counter space in bathroom, and fully stocked w/ towels. Water pressure was a bit weak at times, but nothing to complain about. Wifi was free and no problem w/ connecting, (although we did have to put in the password everyday). Never a wait for elevators, and staff was friendly. Only downside was how long it took the Wyndham rep to finally accept that we WERE NOT interested in attending the presentation. (I started off w/ a polite, "no thanks, not interested"...and finally had to say a firm "No", and just walk away.)The hotel is in a great location---a block or two from Union Square, and close to a variety of bus/trolley routes, as well as BART. We bought a week long MUNI pass, ($45), good for cable car, bus and trolley. We did not use the Powell Street cable car, as the wait was always LONG.....but did take several rides on the California cable car, (never a wait/never crowded). We found several good pubs/cafes in the area. We did go to the rooftop lounge to relax & read the paper.....but mainly spent our days touring this beautiful city. The Donatello has a great central location, yet isn't in the midst of all the crowds. Highly recommend.

Great location for our three night stay in San Francisco. Big bus stop a few minutes walk away in the square and easy access to the cable car network. We had a spacious room with kitchen area that included fridge and microwave. Gym ok for a city gym and free tea and coffee on the club level.As with all city hotels there is traffic noise but didn’t spoil our stay.Staff lovely too

Great Hotel with a great location, Comfy bed and very polite and helpful staff.Only one downside and that was the parking costs. Valet only.Walked out of door and five minutes away from centre.All in all a great place to stay.

We spent 3 nights here in June for a 1st time stay in SF (traveling with 9 and 12 year olds). The Club Donatello was outstanding in all respects. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location can’t be beat - just one block from UnionSquare and an easy walk to Chinatown and mass transit. Highly recommend! Of note, we were in a club room and would not even have known this was a timeshare if I hadn’t read reviews to that effect here. We never saw or heard from any individual trying to sell us a timeshare. As far as I could tell, there is absolutely no difference between the hotel and the “club” - except that the club rooms are on the top 3 floors.

Enjoyed a week visiting San Francisco and enjoyed staying at the Donatello, The staff were very helpful and friendly, the beds clean and comfortable, and the location convenient. We only rented a car for two days to visit sites away from the city which saved a lot of parking fees at the hotel. The cable cars are a great way to get around the city and you can buy a one or two day pass. Don't miss Fisherman's Wharf, a tour of Alcatraz, and a free tour of the Cable Car Museum. NAPA Valley wineries and a tour of a Redwood Forest are nearby attractions worth visiting.

We were here on a special offer for Wyndham so had an opportunity to visit their properties.We were in a nice sized room that was very clean with contemporary furnishings. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even loaned us an umbrella since we were walking to Fisherman's Wharf and it was raining off and on.The location is close to the cable car line, probably three blocks away. We like to walk, so the location was good for visiting the different areas around the hotel.One concern was that wi fi was not secure and we had difficulty staying connected. There was lots of street noise that could be heard in the room; typical of a large city. The pillows were too firm for our comfort. Nice shower area, good water temperature.Parking is valet only.

In all honesty I can’t say anything bad about this hotel, however equally I can’t really say anything good either and an average rating is arguably nearer to a good. It was a careful selection and a hotel I was really looking forward to staying in. Check In was laboured due to being passed over to the concierge to introduce Wyndham properties which after a 10 hour trip was unneeded. No mention of the reason for our stay, let alone upgrades or gifts we had received in most other Cities. The room was nice, but nothing impressive and the pre visit photos had been carefully taken to suggest a bigger room than it was actually was, and clear to see why no pictures of the bathroom were posted. No enquires when we left as to our stay and only the concierge and bell boys wished us a safe trip. Overall, a good hotel in a great location but I’m sure better value for money to be had at almost $350 a night.

Our usual San Francisco hotel wasn't available for the dates we were there, but we found a great deal for the Donatello and decided to take the chance. I'm glad we did! First, a week before our stay, I received a phone call from a concierge asking if there we had any special requests. I said no, just a quiet room--the view wasn't important.Honestly, the hotel isn't much to look at from the outside; its a tall piece of 1960's concrete Brutalism dropped in the middle of historic Union Square buildings. But the interior is another story. The lobby is small but easy to navigate, and the front desk person had us checked in (early) within five minutes. They turned us over the concierge who gave us a rundown on current events and a discount book, plus a low-pressure pitch for "Club Donatello", which I gather is a reserved time-share type of arrangement on the hotel's top floor. When we told her we weren't interested she let it go.The room (a king) was large for San Francisco and the bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows (a big plus since we like reading in bed). There was a kitchenette area with a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and its own sink, plus a full set of dinnerware, plates and bowls, plus dish washing liquid and a sponge. An alcove held a closet with bi-fold doors and a chest of drawers plus the luggage rack, so it was all out of the way. The long desk made a nice place to eat. There are power outlets and USB charging ports on all lamps and built into the desk.The bathroom, though small, was spotless (a big deal to me) and the shower was roomy with plenty of water pressure. The room was cleaned very efficiently early in the day, so after a long day of walking The City we came back to a freshly cleaned room. All of the staff were friendly and helpful.As someone who has visited SF regularly for 25 years, the Donatello is someplace I'd definitely consider again.

Just returned from a terrific week at the Club Donatello in San Francisco. We attended a conference at the Moscone Centre and had time for sightseeing, dining and shopping. The location of the hotel was perfect. Restaurants, shopping and touring were easily accessible . Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was spacious comfortable and quiet. The rooftop was delightful for a glass of wine or coffee at the end of a day. Would return in a heartbeat!

I apreciate very spacious room with very comfortable bed. Great terrace attached to the room. Room is very clean, quiet and modern. Many nice amenities, like: fast WiFi in the room, coffee mashine in the room, popcorn in the room, and so on. Coffee for free also available in the club / sky-bar. Lack of bidet and lack of shower hose, only shower head. Very expensive valet parking, but I did not find better choice.

The ventilation is located under the windows, and even, when windows are closed, you can hear the noise. Excellent location, large and comfortable room. Here you can find everything you need. Every day newspapers, small chocolate, as a present. Nice terrace on the 14 floor. Comfortable bed. Nice bathroom. I liked of staying here.

Nice hotel at a reasonable price. They provide free morning coffee. The cable car passes one block over (buy a City Pass for unlimited rides). Also restaurants of Union Square very close. I would stay here again.

We had a great stay at the Donatello. The rooms are clean (and were cleaned and serviced every day!) and big, with a little kitchen and luggage area. The bed was very comfortable and huge! We enjoyed using the club facilities and the jacuzzi. We could not fault the facilities or the service in any way. Great central location too! We would love to return for another stay.

All the staff we encountered here were friendly and helpful especially at the front desk. After issues with a different hotel I’m glad we ended up here. Our room was a great size and felt larger than I expected. The room was clean and housekeeping was attentive. The location makes it easy to get around the city. Loved having parking on site and the rooftop area with coffee and tea was a great perk. Will be back again!

Stayed here for 5 nights for business. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk from Union Square and not too far from The Moscone Centre.The room is a great size with good facilities, great to have the fridge, microwave and coffee machine in the room.I would definitely stay here again

I had a wonderful time at the Donatello in downtown SF. The rooms have recently been renovated and are now well appointed. I enjoyed utilizing the Club facilities on the tip floor. I do believe some updating in these areas could also use some refurbishing.

The hotel was in great location, close to shopping and some restaurants.. Found the jazz bar to be small and little loud. Good if you like that kind of stuff. Room was great, we stayed in 503 and we had our own walk out to a green space. Room was clean.

We’ve just got back from 5 nights in San Francisco,staying at the Donatello.on arrival The staff were very friendly the only problem was they do not have cots but we only found this out when checking in,so Baby was happy in a queen size bed with us,it is ideally located with everything within walking distance,we didn’t eat at the restaurant but did make use of the rooftop club facilities where tea and coffee and a nice lounge space is available,we had a kitchenette as we had a baby which was clean,modern and a good size and wouldn’t hesitate in recommending.

Newly renovated and friendly staff and room service. Center location. Be aware: there is no cooking at all, not much activities;jacuzzi too much chemicals.Besides regular tourists spots, this time we visited Lands End Trail, Grandview Park, Sunset watch; and best is to visit Mt Tampalais by Marin County. Best place to see the gorgeous bay.

This hotel is in a great location. close to the bart line with a 10 min walk to the resort. 40 min walk to the fisherman wharf. good restaurants and hotel pick up with tours or close by as a pick up for tours in the area

Pull into the portico and the friendly bell staff will assist in unloading your cases. We arrived at midday and didn't expect our room to be ready. The bellhop stored our bags for us and asked if we needed a map or any directions. Nice,Newly renovated rooms quite spacious and nicely appointed. Beds firm and comfortable.Hotel has a great location, but with that comes the city noise... no way to avoid it.Hotel has a nice Italian restaurant, but if you go, request seating in the main room and not the bar area which is cramped and noisy.

After visiting the wine country, we visited San Francisco again. SF is not that far away. The Donatello was a very nice hotel and the staff friendly. Location is the key here. It was great and we could walk to many places. It is located in the heart of the city. I would stay again for sure. The rooms were fine and we didn't have any trouble .

We are a family of four (2 adults, 2 teens) and spent 5 nights here. The room was spacious and we didn't feel cramped. We were lucky enough to have one of the 5th floor rooms that has a spacious outdoor shared terrace where you can sit outside. There were even humming birds on the terrace!Used the small gym every morning and enjoyed the complimentary coffee.

The hotel is located very close to Union Square. It is easily accessible by train (BART yellow line, get down at Powell station with about 8 min walk) from the SFO airport if you are using public transport. The neighbourhood is decent as well. Overall, value for money with friendly staff, location and facilities.

Renovation is on. One of the morning we have to endure few hours of power drilling from the room above us. Hotel should inform us of the renovation during booking so we may choose another hotel.During check in, the senior lady staff is more interested in getting us to attend timeshare selling session. She also try promoting us to a list of restaurants which she even mentioned she can earn commission (if we eat there). After a full day in the road, we just want to get our room and rest.Despite being informed we are 3 guests during booking. Bed for 3rd guest was never set up. (we have to set up the sofa bed on our own).Location of the hotel is excellence, at Union Square, near to metro and Market Street.

I was a little nervous that this time share hotel room would be too small for a couple and our 6 foot teenager, but it was just perfect. Immaculately clean, spacious, nicely appointed and with possibly the best king-sized bed we’ve ever had.The location is terrific for visiting all around SF. Within walking distance is Chinatown, Union Square, Westfield, the Business District and the cable car turnaround. Heaps of good restaurants and cafes, Walgreens for grocery and pharmacy goods, Starbucks and self serve or drop-off laundromats. The only negative was the anticipated time-share hard sell. Not only did they grab us during checkin to push the “free breakfast” and sales push, we were called twice on the first night by the concierge urging us to take them up on the offer. The second call was at 8:30pm - after we’d been asleep for over an hour due to our international flight.This practise needs to stop, as it just detracts from an otherwise perfect hotel experience.A note re the homeless situation in SF: this hotel was well situated with very few homeless people or panhandlers around. You will see them though where ever you go in SF and it’s shameful so many people have to live like this in such an affluent country

The Donatello was the perfect location for an overnight stay before heading to Auckland NZ late the following eve I g. I booked 2 nuts with timeshare points. Located a few blocks from Union Square it was a good place to walk . We had a big breakfast at a diner a block from the hotel. There was a nice bar and restaurant there. We visited the bar and headed to Morton's near by for great happy hour food. The room was very comfortable and provided a very comfortable bed.

I will definitely stay here again and recommend to my friends. the rooms are large and I noticed they are very quiet, we never heard any noises from our neighbors. friendly staff and they have on site parking for a reasonable amount. close to Union Square and shopping, I had a great stay here.

Bed great, view not that great. The staff were very helpful especially the consierge who were always looking to help. Location was not bad just off union square. This hotel thankfully was not being picketed by the hotel workers union as waere other hotels so reasonably quiet. It would have been good if you could get a breakfast at the hotel but the staff did recommend restaurants nearby. The smoke from the bush fires did not help but the hotel itself was not affected

Unprofessional staff did not know how to handle error cancellation reservation by The Donatello. Try to walk away instead of solving the problem. Took more than 3 hours with confrontation checked in. What kind of resort? Treated guests with no respect from unprofessional young man. Unacceptable and embarrassing.

We have been here two times in about three years and both times we had very nice rooms and fine service. Except to the obligatory sales pitch from the time share salesperson, checking in would have been very quick. I realize that the salesperson has a sales quota, but applying pressure to attend an orientation is not the right thing to do when the travellers have spent much time to get to this destination and may be in need to get to their rooms. They will not take a "not interested" at this point and continue the pitch when they must realize that their target will probably be a no-show or turn down any offer made.The room was very clean and we liked the service bar that had a microwave oven and a full-sized coffee maker, seldom seen with single server machines used in so many hotels, and real plates and cutlery. There was also a small service sink that could be used in rinsing out dishes and for filling up the coffee maker. The bath room was very ample and there were plenty of towels. We were up around the sixth floor and it was very quiet considering the usual city noises.The car valet service worked like a charm and the parking rate was reasonable. One can find independent garages via internet parking service sites, but many of the ones close to the hotel were cheaper but did not have in-and-out privileges. The location is very good for downtown and it was close to the restaurants we had planned to visit and shopping was about two or three blocks away.We will return to this hotel, but would be a lot happier if I could somehow bypass that timeshare sales desk the next time back and give the hotel a higher rating.

This is one of Wyndham vacation club hotel, the room was equipped with microwave, mini fridge, cups, bowls, plates and silverware. Rooms are big being in the downtown, and maintained well. Top floor is dedicated for the club with tea, coffee and place it sit and relax. Their fitness center was kept nicely. The staff is very friendly and always greet you on entry and exit. Only thing didn't like is they try to sell you timeshare stuff during your stay, being part of the Wyndham family.

Rooms are very spacious. It’s centrally located to the mall and shops. The front desk is very attentive. Parking is a bit pricey however the hotel allows you to go in and out. The other parking places nearby do not. The top floor was awesome to watch the sunset and enjoy some tea and talk.

Even know the rooms are very nice. The staff and follow through leave a lot to be desired. The front desk staff is obviously untrained in both protocol and customer service. I had multiple problems getting into my room at check-in. Turns out the room was double booked and it took three attempts for them to figure that out. The keys did not work in the new room at one point. Afterwards when I complained about the things that went wrong there was not much follow through and never did get a hold of any of the staff. I would not come back to this hotel. The front desk staff have a very nonchalant, non-customer service-oriented attitude as far as caring that the guests have been inconvenienced  There are too many other nice hotels to stay at for me to want to repeat this experience.

My partner and I stayed at The Donatello for four nights on our first trip to San Francisco. We found the staff to be very friendly, the hotel to be very well located and the room nice and spacious. The room had everything you would want, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, plenty of space to put your clothes away and plenty of mirrors with great lighting. It is an easy walk to the shops around Union Square and and easy walk to the nearest cable car stop which takes you all the way in to Fisherman's Wharf. The bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable and we had the best sleep every night. All in all, I would recommend The Donatello for a stay in San Francisco.

The staff (front desk, bell men, housekeeping) were all very nice and friendly. I was impressed that the bell man remembered the guess names during the entire stay. The room was clean and modern. The hotel is in a good location from public transportation as well as walking and Union Square. The hotel is a part of a time share do expect the phone to ring within 5 minutes of reaching your room to try and set up a showing. They were not too pushy when I said no.

Of all 3 hotels we stayed at during our tour of America The Club Donatello was our favourite. Firstly we emailed them all before arriving asking for rooms next door to the couple we were travelling with and this hotel was the only one that obliged. The staff from the cleaners to front desk and concierge always greeted us with a smiling hello and provided an excellent service. Our room on the 11th floor was clean spacious quiet and had everything we needed while 2 floors above was a comfortable rooftop lounge where you can take your own drinks or take advantage of the complementary tea coffee and hot chocolate on offer. There are also leisure facilities on this floor with a sauna spa and small gym. The Donatello's location is ideal for San Francisco sightseeing with many restaurants and cafes, Union Square shopping, China Town and theatre district all within a mile while the cable car to fisherman's Wharf and bus tours are on the doorstep. Thank you Donatello for a most enjoyable stay.

This hotel is in the middle of everything. It's conveniently located near Union Square. The hotel is a bit old, but they are remodeling. The gym is not good though, very tiny and not much equipment. However, the guest room is large and the staff are wonderful!!

This hotel was selected for its location, amenities and positive reviews, and it did not disappoint. The area around Union Square has plenty to offer and is a safe and pleasant environment, with most forms of transport close by. The hotel was very presentable, and everything functioned as it should. Our room on the 9th floor was very spacious and clean, looking out to the rear and hence largely unaffected by traffic noise. The staff were universally pleasant and helpful, and we appreciated being able to take advantage of the hospitality facilites on the 14th floor.That said, there were a couple of downsides: the sales pitch for the timeshare group (of which the hotel is part) was unwelcome on arrival, as our body clocks were at the middle of the night after our transatlantic flight. Also, the on-site restaurant was overly expensive for what was simply decent quality Italian food - maybe a reason why there is no menu in the room other than room service!

Great hotel near union square and all the great stores and restaurants. This hotel has a great restaurant also. You can go to the top floor and be in a big living room and have your coffee. They have a gym, and a massage area.

We stayed four nights at The Donatello – two before and two after a four-day tour. Both rooms were spacious, very well appointed and had an excellent layout. Added conveniences included a sofa, coffee table, table and chairs, a small kitchenette and a large dressing area.The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially the Bell staff.Location-wise, the Donatello was excellent and extremely convenient for our purposes.The only negative was the hard sell by the Wyndham representative – we immediately stated that we were not interested, however she persisted in trying to persuade us to attend a 90-minute presentation. She made us feel very uncomfortable.

Stayed here for 4 nights with 2 kids & we had a great stay! Centrally located near Union square, it’s close to most things. We had a king bed & sofa bed & both were very comfortable. Yes, they try & get you to go to a Wyndham timeshare presentation - we had to be there for about an hour & a half, but they weren’t too pushy about it. We got a free breakfast & $150 off a sightseeing tour, so we were pretty happy with it! Would highly recommend this hotel

Exceptional hotel, completely remodeled in past year. Service and staff do a great job. Location one block from Union Square. Rooms have kitchenette and are la at get than most 4-5 star hotels in San Francisco.

Stay was first rate. Amenities were 5 Star . Rooms were spacious and well appointed.. everything was spotless. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Club level offered a respite overlooking the city views. An oasis in Union Square.

Rooms are both large and clean. Bed is comfortable. View from my room on the 9th floor was not great, but how much time do you spend looking out the window? Air conditioning (I live in the SJ valley) worked great! Nice to be cool for once. Easy check-in and check-out. High-end shopping is easy two blocks walk.

Booked the hotel using our timeshare points. This hotel is a step away from Union Square, convenient location for shopping, sightseeing, churches. Excellent food around the area. Also a few blocks up are reasonable and very good food.The service was excellent. Rooms are big for San Francisco standard. We had a 2 queen bed and a sofa bed in the room. This hotel have utensils and microwave in the room which makes it convenient when you are travelling with kids and just want to order food in.

A bit overpriced (as is everything in San Francisco) but very nice, clean and large room. Only a minutes walk from Union Square and they offer valet parking at a SF reasonable price of $ 35. Would recommend to friends and family.

We stayed 4 nights at the Donatello and can say the room was a good size and very clean. The main bed was firm and comfortable. The pull out sofa bed was not so. But it's a sofa bed and they are never very comfy.The staff were very helpful and always met with a smile.We were never hassled about time share.The location of the hotel gave us a brilliant start each day for our trips.I would thoroughly recommend the Donatello.

We stayed at The Donatello for a short family vacation in July 2018. You can’t beat the location as it’s right in the heart of Union Square! Public transportation is easily accessible, there are great restaurants within a block or two as well as small neighborhood groceries to stock up on necessities like bottled water, fruit, wine, etc for your room. Our room at The Donatello was equipped with a small kitchenette, including a refrigerator, microwave, sink, and coffee maker. It was also stocked with plates, bowls, and flatware. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, and street noise was not an issue for us on the 8th floor. We arrived several hours before check-in time, so we left our bags with the concierge and headed up to the restaurant for brunch. The restaurant service was quick, the staff friendly, and the food was delicious. We will definitely stay at The Donatello on our next trip to San Francisco!

The noise from the street is so incredibly loud (people shouting, cars honking, sirens blaring), we can hear every word, honk, blare from our room on the 8th floor. The hotel has “old money” charm but the water pressure is poor and the street noise is 24/7. Not the place for light sleepers!

We stayed two nights here on a quick trip to San Francisco. It was our first stay here, and it was delightful. The location near Union Square and so close to the street car station was ideal. We were in the regular hotel part on the 10th floor, and our other family members were in the Club Donatello section on the 11th floor. Our room was a little bigger than theirs, and we had a table and chairs which they did not. The rooms were large with great views of the city. The staff were so accommodating in every way. The bathroom was a little small compared to the overall room size, but we were very comfortable and were happy to have the kitchenette with small fridge, microwave, sink, and countertop space with dishes and silverware. They also provided dish soap and sponge. We had a unique parking need because we were in a big SUV with a small luggage hitch attachment on the back. They had two oversized parking spaces right outside the front door for this situation and did not charge us anything additional (parking is $35/day, which is reasonable for San Francisco hotels). The front desk staff was very friendly, and the concierge gave us helpful information on the area and a city map. The best part: the lounge on the 15th floor! It had a small self-serve coffee/tea/water area, tables and chairs, a fireplace, and nice views of the city as well as doors to an outer patio area for some fresh air and closer look at the views. There is also a fitness center and hot tub on that same level. The lounge was our meeting spot for our two families to have breakfast and play games in the evening. I highly recommend this hotel.

I have mixed feeleings about this stay. The great is location, good is the staff and only because the timeshare folks are trying to call and talk to you on a regular basis. I have to say they were friendly and helpful enough and understand the job but it is annoying after a while to get the calls. The good and bad is the room. Nice size but could definately use some updating. Lots of chipped paint and just seemed a bit worn. I was torn between 3 and 4 rating but overall is was anice stay, so giving it a 4 but be aware it is dated. Last thing is we were on the 6th floor and city noise is stll loud but thats the city.

We stayed one night on our way to Napa Valley. We were within blocks of the Wharf. Breakfast was not included but we could choose from the menu or a cold or hot buffet. We opted for the cold which was between $15-$18 per person. Our room was about as far away from the elevator as you could get. Overall it was a good stay.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Very close to the pier, central location. Parking not included, even for hotel guests. Breakfast is very expensive and was not included in the room, so we picked Hollywood Cafe (more expensive, but better choices and quality) right across the street. Rooms were nicely appointed - typical to what you can expect from a Hyatt centric..
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: This hotel is located in a great location walking a few blocks to Pier 39 and so many restaurants to choose from. The Starbucks is right next door as well as a market 1 block away. The double beds are a bit small is my one complaint. They do have a heated pool which the kids had fun in. The Hollywood Cafe across the street was yummy and is a better choice than the breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. The valet was $60/night but everywhere else was pretty pricy too. They have area near the lobby with games such as ping pong table and a few others games. A staff closed it up early at 8 pm indicating they have an event the next day but saw that it was actually 2 days later. The room was packed with guests playing the games and waiting to go see the fireworks on July 4th. She definitely did not have to close the room and kick people out as they were not cleaning or prepping the room that night. I think that was definitely could have been handled better and given guests more time in that game room. Bad management on that decision.But overall great location and clean room.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Clean hotel. Staffs were great and actually remember you! Location was convenient and we were able to walk every where. Parking was expensive but that's just part about being in the city so we opted out for not having a car. Few blocks from fisherman's wharf.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Very nice hotel close to the Fisherman's wharf. Overall experience was very good, I would only extend the range of the continental breakfast buffet. Also the concierge could be more helpful and nicer.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: I can’t say enough good things about my stay here. The staff knew from my reservation that it was my birthday and they sent up a bottle of wine, cheese plate, and a birthday card signed by all staff. I was so shocked. It’s always the extra things that the staff do that make the stay amazing. Yes the room was incredible and everything I payed for but how I was treated and how they went above and beyond making me feel specia for my birthday really made the trip. Also checking in early was a bonus and being able to store our luggage after checkout until our 10:30 pm flight was a great perk. Look no further this is the hotel for you!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: The customer service at this he front desk and valet was very poor, nearly rude. This hotel did not meet my expectations for a Hyatt. The pictures online do not accurately represent the condition of the hotel. Parking is a nightmare and very expensive. For the price of this hotel I would look elsewhere on fisherman’s wharf.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: from check in to check out this was a great experience. restaurant on site was good, varied food and excellent service. rooms were adequate with no outside 'noise'; couple of blocks from fisherman's wharf; close but not too close.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Central to a lot of SF tourist attractions within walking distance. Right next to a Trolly line start. Starbucks across the street. Restaurants and grocery store right there. Great place to stay. Totally recommend to others traveling to SF.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Great stay at Fisherman's Wharf. Perfect location. 5 minute walk to wharf. 10 minutes to Pier 39. Hotel looks like its pictures. Clean modern rooms. Rooms are large and nicely laid out. Friendly helpful staff. Great value.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Hotel was nice and modern with spacious rooms and very helpful staff. We had a lovely time and though we did not spend a lot of time at the hotel it was very nice and a convenient spot for our family.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Visited for an overnight stay for a conference in the hotel. Stayed on the third floor, which was quiet overall. Room was clean. Only downside is there wasn't a clear place to work as there wasn't a desk in the room. Room 304 doesn't offer a view, but that's minor. Staff was friendly. Valet was a little steep at $59/night, but that's SF. Valet also offers in/out privileges.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: This is my first time at the Hyatt Centric San Francisco and the location at Fisherman’s Wharf was perfect. Walking distance to attractions, tours, and dining options. I’m little disappointed in the service of the staff. A week before my stay, I emailed the hotel to inquire how to get to the hotel from SFO via public transportation, I didn’t get a response. I’m also a Hyatt Explorist member and I wasn’t recognized for my status or was thanked for my loyalty. While I didn’t get a room upgrade, which is upon availability, I was surprised that I didn’t get a preferred room. I was given a room on a lower level with no view, just of another side of the hotel and the roof. I didn’t feel appreciated as an elite member by the staff verbally or by room assignment. The room was modern and clean, and the hotel does have a great fitness room and pool. I hope the service will improve, but this hotel is one to consider.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: BEAUTIFUL place, valet parking only at $60! Fancy room with lots of amenities but no microwave and automatic light in bathroom goes off after certain amount of time of inactivity, like when you are in the shower!! Sure is dark in there!! Strange elevators too, one off lobby with 2 doors and 2 others in a side alcove?? Great location, 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, easy to get to everything! Easy to find. Would stay again!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Far expensive, breakfast is not complimentary, careless staff. If you have stayed in lower categories of the chain (example Hyatt Place which is category 2) you would expect something better for a Hyatt Centric which is category 5... but no.
