Please be aware this hotel is like a bed and breakfast without the breakfast, but expensive just because it is "centric". Options around (a couple of blocks) are way better for this location.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel, great quality you’d expect from a Hyatt, great neighbourhood to walk around exploring, easily accessible to Fisherman’s Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Lovely pool and hot tub, store in lobby for snacks and supplies. They even got me a curling iron! I would stay here again.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Wonderful stay ... perfect location.Room very clean. Good bathroom with huge shower. My room was so quiet with comfortable bed and everything you could need. Reception staff so friendly and welcoming. Free water daily and I was given free milk for my room which was much appreciated staff could not do enough for me and are the real plus point of this hotel. Good pool with free towels. Breakfast good coffee not great better to use Starbucks coffee near reception. I really enjoyed my stay and would book here again without hesitation. Not a fan of the attached restaurant/bar food terrible and Fri is not good for the price. Plenty of great places to eat and drink in San Francisco so this is not a problem.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: This Hyatt was in perfect location at Fisherman’s Wharf. It was walking distance to Pier 39, Chinatown and North Beach. Public transportation was easily accessible as was getting an Uber/Lyft other tourist locations. The hotel itself was very well kept, clean and comfortable. Staff was courteous & attentive. I would definitely stay in another Hyatt Centric Hotel.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We were told to stay at Fisherman’s wharf but all hotels here were very expensive- then we found this gem! One block back from all the action and next to the Tram and Starbucks. The hotel is modern, scrupulously clean, friendly and welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff. And the big bonus for us - the laundry along our corridor. Our room was a good size, great bathroom and very comfortable. I cannot recommend this hotel more highly.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: The hotel was very clean and nice. The gym was clean and had a lot of equipment. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Gluten free options at the restaurant. Location was in walking distance of main attractions and stores.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: The location is excellent, a couple of blocks away from Pier 39 or the Cable Car. The room was clean, big bathroom, super comfortable beds. We didn’t get a nice view, but we didn’t mind that. We reserved with points and it’s totally worth it. The hotels in SF are extremely expensive and in Fisherman’s Wharf they look old and not worth $300 a night. For a great breakfast go to the Hollywood Cafe, is right in front, and Pat’s cafe is close by. They have bikes at the hotel that you can use.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: This Hotel was very expensive. The price I paid was very high and didnt reflect the prealling rate at this or similar hotels of better quality, that night. When I complained they eventualy agreed I could move without giving 24 Hours notice to a better cheaper hotel, but paid $60 over the odds.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Great hotel in a wonderful location. Be sure to not accept a room on the third floor facing the pool. The pool opens at 7 am and we had kids running and yelling right outside our window. Otherwise it was clean and well cared for
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Everything about the hotel was really very nice. Comfortable room nearness to most of the things I wanted to visit and nice staff. My only complaint is that I was charged a destination fee of $20. plus tax. I asked if this was part of my pre paid package and I was told instead of the benefits of this package and was given discount coupons. I was never told yes or no. My bad. Again, other than this, nice place.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Friendly and good service helpful staff. This was a convention I attended and the meeting was at the hotel. It catered to the meeting attendees and they all were pleased. If I ever come back this way I will stay here
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: My wife and I recently visited San Francisco and chose to stay at the Hyatt Centric Fisherman’s Wharf. First off, I would advise ignoring the counsel to avoid Fisherman’s Wharf. We found it to be convenient to everything we wanted to do and it (or the starting point for it) was all in easy walking distance. The FW area is about a 30 minute or so ride from SFO. There are several other property brands within a block or two including a Marriott, Sheraton and a Holiday Inn. From outside, the building is fairly unimpressive. Everything in the area appeared to be a bit dated but in the case of the HC, nicely maintained and mildly updated. We didn't have a car but I believe parking was $60 a night and there is a resort fee of $23.The lobby is a bit cramped primarily due to its long, narrow design. There is only one lobby-level elevator to the guestrooms which can get backed up but there are more available a level below. There is a large function room in the lower lobby that had ping pong and air hockey tables in it when we were there. There is a snack/convenience store that serves coffee next to the registration desk. There is also a very nice restaurant and bar onsite.We were greeted cheerfully by the front desk staff who very pleasantly and efficiently got us on our way to the room. My elite status with Hyatt was recognized and got us an upgrade to the Executive Suite and free breakfast. General décor was nice and as with the exterior and the lobby looked to be updated and well kept. The room was huge. There were separate living and bedroom areas and a large bathroom with a double vanity. The living room had a gigantic flat screen and a sectional sofa along with a bar housing the coffee service and a mini-fridge. There were plenty of outlets, updated connections to the TV and everything was in working order. The bedroom was nice with a (slightly obstructed) view of the bay bridge. It was large and had a large flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable except for the pillows (my only real complaint with Hyatt properties). Bathroom amenities were mid- to high end, the shower had been updated and there was good water pressure.There is no lounge at this property but we enjoyed the buffet breakfast every day. Wait staff were way pleasant accommodating a few special requests and taking extraordinarily good care of us.We enjoyed eating at Scoma’s, Ghirardelli Square is a short walk and the Big Bus Center is about 3 or 4 blocks away. They are right in the middle of it all.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, will stay here again if we return and highly recommend it.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: The hotel was updated and clean. The staff were very helpful. The rain shower was unique. The housekeeping staff seemed to work very hard. Employee, David, who assisted with our car and luggage upon arrival and departure is an excellent employee and an asset to the Hyatt. The food was good, but could have used one extra server in the mornings. Overall a positive 3-day stay.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Spent four nights at this hotel and it was a great experience. The location was really good and the food in the bar/restaurant area was excellent. The associated bar was a great place to meet with friends. The rooms are very well-maintained and timely manner.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Wonderful Stay with an excellent staff. Front desk check in was a breeze. Everyone was extremely friendly and willing to check me in early. Valet was perfect. My room was rather large and I could not have asked for a anything better. Clean in every way. Bathroom spotless and although I am not a huge fan of the "rain shower craze" the water pressure was perfect. All in all, perfect room, perfect location and wonder staff! Thanks Hyatt! You did it again!!!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Super close to pier 39 and fisherman’s warf. Best hotel in that area. Lots of food and play options. Walking distance to bike and rental car companies. The bedroom was a little compact. Front office is very friendly
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Wonderful location. Excellent staff. Clean comfortable room.This Hyatt hotel is within walking distance to almost everything and everywhere ....all the piers as well.Good facilities within the hotel .....pool, hot tub, lounge, etc.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Very nice hotel.. well located near Fisherman's Wharf.. If you don't want to eat in the hotel restaurant everyday there are lots of choices nearby.. We had a king deluxe room that was plenty big enough for the two of us.. lighting is good and plenty of outlets to charge things with.. very large bathroom area with lots of counter space..
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Our second time staying here. Such a great experience. This is a great location. You can easily walk to The Warf, Starbucks, Walgreens, a Trolly Station, plenty of restaurants and shopping. Staff made sure we had a great stay. Food at the restaurant for breakfast is very good. We did not get a chance to have dinner or lunch at Brick & Beam but the menu looks good.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: When using the restroom I found a wad of human hair inside the folded towels the front desk promised new towels, which were never delivered. They also promised a credit, which never came thru. Check your towels!!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We celebrated 20th anniversary in SFO at Hyatt. Give property a 4.5 actually. Need ice buckets in room!! Perfect location! Staff was professional, but could use more valet attendants. The maid service was excellent. We always came back to a nice, clean room. We also felt special with the anniversary wishes, snack, and drinks sent to our room by staff. Thank you so much! Lower rating on sleep quality due to flat pillows, but we sleep on special pillows at home, so no hotel's pillows or bed is comfy for us.Would definitely recommend this hotel on the wharf when visiting this beautiful city.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: I am s=in the midst of a 10 day stay for business and am quite satisfied., My company is paying, so I can't comment on value. Single king room size is average. It is clean with a good shower. Staff interaction has been minimal, but all of it great. The location for visitors to this area is great.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Stayed four nights with my two children and spouse. Room was large but double beds a little smallish for each adult sleeping with a kid. Got a connecting room to a king room where grandparents stayed. Everyone had clean rooms. Great housekeeping. Free big bottle of water each day we stayed. Location excellent and close to the wharf. Would stay again.Downsides, I found room pricey. With exchange was basically $500/night. Maybe its the location, not sure but staying at the Wharf seemed to be the spot for everywhere we wanted to go or any tour we had to meet. Outdoor pool lovely but since it's so windy the closer you get to the water and the wind was quite cool, we really only took advantage of the hot tub which is a max of 6 people so my family filled it up! Our room had a very loud "tinny" sounding heating/cooling unit. I couldn't sleep with it going at night so I had to wear my earbuds and play white noise.Didn't use room service or anything. Had no issues, so cannot comment on service that way or response times.I would stay again as I did find it very clean, but again, very pricey!! I categorized as mid-range, which I am sure it is for the area even though at home the cost would be luxury!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Just stayed 5 nights at Hyatt Centric and found the location to be convenient for Fisherman’s Wharf, Ghiradelli, Pier 39, Embarcardero, Ferry Building Marketplace, Powell & Hyde Cable Car Stop. Very easy to walk to these attractions or hop onto the F Market/Embarcardero trams. The room was large and bed comfortable. Bathroom of a good size though I still find Hyatt’s bathtub/shower curtain/shower combo very outdated. The only peeve is the $20 + taxes destination fee for per night which no one mentioned until I saw the tiny card that came with the keycard. This is supposed to cover the daily bottle of free water + list of useless items which honestly we do not need.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Loved staying here. Location was perfect, rooms were clean, staff was friendly. Room was quiet, only noise was from guests in the hallway (grandparents who think it's cute to let grandkids run in the hallway and encouraged it...ughhh...). Had a mini fridge, Keurig and safe. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We wanted location, a comfortable room and value. We got all that at the Hyatt Centric. If you can, be lucky enough to ask for a room with a view. We did and got to look out to Coit Tower. They have a semi-heated pool and a small hot tub that was enjoyable, especially after all the walking we did. Though the hotel is more family oriented, it was respectfully quiet. The Brick and Bean Restaurant has a fantastic menu for dinner (especially for us vegetarians) and their brunch is equally marvelous. My favorite amenity: BIKES! They're free for residents. You could take one and be out all day with it. The staff was very friendly and the next I come into San Francisco, I will definitely look up the Centric as a hotel possibility.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: The hotel has some great qualities such as the location, cost, ambiance in the lobby. I felt like the rooms were a bit dated and I wish that the bathroom door had a lock. In terms of service, the personnel were friendly.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Nice comfortable beds but rooms could use updating! The pictures online are deceiving as to views! Had to stand on furniture to really see. The bathroom window opened awkwardly so that street was visible but there was not a bathroom fan so... carpet dingy and room set up not ideal, better lighting might do the trick.The hotel is ideal if you are looking to be close to tourist spots like the wharf and Ghiradelli square. Best to Uber or Lyft rather than rent a car! Overall good but not worth the $$$
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Very nice hotel, food was excellent, room was very nice, great location, enjoyed being able to walk to many places especially the pier area. The staff was helpful. The corner room was large and extremely comfortable
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Looked for a good hotel in San Francisco. This hotel is not at all at the level of a Hyatt in Europe or the middle east. I do not recommend it. Poor service, asked twice to clean the window, which was full of bird dirt. Nothing happend. It was disgusting.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric during the RNR Half Marathon weekend. The hotel is beautiful and located right in the heart of Fisherman’s Wharf. Everything was within walking distance. The hotel does not offer a shuttle to and from the airport but you can reserve a spot on the Super Shuttle or the Airport Shuttle for $17 per person each way which is about the same as an Uber or Lyft. We received excellent customer service from Luz at the front desk.The only small drawback if any, was that the free breakfast is not available unless you are considered a Globalist through the Hyatt Rewards program. Otherwise it is about $26 per person to eat breakfast there. Fortunately, there are a ton of great little restaurants right outside the hotel like Hollywood Cafe which offers a delicious, reasonably priced breakfast and lunch.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: I checked into this hotel for a conference at the same site. I arrived ~ 2pm and they didn’t have a King available so they gave me a room with a King and Double bed. The King bed was saggy and the room looked pretty substandard for Hyatt so I asked for a nicer room and they were going to charge me more so I stayed put and planned to use the smaller bed. Also the safe didn’t work but they sent a tech to replace the battery rather than give me another room. After the first night I wish I had pushed harder for a new room without having to incur a fee because I noticed the following: the bathroom door was sticky and unclean and the sheets on the bed had holes in them (see picture). The bottle of water isn’t complimentary (the note states there’s a $20 room fee that covers the water—- pricey bottle of water), however they didn’t bother to replenish it after they cleaned the room the following day. I didn’t get a good night’s sleep due to the constant noise & vibrations but I didn’t know where they were coming from. The front desk/bell staff overall was nice but the person who I was in contact with after check-in did very little to improve the experience. I will never stay here again and will encourage my conference event organizer to skip this venue. I expected much better from Hyatt!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Top location which puts you close to popular attractions including Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, North Beach, Cable Cars, Lombard St... the list does on. We walked a lot of San Fran which wasn’t too difficult (except for the 42 odd hills). The hotel is clean. Employees are politely. Excellent bar/restaurant attached. Water pressure was average (takes a while to wash your hair). Minimal hanging space in the wardrobe if you’re a couple. For the price we paid I was hoping for something a littler more grand. But there’s nothing that would stop me from recommending to friends or family. It’s easily a 4 star.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Requested a room that was on high floor and quiet. Provided a room on 3rd floor and next to the pool - very loud! We were then given a room on the 5th floor (after waiting), but overlooking the pool as well. Loud! The following day, we were given another room on the 4th floor. A light fixture was not working and there was a vent in the bathroom spewing out lots of dust. I ended up getting an eye infection in both eyes. Had to get prescription from doctor for eyes. Not too pleased.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We just flew in from Australia (14 hours) and they provided immediate room availability so we could rest...this was at 8:30 am. Really thoughtful staff, great location to Wharf and buss/trolley lines and restaurants.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Great location! Great staff! The room was spacious compared to other rooms I’ve stayed at in the area. I really enjoyed my stay here! Walking distance to the wharf and the cable car pick up. The valet was $60 plus $9.00 in tax. Very pricey but it’s SF!
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: We chose this hotel because of its location and accessibility to many of the tourist destinations. Many are just less than 20 minutes via Taxi/Uber/Lyft/Cable/Bus. Even walk distance. Rooms are clean and really spacious.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Great value for money in the expensive Fishermans Wharf district. Rooms were new and very comfortable. Great location for tourist activities if you wanted to do those. The staff were great! Very helpful, Highly recommend staying here
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Overall the property was nice. The rooms were clean and felt updated. No complaints about the stay. We were rushed while eating dinner at the restaurant on site, which is pricey. The food was okay. There is a destination charge that is added on to your stay. I don't feel like you get good value for your money with destination charge. You get 1 bottle of water and some other discounts. There was also a coupon book for the wharf that didn't have many good deals. The location of the hotel was perfect, but I would look for one that does not charge a $30 destination charge.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Great area. Able to walk around. Cable car was right next to hotel which was nice. Hotel was close to many different public transportation stops. Easy to get around with my little one. Check in was fast and service was great. Would stay here again when we visit.
hotelName: 13    Hyatt Centric Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco

review_body: Reserved a room here for 2 nights based on reviews, location to our event, and photos from their website, which are misleading. The desk clerk was extremely welcoming and helpful to me and my daughter - we were on a road trip from Tennessee to Seattle and we stopped in SF for a friend's graduation. The hotel decor was worn, but charming. I enjoy staying in small boutique hotels and liked the idea of a nice bed and breakfast, especially after a road trip of staying in chain hotels along the highway. Our room was fine, seemed clean on first inspection. Again, a bit worn. It was very hot in the room, so I turned the thermostat to a cooler temp and even cracked the window. Decided to head to the lobby for the cookies and sherry that they offer in the late afternoon. That is when I saw the first mouse run across my path.So, yes, we are in a big city in a small hotel - this did not bum me out too much, actually. We named the mouse Annie - lol. Then I looked down to see a big fake fingernail on the floor at my feet. Ugh. Oh, and another mouse. Back to the room - it had an odor of dirty feet and the comforter seemed a bit suspect. I didn't want to use it, but had no choice when the sun went down and the room turned cold. Ok, turn the thermostat up, no problem. Nothing. No heat, no cool, nothing. Not sure if it even worked. A call to the front desk indicated that nothing could be done until morning. Just to be clear, at this point, I still wasn't completely turned off by the place. I decided to take a shower to warm up - that's when I saw the mold on the shower edges. Coming back into the room from the bathroom, I looked toward the bed and saw some gross smudges on the bed skirt - right where one would wipe one's hand as they were laying in bed. Still willing to give them a chance of redemption, I thought breakfast would be nice, just like their pictures on their website. I'm no snob and certainly appreciate the included breakfast at a Hampton Inn or similar place. I know what to expect there and am not disappointed. And I got the same thing but worse, literally the same flip flop Belgian waffle maker, the same kind of stale muffins, etc. at the Queen Anne,. Breakfast was better at the Hampton Inn that I had stayed at the night before in Bakersfield. I was done - bailed on this hotel and booked a room at the Omni - for practically the same price. Best decision I could have made.

Gorgeous rooms and no detail of Victorian charm was overlooked in the restoration and decorating. Fun to eat breakfast out on the European patio. A great location for exploring Japan town and the Fillmore district.

What a Great 'ol Girl. We were looking for an overnight to go along with a medical procedure at a local hospital and came across the Queen Anne Hotel. That price was right for a Tuesday and Wednesday stay and we booked the two nights. What a neat surprise when we got inside. Unless, of course, you hate old victorian buildings and furniture. We loved it. The place had been a finishing school for young ladies in the late 1800's and early 1900's. We had a king room with fireplace and overlooking the street. Staff were great and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is within 3-4 blocks walk of many fine restaurants. Can't wait for another excuse for a stay.

Every part of this hotel is decorated in an elegant, gorgeous way, from the sitting room (lobby) to the halls to the dining room to the rooms, which are each different. Even the elevator has a soft covered bench! Breakfast is in a lovely dining room and has waffles, eggs, cereal, sweet rolls, &more. In the afternoon there are homemade cookies & sherry in the sitting room. Everyone working there is warm & helpful. They even provide rides to wherever you are going if you sign up ahead. We LOVED this hotel!

Stayed here on our first trip to San Francisco. Wonderful hotel that seems more like a large Bed & Breakfast. Friendly staff and wonderfully decorated hotel. Very comfortable room. Highly recommend this place.

Good: beautiful, tons of character, great breakfast Con: not very suited for business travelers- no real work desk, breakfast start at 7. Price was right ( Hotwire). Would repeat if necessary, but not first choice.

The hotel and staff were great as well as other guests. On most of the afternoons while we enjoyed tea and sherry in the parlour guest would sit down and play the baby grand piano while we played chess and other games, it was such a relaxing way to wind down after a busy afternoon. The concierge was amazing and very friendly, she helped us with dinner plans almost every night and with car arrangements. The entire staff was great, we really enjoyed our stay over Spring Break.

My daughter and I have recently returned from a 10 night stay at this wonderful Hotel.Most beautiful place I have ever stayed at.Beautiful antiques everywhere from Foyerthroughout.Lovely rooms although my daughter thought the Peacock wallpaper a bittoo much. Comfy beds , lovely furnishings and very quiet.the Concierge, Nagr is verynice and very helpful as are all the staff. Would love to return one day to my favouriteCity and this glorious Hotel. Convenient for all your sightseeing. Marilyn G.

I was looking forward to staying at the Queen Anne, but was I very disappointed. Quaint but shabby. Every room in the place is thick with an aroma, most of them suffocating. Bed impossible to sleep in, very hard, with questionable throw pillows and bedspread. Furniture worn and tatty; didn't want to trust my clothes to the dresser drawers. It was chilly but I looked in vain for a thermostat to turn up the heat - there was none. On the way to the airport, stopped in for the complimentary breakfast and left almost immediately. Location is good and the staff were cordial, but I won't return. Not recommended for children.

Front Desk was helpful and friendly. I absolutely loved the architecture and furnishings. It's worth it to really look around in the common areas and appreciated the very fine décor. great location. After 9 pm or so it quiets down and I slept great. Real comfortable bed and linens. Overall well worth it.

This is the second time I have stayed at the Queen Anne, both times for the same reason: a training conference held at the Holiday Inn on Van Ness Avenue, six fairly short blocks from this hostelry. I consider this a great secret for other conference-goers in the neighborhood, as the Queen Anne charges almost exactly half the rate at the larger hotel. Did I miss any amenities? Absolutely not. My room was on the top (fourth) floor and may have originally been used by an employee, as my ceiling had a sharp slope that probably allowed for a dormer window I couldn't see. The bed was comfortable and the well appointed bathroom roomy, with a shower that was easy to operate and provided full coverage. In addition, I was offered a full breakfast buffet--and I do mean full! Fruits, juices, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, breakfast meats, an array of breads and quite possibly more things I don't recall, were displayed attractively. I had fun creating my own light waffle in a rotating pan, and it was delicious. We guests ate in a dining room that seemed, by virtue of how it is arranged, to encourage friendly exchanges and mutual offers of help and information. During my first stay, the hotel was undergoing the final stages of refurbishment. It is now completely decorated, and charming. The employees were, without fail, friendly and helpful. During both my visits, I was allowed to leave my car in the hotel lot at no extra charge during the second day of the conference. This is no small gift in San Francisco where street parking is practically non-existent and garage parking, if spaces are available, is very expensive. A final note: I didn't give five stars because that might lead folks to expect a very polished, perhaps elegant place to stay. This is more like a charming inn or B&B.

We had a really good deal on a price for this hotel . It’s located in a really good area of the city , while the hotel itself is little outdated ( which is part of its charm ) we found that we liked it a lot . It has a great atmosphere , and added bonus was that breakfast was included ( which we did not partake in ) and we loved that they offer complimentary cookies and cherry in the afternoons . All in all it was a nice stay and we would gladly come back to this place because of its value and quirkiness .

Centrally located. Quiet for SF. Rooms are nice, not extravagant. Love the afternoon sherry and cookies. Common area is perfect for chilling out. Breakfast is meh, you'll want to eat elsewhere if muffins and waffles aren't your thing. Hosts are very pleasant and accommodating. Price is very reasonable.

Upon arrival Queen Anne still had extensive Christmas decorations everywhere that suited the Victorian style. Everything looked magical.Our room 415 on the 4th floor complete with peacock wallpaper was fine. We were going out the first evening, so we needed to iron clothes. The iron didn't work, neither did the night lamp. The iron was quickly exchanged, the night lamp was never exchanged. We were spending 6 days in SF at the Queen Anne. Breakfast the first morning was a disappointment. In the reception it's called an "exclusive continental breakfast". Check out the posted pictures. The boiled eggs were green inside. Nothing home-cooked, but cheap muesli, pastries, etc. No yogurt or healthy items. Bananas got more and more rotten along the way. We ended up having breakfast other places even though breakfast was included.We asked the concierge for assistance booking a table for 5 for our last evening. She didn't get through on the phone 5 days before we wanted the reservation and never followed up. We ended up walking to Octavia 1 block away and made the reservation ourselves. One of the last evenings while sitting in the impressive living room by the fireplace, at least one mouse turned up and ran around the room. This was addressed to the receptionist, who jotted down my name. The next morning I also mentioned it, where the receptionists reaction was "this is a first time ". This attitude combined with lack of cleanliness (staircase wasn't vacuumed during our 6 days stay even though I addressed it after 3 days) was the last drop. Therefore the rating 2. The room and location are fine, besides that the standard is just too poor.

This is a lovely place to stay if you like character and something different to the usual hotel. The room was spacious and bed comfortable sndvwd had an open fire in our room so was very cosy. Good bathroom and tv. The breakfasts were pretty good - cereal, bread, bagels, boiled eggs, waffles. The service was a stand out - very welcoming and responsive. The lounge area was a nice place to sit as alternative to being in the room and there’s tea and coffee available at all times. The location is great for people who don’t want to be around the more touristy areas of union square or wharf - central for getting to different parts of SF. We liked Polk Street for the atmosphere and bars and it’s an easy walk there. Would recommend this place for a memorable stay in SF and was excellent value for money.

Recently stayed here for a show we attended at the nearby Fillmore. During the Holidays especially there is no better place to stay in the area of the city. Historic Victorian stylings wire a nostalgic Yule tide decor of yesterday. Pleasant and helpful staff and an excellent br3akfast buffet. They serve Sherry and Cookies between 4-6. The rooms were spacious, charming and comfortable. Street noise was minimal. Great place to stay when in the area for music at the Boom Boom room or dinner in Japantown. Recommended highly.

This is a beautiful Victorian building, you really can't call it a house. The reception area and the sitting rooms downstairs r a magical place to hang out with lots of nooks and crannies to relax in. Wheel of the fireplaces downstairs and the warmth that you felt in those rooms. Our room was large and well-appointed and spotlessly clean. It is very evident that the staff here love's this beautiful inn. There are plenty of places to eat around there including the famous Tommy's Joynt, Miller's Rest, Lemoncello and the amazing Brenda's French Soul Food. You will want to stay more than one night just for the sake of relaxing in the sitting rooms. The sherry and treats along with the hot tea at night are great. If you want a true Victorian home experience then this is the spot for you. No, there are not restaurants across the street but they are very close by. I'm not sure about all the complaints on here about not being close too good restaurants. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Why stay in a chain hotel when you can have a true San Francisco experience by staying at this beautiful bed & breakfast Victorian. The staff couldn’t have been nicer as we were treated like we were their only guest. Our suite was updated & very clean, however the walls were a little thin so we could hear talking next door. We did love the special afternoon cookies, sherry & tea. It was such a nice touch & the breakfast was enough to get us started for the day. Our favorite spot in the hotel though was right there in the Parlour which seemed to be the gathering place for several guests. It felt like we had gone back in time. We will definitely come back again.

Great location. Very beautiful decoration and styl, very special and magical. Very friendly personal. But the rooms smell very bad... very bad! It is not just bad smell, it stinks like skunk. Sorry ...

I was looking so forward to our stay in a true Victorian Painted Lady in San Francisco...I was quite disappointed, this Lady has truly seen better days. I know the age and ongoing upkeep can be daunting on a hotel of this age, however my complaints are on the overall cleanliness, a crevice tool needs to be used on the stairs, which at all times of day appeared to need vacuuming. The rooms bedspreads and curtains need replaced. My impression is the owners have made a cheap attempt to decorate, the framed paintings and pictures are very cheap replicas. Attention to detail is so important, especially if you want return guest. The breakfast while a nice offer , leaves so much to be desired we chose to eat elsewhere, even the coffee was not good. While looking forward to our overnight, I certainly would not recommend the Hotel to friends or family, and I do not think we will return, I wish I could say I would. Management needs to take a hard look at how you want to present this grand old gal, she could be elevated by attention to the small things, which after all become the big things.

Beautifully decorated historic hotel. You can almost hear the past as you explore the many antique pieces throughout each floor, including an old elevator. Our room was large and in need of an update, but very comfortable. The location is perfect, as it's basically in the centre of town. The parlor is breath taking with it's piano and fireplace and many antique pieces.

The bedcover smelled old and of someone’s body odor The overnight person was rude and blamed staff for not coordinating taxi to bring us to airportWe saw a small mouse run into dining room and informed staff the women said oh we were trying to catch it like it was nothing and lastly arrived home with a rash bed bugs???

We stayed at the Queen Anne for two successive nights (and a third night after a couple of days in Napa/Sonoma). The rooms (and the hotel itself) are furnished with Victorian-style antiques, and are spacious and elegant. The breakfast in the mornings was very good, and, as several other reviewers have mentioned, the afternoon cookies and sherry in the parlor were very nice. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the location - although on the edge of Polk Gulch and Japantown - was close enough to walk to many downtown locations. Definitely worth a visit!

Booked this hotel by reviews and was disappointed. This was not my first stay in SF but it was my first stay in the neighborhood. The good: beautiful lobby, safe neighborhood, decent breakfast (included), free cookies and sherry every afternoon if you're in the hotel mid-afternoon, one room has a fireplace. The bad: 1. One of the two rooms was tiny (smallest room according to the floor plan) but that didn't bother us so much. 2. The carpet in one of the rooms smelled bad (think old carpet smell in your grandma's house) - so bad that we had to leave the door open during the day. When we forgot to leave the door open one day, we came back to an awful smell again. 3. The windows was those old kind of windows without any noise insulation at all - such that at night a car driving by woke us up. Unexpected for a hotel in San Francisco in 2018. 4. Heat made a horrible sound - it almost kept us at night. 5. Our door did not close naturally, we had to actively pull it open every time we left the room. Again, this is a $200/night hotel in 2018. 6. Wifi did not work in our bed. Our room wifi only extended to the hallway and in the bathroom. 7. They charge $30 a night for parking, but neglect to tell you that there is free street parking at night time in this neighborhood. 8. Not the hotel's fault, but the neighborhood this is located in (Japantown) basically only has Asian food places and is mostly residential - not many bars/restaurants/cafes located within 10-15 min walk. We liked the quiet atmosphere but this is something to know. Overall, this place could be a great hotel but right now it's pretty shabby and needs some updating to bring it up 2018 United States standards.

I have stayed at the Queen Anne Hotel twice (2014/2015 and 2015/2016) and found it to be absolutely excellent. The rooms that I was given were excellent in size, cleanliness, comfort, decor and temperature. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. The breakfast was superb and very varied (and included lots of tea, fab for a limey like me!). The hotel is located in a lovely part of San Francisco (Pacific Heights) and is near to public transport that can take you to different parts of the City.

Staff very freindly, informative, understanding and comforting. Suite was very clean. Beds were very comfortable. It's a beautiful hotel with interesting history. This trip was for major surgery at UCSF so I needed to be close to hospital as well as accommodating for my family. I will definitely stay here again. The bed and breakfast atmosphere was what I needed just before my surgery. The prices are adjusted for patients and their families just when needed. Thank you to all staff.

Children of all ages will love the uniquely furnished Victorian parlors with gas fireplaces, the afternoon tea (sherry for grown-ups), the generous buffet breakfasts, and the spacious bedrooms; there is room for everyone to spread out. Walk three safe, clean blocks to Japan Town and enjoy restaurants and shops full of tchotchkes for every budget. Close to bus lines. Nearby Fillmore street has a scrumptious bakery, restaurants, a book store and original boutiques. China Town and Union Square are walkable. Delightful, friendly, accommodating staff.

Just wonderful! Apart from a lovely staff, beautiful ambiance, and comfortable accommodations...cookies and sherry in the afternoon. Centrally locatesd with a lot of charm. For my friends first trip to San Fransisco, certainly a made the visit. Just wonderful!

Great hotel. Comfortable bed, good shower, nice staff and fresh baked cookies every afternoon. Close to bus stop. Loved the Victorian decor. Fresh flowers in the common areas. Nice breakfast selection. Would stay again.

I chose this hotel as the closest to family I was visiting. It was a good, solid, stay.It's a mid-range hotel with much more personality than a chain. My room was delightful and clean. The breakfast was nothing special. I'm glad I stayed here and I would again.

Just Jaw dropping - I loved it! we were given room 410 but I was not aware of any haunting. Lovely throughout the entire hotel. You do not need to have a car if you are staying here - if you do it will cost you an extra 30.00 a day. If the city has enough sights for you, plan to use a public system. Our hotel person taught me how to do Uber and she was the most fantastic person I have ever run across. Helpful, polite, was able to keep me in check and so informative. Wish every hotel I stayed at had this type of person available to travelers. The hotel does come with breakfast but don't expect more than your usual chain ones. I was expecting just a bit more considering the hotel's Victorian image.

I loved our stay here. From what I hear room 410 is the most haunted. We were placed in the room below, 310. We had some wacky moments that made it seem like this place is certainly haunted, like smelling a distinct perfume waft through the room and green/blue colored orbs following us around in our pictures... my husband and I love that stuff, so it made for an interesting stay. The victorian decor, complimentary cookies & sherry, and wild parrots flying outside the hotel all add to the unique experience. If you like bizarre and beautiful, this is the place to stay.

This is a nice, old, historic place to stay. Rooms are fairly quiet. Breakfast is ok, I thought coffee tasted fine, but cups are way too small. Staff are polite. They say the hotel is haunted. I heard noises but nothing that was a definite ghost. Could have been a noise from someone else in hotel. The morning that we left something interesting did happen. It was around 6:30am. The doors to the breakfast area were closed and lights off inside. No one else was down there except for my husband and an employee. It was cool outside so no need for heating. We had been down there for about 15 min waiting on our Uber. I was fixing my last cup of coffee when the door to the breakfast area opened by itself. Could be a normal occurrence, but it was a little spooky to me.

The lobby was wonderfully charming with decor that completes the victorian esthetic (my primary reason for choosing this hotel)! Although there were fancier rooms available, I opted for the simpler Victoria King room since the nightly rate was ideal. The Hotel offered a free "Deluxe Continental Breakfast," which was pretty satisfying, along with afternoon tea during happy hour (4-6pm). Best of all, Queen Anne Hotel is nestled in a great location!!! Just a short walk away from shops and restaurants on Fillmore St. or Japantown! I would definitely book this hotel for future stays! (FYI, this hotel is apparently on a ghost tour for allegedly being haunted, however I never encountered anything out of the ordinary/supernatural in the room or hotel. Please don't let this discourage your stay!!! My friend was almost deterred for this sole reason however ended up having a great stay!)

If you want to connect with old San Francisco, the Victorian and historical version, stay here. Don’t stay here if you seek the new version of SF, the modern, slick and high tech one.Queen Anne has been my home away from home when I visit San Fran for 15+ years. It’s grand and old school, romantic. I used to live in San Francisco, grew up in the Bay Area and now live in Brooklyn. Love that it’s NOT near Union Square or Fisherman’s Wharf. It’s a nice neighborhood and staying here lets you live like a local, not a tourist. The 4pm sherry and cookies are worth coming back “home” for after a day of kicking around the city. Fillmore street / lower pacific heights neighborhood is a few blocks away, as is Japantown. Lots to do within walking distance, but an easy car ride to everything else. The hotel offers complimentary car service drop off anywhere in the city at three times in the morning. Breakfast is included.

This hotel building js beautiful, but the overall experience is depressing. The rooms and the bathrooms are tired. Everything feels like it needs a really good cleaning, and my room was musty smelling. The staff was pleasant but I would come back because the rooms were terribly old and tired.

Beautiful historical building, friendly staff, comfy beds, lots to see in the area & fun times looking around the hotel. Clean and lovely shower. Although we didn't encounter the "spirits" of the hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed our New Year's eve stay. Parking across the street.Wifi access, close to restaurants and shopping, and fun to explore.

I used to live on the Fillmore, and had heard about this hotel for a long time. We need a place to stay overnight on new years eve in San Francisco. So I thought we'd try this one. The location is marvelous, right in Japantown / Pacific Heights.Well, the property needs a serious upgrade. It is a very nice Victorian that with the right level of taste and care could be a spectacular hotel. As it stands, sadly, it looks dated, smells musty, and the holidays decor is in poor taste. My recommendation to the hotel: Call Bernardo Urquieta, a San Francisco architect who lives on Lake Street and has immaculate taste.Get the place redone.ASAP.It's a gigantic wastage of a fantastic property to run it with such poor taste and lack of care.And it is way too expensive the way it is at the moment.

I enjoyed my 3-night stay at the Queen Anne Hotel very much. The neighborhood is quiet, parking is convenient, and while the decor is a bit over the top Victorian, it became more and more comfortable and pleasing. I’ll be back!

Though it has been months ago that I visited, I loved loved loved everything about it, from check instaff, to breakfast, to beautiful beautiful beautiful surroundings, to free morning shuttle to anywhere, to gracioushousekeeping staff, helpful concierge, free sherry and cookies in the evening in the fabulous formal parlor. ALL the staff were great, not just the specific ones I mentioned. It was just a wonderful hotel in a neighborhood location, not atall touristy, but very accessible.

My family actually stayed in a lovely corner room with a turret. We were impressed the hotel survived the San Francisco earthquake and fires. We knew nothing of the hotel supposedly being haunted. I half awoke one night to experience a feeling like someone was tucking me in and gently pushing on my collarbone. I thought it was a strangely comforting feeling. The next day, we found out the hotel was supposedly haunted by the former headmistress, Mary - who ran a boarding school for girls. We were told she likes to tuck people in at night! I was shocked and a little freaked out by what I’d experienced the night before. It wasn’t a scary experience, it was comforting. I believe it was Mary.

Amazing staff make the stay at this hotel a wonderful stay. From start to finish the staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating. They remembered our names and helped with other details of our stay. The hotel is full of antiques and it is like stepping into a different era. We had a spacious room and when it got warm, they delivered a fan that did the job. They offer a glass of sherry and cookies in the living room (parlor) in the evening and continental breakfast in the morning. The hotel says it is a "bed and breakfast hotel" and that's exactly the feel. You can sit by a fire in a beautiful setting. We would definitely return to this location.

We visited San Francisco to see La Traviata at the opera, and came across this hotel somewhat accidentally. We were looking for a high quality hotel under $300. We ended up loving this hotel (and the staff). This hotel is like a time capsule from 1890. The first floor public rooms are filled with comfortable antiques that seem in almost new condition. The first floor has a large number of comfortable places to sit and read (including by the fire). Our room was on the 3rd floor. There's a modern elevator, but at least once you have to take the stairs to get the full 1890 effect! Our room faced Sutter street, and we didn't encounter any street noise (and I'm a fairly light sleeper). The breakfast room is large, and also appears from 1890. There were cereals, hard boiled eggs, sausage, waffles, muffins, and a number of other items. The one thing I thought would be a negative (being about 15 blocks from Union Square) turned out to be a positive- no crowds and VERY easy to get an Uber or Lyft. I never had to wait more than 3 minutes. At Union Square, you're competing with dozens of others, and how does your driver find you? We liked this hotel so much, we're going back in December.

Stayed here for four nights and loved my stay at the hotel. We had the superior twin room which had 2 big very comfy double beds. The room had a lovely view from the bay window and was lightly decorated. Staff are friendly and extermelly friendly. Sherry and cookies from 4pm is a nice touch its lovely to relax after a day of sight seeing in the parlour. Breakfast was substainable and again is a nice touch as most hotels don't offer breakfast included. Wish we had stayed here longer to enjoy the room more.

We booked into The Queen Ann Hotel Tuesday night stayed through until Thursday morning. The staff were all very friendly, attentative, warm and welcoming from curb side to check out. This beautiful victorian hotel offers the comfort and convience both in amenities and location to our fun time destinations located in Japan Town. Proximity to Filmore and Geary streets is two blocks walking. The parlor is a lovely wide expanse of antique furniture, cozy fire places and quiet nooks. A fully ready sideboard offers guest a steady hot supply of tea and coffee as well as a 4pm cookies and Sherry. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. Tall ceilings dressed with wide windows we left open all day and all night. The hotel offers continental breakfast of suasages, waffle station, toast various pastry, cerals, tea, coffee amd juice. Parking for hotel is convient to location for a nightly fee. I recommend the parking cost. We caught a show at the Filmore, food and shopping and had a beautiful relax day at the Kabuki Springs and Spa - calling the Queen Ann our home for the length of our stay in reasonably priced accommodation of by gone era beauty and comfort. We will stay here again!

My wife found this place after seeing the apt which I rented through bnb website. let's move on quickly - that was nasty. this hotel felt historic from the moment you walked in the door. sure enough you start to notice the chandeliers, the antique furniture, the pictures, the wallpaper, etc that this place has an incredible story to tell. Asking the concierge, he explained that yes, the building is from the late 1800's. let that sink in for a minute. Now imagine the walls, the furniture pieces, the hand rails to the stairs, the wallpaper, carpets and everything else that is this Queen Anne Hotel. It turns out, that the Hotel as it is today is actually only half of what it once was. The famous fire of 1906, which was destroyed or consumed 80% of the city. Breakfast made you feel like you were Royalty. All the squeaky floors as you walked and the elevator....had the same bench from what I assume was the person who ran the elevator for their guest 100 years ago? It was mentioned later about the supposed ghost that still roams? We felt nothing. no presence of any ghost.

Boutique. Rooms small but well kept.The old world style was great change from other places we stayed on this trip. Car parking across the road was convenientThe sitting area and fireplaces where a great end of day stop.Sadly we where to late most days for the free nightcap but local BWS solved that.

Truly a unique and exceptional experience. If you want to stay in a beautiful, authentic victorian, in a great location in SF, this is the place. It's genuine, and classic. The staff was always happy and smiling, and the morning breakfast experience was very european and delicious! It's a MUST STAY hotel!!

As a family of 4, with 2 teenagers, we needed somewhere close to the city to stay and came across the Queen Anne. It was superb and we would definitely recommend it. The 4 o clock sherry/coffee are a lovely touch. Breakfast was mainly help yourself and was a good start to our days. The decor throughout is victorian and classy. The staff were extremely helpful and chatty. If I had one complaint it was the parking but it seems Califorian hotels like to charge for this service.

We stayed at this place for 3 nights.It is located in a side street, near Van Ness Ave. ICable car, Pier 39 and Golden Gate are well in public transport range.The rooms are simple but neat. The whole place is kept in the style of the late 19th century with paintings of that era and furnishings alike.The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The breakfast buffet was simple but satisfying.A nice place to travel a bit back in time.

We stayed one week and we appreciated the service . The breakfast included is good and the muffins delicious. One improvement could be the opening hours for the breakfast during the week end (8-10am) and more choice in the buffet to have a full brunch

We picked this hotel as we were intrigued by the stories of its haunting. In our two nights here we did not have the pleasure of meeting the ghost of Mary Lake which is supposed to haunt the place. The hotel was quaint, and the breakfast could have been a little more varied. Our stay was pleasant enough, and the decor quaint, although the room was a bit smelly, but maybe this was the effect of Mary Lake? Parking was provided in one of the adjoining side streets and this was a plus. The location for our purposes of seeing the city quickly over two days was a bit out of the way, as we opted not to drive around the city but take a hop on hop off. An interesting stay all in all.

When you stay at Queen Anne you should know what to expect. The decor is 1800's super vintage. The service was great, the beds were clean, the bathroom facilities were easy. It was a very nice and safe location. Fairly quiet and walks to local parks nearby. Good value for money, we would stay there again.

Everything about this stay was amazing. The professional staff, concierge services, rooms, free breakfast, evening everything. The hotel is so historic and the decor so unique that you feel like you went back in time, but with modern amenities (like your own bathroom, hair dryer, fridge). This place is easy to find and is located near Japantown. The only thing that freaked me out a little was the huge window. There is no air conditioning so when we opened the window, to get some air flow, it didn't have a screen. The front desk did give us a fan, though, and the room was still quiet even with the window open. Overall, this hotel is exremely quiet, which is a nice welcome in the hustle and bustle of San Francisco.

Everything needs to be upgraded: the front desk staff, the reservation systems, the breakfast 'club' offering, the rooms, the windows, the gym...This is such a letdown compared to its website, and the past reputation.A bit of a conference hotel rather than upscale attentive tier.

From the top of the mark this hotel has an amazing view of the city but if you don’t pay extra your room won’t. The hallways are dark and the carpets in the rooms are dingy. If you rent a car they charge a lot of money 73$, if you don’t rent a car you have to walk up a very steep hill and San Francisco doesn’t have the best public transportation system. The bathrooms are tiny by American standards . Part of the appeal of the hotel is how old it is but that doesn’t mean the furnishings in the rooms should look dirty

All the best of San Francisco. I had a lovely visit with family, explored the city, went for a run in the park, discovered a new restaurant, browsed in my favorite bookstore and then retreated to my oasis at the Mark Hopkins. On a high floor with an amazing view. My third stay here and it gets better ever time!

Stayed on this hotel on a recent business trip with my partner. Very good location for visiting the city. Close to all sights. I really like this area as it is close to the tenderloin and union square. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. Staff were friendly. We didn't have breakfast or meals here as our days were busy and most meals were planned but we did go to the roof top bar, top of the Mark on a few occasions and it's apparently a city attraction. This hotel is a little pricey but we were on a business trip so wasn't on our budget. I would recommend this hotel for business trip. For leisure, I would like something a little more intimate but having said that, I really enjoyed my stay here. Would recommend this hotel to others. FYI, as with most places in San Fran, the climb up is a bit steep so bear that in mind!

Not much to say other than the hotel is nice, the staff were on the ball, the room was comfortable with good views, the food was lovely and you in a good part of the city. It's not the cheapest place, but we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Enjoyed our stay overall with the exception of 1 night desk person who did not understand what we needed when we stopped at the desk. She seemed to think we wanted room service, but what we needed was housekeeping for extra coffee pods for our coffee maker. Thank goodness for awesome housekeeping! We left a note the next morning and the rest of the stay it was stocked properly for 3 people. The bedding was extremely comfortable and we all slept very well every night. The view from our floor was wonderful too. Sitting up on the hill is a great location!

We arrived at 11.45 pm and there was no one in sight. Having unpacked the cases, we went into the hotel and were greeted by the reception staff member, good professional welcome and informed of the upgrade to room 1528.We were ask if we needed assistance with luggage – a little late – and declined.Whilst the hotel is stunning in design and we were upgraded to a corner suite 1528, the luxury of a secluded club room and that special service that is the brand of IHG InterContinental’s After the original WOW factor of reviewing the suite 1528 , it quickly became clear that it had things for show and functional use was never considered.Try staying in the room for two days.Suite 1528 is a corner suite and the view is stunning however with no drawers in the bedroom to store clothes you cannot hang, and hideous TV (magic) cabinets.Towels are not 5 star. The Shower has no power. Bed feels like it is running downhill and the curtains do not meet and the hotel opposite sign is on all night.The furniture has a lack of scatter cushions to allow you to relax. The backs are so far away I wonder at how tall I would have to be to sit on it comfortably.Staff were professional and friendly. Rooms were clean and had the usual extras, but this was not as good a stay as it might have been.Doorman do not seem to greet and do not appear to be there to open doors (except once) in 5 days.Plus sides – the California cable car stops outside. The Cable Car museum (which is also the engine rooms for the 4 cable routes) is 3 blocks (downhill) = Powell line is one block away.Maybe the other Intercontinental in the Finance district would have been a better stay?

If you want something classy, this is your spot! The rooms are big, old but classical. Great view and a prime location to get a overview over the city. Please check out the top floor for some good times!

Elegance and a timeless landmark of San Francisco. The room is spacious and elegantly appointed. The bed is so comfortable with premium linens and pillows and it affords an excellent night’s sleep. The temperature is easy to control and the bathroom is supplied with Intercontinental’s usual and wonderful Agragria verbena amenities. Avoid the bottles of water (supplied for free in European hotel rooms) unless you want to pay $7 each. The breakfast is expensive but very good. Be certain to watch your check to ensure they charged you for the correct buffet. A15% Tip is automatically included on your tab. We enjoyed the comforts and location and would definite stay here again.

Every time I go to San Francisco I used to sleep at this great hotel in the top of Nob Hill. You are near rather everything (Union Sq, cable car, Chinatown...), without crowd, in a beautiful and safety zone.Good size rooms, with coffe maker for free. Comfy bed, appropriate bathroom. Excellent housekeeping! Good views at sunset grabing a drink at the Top of the Mark.Hope to back soon.

Everything in this hotel is old and old fashioned. Room full of old furniture and dust. Old stains on the wall and furniture. Horribly flat pillows gave no neck support. Room smells old and musty like a basement. The room I was in needs a paint job, a good dusting, and a new lounge chair. The chair looked and smelled gross. Entire hotel is dimly lit and not much natural light gets in. The hotel is dark and depressing in my opinion.

This is a very tired property! It's a shame because it's one of SF's landmark hotels. I'm here for 5 days - checked in last night after a long flight and went to order room service at 10:59 pm and they said I couldn't order a burger because the chefs had already shut everything down...I pointed out the menu says that you can order up until 11pm but they still said no :-(. Then I went to the gym this morning...it's a really small cramped gym. The machines are all old and dirty...the bikes are 10+years old. Only one has the pedal straps, the Sani-wipe station was empty, there were towels piled up so high it looked like it had not been emptied in a couple of days....and when you have clientele the likes of Chris Webber and Shaq who were working out at the same time as I was, you'd think you'd make sure you had the best, most up to date equipment and that it was clean and pristine. The Westin, the Marriott and the Hyatt all have Peloton Bikes and Treads....The condition of this property is Very disappointing!

Since I love riding the SF cable cars, I always stay at one of the big four hotels atop Nob Hill--the Mark Hopkins, Huntington, Stanford Court and Fairmont. Of the four, I prefer the Stanford Court because I find their standard rooms to be the largest. However, you can't go wrong at any of the four especially since they are all located where California Street crosses Powell where all three cable car lines stop. One nice feature of the Mark Hopkins and the Fairmont are their rooftop lounges with wonderful views of entire Bay area.

Luxury abounds in a historic hotel perched on the highest hill in San Francisco. Anything you wish for is just a phone call away and available in over 20 languages and sometimes even more. The views from the historic top of the Mark cannot be beat, from morning fog rolling in over the mountains too sunsets over the Golden Gate bridge. Nothing is too much to ask for and you are right next to two different trolley lines that you can catch right outside the hotel. The famous Tonga room tiki bar is directly next-door in the Fairmont. George, the concierge, is a wealth of knowledge. The dress code from years ago is now California casual in a tasteful and respectful form to bring joy for other international travelers. Bedding is luxurious! Windows open to catch the fresh, and chilly, ocean breeze. Lyft & Uber are always on stand by. Just six minutes from Pier 34.

awesome location, great history and helpful staff. It's pretty close to Union square and helpful if one is game for the uphill walk post a heavy meal. I enjoyed my stay here; a little expensive and would need a little more variety in their in-room dining menu

Welcome to The Mark! that's how the friendly hotel staff at the check-in desk greeted me when i checked-in and the experience throughout my stay is all filled with pleasant surprises from the friendly staff to the happy guests. Highly recommended for family and couples who wants to experience San Francisco (steep approaching roads, historical value of the building and the awesome view from Nob Hill)

We stayed for 2 nights for a weekend getaway, couldn’t have been happier!!! Great room, great views, great service! The only negative was parking; a complete ripoff at $72.96 per night...!!!! No warning about price and even if the money is not the issue, it shows how greedy they are; it’s a shame for such a great place.

The personal touch from each employee. I was welcomed by Hailey the front desk agent. I knew I was checking in early and she said the room was not ready yet, but had a room ready two floors below. So she got me in and new I had a long flight. The Front desk supervisor came out and welcomed me to the hotel and thanked me for being a IHG rewards member. Roy made our stay memorable! He always welcomed me with a smile and his willingness to help. He truly cared about my experience in the hotel and he made clear his pride to work at the Intercontinental. He took the extra mile to find out the nature of my stay and he made sure to ask me how things were going on a daily basis. When he found out that my wife was joining me later in the week, he couldn't wait to meet her and to make her birthday special. He is a genuine person and he made me proud to be a part of this company. Anna was outstanding as well. She greeted me on the first day by my last name and went over all the details about the club lounge. She did a great job on convincing me to order the room service since the food was so good. The club lounge team is awesome. Having the housekeeping staff say good morning every day made my day. Jaap Doelens the F&B Director came over to me in the club lounge Thursday night to see if I needed anything. The F&B team was really helpful and room service was really good. The food options was outstanding. The bellmen helped me with packages and assisting me opening them in my room. I know it is hard to find good staff, you have a great staff at this hotel. Thank you all for making my stay one of the best.

Weekend in San Francisco and good rate for club room relatively last minute. Old fashioned (good way) with professional and charming staff. We had an 11th floor room with good views over Grace Cathedral and distant views of both the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Location was very peaceful at weekend and nice to walk down to both Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero (you will need to take a cable car/taxi/Uber back due to being on top of a very steep hill)The club lounge is a little strange as it is in the middle of the small bar/restaurant on the ground floor. The area is well policed albeit we had some interlopers enjoying the evening snacks one night. There are very few "comfy" chairs - most are stools/high tables, but the décor is classy and service attentive during the evening. Complimentary cocktail food was high quality and the open bar had a small selection of beers, wines and spirits available 5-7pm (it would have been nice to have more soft drinks such as cranberry or tomato juice). Breakfast was a little more chaotic with club guests mixed with the main breakfast service in the small restaurant. Once you were identified as club you were pretty much left on your own after the first coffee was poured. We found Orange Juice at the waiters stations and the buffet had a reasonable choice of breakfast items and was available until 11am if you wanted a lie-in. Fresh fruit (including home made smoothies), cookies, hot and cold beverages were available all day.We really enjoyed this piece of San Francisco history. I would rate it 4.5 stars - not overly luxurious but charming.

I stayed here a few nights ago with a group of friends for a reunion. For starters the hotel is beautiful and the staff is friendly and welcoming; we ran into the general manager Mr. Pace who gave us a great recommendation regarding good brunch spots. Our room was amazing with views of what seemed to be the whole city; as we stayed in a suite and the window in the living room was a direct view of Grace Cathedral. I will defiantly be coming back due to the ambiance and quietness of the overall hotel.

Quick visit to see a friend in San Francisco went really smoothly. Check in was a breeze, was able to head to my room in minutes and then up to the Top of the Mark for a drink and some amazing views. Before heading out for a bite we saw a couple get engaged to everyone's applause - it was a nice, fun atmosphere. After eating, we ended up back there for a night cap. The place was rocking - the band wasn't playing the type of music I'm necessarily into, but it was fun to people watch and see so many people having a good time. Headed back to my room - bed was comfy and clean - slept really well. Buffet breakfast the following morning was extensive and well stocked with something for everyone. Staff were attentive and kept the coffee coming! Check out went smoothly and my car was brought round in minutes with the minimum of fuss. I hadn't stayed at the MH for around 5 years, but it was as great an experience as I remembered.

The hotel is a grand fantastic building with a great reception area. Paid a premium for a "great" view of the city, but the view was at best obscured. The rooms are a bit dated and the beds a little uncomfortable. The appearance of the rooms and fitting in the bathroom appear elegant but the sink and bath often good blocked. It is an old building so as expected the water piping was noisy so sleep was effected when other guest flushed the toilet etc. Overall, we are glad we stayed and accept an old building is difficult to rennovate to modern standards. All the staff were very polite, respectful and helpful. The gym has dated equipment which is maintained well and still functional.

My husband, 4 month old and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved our experience. The room was lovely and spacious even with our travel crib set up and we were able to open the windows for fresh air. The bathrooms are a bit dated but kept very clean as was our room.Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful in all areas.The location was central and fun to access on the cable cars that ran close by. It is at the top of a very steep hill but we knew this when booking and often walked down then caught the cable car back up.Only downside was we didn't get breakfast included and found the options locally a bit limited.Would certainly recommend and come back here ourselves.

The location at the top of Nob hill is a bit of a struggle if you are not fit or dont get a taxi everywhere. Seriously steep hill if you have been out seeming to city and try to walk back.Rooms are large nicely furnished and are quite, we were net to the lift and never heard it once. We used room service which was very good, I tipped the server when he arrived only to find out later that 15% + $5 is already added to the bill, so don't make this mistake.Great concierge and bell boy greet you on arrival.

The only place we stay when traveling to San Fran. Love the intercontinental club and staff is outstanding! It is an experience you will never forget and for me it's always fun to catch up with everybody.

The hotel is beautiful, though aged. Our room smelled like smoke so I opened windows to air out and that worked. Woken up at 445am this morning though, to fresh cigarette smoke drifting in from an adjacent room-disgusting. Can't go back to sleep. I called down to desk,I don't think anyone came up.Go outside to smoke people!! I have a 2nd night here, though Lind of wish I I didnt. I dont want to stay in a room that reeks of smoke. I will update this review after I speak with them today.

Such a lovely hotel, great location and the choice of breakfast was amazing. Everything seemed very lush, clean. I highly recommend this hotel. The only real negative was, the staff, they were not as friendly as you would expect. Having been an IHG member for a while now, I have experienced the difference of being a higher tier which is a real shame for the newer customers.

I remember back when I was in my early 20's visiting San Francisco, I had walked by the Mark Hopkins Hotel and had my picture taken in front of the doors. I remember thinking at the time that I doubt I would ever be able to afford to stay at such a hotel.Well, little faith I had at that time, for this past week my wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. Loved our stay.I would have to say, the service here was exceptional...whether it was the welcome you receive when checking in, or the doorman grabbing the door for you. Our room was always spotless and made up everyday. Loved the location at the top of the hill...kind of centrally located for our needs. The room had all the amenities we needed and the internet was fast and reliable. Tried breakfast and the bar downstairs...excellent. Unfortunately we never made it to the Top of the Mark...next time.The only negative I can offer is the bed...not as comfortable as I would have hoped. Had like a pillow top that clumped up and made sleeping a little difficult.We would definitely stay here again.

This was very nice experience. Service was great! They make you feel like celebrity! Rooms were great and the restaurant on top SUPER!!! Would love to come here more often. I think it is really must visit place, especially if you visiting as a tourist.

Whilst the hotel is a little old fashioned by modern standards this just adds to the ambiance. We booked a club room and as IHG members we got a free upgrade to a bay view. Lovely comfortable room with nice bathroom As club members we had complimentary breakfast and evening drinks with Hor D’ouevres We also visited Top of the Mark. The cocktail bar on the top floor with stunning views of the city. Well worth a visit and if you are staying at the hotel you don’t pay the $10 cover charge

The Mark Hopkins is lovely from a perspective of old-world elegance. Room was very nice and clean. We had a great view (they upgraded us). Food was very good as was the service. Downside is it is at the top of Nob Hill. If you want to take a walk you are going downhill, but getting back is going to require a great deal of effort (or Uber).

There was a convention in town so I understand the $600+ a night rate but this property is mismanaged in many ways. Room had ripped wallpaper and hair in bathtub. Athletic facility had two very old bikes and two treadmills. Almost all hotels now have the Peloton bikes or at least one with a road seat. Front desk didn't know what floor the athletic facility was on. Then they never sent a bill so I had to call. So that's the room, housekeeping, facilities, front desk and billing. That's poor management all the way around.

Realized I left behind an important work document at Top of the Mark and called the next morning. No one willing to access lost & found until after 8am. Excuse was that Housekeeping didn't arrive until then. I really don't believe that manager on duty doesn't have keys. I had to leave for the airport at 6:30am. So too bad for me and my business. Won't return to this hotel. I recommend staying at Fairmont San Francisco next door where they offer outstanding 24hr guest service.

I have to say the service I this hotel is second to none. From the minute u arrive the minute u leave nothing is too much bother. It was my partners 50th birthday the day we arrived and the had complimentary cake and sparkling wine waiting for him. The breakfast buffet is a must. The food is excellent and freshly made and the Greek yogurt is the best ive tried. The rooms are spacious and clean. The only thing I would say is that u should vacuum under the bed as u can seethe dust while sitting on the chair. If we return we will definitely stay again.

Always a great place to stay. Breakfast buffet is worth a try. Always looking for morning coffee, which was available in the lobby; hot and fresh. Room was clean and well appointed. Go across the street to the Fairmont for fresh baked pastry in the morning. Cafe Cento. Was not happy about having to pay extra for Wi-Fi access.

We stayed at the Mark Hopkins for four nights towards the end of December. Upon our arrival we were greeted in the warmest way possible. Even though we arrived a few hours before our scheduled check-in time, we were more than welcome to already go to our room. From our room we had a very pretty view on the park and Grace Cathedral. The hotel is in a very pretty neighbourhood and many attractions are easily walkable (Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz' departure pier). We were also amazed by the architecture of the hotel itself and the decoration of the bedroom and lobby.We both were very happy with our stay, and would immediately recommend this hotel. Only negative point: on of the three elevators was broken (and it took multiple days for it to be fixed) so the wait for a non full elevator could be sometimes more than five minutes.

I had a marvellous time at your hotel. You had several front desk staff people always ready to help me. The room was very tidy and my view was spectacular. I plan to be a guest every time I visit San Francisco.

We stayed at Mark Hopkins, a beautiful hotel at Nobb Hill. Lobby Area was good enough and comfortable. There were coffe facilities at lobby area before the breakfast starts. The staff were quite helpful and kind. On problem, if you want to walk, it stands on a hill and it is not easy to reach, I advise you take a cap.

The Mark Hopkins is a great hotel. It has the classic feeling and the decor is remarkable. Our room was nice and tidy with 2 queen beds. The view left a bit to be desired, but we requested a low room. We enjoyed are stay with easy access to various parts of the city, including Nob Hill, Chinatown, and Union Square.Be forewarned: There aren't many affordable restaurants in the immediate area.
