The breakfast at the Mark Hopkins was very expensive. Each day we were there we walked several blocks in order to have a moderately priced breakfast. The parking is a bit pricey, but that is what you get in San Francisco. It was upwards of $60 a night.Overall it was a good stay. We knew what we were getting into when we stayed at this hotel.

I always enjoy staying here. Always stately and beautifully looked after the beds are great and the hotel has a grace and charm that is comfortable and strangely unpretentious given its Nib Hill address. The team make the experience though. Always helpful and welcoming. The concierge Alberto is a treasure and remembers many of his repeat customers. I always make my way back here when I am in San Francisco.

Hotel is old and dated but the super comfortable bed with Frette sheets makes up to the lack of modern and up to date amenities. I slept so beautifully! Breakfast was great too. Lots of options and very appetising.I had a newbie during check in so that whole check in experience took a while but overall I had a good stay..

Spent 4 nights here in October . First time in San Fransisco . As other reviewers have said -quite dingy and in need of a facelift. Room was ok ,bed comfortable.Had breakfast one day and found it expensive and poor quality in comparison to other hotels we have stayed in. Spent a couple of evenings in the top bar which we enjoyed.Staff up there were great and helped us chose some nice things from the tapas menu, again expensive.Found the location of the hotel to be quite pleasant,lovely breeze and views from the car park. I was tossing up between nob hill and fisherman’s wharf and are glad we chose nob hill.Overall it was an ok stay-certainly woLdnt rush back-but- didn’t see anywhere else I would want to stay either.

The best thing I can say is that there are some nice views, if your room faces the right way. Beyond that, this place is dated, tired, and poorly located. Rooms are small, walls are paper thin. You’l hear your neighbor talk, or snore, or flush their toilet. Windows are single pane, so traffic noise is significant even if you are high up. The Top of the Mark restaurant is fine, but fairly cheesy (beyond the views). No real bar to speak of in the lobby area (four bar stools don’t count). There is nothing within easy walking distance (restaurants, bars, ...). This may have been a prime property at some point in the past. Today, there is no reason to stay here.

The hotel is centrally located on top of a hill. When you arrive at the hotel it looks exactly what you expect from an Intercontinental hotel, a very grand and beautiful building from the outside. This is however the only thing that could impress me during my stay. The doorman should be the face of your hotel but I found them rude and uninterested in guests. They even dared to tell me to tip the driver for the complimentary car service. The rooms are very dated and look tired the rooms are also really noisy. I could hear every conversation of my neighbors and there was a lot of noise from the street. Also, as a IHG platinum Elite member I would have at least expected a bottel of water or some fruit on the room. A bottle of water is present in the room but this hotel dares to charge $7!! per bottle. For my next stay in SF I will definitely book a different hotel.

Lovely grand old hotel rich in history. Its clear the hotel has had recent renovations but in keeping with the historical nature of the hotel. It has a very grand feeling as you enter. The holiday decorations were amazing and beautifully done. The first thing I noticed was the very friendly valet that greeted us as we arrived and never failed to give us a cheery welcome each time we came in and out. The desk staff was also very friendly and accommodating. We also received a lovely note from house keeping each day. We stayed on the 14th floor and the view was excellent, room was comfortable and very nice bedding.

The Intercontinental Mark Hopkins SF is a gorgeous hotel—but exteriorly only. After walking in, there are only 5 registers to check you in and 3 very small elevators to take you up. Each elevator can only hold about 6-7 people (less with luggage) and they run exceptionally slow. During evening hours, one is designated to Top of the Mark and you’re down to 2 elevators. When asked to take the stairs, we were told they don’t go to the 5th floor (that was a lie). Bottom line for the elevators, be expected to wait 5-10 minutes to ride on one. Onto the rooms...While I understand this is a historic icon, the decor is very dated and run down. The bathroom is incredibly small and narrow. There are no outlets by the night stands and only one near the desk. Overall, this hotel needs some renovations to accommodate the influx of customers. It definitely doesn’t hold up to the standard 4 star hotel. The only saving factor for this hotel is the name and location, otherwise it’s very disappointing.

The Mark Hopkins is a San Francisco classic. As such there are some minor inconveniences that come with age. One such inconvenience is the elevator service. The three elevators are small and two service the busy Top of the Mark. During prime times be prepared to wait a long time for an elevator. I recommend the 15th floor for the best elevator service. The middle level floors are difficult for down elevator service. Otherwise the hotel is excellent in all ways. The staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms are clean and spacious. The location at the top of Nob Hill is nice but may be difficult for some to navigate. In summary the Mark Hopkins is an experience to try at least once. For me it will not be a repeat experience but I have a positive memory of the stay.

I stay here a couple of times a year when in San Francisco for events or visiting family and not wanting to drive the hour and a half home, or just to have fun in the City.This most recent visit Thanksgiving weekend was my best because of an upgrade to a suite with an atrium and private terrace. In the past I have upgraded myself (paid) for a room with a large outdoor terrace but it did not have an atrium. I think here is only one room in the hotel with the atrium and terrace.Because this was an upgrade (not paid for) I did not have access to the InterContinental Suite like I have had in the past when staying in a suite here, and that was fine because I have never found the Club InterContinental here to be very exciting. (Although on one stay the Club on the second floor was closed for some reason and they instead were using a hospitality suite on an upper floor - the Mark Hopkins Suite, I believe - and it was much better than the regular Club.)What's not to like about a private atrium and terrace with views of the Golden Gate Bridge all the way to the Bay Bridge? The large bathroom also had a big whirlpool tub which I enjoyed very much. And I love the REAL plants in the suites and rooms at the Mark Hopkins.Because of the wonderful suite I had most meals in and as always, the room service is excellent here. And one evening I got to speak with the room service order-taking person Carolyn who remembered me from past visits. I do feel like family at this property.The only bummer on my stay was a rather tactless bartender at the Top of the Mark one evening.My cousin joined me for the holiday Sunday brunch at the Top of the Mark and while very pricy, the food is very good and you cannot beat the view.Thank you Mark Hopkins for the wonderful upgrade and I very much look forward to my next visit.

We had a girlfriends’ trip to San Francisco planned and were very excited to stay at the Mark Hopkins. We were so very disappointed and would never stay there again. There were so many things that tarnished our stay. The overall property is tired. The furniture in our room was chipped and scratched, there were not enough outlets or mirrors. The beds are very small as well. The hallway was cluttered with dishes and trays outside of doors and it looked like the hallway carpets hadn’t been vacuumed in a very long time.The elevators are very slow and we took to walking the stairs to the 12th floor. Many people are coming to The Top of the Mark , but they really should have a separate elevator for them. We went up to enjoy a cocktail at The Top of the Mark, wish I could say we did. We waited to get in...no problem, but the waiting area is so small. People were jammed in elbow to elbow. When we were finally seated, we waited 45 minutes and never even got a glass of water, which we asked for twice, We realize a wait is inevitable, but 45 minutes for water is not okay. We ended up leaving because there was no point in waiting any longer. We let the hostess know why we were leaving and went elsewhere. We also let them know at checkout about the experience. We’ve been on many girls’ trips and don’t expect perfection. We do expect good customer service from a highly touted hotel. I can not recommend this hotel and would suggest splurging and staying across the street at The Fairmont.

This hotel was originally built in the 1920s. Hotels of this age can be pretty quirky with small rooms and tons of architectural character. But this place is fantastic. The rooms are spacious with huge windows that have fabulous views of the San Francisco skyline in the higher floors. From our room in the 9th floor we had views in three directions. The windows open bringing in lots of fresh air, yet the rooms are quiet and comfortable. The service at the hotel was fantastic. We only experienced the breakfast buffet which was excellent. They offer Asian styled breakfast, Italian style breakfast, and the normal American favorites. The service in the dining room was super friendly and warm. We were there during the Christmas season and there were choirs in the lobby and Santa was also there visiting with children in front of an enormous Christmas Tree. A very, very festive holiday spot. Great for just a visit if not a stay. Location at the top of Nob Hill was perfect. Close to Union Square and all the holiday deliciousness and festivities. Plus the price was outstanding. I have a love for Intercontinental properties as I’ve stayed at some great ones and this one does not disappoint.

What a fantastic hotel.....great location.....gorgeous opulent rooms.....bathroom spotless and lovely bath..staff very helpful and friendly couldn’t ask for better.....roof top bar has fabulous views of the city....

My wife and I stayed at the Mark Hopkins Hotel on November 27, 2019 to celebrate her birthday. From the greeting of the bellman to the front desk attendant to the housekeeper everyone projected the hospitality spirit and gracious service. The front desk attendant was so helpful and sensitive to our questions.And the room! WOW! An amazing view of Nob Hill! We felt we were on top of the world! We had a drink at the Top of the Mark. Again, the excellent service was exemplary and our server provided some history of the classic room.We had a wonderful experience at the Mark Hopkins Hotel We’ll stay again!

Stayed a couple of years ago with my girlfriend and recently came back for a solo business trip. I'm glad to say that my 2nd experience was just as excellent as our 1st and I'm very glad that I came back. Location is excellent, but be prepared to walk uphill/downhill from every direction. I enjoy walking so that didn't bother me and you'll be a short walk to Union Square, Polk St, Chinatown, Ferry Building, North Beach, Financial District...you get the point. It's all right there and if you don't want to walk, it's incredibly easy to find Uber or taxi. Powell St Bart station is just 10 minute walk away.Check in/out was incredibly quick and easy. Service was just as friendly as my last visit and room cleanliness was great. Bed was super soft, nice amenities including a decent fitness center and wifi is reliable and fast. (Sign up as a member to get free wifi) It really is a fantastic hotel in San Francisco. I'll be back for a 3rd visit soon!

Great service all the way around, truly an Intercontinental Life living experience. Check in was great, concerige, fitness room with the hydration station machine (I want one of those!), breakfast and of course, drinks at the Top. All were wonderful and was a great way to spend a few nights in the city. Cable car museum is easily walkable about 3 blocks away (downhill) and Grace Cathedral is only a block away.

If you're looking to be close to fisherman's wharf - the location is perfect (3 min walking distance). The hotel is clean, modern and convenient and the team friendly. The only issue i had there was that the toilet wasn't flushing well but the team was great and fast in addressing this.

The hotel is far away from being a resort and the extra charges you apply are not fair. When you enter the website and it shows the rate per night that should be what you have to pay. That's it!!! Will not return nor recomend anyone else to be fool around.

Fabulous location, superb service, clean and elegant. Loved the coffee and free bikes to use . Great way to see the city. Concierge was exceptional, arranging transfers and excursions. Fire pit outside was well received in the evenings.

Room was super duper great, mirrors on room makes it stunning to see, the front desk lady is a really nice and helpful indonesian, i have a problem about my ups shipping and she’s willing to help me! what a really nice and gratitude action of hers!

The location of this hotel cannot be beat, and it is a beautiful property. However, don't associate a large price with large space. The rooms are beautiful, but small.Beware of the resort fee that is not included when you reserve through expedia and will be charged when you depart. The resort fee does not give you many perks. Coffee and water are provided, but no breakfast is included (however this seemed to be pretty standard for other hotels in the area). Overall it was a good stay!

Hotel is located right next to Fishermans Wharf, the Big Bus Route Start and Embarcdaro. Access to the E Line was within a block of the hotel which is great if planning to take in a Giants game. Room service value was good even though they only seve breakfast. Service was top notch.

Staff too busy chatting amongst themselves to be bothered to serve. Having a laugh and ignoring clients. It’s not just once it’s happened, this morning no one bothered to take a food order then this afternoon tried to order drinks to be told the bar staff would be over for them to be chatting amongst themselves and didn’t come after 5 minutes so walked out! They stand there having a chat.... it’s not good.Chose because of the good reviews and location.... wish we’d chosen different

the only positive thing about the Zoe Hotel was FrankHe's the guy who took care of our luggageWe wer perplexed to be charged $33.00 for amenitiesWhat amenities? No coffee pot in the room for exampleThe room were small for the outrageous price. Worst service I had ever experienced in the restaurant. There are too many great hotels in San Francisco.Do your homework folks. Stay anywhere but the Zoe

Rooms were great. Location great. Incidental fees not so great. Very modern and clean. The courtyard was very nice. The restaurant was pricey and the menu was not big. Overall the experience was enjoyable.

This hotel is a great choice if you want to be centrally located and close to Pier 33 (Alcatraz), Dylan’s Tours meeting place (electric bikes!), and of course Fisherman’s Wharf. The pillows and bed were extremely comfortable and there was even a white noise machine provided. The room was small but everything was well thought out. It’s expensive but that seems to be the price you pay for SF. Within an easy walk of all sorts of good breakfast places.

Great hotel in a really good location for visiting the main tourist attractions. The room we were given was large and comfortable with a good bed and bathroom. Staff were very helpful and check in was well handled.While Fisherman's Wharf is not great there are plenty of places to eat and the access to the boats across to Alcatraz are within walking distance.All in all a great stay at a lovely hotel in a fantastic city

Worst hotel experience. Not a 4 star, even a 3-star is better than them. more like a 2 star hotel. Avoid them like a plaque, if you can. On top of the experience hotel charges, they have lots hidden fees, such as resort fee charging for $37 per night for you wifi and hot water, never heard of. $60/day for your parking. $100 per nigh deposit. Very rude services, and they don't care as they locate clear to the tourist attraction -fishmen wharf. They benefit from the convenient location--that's all. Very tiny room and noisy hard to sleep. You pay a 5-star premium to get a 2-star service.

great hotel! rooms are nice, bathrooms are nice, lots of space. Like all things, anything you open will be charged to your room. Do not think that the water is free! It is a lovely place though, connected to a pizzeria and a great bar, with plenty of lounging areas downstairs. They also have a gym you can use in another building. A really great place, and the staff were really helpful!

I booked a room online and it was booked on the incorrect date. When I arrived the next day I was informed the room was booked from the next before and there was nothing they could do to refund my room or give me a credit for the night that should have been booked.

Wonderful boutique hotel. Walk to Fisherman's Wharf, bikes for use, great Italian restaurant,on bus line, comfortable rooms. Good value. We went to Wharf and took ferry to Alcartaz for audio tour. Try it is a kick.

Great location. Easy to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 & Ghiradelli Square. Rooms are nice, clean and loved some of the extra thoughtful amenities like complimentary umbrella and clothes steamer in the room. Courtyard with fire pits is wonderful!

Hotel Zoe is pretty much what you might expect from a city centre hotel It was well furnished with a nice large lobby offering water all day and coffee in the morning.The staff were generally very helpful and any requests were dealt with promptly. The reception did get overwhelmed quite often. I felt the concierge wasn’t particularly keen to find out what we wanted but more to offer things that they get a commission on. However she was helpful with general information.There was a small bar and the drinks were quite expensive but nothing out of the ordinary for San Francisco. The room was smallish but well catered and serviced every day.The outside area off the lobby was pleasant and also the fire in the main area - we warmed ourselves at it a few times after coming in from a foggy walk along Fisherman's Wharf.The location was excellent - two minutes from Fisherman’s Wharf and near the trolley bus to Union Square. We thought the Italian restaurant attached was quite ordinary foodwise and the dinner menu expensive- dinner seemed to offer less choices that lunch leaving on the more expensive options for evening dining. Staff were lovely though.They pulled the stops out getting an taxi for the airport when our SuperShuttle let us down badly - being able to summon a taxi immediately. Many thanks!There were bike and scooters to use which was a nice touch even though we didn't use them.

Zoe was a positive surprise. Easy access by car, good parking facilities, and excellent service. The hotell has clean, quiet, and spacious rooms.The hotell provides a great starting point for exploring San Francisco.I recommend Zoe for your next stay om San Francisco, especially if your stay is for experiencing Fisherman's Wharf and the surrounding sights.

I'm so glad I found this hotel on Trip Advisor. This hotel is very clean, the staff was friendly and pleasant and the front desk was always able to answer any questions we had about the area. We also ate at the restaurant one night and the food was fantastic. One evening, we sat by the gas fire pits in the courtyard and had a drink while our children played cornhole. They even have soft blankets to bundle up by the fire. We will definitely stay here again when we return to San Fran.

Nice location - of course, prices very high in SF. Was easy access to all of the amenities. The concierge desk was hard to find - look for them. If you take the stairwell instead of the elevators, the smell is not pleasant.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Zoe. The location was excellent and so close to Fisherman's Wharf and all the shopping, eating, and tourism. It was also within walking distance to Little Italy where we had a fantastic authentic Italian dinner. The rooms were very nice (a little smallish), but nicely decorated and appointed. But we really loved the lobby and outdoor common area. It was really nice to hang in the outdoor area with the fire pits, candles, and sofas. We really enjoyed it. Great hotel......we would definitely stay there again.

we found hotels expensive in San Francisco. This hotel was very nice though ,staff friendly, restaurant quite good value and good staff. location very good for pier 39. Valet parking $70 plus tax a night but all good hotels seem to charge around that in this area

Easy walk to most attractions, a block from Fishermans wharf, short walk to great restaurants. Friendly, helpful staff. Very nice room, clean with comfortable beds. Was surprised by resort fee with not that many amenities that pertained to us.

Hotel Zoe is a very nice boutique hotel conveniently located in Fisherman’s Wharf. Rooms were very clean and very comfortable. Reception staff was very accommodating after a mix-up in our reservation through a booking agency. Jurita was so professional and was able to fix our dilemma. I highly recommend Hotel Zoe. Ask for Jurita for special attention.

We stayed here for six nights at the end of our three week trip to northern California. On the plus side the location is good, close to pier 39 and fisherman's wharf. The concierge is very helpful and the rooms are ok. Front desk staff were very hard nosed and made absolutely no allowances for the fact that we were staying six nights, which I think is poor on their part. Every request was batted straight back from a later checkout to a quiet room. I paid up front in April and was then emailed with a special offer by the hotel of $20 a night spend in Pescatore. All I got was one $20 spend which in the small print said it was only valid for lunch and dinner-not breakfast. This is penny pinching your guests and not good customer service. In our whole 3 week trip, this hotel was the least accommodating and welcoming and we just felt like impersonal 'numbers'.

Excellent hotel facilities and staff. Great to have coffee available in the morning. Lovely spots to sit and relax around open fires. Staff supported me very well when the airline misplaced my luggage. Easy location to walk along Fisherman's Wharf, catch the cruises and hop on hop off buses. Concierge was extremely helpful.

This is my first trip to California so I wasn't sure what to expect but the room in a good size, bathroom clean and updated. The staff are friendly. What a quaint hotel! I love the location, just a few minutes walk from Pier 39. The décor reminds me of an Asian/Modern tastes. There is an in-hotel restaurant that I will try this week. Two elevators (which is a plus!) The hotel offers valet parking so I don't have to fight for parking spots!! This hotel was about $60 less expensive than the counterparts but I am defintiely impressed. The valet parking was $20 more than the park-yourself option but I think the service for not finding a spot myself is worth it. Other immenities - voucher for continental breakfast at Pescatore, coffee and water in the lobby, free wi-fi access, $20 Pescatore credit per stay, access to 24 Hour Fitness (across the street), bike rental, ipads and wireless printing, and a few discounts for attractions.I would definitely stay here again.

Nicely placed to walk to locations we needed to visit. Staff were very helpful.. internet was an issue they sorted it.If you don't have your room cleaned you save money on the restaurant next door. This was reasonably priced too.

This hotel is really nice, and is an affordable option on Fisherman's Wharf. Location is great; 15 minute  or less walk to lots of options (Giradelli Square, Pier 39, big bus tour launch, etc.). Service was very good. Rooms were clean - no issues there. Breakfast at the on-site restaurant was very good and not over-priced for the area. We had two families, 8 people total, and would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel, great staff, close to the Wharf. Not much else to say other than this is a must stay hotel when visiting SF. Trip Advisor wants me to lengthen my review to help but the only help I can give is to book this hotel now!

Small rooms but plenty of space for suitcase and shelves for toiletries. Good morning coffee service. Clean and still new looking. Temperature control in room was excellent. Sound proofing was lacking; even on the 4th floor, noise from the courtyard where they must have cornhole and seating was quite loud. Restaurant attached to the hotel is overpriced for the quality and type of food (pasta) but that's kind of the norm in this tourist location. I highly recommend the dim sum restaurant in Ghirardelli Square though; the walk isn't far.

Very clean and modern hotel with a great location. We were able to check in early and had a promotion that included parking. Easy to valet park and very helpful bellman (Frank is the best!). Great coffee & tea in the morning plus a $20 voucher to use at the restaurant which has a great Italian menu plus wood fired pizza. Nice outdoor seating area too. Easy to walk to everything!

Hotel Zoe is a perfect location. Pier 39 is 5 or 10 minute walk, Trader Joe’s, Safeway & Walgreens just steps from the hotel. Zoe staff are very friendly, efficient and helpful. Also the Italian restaurant was great.

We loved Hotel Zoe. Check in/out was very efficient. The entire hotel has a modern style and is very well done. The rooms were clean however if you opt to not have the linen changed they don't even empty your trash. The valet service is quick but this hotel is walking distance to everything around Pier 39. We would stay here again

Absolutely nothing stands out about the quality of the hotel, service, or amenities that justify such high nightly rates (over $800 for two weed day nights). I was told my "perk" for staying there would be free wifi... what hotel these days doesn't already offer free wifi already? The mattress was very worn and had a noticeable depression in it. The staff were slow to respond to inquiries and requests. Would not recommend this hotel unless is was absolutely the last option available.

Great place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf. While San Francisco is outrageously expensive to visit, this is a hotel that I can highly recommend. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There is a fridge in the room. The staff is wonderful. We only had breakfast in the morning, but the fresh fruit was outstanding. Every fruit in the bowl was at the peak of ripeness and freshness. The coffee was probably the best drip coffee that I have ever had in a restaurant. The location of the hotel can't be beat. There is a trolley station just a couple of blocks away. You are only a couple of blocks from the heart of Fisherman's Wharf as well. There is a Safeway store right next door. Would definitely stay here again.

Been visiting the Tuscan for nearly 30 years - Always a first class operation and experience. The conversations and friends made at the evening wine tastings (no longer) were unforgettable. The Zoe has turned the lobby into a sterile European hospital waiting room look. The only saving feature is the Pescatore restaurant, which still has great food and staff, but for how long? We won't be back

First thing first; the front desk lady who checked us in was just plain rude from the start. And, this was even before we officially checked in. I think being a boutique hotel doesn't mean you don't train your staff. I was traveling with my wife and 1 year old kid, and was staying for 3 nights. This hotel is not a kid friendly place; we were given room on 1st floor where there are about 8-10 flight of stairs from the lobby. I requested if they can allocate a room that has elevator access such as a 2nd floor, and the message I got was this was the last room and we are fully booked. There isn't a ramp where you can take your stroller; we have to literally lift the stroller when our kid was sleeping up and down the stairs!!! They couldn't provide with very basic things that every other hotel in San Francisco provide, such as - Microwave/Kettle to heat milk, and Baby Cot. For the price we were paying, we could've as well gotten at the bigs ones such as Hyatt or Marriott as their staff will be properly trained and are kid friendly. The cleanliness of the room was subpar; we noticed hair on the bed upon checkin and when complained, was moved around to a different room on the same floor. So they did have rooms available; they just lied about it.

We booked this hotel for one night in San Fran before heading to Napa. We stopped in the restaurant in the afternoon for a cocktail. Marlowe makes a GREAT Cosmo! We came back that evening for a late bit and were very disappointed in the food and at the fact that we saw a roach crawling across one of the booths/seats.Breakfast in the restaurant was also disappointing. There's a good breakfast place down the block called Hollywood.

From the moment I arrived I was impressed with Hotel Zoe, I think its a hidden gem out of the San Francisco hotels. As long as the price is reasonable in comparison to other hotels, I'll never stay anywhere else again!

Clean spacious hotel room, trendy. Location was only a couple blocks from the wharf and tourists sites. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The food from Pescatore was tasty and filling. Easy access to amenities.

Jose has great customer service skills. He made the check in experience bearable and kept a smile on his face and mine. I appreciate the fact that he explained everything well and listened to my concerns.I disagree with the $33.77 AMENITIES charge. I would like to choose what I want and not be charged regardless. I felt this was unnecessary and didn't get a sufficient answer when I questioned the charge.

Ideal San Francisco hotel right in Fishermans Wharf. Rooms were very clean and quiet. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great value hotel. Will definitely stay again when next we stay in San Francisco

This hotel is in a perfect spot! Just a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, a block from the Powell line trolley, and a 15-20 minute walk to the Ferry Building....all things we do in SF no matter how many times we go. They had fresh fruit water every day, a nice restaurant and friendly staff and doormen. Uber knows the place well too....highly recommended, will go back again for sure!

Perfect location, a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and a Cable Car station, walking distance to North Beach. The staff is friendly and attentive. The rooms are clean. Loved the complimentary strawberry or lemon infused waters.

We booked this hotel last minute through AAA when our original hotel did not suit our needs. We were beyond satisfied!The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The building itself is beautiful and clean. The rooms though on the smaller side are efficient and comfortable. The food was fresh and delicious.If I have any critique is the additional fees charged on top of the AAA rate and that our room service breakfast was delayed more than 1/2 hour past the scheduled window, but the staff did call to apologize and confirm we still wanted it before they brought it. Also, an in room coffee option would have been nice.

Great location, room clean, helpful staff, easy access to the Alcatraz pier and public transport. Note, use the laundromat in the Safeway next door, bar did shut around 10:30 but not a problem for us. Free coffee and papers each morning

Some of the best hotel service i have ever had! From Frank, the man who helped us with our bags, to Jose, the front desk concierge, the service was phenomenal. Every day in the elevator the staff would always ask how are day was and how we were doing. It also helped having a five star water station on the first floor. The valet service was extremely kind and easy to work with. Would definitely recommend to anyone!

Stayed here for our first stay in San Francisco. Ideal location. We were able to walk to the ferry terminal to go to Alcatraz. We were so close to the Fisherman’s Wolf cable car stop we able to get the first one at 8.15 no lines! We felt safe. The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel is very good.

We booked this place because it looked nice and was walking distance to see Beach Blanket Babylon. Booked a suite at $700 for 1 night. Ended up in nothing more than a standard hotel room next to an elevator with a view of a neighboring building wall. Eat dinner at the hotel restaurant and go to their outdoor patio with fire pits for a drink. At 10:00 p.m. they turn off the pits and tell us to leave because they are shutting down for the night. Only positive is the staff were nice and helpful.

Starting our Caliroad trip couldn't have been better. Great location for piper 39 & embarcadero. FOH team, reception team all genuinely pleased to see you and to help. Great free room upgrade. Superb modern rooms. Excellent food in Pescatore restaurant

Avoid room 140. The room is on the first floor and has a window which overlooks an adjacent outdoor/kids play area. Unless you're happy to be woken by the sound of a basketball being bounced off your window - suggest that you request that you are not allocated room 140 when make a booking. Also, even if you are getting in late/leaving early - there is a "resort fee" of about AUD50 to cover things like "free wifi", ice water and local telephone calls. Probably better suited to longer stays that a quick overnight stop over.

The rooms are small but had just what we needed. The location was great. We were able to Bart and walk everywhere we wanted to go. The rooms were spotless and the staff were incredibly friendly. It’s a great price and a great hotel for a weekend trip.

Moment we checked in we felt like the hotel had their hands in our pockets.Cost for parking at the hotel is 70$ + taxes for a large SUV.We found secure 24 hours parking above SAFEWAY supermarket right next to a busy 24hrs Gym on the 2nd floor on Mason street at the crossing of North Point Road. This was at 36$ flat for 24 hours and could be accessed any time. We even left our bags in the car overnight to make early start to the airport next morning.We requested a room with a bit of a street view but was told by the receptionist that ALL rooms were only courtyard views. Later when we walked out and noticed a large no. of street view rooms.Don't expect complementary tea/coffee in the room. On request it will come at a cost of 29$ per day as GUEST AMENITIES FEE which was never mentioned to us when we requested for one.When we arrived in our room my daughter mentioned the toilet was as big as an Aircraft toilet & in reality it was only slightly bigger.Housekeeping require you to be out of your room by about 11 am or else they put notes under your door saying the room will not be cleaned that day.Better be very sure about your Check In & Check Out dates as they DO NOT refund any money if you make changes to your bookings under any circumstances.

Stayed at this hotel for the 2nd time in one year. Got to stay in the upgraded room which is pretty neat except for the noise. The loud sounds of the elevator are so disturbing through the night that their fancy sound conditioner failed to beat! However we left very disappointed because my 2.5 year olds’ stuffed animal got lost from our room. We probably left it in our bed and during cleaning it may have been taken away accidentally by the cleaning staff. It could’ve been something more valuable and it just goes to show how careless their cleaning staff is. I tried reaching out to the front desk, lost and found and then also the manager about it but they couldn’t do anything. The issue was reported within an hour and still they couldn’t do anything about it. Hard to believe they couldn’t track their laundry and don’t know where it went. We left very disappointed because our 2.5 year old has no way to understand what happened to his baby shark and is pretty sad. I hope they are able to still find it and ship it to us as they promised and also are very very careful in the future when making the beds and cleaning the rooms to not be wrapping up people’s precious things in.

My sister works for Marriot so I get the explorer rate which is awesome. I booked two rooms thinking that I could use the assuming I could use the rate for both. I had no idea I could not . My sister never told me and I’ve used my rate just on one room many times. So when I arrived to check in the woman at the check in counter told me the rate cannot be applied for a second room . Not knowing this I told her , “ I had know idea about that rule. Honestly I was not informed and definitely don’t want to get my sister in trouble “. She explained she is going to have to charge me for a cancellation fee. I told her it was an honest mistake could you please let me slide on the fee or could you call the manager? So she called the manager, And explained that I had the explore rate and I booked two rooms do we charge a cancellation fee? I am in a Repton said you didn’t tell her I made an honest mistake and I didn’t know that! She whispered in the phone he says he didn’t know that. Long story short I talk to them manager face to face she wasn’t budging to charge me the whole I’ve been out of the room as cancellation fee didn’t want to hear my story followed me around the lobby as I went to the bellhop I was so mad I’m in barest for Marriott as I know they’re not like this I will never stay at that place ever again. I will tell all my clients not to stay there. The whole point being she didn’t have the time or day to listen to my explanation I screwed up I’ll be accountable. If I have to be a cancellation fee I’d have to be a cancellation or I just keep the room she was rude and I wish I got her name !!! Work at hospitality that’s not how you treat people Period!

Had the opportunity to attend the MuleSoft user conference. The hotel did a nice job hosting the conference. Disappointed that all of the conference facilities were underground. Good to be able to walk around the Yerba Buena neighborhood during our breaks and afterward.

The Marriott Marquis located on 4th street of SF. My first impression of the hotel is that it felt grand. The moment you checked in, the lobby was huge. They were currently remodeling the lobby when I arrived. I was on a business trip and I did not really get to enjoy the spa and the club level as much as I can.

This was a fantastic stay! From check-in until I checked out 4 days later, the staff went out of their way to ensure my stay was enjoyable. The staff at the desk and the concierge gave wonderful suggestions on tours and businesses within walking distance. The housekeeping crew did a fantastic job on my room and were very courteous when they came in contact with us. The staff and the FOOD at the executive lounge (M Lounge) was excellent! The staff was always friendly and the food.... best food at a lounge!!! This hotel is in a great area and special thanks for lost and found for returning my items after I checked out!!! Amazing and above and beyond the Bonvoy experience I was expecting. I’m coming back!!!!!

Excellent stay for my family at a good location!It is located near Union Square where we can find dining and shopping options easily. At the same time, there are plenty of transport options as well bringing us to various parts of SF without problem.Room we stayed in was newly furbished and of good size. Despite the crowd over the Memorial Day weekend, there wasn't any delays on the elevators. Having a longer line at the concierge and counters was understandable but it didn't affect their services.we did not opt for breakfast and found plenty of options like Denny's, Starbucks and other coffee places.An enjoyable stay indeed! will not hesitate to return!

This is hotel is very conveniently located for people who are at SFO for business to be conducted downtown. I stayed here to attend a conference at Moscone Center and it was just walking distance from the hotel. It wouldn't be wrong to describe that the hotel is located centrally being just walking distance from Union Square and other landmark places.Its a very busy hotel and yet the front office is smooth and prompt in its service. I got to stay at the 19th floor at one of the newly remodelled rooms - as the reception executive described- and i found the room spacious and accommodative. The window overlooked the Museum of Modern Art (MOMA) and St Patrick Catholic church. The room came equipped with a wifi Tablet providing info about the city and the hotel. Many services of the room could be time managed with this tab - which is a good feature. The room had utilities like iron/ironing table and an electric kettle. The breakfast at the hotel was very substandard but I truly believe that it was so because the rooms were bought as a block deal by the conference managers who decided on a low cost menu to boost their own margins. The hotel shouldn't have agreed for such a third class breakfast plummeting their own standards. That's the only bleak spot on their repertoire during my stay.

My room was right next to an elevator shaft. The constant movement of the elevators was heard and felt at all times of day and night. Really poor experience. I didn't ask to be moved because I had unpacked all of my belongings and work material for a 4 night stay - mistake on my part. My room was also not cleaned on one of the days.

Concierge lounge is very large and has good refreshments. Location is very convenient and the rooms are large. Valet parking is easy to access and is covered. Lobby is very large and is a good place to meet.

Matte and Mike worked the front desk and were awesome ambassadors of Marriott the way they handled customers with issues there were in front of me. I remember the situation seem complicated however they handled it with ease and as they moved to take care of me with a smile. I love this place and Marriott. Thanks guys. Keep up the great work. Awesome face if Marriott and San Francisco.

First, I will say the staff were wonderful across the board. The newly renovated hotel included the following deficits: inexplicable flashing light on the phone, lamp by the bed did not provide enough light to read a picture book, no adjustable desk chair, only one chair in the suite (bedroom and sitting room), no luggage rack (actually nowhere to set luggage except the floor or in the sitting room), the sofa was no more comfortable than sitting on a park bench, and no room service. The biggest problem is that the shower stall had absolutely nothing to hold onto - someone is going to fall and the hotel will be vulnerable. Again, staff were super responsive but they can't change the furniture or redesign the shower! And this was not a cheap stay. Over $1300 for four nights.

This location was perfect. Lots of restaurants and shopping. The room was beautiful, updated and very clean. The bed was so comfortable. The staff were very helpful and informative. Only negative-The over night parking charge was very expensive. Overall, great experience!

We stayed at the hotel 3 nights in may of 2019 to attend a conference . they provide me with a lower level room. Front desk lady was helpful so was the supporting staff. However at the time of checking out unfortunately came across a middle aged non white desk clerk he was not only rude but painful to see that person like him works for Marriott Marquis.

We were with a tour group. Our room was excellent. The location was great as several things to see in the area. There are many places to eat close by and also close to various forms of transportation.

The location is ideal for the central city exploring. The accommodations and hotel are first class. Within walking distance are some of SF's most interesting sites, restaurants, museums, etc. Marriott's reputation lives up to itself.

Check in process was a little confusing because the app didn’t really specify what to do once checked in online. The app did not work to access key less entry and the chat to ask questions function. The tablets inside the rooms were not helpful (could not figure out information about room service, car rental, etc.)and had outdated information for the restaurants (specifically B55 - menu was old so all items that we wanted to order were unavailable). Other than that everything else was great.

The Marriott staff was wonderful from doormen to housekeeping. The location is very good for walking to a number of great restaurants and Yerba Beuna Park/MLK Memorial and many art museums. St. Patrick's Catherdral is next door as well.

Excellent facility with very professional and friendly staff. The bed was very comfortable. My window faced the inside courtyard and it was weird not having a view to the outside. The lights in the room where hard to find.

Fantastic hotel, great location, wonderful staff and great modern room. When we are next in San Francisco, we will automatically book here again. It is our honeymoon and I am thankful for the extra effort they made to make us feel special. Check in staff were amazing and gave us lots of good advice about where to eat, and things to see and do. We took their suggestions and it added to our experience. Note (for new guests) - overnight parking is expensive, but its the norm for this city.

We will always see to it that we booked in same hotel when in San Francisco. We love the staff soo approachable, accomodating and courteous. The hotel is clean and very cosy. We love this hotel. Long live San Francisco Marriott Marquis

I stayed at the Marriott Marquis for 4 nights in June, while attending a conference. Everyone from the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff and restaurant personnel were so friendly and helpful. The newer room was beautiful, with an incredibly comfortable bed and pillows and a fabulous bathroom with walk-in shower. Around the hotel are a variety of restaurants, and the sights of San Francisco are a short cab ride away (Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Chinatown, Presidio, Golden Gate bridge, etc.).One thing to consider, however, is this hotel and this city is EXPENSIVE. It's also difficult to see so many homeless people passed out on the street, outside of restaurants and in the parks. Lastly, regarding the conference: the space itself was fine (but in the basement, like many other hotels so no natural light) but the food that was served each day was HORRIBLE. Some of the worst conference food I have ever had. The first two days we were served the same dry kale salad (just dressed a bit differently each day), the same tasteless dry chicken breast (just prepared differently each day), with no option for something else to drink but water or coffee/hot tea with dessert. The continental breakfast was also EXACTLY the same each morning, except one day they didn't offer the boiled eggs that were served the other days.

Great choice in a comfortable and modern hotel in the center of San Francisco.Used inside Hertz rental option twice for excursions in the surroundings.Area wasn't ideal (beggars and homeless frequently hang around) but it is safe and strategically positioned to connect with transportation system.

Centrally located in downtown San Francisco, Marquis offers some greats views (from 39th floor) and a refurbished check-in and restaurants (ground floor). Great for visiting SF MOMA, SF Symphony & Opera and other museums, and v. close to Union Square and tram rides to Fisherman's Wharf. V. friendly, efficient check-in staff and reasonable rooms with comfy beds!

We have just spent 28 days since May 1 in Marriott hotels from Florida to Memphis to St. Louis to Napa to San Francisco. Hilton Head was our favorite -- great staff and amenities, with San Francisco a close second. We won't be going back to the Memphis Marriott. Really amazing how the desk people at reception can make a difference, as well as the staff in the restaurants.

Excellent location close to 4th Street and Market Street muni. Many restaurants very close. Room 6043 was very spacious window overlooked roof but we were not in our room long. Beds were extremely comfortable with a spacious bathroom area. Fluffy towels and accessories at ee provided. If you are short on time and need of a quick bite for breakfast the downstairs cafe is very good. I enjoyed the visual wall display of California attractions.

We were greeted straight away and had awesome valet and bell service. Our bellman was the best. He told me he’d unload everything and I need to take a break...I’m on vacation! Loved that! He drew things out on the map of some great places to visit and refreshed our memories since it had been 12 years since we have last come to San Fran. The room was perfect for our family of 6. They even brought extra towels and a pack n play for us. My kids loved the view from our room! The only thing I wish they had was a shelf under the sink. But other than that the room and service was spot on!!

I want to say thanks to Sabina at the FD she was very friendly and helpful person ,she gave me a directions to all the places I have to visit when I am at SF She need to be recognize as a employee of the month ( employee like her need race) I hope her boss read this review because people like Sabina need to be recognize Thanks again I hope next time when I visit SF I can stay again at this property The bar at top floor is just amazing awesome place that you can get a drink and very friendly bartenders ( I can say this if you stay at San Francisco for a few day and you are looking for a nice hotel this is the place you need

When we arrived to the hotel, checked in, to going to our room the service and staff were amazing. Loved the hotel, service and amenities. The M LOUNGE was one of the best we have been to. Would recommend this hotel to everyone going to the San Francisco area.

Stayed here the first week of June. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The ease of check in was nice. The location of the hotel was good because it was a short trip to the BART and cable cars. I didn’t take taxi/Uber/Lyft one time. Not the hotels fault but be prepared for quite a few homeless roaming the area and asking for things. My room was spotless. I opted to not have my room cleaned in exchange for free WiFi which is absurdly expensive for WiFi. My biggest complaint was I bought a soda from The Pantry that was 6 months expired. Overall I would stay here again for the convenience it brought getting around and the cleanliness of the rooms was better than most hotels I stay at.

Staff was amazing and helpful. Facility was beautiful in a beautiful location. The View bar was a great way to end our night. Checkout was great. The lobby is a really busy place, but the hospitality manager was waiting at the front desk line. He gave a great, friendly greeting, took my room key envelope, asked how I wanted my bill (email) and we were out the door in seconds. Amazing.

My husband, son and I were first-time visitors to SF and after searching many hotels decided to go with the touristy area of Union Square. We are very pleased that we chose this hotel since it was close to many things we needed and close enough to the sights we wanted. We got an Executive King Suite which was very spacious with the much appreciated extra room for sitting and hanging out after long days of walking around and exploring the city. We got a room on the 9th floor - no view of the city - but we were fine with that. The windows were big enough to let lots of natural light in when we needed it and we didn't hear any street noise. The floor itself was super quiet and we heard nothing from other guests. The hotel was busy but big enough that it doesn't feel crowded. Check-in was a breeze. Staff is exceptional. We opted not to rent a car, using public transportation and rideshares and it was perfectly fine since the hotel is within walking distance of many places we wanted to visit or as a starting point for the tours we did. The option to rent a car was provided by a Hertz in the hotel. We also were able to book a tour to Muir Woods through the hotel and were picked up in front the hotel. All very convenient. We had a lovely time in the City by the Bay and would definitely stay at the Marriott Marquis again.

We stayed for 3 nights to explore the city. We were in one of the newly renovated rooms on 14th floor which was large, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The daily servicing of the room was excellent and the bathroom was a generous size. The only criticism would be that the water pressure for the shower was not very good. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.The View lounge on 39th Floor is well worth a visit for an evening drink to enjoy the atmosphere and city lights. It was very busy when we visited at the weekend.The hotel is walking distance to lots of the city - we even walked to the Pier for Alcatraz - around 30 minutes. Lots of shopping right on the doorstep and a 2 minute walk to the BART.All in all a great city break hotel.

Stayed here fro one week with my husband was great, excellent location for seeing the sights, centrally located and within walking distance of everything, room was great, clean and a very comfortable bed, the bar the view was brilliant, recommend going for a drink here at the hotel has great views of san Francisco,

Marriot Marquis is one of the most conveniently situated hotels in downtown San Fransisco in every respect. Just 2-3 blocks away from Union Square and just getting out of the hotel is a Jewish museum and museum of modern art. China Town, Little Italy, Lombard Street Ghiradelli Square everything just within minutes of reach by uber. The hotel is clean, though there are some reservations going on. The View Lounge provides the best views in the city while you can enjoy your drink. One negative point, the room that we were allocated was just near the vent from where the kitchen could be smelled easily. The staff is polite, helpful and friendly. The biggest attraction is that just outside the hotel are a lot many places to eat which offer the tastiest food. Overall a cool place to stay.

Great location for our business meeting, great restaurants located on the property and the best view from the roof bar. The hotel is under renovation, however they are very considerate of guests. We stayed in a renovated room, which was very comfortable. The gym was great.

If we'd known there's no room service -- just an app to contact local restaurants, or the option of going downstairs to the pub or the mini-store to pick up food -- we might have chosen a different hotel. When you want to have breakfast delivered while you're getting ready for an early am meeting, you don't want to have to go pick up food that's not really "breakfast" food or hope that a local restaurant can deliver quickly enough that your eggs or pancakes or whatever hasn't gotten cold on the drive over in morning traffic. Their explanation that room service is too costly...sorry...that doesn't fly at a high-end hotel.

My friends and I arrived around 3:30am for a very late checkin. The front desk associate was friendly and offered us water and even offered a late checkout of 3pm since we were arriving so late. The rooms were recently renovated. I loved the design of the room and the beds were comfortable like most of the beds at Marriott hotels. I do miss the down duvets that Marriott used to use. The new cotton/fiber duvets are just not as comfortable as the old feather ones.After checking out we still had more of the city to explore before we started our drive down to Los Angeles. The hotel was able to provide complementary luggage storage for us while we explored the city which was very helpful. Overall this was a excellent hotel with a great location and very comfortable and modern rooms. I wished I had the time to stay here longer. Next visit to San Francisco I’ll be sure to return to the San Francisco Marriott Marquis.

The rooms are comfortable and well maintained. Overall a good experience and most Bay Area attractions are quite nearby. The restaurant can have more food options for in house dining. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast has good variety though they repeat the menu each day (we were there for 5 nights) but this is not a major issue

Just had a great, 4 night, Memorial Day weekend in at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis. Everything there was super! The people who work at the hotel were incredible, they really care, they are really helpful. My room was great, WiFi was powerful both on my laptop and my cell phone. The room was newly upgraded and the bathroom was nothing short of incredible. Go there, you will totally enjoy it. Easy to walk to great restaurants, easy to get an Uber. The bar on the 39th Floor has a panoramic view that is "wow." I totally enjoy staying there, had not been to San Francisco in a long time.

Very good lounge with lots of variety for food but crowded for breakfastFantastic gym spanning 2 floors and open 24 hoursConvenient to everywhere and close to transportation Hotel was well maintained with friendly staff.

If you’re taking your family on vacation to downtown San Francisco for a nice clean air conditioned room, with excellent service and spa and a pool, pick another hotel. The hotel check experience for elite guests is slow and not accommodating. Don’t bother speaking personally to the manager Tony, when we asked to change rooms he told me to come downstairs and get keys.

Location was great although can be a bit sketchy at night, but that can be expected in big cities. Room was very clean, modern and the bed was very comfortable. Because it is such a big hotel, you don't get the personal service you would get in a smaller hotel, hotel lobby is very big, looks like a mall. If you don't mind a big hotel, then you will like this one! Good value for money!

Our stay at the Marriott was fun and easy. The entire staff worked to make our visit an extrordinary event. Alfonso (our first bell man) showed me several of the "Must see" places on the map, as well as giving me a good orientation as to the location of our hotel via everything else. The times we visited the conceriage, we received wonderful tips on dining places.

Visiting from Australia, we spent 6 nights in this beautiful hotel. The location is fantastic, amongst shops, shopping centres, bars, restaurants and very handy public transport. From the moment we checked into the hotel we felt truly welcomed. We did have a slight problem and when we brought it up with Silvia at the front desk, she fixed it all without any hassle, nothing was an issue here. The room was spacious, clean and the bed and pillows were most comfortable. There’s a great cocktail bar with an incredible view of the city, the prices for the cocktails are quite steep, however it’s a must do, especially for a special occasion. Strongly advise you to get there as soon as it opens to be seated at the window. I highly recommend this hotel, our experience was the best, the team here go out of their way to make sure that you have a comfortable, hassle free stay. We also picked up our hire car from here, making it really convenient.

Terrific staff, friendly, helpful. Clean rooms , good food. Great location and close to everything we wanted to see and do during our stay in San Francisco. The concierge staff helped us with events and helped to coordinate transportation.

Great central hotel. Easy to get around the city. Staff were very helpful The roof top bar had amazing views of the city also a great atmosphere definitely a place you would it on your must see list. Very reasonable price as well

Staff professional. Rooms neat and tidy. Concierge helpful. Check in and out easy. Close to moscone convention center and easy in and out. Lyft Drivers aplenty. Easy walk to lots of restaurants. Overall would recommend

This hotel is close to the financial district so everything was in walking distance. The website pictures showcase an older looking room, but when I walked in, the room was clean and renovated! I was on the 15th floor and did not hear much traffic from the street. There is a sound conditioner that helps with blocking out outside hallway noise at night. We called the front desk to make the room colder and we experienced quick and professional service from their engineering department. The only issue we had was the sink because it did not drain the second day we were here. We called the front desk that evening, but we were on hold for 20-30 minutes and didn't receive service. Overall, it is very nice property and we would come here again the next time we're in San Francisco.

This Marriott is well-located for conventions and has loads of amenities---which is why I returned in April for my third stay. However, a recent change to the rewards program now denies access to the Clum M lounge to Gold members (it is for Platinum only). The benefit and value of this for breakfast, and an occasional snack previously made the premium price of this hotel worth it. I was disappointed to be denied access to the Club M, and even asked a manager for an exception. I was told it was too busy that week, yet in passing by I often saw lots of empty tables. Now it seems that the only benefits that saves any money that is available to members below Platinum level is free internet, which any level member gets. I loved my corner room with a view, but will have to evaluate my total budget for my next trip. Colleagues stayed at AirBNBs and a diff hotel nearby, and saved considerable money. I hope the Bonvoy program reconsiders this somewhat recent change.

We had a renovated room in this nice hotel. Obviously it’s not a cheap evening but I don’t think anything is in the heart of downtown. If you want to be in this area, it’s well located, has a rooftop bar with a great view and friendly service. We walked to the Ferry Building this morning and enjoyed breakfast there.

Excellent check in by the guy at the reception. He clearly explained that there are some renovations going on and thus we were allocated a room. The room was very well furnished and was very clean, neat and tidy. The shower was also commendable. I have been to Marquis several times and greatly appreciate the services.The house keeping department, spearheaded by Vani, did an excellent job and she surely deserves a reward or recognition and appreciation.Keep it up. Mayur and Daxa Shah

When visiting SF, it is a very good place to stay. It is literally located at the downtown, nearby union square, china town and so many other things. Close by the Trams station to go to Fisherman’s wharf. Its is very close to shopping center. The hotel itself is very busy. The lobby area is being renovated and staff are very helpful. During check in, a bell man called Rickey assisted and escorted us to the room. He explained everything and took his time doing the room tour and suggested places to visit. He was super professional and helpful. The hotel is very lucky having him! What a great experience!

Excellent hotel was the most expensive but the best in all the hotels we stayed at during our 3 week trip in Canada/USA. Wonderful location close to Union square, Powell St Cable Car, and shopping. Staff were wonderful especially Alfonso. After escorting us to our room he stayed and advised us the best places to see, where to eat and things to do. They had free umbrellas available on rainy days and a check in computer for flights with ability to print out our boarding passes. Overall wonderful experience and friendly staff.

I asked to reinstate my reservations that I had mistakenly cancelled and they refused and are charging me $650 for cancelling. They still have rooms available and said I would have to make a new reservation and still pay the cancellation fee. Totally unfair.

First of all: the hotel is in a great spot, bus stop is 2 minutes away, area is quiet and safe and the room rates are also great for SF. Our room had no view, but therefor was the most quiet. Breakfast is nice, a bit hostel style but with great bread. The staff (we saw 3 different people during our 5 night stay) was - apart from 1 girl - not very present/hospitable/welcoming. We reported our non working TV, nothing was done about it till we informed them a second time. Dirty tables at breakfast were not cleaned away for more than 20 minutes. When we checked out there was no proper greeting. It's little things, but coming from a hospitality background myself that's what I look for when on vacation.

Very quiet, comfortable B&B. The room was small, but spotlessly clean; good shower; nice, firm mattress; great price for San Francisco. Parking available in a public lot about five blocks away. Excellent restaurant, the Alamo Square Seafood Cafe, across the street. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The first morning we left early so we didn’t have any breakfast. We ate at a nice restaurant near Fisherman’s Wharf. The second morning we decided to have breakfast at the hotel. There was a basket with about 8 croissants and we (family of 3) ate two croissants each. The girl from reception had the cheek to tell my wife that we ate all croissants and they were for the whole hotel. Unbelievable. We have paid $540 for two nights in lousy room in great need of updating only to be told we had too many croissants. Unprofessional and incompetent is an understatement. Worst experience I’ve ever had. I don’t recommend to anybody. Don’t pay so much money to be treated like this. Find another place. There are plenty of options.

Our 3 night stay was a very pleasant experience, and included a perfectly acceptable breakfast - straight forward and sufficient to set you up for the day.We stayed in a first floor Queen Room, which had a certain charm, and was clean and comfortable. Although it fronted onto the street, traffic noise was not intrusive. The lack of a/c was not an issue for us in January.There is a bus stop just outside the hotel. The buses are frequent and affordable (50% reduction for Seniors). Busses give access to the whole of San Francisco.There is a good restaurant opposite, and others in walking distance.If you want a reasonably priced stay in a quiet, comfortable hotel with easy access to the rest of San Francisco via the busses, this is the place for you. We would stay again.

Good location near Alamo Park but on noisy street. Messed up reservation after called twice to confirm specific room choice. Would not change and didn’t offer even an apology. Rooms are sparce at best. Absolutely no place to unpack. Closet has a few hangers but there are no shelves, drawers or counters. Bathroom is clean but extremely small. Can barely move in shower. No place to put toilettries. Lots of hot water though. Ground floor room on left side is almost ON the bus stop. Ridiculouly loud even with windows closed. Staff isn’t very friendly. Sit in small office with head phones on and look annoyed when you ask for anything. Breakfast is ok but there are better pastries and coffee down the block at The Bean Bag. Somewhat expensive in my opinion. Good place to crash for a night but no more.

My mom and I stayed here for two nights in the suite on the first floor (room 1). Overall the experience was great, but I don't think it was worth what we paid for the room. The room was clean, and the beds were super comfortable, but overall it felt just a little bit run-down. The breakfast was great, they have bread from a local bakery and a good selection of other continental breakfast items. It was very quiet, I was worried about being so close to the front door but I didn't have any issues sleeping. The staff was friendly and helpful. A great option in an area of the city without a ton of hotels to choose from.

This little Inn is part hotel, part B & B. The hotel has the charm of an authentic large residence, rather than a sterile hotel. Each room has its own bathroom and is well-appointed and quaint. The bathroom is modern and very clean. The mattress is very comfortable and the sheets are ironed. The rooms are quiet. The Inn is located in a very quiet and safe residential neighborhood. It is only blocks from Alamo Square and Painted Ladies and less than a mile from the famous Haight Ashbury neighborhood. There are not a lot of restaurants in the vicinity. We used inexpensive Uber rides to get to various districts with no waiting time. We also walked to a nearby stop to catch the Big Bus Tours. The Inn is an excellent value. For under $225, we were able to drop off our luggage first thing in the morning until we landed back to the Inn in the evening. The next morning, the staff provided a buffet-style Continental Breakfast in two sunny adjoining front rooms. The following day, we were able to leave our luggage for the entire day, prior to departing the city. We saved a lot of money, even factoring in Uber rides. Mark, the manager, was professional and welcoming. You will be happy if you choose this delightful experience!

Sometimes you book hotels based on the Internet pictures and are disappointed. This beautiful old Victorian inn did not disappoint. It was small and had no elevator, but this added to the quaintness and authenticity of an old inn. It was clean, the breakfast was very fresh and good (European style), the bed was great and we had a nice sized room with a queen bed, a private bath, and a bay window. We wanted to be close to UCSF Hospital as my daughter had a surgery planned there, and we were 2 miles away. The bus stopped right at the corner so we could catch it there. Also, there were so many beautiful homes to see in the neighborhood. We walked and rode the buses everywhere. THe staff gave us good advice, such as use the local bus service and streetcars ($2.75 per ticket which is good for 90 minutes and $1.35 for seniors!) We were in walking distance of the Painted Ladies, Alamo Park, and Japan Town food. There was also a McDonald's close by. We enjoyed our stay here.

We were in San Francisco for a couple of days for an event at Civic Center Plaza and wanted to find a place within walking distance. I'm so glad we came across The Grove Inn! On our check-in day, we arrived early. The room wasn't available yet, but we were able to store our bags and one of the Inn attendants gave us restaurant and coffee shop recommendations.We stayed in one of the upstairs rooms facing the street and it was very comfortable! The place has a unique "old house" feel to it, which was very cool. For breakfast, there was coffee, tea, orange juice, fresh bread from a local bakery, as well as other assorted breakfast items (cereal, oatmeal, etc.). Between the friendliness of the staff, the charm of the building, and the convenience of the location (walking distance to Alamo Square, many restaurants, and Civic Center Plaza), this is undoubtedly a place to which I'll be returning.

Love this little place. It was well taken care of. Very clean and well run hotel. The bus line runs right by the hotel. Parking is interesting so glad we didn’t have a car long. The hotel is always locked and needs a key fab or a door bell to enter the building for added security. They held our luggage after check out while we went to breakfast. Definitely worth the money saved!

We stayed on the second floor, facing the street. Clean, comfortable room and other guests were quiet. Easy walk to Hayes Street shops. There are lots of Victorian's in the area. When we visited, there was not a lot of traffic on the street and earplugs are available. Would stay there again.

GoodQuiet roomsFriendly staffGood WiFi Really good bedReally good location and neighborhoodBadTired interior, smelled like somebody’s basementBathroom seemed like it hadn’t been renovated for agesYellow stains on shower curtainBathroom fixtures literally broke offNo view, no fresh air, no proper climatizationSmall roomAll in all, ok’ish but not worth the $160 buck rate being charged

The Grove Inn occupies a lovely Italianate-Victorian style building with plenty of curb appeal, its crisply clean exterior decorated with charming historic accents. Situated in a low-key, peaceful neighborhood, it is within easy walking distance of Alamo Square Park, the Painted Ladies, Golden Gate Park, Haight-Ashbury, Japantown, and many other attractions. Nearby you’ll find grocery stores, bars, and restaurants, including a good seafood place right across the street. It has ready access to public transportation, or, of course, Uber. We arrived in the afternoon and were smoothly checked-in by Mark, the warm and friendly manager. The stairs were somewhat daunting, but we knew this place had stairs before booking. Immaculate and comfortable, the room had two big windows providing pleasing daylight, a desk (the television was on it), two nightstands, and an excellent bed. We stayed in a corner room overlooking a side street. Yes, there was traffic and trolley noise, but it didn’t bother us. The sink is in the sleeping area, not the bathroom. This also didn’t bother us. For one night, or even two, this place was perfect for us. The rate we paid was more than a bargain, and you’d be hard-pressed to find better value in the immediate vicinity. The breakfast was a simple, mostly “dry” self-serve buffet, which was fine.But, if you’re like me, the little things that you can overlook for one night grow into annoyances the longer you stay. We stayed three nights, and several things wore on me. There is no thermostat in the room, and no way to control the temperature other than asking someone at reception, which is not helpful late at night. The oddly configured bathroom has no towel rack immediately accessible from the shower. The shower stall was too small (I’m 5’ 5” and 130 pounds), and the shower curtain plastered itself to me each time I stepped too close to it to avoid the suddenly changing temperature from the touchy shower control - yuck. The room has no clock, no fridge, and no microwave. The hotel has a shared fridge guests can use downstairs in the breakfast area, which is locked at night. We knew about the fridge when we booked, but we did end up missing having one in the room. The customer service changed somewhat on the weekend, when two different young women replaced Mark, and neither was overly friendly.A note to first-time San Francisco visitors (we have family here): I described the neighborhood as peaceful, but you should be careful to maintain situational awareness at all times when you are out walking, especially around the parks, and particularly at night. A little caution will help you enjoy a safe, problem-free visit.Overall, the Grove Inn is a clean, pretty, professionally run and comfortable establishment in a perfect location, providing great value and a reliable home base for your San Francisco stay.

The very friendly staff checked in with me prior to arrival to see when I might be arriving, invited me to joint he continental breakfast even if my room was not yet ready that morning, allowed me to store my backpack in the lobby area until I could properly check in and also the next day when I had to leave early and keep my belongings there all day. The room was comfortable - the very high ceilings give it a spacious feel that is rare in an urban hotel, even in a bed and breakfast. The TV was mounted very high into a corner, but I didn't mind too much. The tall ceiling made the shower stall and bathroom feel especially large which was really nice, along with the option to use the handheld showerhead or the fixed showerhead. Cute small set-up in the room for coffee, tea, and water. Wish my schedule allowed me to partake int he continental breakfast, but all I needed was a good landing spot, and the Grove Inn suited my needs nicely. The location is an easy walk to Alamo Square, the Castro, or the Haight, and also near many public transportation bus/train lines to get anywhere else in the city. It is centrally located so rideshares are also inexpensive to other destinations.

Well, perhaps just secret from me. I lived in the city for a long time and hence didn't know too much about the hotel situation here, but in our search for lodging for a weekend trip, we found the city to be very expensive! The Grove Inn, however, had a great price (best price I found, incidentally was booking directly with them) and good reviews. So I was a little worried before arriving, but as it turns out, I shouldn't have been.It's somewhere between a traditional B&B and a hotel. It honestly felt a bit like we had an apartment and were living in SF instead of just vacationing for the weekend. Something about the facade of the building, and the fact that it's on a very residential street.Our room was small, but nice and clean. Staff is very friendly. Some reviews mentioned having trouble with the lobby door, so we were a bit worried about that. But this must have been an old issue. It's now a key fob system and it gave us absolutely no trouble.There was one hiccup with breakfast, but the staff proactively made it right without us having to say anything, so they honestly scored points with this.This will be my go to SF hotel from now on.

We just stayed one night at The Grove Inn. It's quite a nice place. We travel to England frequently, and it reminded me of the B&B's we stay in there. The room was fully outfitted with a coffee maker, a jug of water, etc. We were on the second floor so were able to sleep with the windows open - that along with a tower fan made the room very comfortable. Our room was right by the busy, noisy street, but it didn't bother us. They do offer earplugs. The room is clean and they had quite a nice continental breakfast. We slept well though the mattress was not very comfortable. The only downside for us was the parking. It is only 5 blocks away so I guess that's not so bad. This is a nice place with very friendly staff.

The room is as shown on their website. Room itself was clean and tidy. Bed was comfortable. Check in was easy. Location is quite central that it is about $10 Uber ride to most places in the city. One girl at the front desk was not very friendly, but the other was really nice. Most people follow the rules, so it was fine. A lot of good coffee shops within walking distance. The problem is the bathroom. I understand San Francisco is not a cheap place to stay, but I would expect my room to come with a more proper bathroom. I booked a "Deluxe Queen with Bay Window". It is supposed to be the second most expensive room on the estate (the most expensive is the suite). When I opened the door of the bathroom, I was surprised. It is dated and only got a tiny shower. The sink is outside of the bathroom near the entrance of the room. The slide door does not lock properly because the property is older so the door was slightly out of alignment. Lucky that I was staying with my husband so we could still sort it out. Toilet button is broke although it still flashes properly. The toilet seat rocks it bit too (I am only 110lbs).
