Grouting in the shower is moldy and I found 2 hair inside of it too. I remembered the bathroom on the website was much nicer and I found they put "your booked room may differ slightly from rooms displayed in photos". Great, but I would not say that is "slightly". The room is 4 stars for a small inn, but the bathroom over deserve 2 stars even being generous. Therefore I will only give it 3 stars.

Nice little B&B where it’s located in residential neighborhood, close to bus stops, and if you drove, the parking garage that they recommended has a very good value ($20/day). Very close (walking distance) to famous Painted Ladies – famous Victorian and Edwardian houses – and Alamo Square Park. About 2-3 miles to City Center (Union Square) or Fisherman’s Wharf. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, but the bathroom was a bit too small. No elevator if you got a room on second floor and/or has a big suitcase because this B&B is a typical SF Victorian style house with only staircase. Breakfast was good and quite standard with cereals, variety of breads and pastries, hard boiled eggs, and fresh fruits (oranges and bananas) and coffees and teas. Overall it is a nice little B&B with a great value for San Francisco standard.

Super comfortable bed, nice room. plenty of windows for fresh air, and not too noisy! Loved being on Fillmore - great bus service. And the inn keepers were very helpful. There is a spacious, light filled dining area downstairs for the continental breakfast they provide. Mostly we were so appreciative of their friendliness and accomodating approach. We were able to store our luggage before and after checkin which made navigating the city so much easier.

Stayed here for a week - clean and functional. Nice continental breakfast - and the hosts are awesome and very accommodating. Thanks for a great stay. Walking distance to market street and close to nice spots to eat.

The charming photos do not fairly represent this very clean but sad place. It is on a busy corner although a white noise machine and ear plugs are provided. There is no accommodation for food allergies nor although the place was notified, I was not told that there would be nothing that was gluten free. Yes, I was very disappointed. The public area is charmless as are the employees.

Recently booked a room for myself and friends. When we arrived we where told parking was several blocks away which wasn't doable. We had to take second floor room which wasn't something we needed due health issues with one of our friends. Was told well you should've told us ahead of time.

We stayed five nights at The Grove Inn and highly recommend this B&B. It's well located in a residential neighborhood, with good access to public transportation and within easy reach to several of San Francisco's attractions. There's also several bars and restaurants a short walk from the Inn. Our bedroom was clean, well kept, with a cosy decoration - following the victorian style of the house - and had a very good bed. Breakfast was also good, with a nice variety of fresh breads and pastries (for instance, the best blueberry muffins I had in the USA). Just be aware of the check-in hours, as they only allow for check-inn until 11:00 PM (we barely made it on arrival, as our flight to SFO was delayed).

Good comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfast. Friendly staff and helpful with information. Close to the 'Painted Ladies'. Very pleasant neighbourhood to wander around. Close to bus stop for transport into San Francisco.

Beautiful historic building, well maintained, very clean, excellent beds, linens. Very friendly and helpful staff. Close to bus stops. Great continental breakfast. Everything is top notch.I highly recommend. We will stay here again.

Perfect situated in the middle of the city. Nice friendly personnel. Big rooms with clean bathroom, but in need of refurbishment. Does not live up to my expectations for the cost of the room.Breakfast is also just almost.

It is one of those street villas up a hill, which San Francisco is famous for, and the interior as well as the friendly staff makes it feel like coming home.Reasonable price, always including free Wifi and lovely homey breakfast.Newly fitted room with a good bathroom (modern shower niche).In a really great neighborhood - a bit upper-class; expensive shops, all very fashionable, superb restaurants.

Nice people; decent cold breakfast; very good beds; fine shower; spacious, airy room. On a somewhat busy intersection with road noise - we had a corner room on the first floor. Was not an issue for us.

Staff was very helpful with sightseeing and restaurant suggestions. Breakfasts were delicious - wonderful bread! Room and bed were very comfortable. Great area with good restaurants in walking distance. Street parking was surprisingly easy to find.

We recently stayed at The Grove Inn because it was located near our son's apartment in the city. We immediately felt at home because the staff, especially Zabrina, went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We had a suite, which was very spacious and could have accommodated a small family. The decor was simple, modern and fresh although it was a very old house with high ceilings and a nice big window. The bed was very comfortable and the linens high quality. Each day the breakfast was fresh and delicious.On the last night we let our son and his bride have our room. The staff was very sweet to give them Prosecco and chocolates.

My husband, baby and I stayed here for 3 nights.The room was fairly small but very clean and with all the amenities you would need. Only downside was the sink is in the room, separate to the bathroom. Shower was good.We had a room with bay windows - it was a little noisy as the buses stop right outside on Filmore street and you can hear them all night and early morning. Probably not a problem for other people. It we had a sleeping baby so wasn't ideal. It was super loud the first night but then I realised the window was open!so once I closed this is quiet ended down a bit. Breakfast was lovely - continental but tasty and they get some fab baked goods from a local bakery which were delicious. Staff were friendly and helpful and the location is pretty good, close to the painted ladies. Would recommend and stay here again.

Lovely experience! Wonderful breakfasts and hospitality. Narrow steps are not for the faint of heart, but we loved the atmosphere and made it without a problem to our room. It is a refurbished boarding house, so it is truly an old and historic structure.

We began our search for interesting accommodation about 2 months ago and noted that the The Grove Inn was already starting to fill. After comparing options with hotels ($$$$), Air B&B (little selection) and other Inns/B&Bs (smaller with limited availability), we found ourselves returning online to look again at this location. We took the plunge, booked two rooms and have just finished seven nights there. We are glad we did.The Grove Inn is located just one block away from the Painted Ladies, which you, after walking around the neighbourhood, will realize are just another bunch of attractive Victorian homes. The Inn itself is a moderately well-appointed establishment that has a history of accommodating people back to the mid-1800s. There are about a dozen rooms in various configurations and our two rooms were the Queen with bay window and the deluxe double room. The room is well-sized, but not huge. Bedding is crisp and white and beds are moderately firm with a pillow top. The only discussion point might be the compact bathroom, but the shower pressure is good and the toilets flush quietly. Unlike many other B&Bs there is no common area with comfy sofas, but face it: one is not in San Francisco to hang about the hotel. There is no onsite parking, but other reviewers have suggested options nearby.The inn staff members are attentive and helpful and work from the office for about 12 hours per day, locking up at night. Late night arrivals can be accommodated, though, because the staff can buzz you in remotely and you will find your keys in an envelope just inside the front door. Breakfast is continental, with a couple of cereals, fresh fruit, boiled eggs, OJ, and some excellent baked goods from The Mill bakery on nearby Divisadero street. If you have to check out early to catch a flight, the staff will leave a tray of food in your room the night before. Finally, several great dinner options exist within walking distance (about 4 blocks away) in Hayes Valley and there are a couple more good eating establishments on Divisadero. In short, the Grove Inn is a really great place to stay if you are not wedded to the idea of being in a big hotel downtown.

have been there for four nights with three friends on our three weeks trip through california and arizona.the location of the grove inn is in a quiet neighborhood at filmore street; it takes you 15 minutes by bus to union square. if you are traveling by car, there is a cheap car park 9 minutes by foot from the inn. it takes you a 15 minute walk to haight ashbury, the painted ladies are around the corner.the rooms are spacious and furbished in an old continental style. they are clean and quiet. did sleep very well. the wifi worked perfect. the staff was outstanding friendly and helpful. the breakfast is - for european expectations - quite good. at filmore street up to lombard street there are a lot of good restaurants and bars. it was a really nice stay and iwould choose the grove inn again!

I loved the gal that worked there! The breakfast was fabulous. The beds so comfy. Location was awesome. I would definitely stay there again! I stayed 4 nights and was completely at home all four days.

I used to live in SF, so always find it odd to stay in a mainstream hotel when I visitThis place is beautiful! It used to be an old boarding house during the gold rush, and you feel that in the air.All staff are extremely welcoming, very comfortable rooms and the beds are amazing! Breakfast is a simple relaxed affair- but suits the hotel perfectly Couldn't recommend this place enough!!Don't stay in downtown - stay in San Francisco!!!

Safe area - Hotel clean, comfortable and welcoming - Staff exceptional - Couldn't have done any more to be helpful to us and other guests - NOTHING was too much trouble - Breakfast very good - Got the impression that all of the staff took immense pride in providing the best possible stay for their guests - Looked after our luggage as we had a late flight out of San Francisco - Arranged taxis for us - Provided breakfasts for guests leaving early - Very knowledgeable regarding places to visit and eat, tailored to our requirements, not just to rehearsed information - Sitiuation of hoel very close to Bus links - Easy to get around from there - Overall we would have no problem in recommending this as a very good place to stay in San Francisco - Cost - Forgot to mention, very reasonable and well worth the money.

This is a very sweet, but still clean and modern inn. There is a continental breakfast that is more European than American, reminds me of a lot of breakfasts I had in hostels and hotels in Europe. The breakfast isn't super impressive, but will be enough to fill you up for a day of sight seeing. When we arrived, someone showed us our room but mentioned that there was a suite available if we would rather have that. We were traveling with an infant, so we were thrilled to have the suite with an extra room so that we could still have a light/the tv on after the baby went to sleep. The only negative was that the inn did not have any cribs, which was somewhat surprising. However, luckily I had called ahead to ask about the crib so we were prepared, and rented a pack-n-play from a baby rental service. But that is the only negative I would say about the inn, so if you don't need a crib, then I would highly recommend. I loved the area it was in, and actually booked the inn after asking a friend who recently lived in San Francisco where to stay. This was not a touristy area at all, but felt more like when you stay in an air bnb and are really in a neighborhood where locals hang out and live. Painted ladies is around the corner, Patricia's green area is nearby and has a beer garden and other great bars and shops, the Inn is on the corner of Fillmore street and if you go a bit north on that there is a great shopping and dining.

My husband and I stayed at The Grove Inn for three nights in October. The location and property were both great. Very close to some wonderful restaurants and attractions. We were there during a heat wave and despite the room being very hot the staff went above and beyond to cool it down.

Very personal attentive serviceVery helpfull to first time travellers to San FranciscoThe inclusive continental breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of choiceThe property is situated in a convenient locationHighly recommended

We stayed here when San Francisco was having a heat wave. There was no AC. Room temp were almost 90 degrees. For a northerner, this is tough. Opening the windows let fresh air in and the noise. It is right next to a bus line. There was no parking and the nearest garage is 4 blocks away. Walking back to the hotel late at night might bother some people. The rooms were comfortable, the bed was okay. The breakfast spread was good. The coffee excellent. The owners are very knowledgeable about the city and provide maps.

Stayed in Grove inn 8 nights in September 2016! Everything was just perfect: location, staff, room, breakfast! Place is very clean, comfortable and in perfect location! We loved every minute of our stay. Will definitely stay here again!!! Full marks!!!!!

In all this place was acceptable. We chose it because it was slightly away from the touristy areas. We didn't find it to be spectacular. The room was fine but the breakfast leaves much to the imagination. Whilst a gluten free option is given, it really its just a bagel so don't get too excited! We didn't find the staff to be particularly friendly, but they weren't rude. Just seemed to not want to be there. We were pretty disappointed to have been told to park 5 blocks away in a parking lot for $20 per night when we arrived late on a Friday night and the weekend free street parking! In all it isn't awful, but from the great reviews and cost of the B and B we expected a little more.

Overall an amazing experience. Service was outstanding. All the information we needed. The room was very clean. The breakfast selection was very well presented and it was delicious. Can't wait to go back!

Pleasant stay. Room was very clean. Bathroom was, too. Shower was very good. Could have used another towel or two.Breakfast was a wide variety of nice foods - good reads, pastries, fruit, fresh hot coffee, cereals.All nicely presented and attended to promptly.

Clean room and wonderful staff! Wonderful location! Easy access to the sights. Only issue was you can hear alot of feet running around in the mornings. Still worth the price. Most likely will stay there again!

Clean! Polite! Convenient Location! Will DEF stay here next time we visit SF!!! Also, the free continental breakfast is perfect! The room with two double (or queen?) beds and private bathroom was what we needed, plus there are bus stops going in every direction right outside the door and up to a few blocks away!

I'm super late in this, but my husband and I had an awesome time at this B&B! We went during after Christmas/before New Years and were pleasantly surprised. Centrally located by multiple restaurants and city hall. Breakfast was delicious and hosts were very accommodating with our late check in. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Had a great time. Will be back!

El hotel The Grove Inn tiene buena iluminacion y excelente ubicacion para ir en bicicleta o caminar cerca de lugares turisticos como painted ladies, japanese park, o tomar un bus solo a 2 cuadras para ir al centro de la ciudad donde realizas compras o tomas un tren. Las habitaciones son confortables con estilo vintage, los amenities son de calidad, el jabon con leche me encanto!, tienes bano privado, el colchon es tan suave y realmente descansas despues de volar mas de un dia, El desayuno es fresco tienes opciones de jugos, los muffins deliciosos. La atencion fue calida, eficiente sin demoras al momento del check in. Gracias Jessica South, nos atendiste con carisma y profesionalismo, que bueno que tienen personal bilingue para los turistas. Felicitamos al administrador!The hotel The Grove Inn have a good ilumination and excellent location to go biking, walking to the tourist atractions painted ladies, japanes park, The bus is just a 2 blocks to go to the downtown for shopping or you can choose the train, The rooms are comfortable, I liked the quality of the amenities such as the soap with milk I loved it!, you have private bathroom, the matress is really soft with a vintage stile, you really can sleep and get recovered after flying all day long. The breakfast is fresh and the juices of the day with options to choose, the muffins were delicious. The attention was warm, efficient and the check in without delays. Thank you so much Jessica South, we do apreciate your.charisma and professionalism. It s a relief that the hotel have bilingual personal. Congratulations to the manager!

I have stayed here several times a year since their reopening after and extensive remodel. It is a block from where our son lives near Alamo Park and is very convenient. Josh and his staff are warm, welcoming and professional. For this trip I appreciate his accommodating my need to break of up the reservation due to my participation in a walking event over the weekend that mandated accommodations for me elsewhere for two nights and then allowing me to check in earlier than their check-in time once I finished the walk. Rooms are clean and charming in a beautiful historic building in the Alamo Historic District Neighborhood. Rooms, breakfast, internet, safety and hospitality are exemplary.

DELUXE Room, REALLY ??? Tiny, small window with no view but a wall, sink in bedroom, furniture with stains, shower couldn´t be smaller. There´s really no space for anything. It looks like a hostel, definitely not the cozy B&B they advertise. Breakfast is very plain. Communication was very good and that´s why I give two stars instead of one.I don´t recommend this place and I would never stay there again.

The location was great for us, our friends live on Grove Street. Last time in SF we stayed at an overpriced Hyatt - NEVER AGAIN (+$550 a night, no extras, $50 a night parking, surrounded by homeless/drug users.) The Grove Inn cost less than half of that per night, for a cute, quirky, historic stay in a former Gold Rush rooming house. Our room had a pretty bay window, and high ceilings. Extras included a nice breakfast, and coffee maker in the room, coffee all day, fruit and internet. The rooms are small and crowded, a sink was in the room, the bathroom was minuscule, and there is a steep Victorian staircase up to the room. None of this bothered us, as the price was right, we simply embraced the unique aspects of this quaint, inexpensive, friendly little B & B.

The staff were as friendly as they could be. Very clean rooms and breakfast area. very convenient to the bus lines 1 and 1/2 blocks downhill and coming back the bus stopped across the street also downhill. Beautiful location.

We were met outside and our luggage taken up to our room which was room 15.Lovely big room and everything you would need. Very cleanBreakast was continental and fresh everyday.Everyone was so helpful especially with me asking questions were to go on my map.Would definetly recommend, really enjoyed our stay

Stayed in this hotel for four nights mid June. The area was great 1 minute away from Union Square.... cosy reception area with free water, coffee and cookies. Breakfast was a pleasure staff very welcoming and friendly. Omelettes made to order and a self service pancake maker. Room was small/compact but had everything we needed and was cleaned daily. We were on the second floor and had no view except of heating/water systems but also had no noise either. Beds were very comfy and travel size shampoos and shower gels were supplied. Our room had a safe mini fridge and tv with cable channels. Although there is no gym in hotel you do get full access to a local facility (2 min walk). I would definitely recommend this hotel for both staff, facilities and location. You can get cable car directly outside and the local Starbucks opens at 4:30am ..... All in all would definitely return to the chancellor hotel

What a perfect place to celebrate a 40th bd! Thank you Tina for making our stay unforgettable! From the moment we arrived we felt the warmth and hospitality... The room was small but well appointed.This is truly a gem in SF! We will be back!

Quaint historic hotel just steps away from Union Square. My family and I stayed in a double-bed room. While it was not big (not surprising considering it’s San Francisco), the room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. They have a “pillow menu” from which you can choose a pillow to suit your comfort or need, including a “Snore-No-More” pillow. The lobby has free cookies and apples all day. There’s a full service bar and restaurant on the premises. Happy hour is from 4:30 until 9:30 p.m. Staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was easily accessible and very reasonable for the area. You cannot beat the location or the value for your money anywhere else. I will definitely stay here again.

My 2 teenage sons and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay. The hotel is very convenient and we walked nearly everywhere (even with the hills!), comfortable beds, very friendly staff and fabulous tasty breakfasts. 100% recommended after our 3 night stay.

Very nice hotel, closest to getting around - cable car right outside! and great places to eat close by. Very easy parking facility. Great staff. Request higher floor and even on a hot summer day, its pleasant with some cool breeze.

We loved staying at this historic hotel. The entire staff is kind, helpful and so friendly. The hotel is well appointed, clean and in a perfect location. They provide complimentary coffee, cookies and apples everyday. So close to Union Square and lots of great restaurants, and a quick ride to lots of other places in the City. Highly recommend this hotel!

We got a great deal at the Chancellor for Memorial Day weekend. The location was both ideal for exploring the city, and for getting to BART to see family in the East Bay. The bed was comfy and room was the perfect size for two. We very much appreciated the fridge, operable windows, and ceiling fan. One of my favorite things, though, was that since this is an old building that hasn’t been messed with, is that it was one of the quietest hotels I’ve stayed at in recent memory. Plus, if you’re child free like me, I think the fact that most rooms have just one bed keeps things extra quiet.Other things I loved? Excellent, personable staff; clothes line for drying my hiking clothes in the bathroom; an cage historic charm.Would absolutely stay here again the next time we’re in San Francisco.

Great location almost right on Union Square with very friendly staff.Love the free coffee n tea and cookies provided as well as apples in the reception lounge. Brightlylit rooms. Like having the walk in wardrobe. Dont particularly like having the shower over tbe bath butat least they have provided a safety hand rail n a rubber mat for non slip in bath. Shower ptessure is ok even on the 11th floor.Very satisfied with our 5 nights stay.

This hotel is a fantastic place to stay just a few meters from Union Square and the tram to Fisherman’s Wharf just across the road.There’s parking half a block away for just $20 a day. The rooms were nicely furnished and very comfortable, the staff were all helpful and friendly.I want to come back to San Francisco just to stay here again.

From the moment we arrived, we were treated incredibly well. We were very early for check-in (10:30 am) and only had to wait 1 hour and they gave us a late checkout as well. There was a variety of recently baked cookies as well as coffee and water. The room was spotless and well made toiletries.

Quaint hotel reminiscent of old San Francisco. Nostalgic rooms, cheeky bathroom amenities, thoughtful lobby snacks and drinks, and a wonderful location in the center of Union Square with $20/night garage parking one block away and a 2-for-1 drink special at the lobby bar really make this place an SF treasure.

Spent 3 nights in this old world charming hotel. Beautifully appointed in a style reminiscent of early 20th century. The location at Union Square gives you access to anything in San Francisco. The cable cars to Fishermans Wharf area stop outside the hotel. Designer shopping on the doorstep, bars, restaurants and diners all within 5 mins walk. The staff were eager to help with everything. The room was spacious and well appointed. Slept like a log every night and enjoyed the $18 breakfast every morning. Would choose to stay here again anytime we are in SFO.

Great location just off Union Square. Cable car runs by. We had a room on the top floor with a stunning view of the Square. It’s a 1919 hotel and has a feel of history. Only thing to be careful of is ‘no air conditioning’ , not a problem when we were there. Room and beds are very comfortable.

The location was excellent...across from Union Square and right on the cable car route. The staff was excellent and most helpful. The lobby was comfortable and coffee and cold water always available. It's our go to place in SF from now on..

I loved this historic building! The building itself was beautiful, the attention to detail and adding modern conveniences was spectacular. The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was adorable! Only thing I was disappointed in was that it has no air conditioner. It was very hot when I visited but I understand that it was unusual weather for the area. I would definitely stay again!

We spent 3 nights in this city centre hotel. It was very comfortable for the price we paid and staff couldn’t do enough for us, which we really appreciated. The location of this hotel, is second to none, with the famous trams passing by the door. Lots of amazing theatres and entertainment venues within 5 minutes walk. If you like to shop (not something I’m very keen on), then the location of The Chancellor is fantastic. Handy little Cheesecake Factory located in Macy’s just across Union Square from The ChancellorLove, love, love the additional cute duck supplied in our bathroom. Super comfy bed and great views of Union Square & Macy’s Christmas decorations from our room.Thank you to everyone involved in making our stay so fantastic and we look forward to revisiting your lovely personal hotel.

It's location is great, too. The staff are first class. It could with a bit of updating, but we would return without hesitation. Being right by the cable rides is a plus, too. The hotel was clean, efficient, rooms on the small side, but we had no complaints. No air conditioning, but frankly you don't need it here. It is simply a comfortable and excellent base for visiting SFO. Recommended.

Hotel goes out of their way to ensure your stay is unforgettable, especially when fulfilling a silly request made during the reservation. The location and staff is great. Would definitely stay here again!

Location, price, comfort, friendly helpful staff and breakfast if you want it... we needed nothing more. Bed in double room very comfortable, room size fine for two and with an added closet we had room to store all our bags. Hot shower and most importantly fresh air with no stuffy aircon. Don’t know how you would be in high summer but for our stay in May/June, perfect. We were right in front room level 10 and it was quiet. I pre-requested a fragrance free room and that’s what I got, the cleaner even reinforced that she would not use any chemicals! Fabulous. Staff also organised our shared shuttle back to airport. Great stay. Thank very much.

Pleasant staff, comfy bed, perfectly formed bathroom in great location with partial view of Union Square. Window side chairs were a lovely spot to to soak up the sun and read, watch TV, or eat a snack.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights recently (May 2019). It is located right next to Union Square in easy reach of key locations in San Francisco. The room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable although the small fridge was very noisy when it cut in and the toilet sounded like that of an aeroplane toilet i.e. very noisy. Shower had good pressure and easy to use.Free tea and coffee on hand in the lobby and a nice touch were the free cookies on reception desk :)The bar area was quite small but not a problem.We didn't sample the breakfast so cannot comment on the quality/quantity etc. We'd stay here again.

My wife and I wanted someplace for a couple of days in the city, and there are many options in this portion of the downtown area. The taxi ride to and from the airport was smooth. Getting around the city was a combination of walking and public transportation (get a day pass for convenience). The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean, and traffic noise was not really a problem (we were on a higher floor, so that might have helped). The room was not tiny, but definitely comes from an era of compact hotel rooms. It was certainly not an issue. All in all the decision to stay here was good, and we would return.

We stayed over Easter with our 2 teenage girls and had an amazing time! We had a room with 2 double beds and though the room wasn’t large it was more than adequate for our needs and the closet was very large so we could store luggage. We faced Powell street but could not hear the street noise with the window closed. The room didn’t have air conditioning but we found the ceiling fan more than adequate and the temperatures were in the high 20’s while we were there. The hotel bar was fantastic, drinks strong with great waitstaff. Close to the cable car and shopping..we will definitely be back.

Although the rooms are small here, and the Internet was difficult to access in our room, We liked this Hotel a lot and we would stay here again in the future. It’s an older Hotel but it is very clean and well maintained.They say it’s the little things that count and this Hotel has lots of little touches, which make your stay that much nicer. Cookies and coffee in the lobby, your choice of pillows, and very nice bathroom amenities. The staff is very friendly and helped us get around the City.The Hotel is right near Union Square close to good shopping, restaurants and a Walgreens drug store down the street where you can grab all sorts of food items. It’s located right on the Cable car route and about 5 blocks from the bus line that will take you right down to Fisherman’s Wharf. You can walk to China Town, although the hills might prove to be challenging. I would highly recommend staying here. As I mentioned before, if you want lots of room in your room, don’t stay here but we were here 4 nights and we would go back again.

The rooms are small in size compared to modern rooms today but was adequate. The rooms were clean and bathroom is very clean too. The cable car runs right along the front door. Just for those who are traveling to San Francisco for the first time you are gonna be able to get on for 7.00 dollars one way but you are gonna have to make sure that you have cash only if you just going to get on the street car but if you go down to the ticket booth they take everything that you would normally use to pay for things.

Overall we enjoyed our stay, the location was great, and I would recommend this hotel. Walking distance to most attractions and about a 30 minute walk to Pier 39. Friendly staff. Room was small but comfortable for two people. We knew there was no AC in the rooms at the time of booking but decided to try it out anyway. We had to keep window open often, as it did get too hot at times, especially after someone showers, but the fan they provided was helpful. I learned this hotel was haunted after I booked, but we never encountered any paranormal activity during our stay.

This is an older hotel, that is in need of some work. We stayed in a suite on the top floor. The room was large enough, although we would have preferred a king sized bed. The suite had two bathrooms, with different showers (shower in bath combos). One was better than the other. The furniture, carpets and fittings are all in need of an update as they have aged. The front desk and bell service was good, and the buffet breakfast, while small, was fine.Happy hour at the small hotel bar was also a nice spot in the afternoon with the sports on and full bar available. Bar staff were fantastic. The location can't be faulted, right next to union square and on the cable car stop which can be taken down to Fisherman's wharf.Although it does have it's "quirks", I wouldn't have a problem with staying here again as it was good value for money compared to other hotels in the area.I do need to know however - why a bottle opener was installed next to the toilet roll holder in the bathroom ?

Friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms. Bathrooms small but tastefully decorated. Wish there was more water pressure in shower however not a deterrent to come again. Great location. Would definitely come here again!

This is a great little boutique hotel. The staff was very friendly. It is in a very good location in Union Square, close to restaurants and shopping. There is also a Walgreens and Starbucks right on the corner of the street that the hotel is on. When people say that the rooms are tiny, they mean that the rooms are tiny! But they are comfortable. The beds are nice. The toilet is about one inch away from the wall, but otherwise the small bathroom is nicely done. Water pressure and temperature were both great in the shower. It’s a very deep tub, so be aware if you have mobility issues that you do have to lift your legs quite high to get in and out. Remember this is an old building! The corridors and elevators are very narrow! A fuse got blown in our room and I called guest services and they came immediately and fixed it. I couldn’t believe how fast they arrived. WiFi and TV service were not the best. Overall, no complaints, I would stay here again and would recommend it.

Location is not bad at all while I was attending a conference at the Moscone Center. However, it is not a short walk, more like a 15 min brisk canter. Very close to Union Square though if that's your need. Free coffee and cookies most of the time in the lobby. Rooms are tiny, compared to most other rooms in chain hotels. The bathroom reminded me of an aircraft toilet, but with enough room to swing your elbows. Everything was clean and smelled good though. This area of SF is engaging enough that you don't spend much time in a hotel room. No air-conditioning, but it was not needed at this time of the year.

Wonderful stay at this friendly boutique hotel! Great location, comfortable room, great amenities. Hotel staff were so accommodating. A must stay in San Fran! Bryce was extremely helpful at the front desk. Loved the water filtration system and the pillow menu!

We stayed here for 3 nights in April. Friendly check in staff but the hotel is quite dated. The breakfast, although small and limited in choice, was good. Although, I think the hotel was pricey for what it was but that's because you're in San Francisco! I'd potentially stay again.

Chancellor was a lovely little hotel perfectly located for our weekend trip. Really appreciated the little touches, fresh fruit, baked cookies, water station - even a little yellow rubber duckie for the tub. Rooms are smaller, but very comfortable and surprisingly quiet during the night. Staff was friendly and accommodating, we'll definitely return!

Glad we chose this place as convenient location to walk around this great city.Room was small but clean and well appointed. No air con, so this would not be my choice in the summer.Only reason why this hasn’t received top marks was the bar, it was small and a little tired looking. I tried to order a bottle of water to take to my room, but they didn’t sell water and directed me to the local store! First time that happened to me, they really should stock water. They had a water dispenser near the receptionist but not everyone likes cucumber flavoured water. Breakfast overpriced at $18 each, we ate at a great diner 50 yards diw the road, it was cheaper and MUCH better.

The Chancellor is quite an old hotel, dating back to 1914. It stands right on Union square and is very convenient for downtown San Francisco. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are comfortable, if a little on the small side. Everything has a quaint, old-fashioned feel (well, it is over 100 years old) but the price is fantastic for this location. I would recommend it if you are visiting San Francisco.

This hotel is over 100 years old and has a wonderful character to it. The hotel is clean and well presented. I like the fact it still has a bath tub. The bathroom was tiny but it was clean and had everything I needed. Love, love, love the pillow menu :) The staff were very helpful which is always nice. The hotel is right at Union Square, so is a very convenient location near shops and services. I would stay here again for sure.

Very good location, close to union square, nice and cosy rooms with comfy bed. Spacious walk in wardrobe, very good WiFi. Free coffee, water and complimentary fresh baked cookies in the lobby. No gym at the hotel but cooperating with gym nearby. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would book it again for sure.

The hotel is well-located and has all the amenities we needed. The bed was comfortable. The staff were always helpful and friendly. We can recommend the breakfasts! There are lots of options for eating locally.

Alicia is the World's Best Bartender.Other than that, the hotel is comfortable, staff is responsive and efficient and the location is perfect. Union Square area has many excellent affordable restaurants. And great shopping opportunities.

Pretty much slap bang on Union Square, so central for most things - esp shopping and theaters. The bay area is approx. 35-40min walk (or $8 in an uber) - so very do-able by foot. The hotel itself is clean, friendly and efficient. Its also pretty quiet - esp to say its so central. The rooms aren't massive - but they're not shoe-box sized - certainly big enough given you'll use it to sleep in only, they come with a decent sized bathroom and a large walk-in wardrobe containing a safe.

We spent one night in SF to see a show and the Chancellor’s location at Union Square was perfect! It’s within walking distance to most big theatres like the Golden Gate and the Curran, plus it’s next to many terrific restaurants like Roxanne’s Café, Maru Sushi, and next door to the landmark Sears Fine Food.The Chancellor’s lobby is warm and inviting like a little jewel box. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. We did offsite parking one block away for just $20, the cheapest rate you’ll find in SF! Our room, 1402, was clean, fresh and very stylish. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were top-quality. The towels were plush and the soap/shampoo were high quality. The hotel doesn’t pretend to be something it’s not (like a boring cookie-cutter chain) but rather it celebrates being an old-school, elegant SF property. Just two cons: there isn’t any air-conditioning, which didn’t pose a problem in March, but may be an issue in August or September. However, there is a modern, well-run ceiling fan, an extra fan in the closet, and widows that open all the way. The second con: no coffee in the rooms. To their credit, I was fully aware of both cons before I booked the hotel. We didn’t eat their offered breakfast ($18), but went next door to Sears Fine Food (we’d been wanting to try it). Otherwise we would have tried it. The variety looked delicious. The value for your money was well worth it. Yes, it was March (likely a shoulder month) but at $159 plus taxes it couldn’t be beat. I’m torn between telling everyone or keeping this place to myself, but I think the secret is out!

Great value and location for this family owned hotel right in the heart of union square.The hotel is old but the rooms were spotless and the bathroom while small was immaculate. I can only assume they had been renovated recently.The bed was really comfortable and best of all they actually have a decent quilt/doona on the bed. So often now staying at hotels you feel like you just have a sheet on the bed here. Not at the Chancellor, it was great to snuggle down nice and warm in bed.Only thing to note is I don’t believe they have air conditioning. Maybe something to consider if staying in summer. Would happily stay here again.

The hotel is in an excellent location. We frequent SF regularly by flying but this time we decided on a last minute trip and used Hotel Tonight app to find a hotel. It lead us to the Chancellor.The hotel, like many in SF, is a renovated boutique in the heart of SF (Union Square). Self-parking rate is EXCELLENT at $20/ night at a local garage (you must check-in first in order to get the parking ticket).

This hotel ticks all the boxes - great location (really convenient and central to everything), very comfortable bed, very clean, beautifully appointed and great service. Highly recommend! Really nice to stay somewhere that is great quality but not a cookie-cutter chain.

The hotel is an excellent location, close to shops and food with easy access to the rail system. The room was not large but suited our needs and was very clean. The bed was very comfortable! The only downside was the poor shower pressure, but this was a minor inconvenience to an excellent 8 night stay! Thank you Chancellor Hotel!

This hotel is conveniently located 10 minutes away from the convention center but is in desperate need of renovation. Lobby is not impressive, has a tiny bar, rooms are nothing special and NOT soundproof at all. Wouldn’t recommend.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband while we were in town for a conference. It was more affordable than the conference hotel and conveniently located in Union Square - a vibrant, walkable area with plenty of restaurants, entertainment and large retail stores. It's a quaint hotel, but we enjoyed the complimentary coffee and free cookies in the lobby! We didn't have much of a view; our room was facing a couple of buildings. However, it was not something that was super important to us on this particular occasion.There are a few things in this hotel that we did not take advantage of because we were on the go, such as the buffet breakfast for $18 a person and the bar (they had a 2 for 1 drink special). However, we appreciated at least having those options available to us! My only complaint about the hotel is that once daily, someone from the staff knocked on our door at a random time - once about a radiator out in the hallway (that was not ours), once about replacing a shower curtain (which we did not request), and once about something that we didn't bother to find out about because we did not want to be disturbed and therefore didn't answer the door. There was no 'Do Not Disturb' sign to put on the door and I'm sure the hotel staff were well meaning, but during the few moments of downtime that we had in the room outside of sleeping at night, it would have been nice to not have anyone knocking for random things.Overall, this is a nice hotel that provides many amenities and is in a great location. My only recommendation is to have 'Do Not Disturb' signs for all of the rooms. It's possible that the one for our room was simply missing, but I'm noting this anyway - just in case!

I’ve been staying at this hotel since 2004. I started staying here when my grandma booked a room to tour my college. I fell in love and it never disappoints. It’s small and has a boutique feel. The staff is so nice and they have warm cooking in the evening at the front desk! The rubber ducky has become a favorite for my two girls. Highly recommend! It’s in a great location!

Hotels downtown are a bit hit and miss - this is a good one just off Union Square and right in the heart of the city. The room is of course small but well appointed with a renovated bathroom. For the price you pay its the best value hotel I’ve stayed in downtown if you get it at the right price.

Ask for an upper room with a view. we overlooked heating system on second floor. You live vicariously through your neighboring rooms' activities. Left,right,and above. You hear everything.Clean and comfortable beds.

I stayed for 1 week here for business/pleasure. The location is very central - I was able to see Santacon shenanigans, the Xmas tree & skating rink from the window. Definitely loud - lots of street performers/concerts/11pm bagpipes lol. I wear earplugs to sleep so I was ok but if you're sensitive to noise - it's loud. The room itself was very SMALL/pretty cramped. My 6'4 partner and I struggled a bit to share a double bed. But it was a super cute & quaint room. I appreciated the fridge, since nowadays hotels treat mini fridges like a hot commodity...There always coffee/tea/apples in the lobby. There's no fob system so technically anyone can enter the hotel and use the elevators, which is kind of sketchy. That is all folks!

Stayed here twice in 2015 & did wonder if it would be as good as before but need not have worried as it is still a well located great little hotel.Our room was clean, comfy with everything you need for a short break.Would definitely recommend & stay again in the future.

Absolutely would never stay anywhere in SF but here again, ever. Safe, well-staffed and historic (114 years!)....I drifted off to sleep with the bathroom window cracked to the sounds of music from the park. BART is 4 blocks, trolley goes by right in front. Sparkling clean, and perfectly staffed to keep it affordable. The lobby is like someone's living room, in the mornings you see folks in their robe and slippers come down to fetch self-serve coffee and muffins from the bar that serves happy hour in the afternoons. Pillow menu. Awesome housekeeping. Perfect location. Awesome staff. Perfect stay.

Lovely older style hotel right on union square. Room was small with 2 double beds and smallest bathroom I’ve ever seen. Very clean.Great bar downstairs. Complimentary tea/ coffee downstairs. Close to everything!

This hotel is in a very safe and quiet area. It is very clean and the beds are comfortable. There is free parking and we were able to walk to many areas we wanted to go. The breakfast consists of muffins, croissants, bananas and juice each day.

This hotel offers free breakfast, not much but enough to hold you over. The Location is very close to Presidio, Golden Gate, Fishermen’s Wharf, Ferry Building are a nice walk away. That was nice. The manager was friendly and had great recommendations for us as a family. Kudos mr yodi

Excellent location, the Big Bus stop is only a short walk away.The beds were the most comfortable and clean I have had in a hotel for years.The little coffee filter machine could be adjusted to make tea if you swap out the coffee bag for your choice of tea bag.Fridge and microwave in the room.We took a taxi from the airport, on the clock and it cost $55.

An unexpercted jewel in San Francisco. Price was good and located near several attractions. Room was a bit small, but very clean and nicely furnished. Great place to relax and hit the touristist trails again.

We stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting San Fransisco from the UK. As we spent most of the day out-and-about we only really used the room to sleep. On checking in the receptionist was rather abrupt and we were given a room upstairs which was very musty and had mould on the walls. We requested to move rooms, and were given a room on the ground floor. This room still smelt but there were no obvious signs of mould. The rooms were fairly comfortable, but they were not as clean/ modern as they look on the photos. The walls and ceilings are very thin, so we were woken very early each morning when the room above us woke up. We had a car with us, and the free hotel parking was very useful. We were lucky to always manage to have a space during our stay (there are not enough spaces for all rooms).The location was fine, and we could get everywhere we wanted to via bus/ taxi, and there were a few nice restaurants within walking distance. If we returned we would probably not stay in this location, nor this hotel.

I travelled with friends from the UK and stayed for a week. The gentleman at reception was polite and helpful which we needed after a long flight. The room, bathroom and linen was clean and the beds very comfortable. Luckily we were on the ground floor as there is no lift so bear this in mind if travelling with a lot of luggage! The room could do with a bit of a facelift in terms of the carpet and paint however it was comfortable. The continental style breakfast was a nice touch and enough to get us started for the day. Very good daily housekeeping. The Inn is in an excellent location. The Bay Area/Gharardelli square is about a 20 minute walk and Fisherman’s Wharf another 10 minutes. There are excellent views on the way if you walk over the park area opposite Safeway. The Hop On bus goes from just up the road (5 minute walk) and is easily accessible for the trolley buses and cable cars. There is an excellent Safeway supermarket about 10 minute walk away and there are a couple of convenience stores around the corner. The main downside for us was that there is no safety deposit box in the room so we had to carry our cash and passports everywhere. We were offered the choice to leave these at reception but would have preferred a safe in the room. It did not have the luxuries of some hotels but if you are looking for a place to lay your head after a busy day it is a clean and comfortable choice in a safe and easily accessible location.

Arrived at the inn and was met by a slightly moody and unwelcoming receptionist ( think she was the owners daughter), checked in and was told I had to sign to say I oils to smoke in my room or anywhere on the premises , there was a slight problem with my credit card and someone else came to the rescue, was told once again about the no smoking policy and was then asked if I smoked. I can’t see what that has to do with a hotelier! Apart from that room was quite pleasant for the price however there was a slight aroma to the room and it could have down with the wall either washed or re painted ! Overall you get what you pay for , quite a good location

Amazing how opinions vary, we stayed here for three nights and the noise from the main 101 was bad all night , ask for a room as far away from the road as possible. The Seaside is not a hotel, it's a motel with no facilities apart from your room, breakfast is minimal at best. Our room was nice though didn't smell very nice , very comfy bed and very clean. Not bad location but if you're looking for more facilities you may be better elsewhere.

Good location on Lombard street within walking distance to the port where you can get the tours to Alcatraz and visit nearby fisherman’s Wharf. We rented a car at the airport and dropped it off at beach street as we were getting on a cruise and this worked out cheaper than taxis. There was free parking at the hotel and once we parked we didn’t use the car until the last morning when we went to visit the Golden Gate Bridge, which is a short drive away.I did observe that all the while we were there (Thursday -Saturday)that there was enough parking for all the guests. Lombard Street is busy so there may be some traffic noise but it wasn’t too bad. We certainly slept well in the comfortable huge bed. The rooms are fine with a nice shower. A light breakfast is available free of charge in the reception area. We arrived around 2 pm and were allowed to check in. We then walked to fisherman’s wharf and spent the rest of the day there and nearby which was very nice, with plenty of dining options ,before walking back (around 30 minutes). On day two we walked to Alcatraz landing,where you get the Alcatraz tour,again around 30 minutes, I highly recommend taking this tour but make sure you book in advance. After Alcatraz we walked to the nearby (10-15 minutes), cable car terminus and took the car to Union square ($7). This was very good and once we arrived we had lunch at the Cheesecake Factory in Macy’s which was on the top floor so a nice lunch with good views. Afterwards we walked to Coit Tower (warning: there was a a few tough hills to negotiate with the one near the tower being particularly hard). This walk also took you through China town and took 30-45 minutes but took us longer as we looked around etc oh and of course we had to rest a few times! Once at the tower ($8 entry) we took the elevator to the top and enjoyed some lovely views of San Francisco. After this we walked to Lombard Street and up the crooked street(it’s steep!). This took about 30-45 minutes. Luckily our hotel was on Lombard street about 20 minutes on (walking) from the the cooked street. A shower and a glass of wine concluded our day. The next morning we drove to the Golden Gate Bridge and parked up ‘this side’ of it. I think it’s around $4 per hour to park although we got there around 6.15 am (jet lag?) so it’s free until 8 am. This was plenty of time to walk across and back. This was a great experience with lovely views. I hope our review of the hotel and what we did is helpful and please feel free to ask any questions.

Overall this worked well for us. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds which was cosy but manageable. Rooms are clean.Breakfast is laid out in reception and is a collection only to take back to the room, but it was ok. Coffee/juice/tea, bananas, apples, packaged pastries, croissants and muffins. The staff are all really great - very friendly. This has the feel of a family run business with everyone bought into giving guests a good experience.Parking is limited but adequate for the number of rooms. It is however free which compared to other hotels, saved $25-30 per night on other options we researched.Be aware that it’s not located close to Fisherman’s Wharf or Union square - it was a 30 minute walk to FW ... and an estimated 50 mins Union Square (but we just got an Uber). Also despite being on Lombard street, this isn’t the crooked zig zag part of the street which also isn’t close. The major improvement would better WiFi. Forget about streaming. It’s good enough for emails (without attachments) but even social media catchups weren’t good. Overall this worked well for us and we were happy with our choice.

Lovely small hotel on Lombard Street. All the rooms are off the car park so barely any road noise heard. Expensive for what it is but the whole of San Francisco is! Breakfast is grab & go from reception (croissants, pastries, fruit) which suited us rather than a sit down meal. Always parking available, close by to everything we needed. Stayed for 3 nights

We bought the family to San Fran and chose this place for its great location. About half a mile from the wriggly Briton Lombard st. It’s got parking. Clean rooms which look recently decorated. A basic but decent breakfast. Comfy beds and hot showers. I would recommend.

We spent 3x nights at the Seaside Inn, I’m so impressed by the service received from checkin to checkout. They are very friendly an welcoming :)Free coffee an juice in reception was great. The taps in the rooms also provide filtered water. Rooms serviced everyday, lovely crisp sheets, always enough towels for our group of 3.Close to convince store - gas station, restaurants an a laundromat :) You could walk to Pier 39 but we opted for Uber at $10.Overall, great price for location an hospitality of Seaside Inn staff :)

Stay here for holidays. Hotel is good, but not so luxurious. Enough to sleep after a day to visit San Francisco. Free breakfast at the reception which is fine. Free parking is available. Not so far from the Russian hils :-)Not so bad, but can be a little more good to reach the next level :-)

We had a wonderful time staying 4 nights at seaside inn which is situated at this nice and safe neighborhood at the Marina District. The room is cozy and clean. The manager is friendly and very accommodating to our needs helping us to get hot water to drink everyday. Daily free breakfast is also included. If you are looking for a budget stay to enjoy sightseeing and also would love to savor delicious food in San Francisco, I would definitely recommend seaside inn. There are lots of nice restaurants and shops within walking distance.

OK: this is a motel on a main road. The rooms are accessed via the car park, so they are very noisy, as the doors are not insulated, and are on the access route to the other rooms so you have to keep the blinds closed all the time unless you want everyone going past looking in. In fact, you cannot open the windows so there is no way of getting fresh air into the room without leaving the door open. The room really needs redecorating and refurbishing in parts. the furniture looks as if it dates from the 70s, and is really showing its age. Clean, but with quite an unpleasant smell of strong products to mask underlying dirt. The TV remote was particularly grubby. The room only has disposable (recyclable?) cups, which is a shame; even cheap B&Bs give you real mugs and glasses. Also, sound insulation is poor; you can't avoid hearing people next door. Plus side: the hosts and staff are friendly and helpful, free wifi (with needs refreshing daily), individual heating/cooling, continental-type breakfast which you pick up from reception (it would have been good to have some jam/honey and yogurt), good bathroom (which needs regrouting), iron, fridge, microwave & coffee maker in the room. The pictures do not show the outside.

Great location down the road from the zig zag part of Lombard St. Union street is close by with lots of great places to eat. Beds very comfortable with nice linens. Extremely clean. Fridge and microwave in the room. Parking outside at no extra cost available on a first come first served basis. Spaces a bit tight. Lady who runs the motel is very efficient and accommodating.

After thoroughly researching prices for our chosen week, we booked directly with this hotel. We had apparently picked a very expensive week in San Francisco, so we chose not to pay ridiculous prices for a 4-star hotel. The manager of the hotel was extremely accommodating,as were all of the employees we encountered. She gave us an excellent rate for our first night since we had to arrive after 1 a.m. and we thought that was very fair. We much appreciated that.The furnishings are a little tired and could use some updating, but the staff keeps them extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. We did hear traffic noise. If that bothers you, you might not want to pick this hotel. This didn't bother us at all, since we put in two very hard days of San Francisco sightseeing and were exhausted when we got back. The area is not scary at all. We utilized the bus system for most of our time in the city, and it was a safe walk to get to the stops that we needed.. I would recommend this hotel again

It was good. free parking and breakfast. The parking was limited but it was not too hard to park there. I think you can ask if it is possible for you to park in the evening if you are planning to go out with your car with your family that day.

Good location, walking distance to Fort Mason area and marina for views of Golden Gate Bridge.Helpful and very accommodating staff.Large, comfortable bed.Continental breakfast only but helpful to have it included.

We stayed here for 5 nights and was very happy with the facilities and the location. Laundry and Supermarket very close by and only a 20 min walk to Fishermans Wharf. Found reception to be extremely helpful and they looked after our bags on our last day as we had a night flight. Rooms were clean and they supply a decent size fridge and microwave. We would stay here again.

Stayed here for 6 nights. On Lombard street. Great location for all of San Francisco attractions. The big bus tour stops right near here aswell so that's a big plus. Its about 20 min walk in to fisherman's wharf and about 10 minutes to the crooked street. Check in was smooth and painless. Room is large with a huge bed that was really comfortable.Coffee making machine, fridge, microwave and tv. Breakfast is tarts and cakes with orange juice. Really nice room, bathroom excellent too. Would recommend this place.

The room was small but very clean, updated, a lot of light, and cozy. They have bigger rooms but we went with the cheapest room. Owner was very accommodating, sent me off with lots of breakfast goodies. Close walk to bay. Free parking!

Do not stay here. I booked through Expedia- cancelled the booking and they have still charged my cc the fulll amount. Even after Expedia advised them it was cancelled. They won’t refund my money! Be wary. I now have to fight the charges with my proof of cancellation!!

For those wanting to roam around SF this would be a convenient location to stay. Breakfast provided is very basic. Rooms are OK but not well maintained as it we could find dust and cobwebs. Wi-Fi is good.Customer service is very helpful .Overall Satisfactory.

Good location, about a twenty minute walk to Fisherman's wharf. It's a really enjoyable walk along the bay, with some great views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge. The room itself was compact but very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful.

We stayed for 2 nights passing through. This hotel is clean and comfortable. Yogi the lady on the desk was very helpful. She let us choose our room. She gave us advice about getting around SF. There are pastries and coffee in the small reception each morning but you have to eat in your room. There are a lot of homeless in SF and they do come onto the property to look in the bins in the car park. They don't really bother you. I would stop at this hotel again.The hotel has a small Caremark which is first come first served but we didn't have any problem parking. We opted to park up by Pier 39 rather that get the bus or taxi. We found a carpark with a 12 dollar all day charge if you parked before 10am. Other car parks are 3 times that amount so it's worth looking round.

This accommodation is a hidden gem. It is expensive for this class of hotel but is a bargain compared to most choices in San Fran. Free parking is it’s major selling point coupled with free WiFi and a free basic breakfast of juice/tea/coffee, fruit and pastries makes for a good deal in this area of the world. The hotel is small and run by a friendly manager who is flexible and customer focused. The rooms are small and basic but are very clean and have microwave, fridge and air-con. Shower pressure is awesome and the beds are the perfect blend of comfort and support. Located in the bustling but safe Marina district, you are close to so many attractions here and there is a great selection of public transport or easily drivable accessibility. We would stay here again for sure.

We paid more for this motel than any other on our 3 week road trip but booked here due to good reviews.We were therefore really disappointed .Room very cramped,bathroom grubby and feet stuck to dirty carpet.The worst was the very poor breakfast which you collected from the small reception and took back to your room.You can get the same facilities cheaper in another motel.

We greatly enjoy our stay at Seaside Inn. The motel has free parking on a first-come-first-served basis (but it’s easy to park in the sorroundings if you don’t find the space), wide and comfortable rooms, is super-clean and quite new. Location is very central to all: Presidio, Golden Gate, Fishermen’s Wharf, Ferry Building are a nice walk away. The manager Yogi is very attentive and ready to help. Only the free breakfast could be implemented with some organic items. Very fairly priced for San Francisco.

Stayed at the Seaside Inn for 3 nights in August. Great room with everything you need and big enough for myself, my husband and 2 children aged 17 & 12. Yogi and her husband were very accommodating and couldn't do enough to help, giving directions and ordering taxis for us. The breakfast they provide is enough to set you up for the day ahead (croissants, Danish pastries, fruit, tea/coffee and fruit juice). On site parking is a bonus but like others say a little tight. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed for one night to explore SF while we were in CA for a wedding. Small room but clean, updated and comfortable. Free parking and as others mentioned, a bit tight. Not far of a walk to Fisherman’s Wharf or Pier 39. Limited breakfast but it was something to hold you. Friendly owner.

This motel is a hidden jem. I have stayed here several times and have always had a wonderful time. It's small but the staff is very accompanying. Parking is free but a bit tight. I highly recommend staying at the Seaside Motel.

We had a wonderful stay at the Seaside Inn! The hotel is affordable, updated and clean, and within walking distance of all of the tourist attractions along the waterfront, as well as close to quieter neighborhoods with great restaurants. Yogi was so kind and hospitable and made sure that we had everything we needed. She even booked us on a day trip to Napa/Sonoma with a tour company and allowed us to leave our luggage on the last day so that we were able to continue exploring the city before our flight that night. We will recommend the Seaside Inn to all of our friends!

This family run motel is in a great spot for exploring San Francisco, especially if you’re keen to look at Fisherman’s Wharf, walk bayside, and walk over the Golden Gate Bridge. We did that and walked uptown too (okay, that was a crazy day, 30kms and counting) but the beds here are comfort-plus, and you can wander downstairs in the morning and enjoy the free breakfast. Good value tariff in a pricey city and very obliging owners. Super clean, too. What’s not to love? We’d stay again.

We picked the Sea side in since for its good reviews, location and it was well within our budget since we came in July and the summer season is very expensive. The room was clean. Had a microwave and refrigerator.  We will come again. :)

Picked here as it was within our budget on a very expensive July holiday. Was amazingly clean and modern. Definitely worth staying if after a cheaper accommodation that's clean and close to many attractions. We will stay again 100%

We enjoyed our stay at seaside inn. The room was clean. Had a microwave and refrigerator. The staff was very helpful and attentive. Jordan (I think was his name) was especially helpful. We highly recommend.

Perfect spot for exploring, room was so nice. Decorated beautifully, all amenities that you would need. Would highly recommend a stay here. Free coffee and croissant an extra bonus. Parking is limited but never an issue, and an added relief amid charges elsewhere in the Bay.

Spacious rooms with huge beds and all amenities of a hotel room. Beautifully decorated with adequate breakfast in the mornings and highly appreciated parking hotel staff very accommodating:). Very good WiFi.

I came across the Seaside Inn on a travel blog. This ticked a lot of boxes for us in many ways. Free parking ! Continental breakfast included, room has a microwave and fridge, value for money and it is certainly clean and tidy. The inn is located in a great suburb and after spending three nights and day’s exploring SF we both agreed that we felt the safest in the Marina District. Special thank you to Yogi. We would stay here again. P.s the parking is tight like some other reviews have said, so you are best off to reverse in.

First impressions were ok, we had a good welcome by the owner,we got to our room which turned out to be perfect for our 3 night stay it was clean had tea and coffee making facilities fridge and microwave,the bathroom/shower was ok for our 3 night stay .The location was fantastic with a 15 minutes walk to everything .Overall I would definitely return to use this accommodation

We travelled around America and this was the best night sleep we had together with excellent room facilities. The room was spotless and the bedding smelt fresh and clean, breakfast is simple with a selection of hot/cold beverages, pastries and muffins. Yogi is a fantastic host, extremely knowledgeable and accommodating.

Very comfortable and clean unit. The hosts were so helpful, including organising a shuttle to the airport. Excellent location for catching a bus to Fishermans Wharf and Union. We did a lot of walking to cafes and restaurants in the area.

We had a fantastic stay here. Location is perfect! Family run hotel and they were very accommodating and tried to do whatever they could to make your stay a good one. On our last day staying here our flights were not until the evening so after check out they were kind enough to hold onto our baggage for us so that we could spend the day out exploring San Fran!! Would definitely stay again if we returned to San Fran.

We stayed here before our cruise and were entirely satisfied. Basic but modern room, comfy bed, a refrigerator and microwave all for an affordable rate. This is a family business and they do a fine job multi tasking and taking care of their guests. Continental breakfast includes Kurig coffee, tea and hot chocolate along with juice, fruit, croissants and pastry. This motel is a short ride to several attractions and less than a mile walk to Fisherman's Wharf. We would stay here again!

We stayed here at the beginning of March. The inn is in an excellent position and you can walk to many places or easily catch a bus. The beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in and the room was very clean. Lots of towels and toiletries refreshed daily. The breakfast was limited but ok as a start to the day and there is a coffee machine,microwave and fridge in the room.Would definately recommend this inn. A great place to stay in San Francisco!

My wife came to San Francisco to celebrate her birthday. We wanted to be near the marina and Chinatown but not right in the thick of either area. We also planned to spend most of our time enjoying the city. We decided to stay and the Seaside Inn. Really enjoyed our stay. There is free parking if you have a car. A small continental style breakfast if you want something quick on the go. The room was very clean, great water pressure and plenty of room for the 2 of us. Our king sized bed was comfortable and the room also had a good sized fridge. We’d for sure stay again.

I have NOT stayed at this property yet. However we are booked in for March 2018. I can say that we have asked on 2 separate writings general questions about shuttles, area, Cruise ship area etc.. and have never once received a reply. These people have not had the courtesy to even answer. I cant speak to the rooms or the property but if this is how they treat their customers we don't expect a good stay. Will advise further after our stay.

King size comfortable bed with great space fridge, micro, coffee maker made this room great. Warm and clean, we stay 2 days. Close to gold gate bridge, Wharf, lots of restaurants, bike rental close by great way to get around. Would stay again

The place is really clean and neat. Bathroom was nice, but there were no place to hang your towels. Beds are really good. Location is the best. Right on Lombard street. Coffee machine in the room didn’t work, but it was fine because we got ok coffee on breakfast. Service was really nice and friendly.

My husband, son and I stayed at the seaside in because it was close to all the places that we were going to.The lady that runs the motel was very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very clean, the beds were super comfy and we had a fridge, microwave, flat screen tv and heater and air conditioner in our room. The room itself was a little small for 3 adults with 3 large bags but we weren't in our room only to sleep so we managed. It is situated in the Marina district, near fishermans warf, Alcartraz, Golden Gate Bridge and because we like to stay fit it's fantastic running track and bike paths all along the for shore. A really great area to stay in.

Stayed here with 2 adults and 2 children for 3 nights. Room was spacious enough for what we needed. Beds were comfy, room was clean and quiet. We were only a few minutes drive from Fishermans Wharf and could walk up the hill to the "famous" part of Lombard St.Breakfast options were slim but plenty of dining out options available near by. Parking was tight but we always managed to get a spot. We would stay here again in the future

We spent 3 nights here whilst in San Francisco. It's located a few minutes walk from the bay and bridge views. There are a couple of bicycle hire places nearby. It's a cheap taxi or uber to Pier 39 or Union Square. There is a shopping/dining strip about 5-10 minutes walk away. The room was spacious enough with a comfortable bed. You could hear a little bit of noise from the room next door especially if they stomped around. It was good value for San Francisco.

From the outside, not so great. Looks like a 50's motel. All outside entrances. No elevator. We were on the second floor of two. Not really a big deal for us though. The rooms, however are very nice and super clean. Bed was really comfortable!!!. Bathroom spotless with nice shower. The rooms have obviously been redone. was a little noisy but not bad at all. The management was really nice and let us leave our luggage in the office until check-in. 15 to 20 minute walk to pier 39.. great walk down by the water to the pier, etc about 2-3 blocks away. Beautiful view of the golden gate bridge as you walk. Light breakfast in the morning in the office. Croissants, muffins, sweet rolls, bananas, apples with juice and coffee. Certainly enough for us. Oh yes, the rooms have a microwave and mini fridge. Dish tv with large flat screen. Nothing is cheap in San Francisco!!!!! All in all we were very pleased with this motel and would for sure stay here again. If you are looking for luxury, this is not your place, but a nice, clean and comfortable room... you will get it.

GoodLocation is very good. The BigBus picks up just two blocks away, only a few stops away from Fishermans Wharf. Very easy to get around.Bed was 5star equivalent! Rooms modern and nice.Breakfast is basic (pastries, fruit, oj ex) but good, very handy for a quick bite as you rush out to see San Francisco. Good coffee & OJ.Wifi worked great every time!!BadAnts! We found a stream of ants in our room on our first morning. We reported to front desk and they quickly sorted it out and mentioned this was not normal. We didn't see any ants again for our remaining 2 nights.We were located in middle of hotel but could hear the road noise some times. Noise proofing could be better, if you're a light sleeper best bring earplugs.

The Seaside Inn is in a fantastic location - around 15 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and close to great bars and restaurants. Staff were very welcoming and the room was comfortable, clean and large. The wifi worked perfectly and the in-room coffee tasted good. The continental breakfast was a welcome addition every morning before we ventured out into San Francisco for the day. We didn't have a car with us however there was ample parking for those who do. The only improvement would have been having fresh milk available as creamer doesn't work well with English tea! Would stay again.

The location is great for exploring San Francisco but you can't get away from the fact it's close to the road. Our room 210 was the closest, above reception. It didn't really bother us as we just came in from the UK so we had a good sleep but it's worth noting. The room and the bed were on the small side but we would go back as it was spotlessly clean and really friendly. Great wifi, shower and comfy bed.

Called hotel, as stated in coupon to get discount. Had some communication challenges on the phone. We booked two rooms but they refused to honor Trip Advisor advertised booking.com price, nor would honor Trip.Advisor coupon as stated. Did show them online price & coupon but they did not care.The hotel itself was okay.The next night we stayed at the Comfort Inn just down the road which had excellent customer service.

Good location - 15 minute walk from Ghirardelli Square across Great Meadow Park at Fort Mason. Room had everything we needed and was totally spotless. Breakfast was more than plentiful. We would definitely return.

Pretty much an average style of motel, all necessary amenities, air con. fridge, microwave. Getting a bit tired but still good value. Good WiFi. Great location near all the good bars and eateries of Union St. and about 15-20 mins. from Fisherman's wharf and the cable car. The staff are very friendly and helpful, Yogi was fantastic...she pretty well runs the show and is so helpful and accommodating.

Stayed here for a few nights for the start of our California road trip. We choose here mainly for the parking spaces as it's very expensive to park in San Francisco. The spaces are limited but we never had an issue getting a space. The hotel room was clean and spacious. There was lots of restaurants within walking distance.

Very good little Inn in the middle of the Marina district, along with a bus route that connects to most tourist destinations. There is a nice continental breakfast in the morning – along with a well-stocked Keurig coffee maker.

Seaside Inn is a competitively priced accommodation located conveniently for transport links, and easy walking distance to Fort Mason/Marina/Presidio area. The Hotel rooms are clean and well furnished with handy facilities and comfortable beds, although rooms are a little on the small size if more than 2 people sharing. Like many wooden built properties noise insulation could be better so use earplugs if you're a light sleeper and request a room back from the busy Lombard St, hey this IS San Fran after all ! The breakfast is perfect for grab and go and there's a good selection of pastries and drinks. Yogi on front desk is helpful and knowledgeable.

we had a lovely time there, the cozy rooms are clean, updated and comfy. the staff is lovely. it's walking distance to fisherman's wharf, the palace of fine arts and ft. mason. we used the hop-on bus to get around the city. its a fun though long ride and being in an open double-decker bus in sf on a sunny day is magical.

Really clean and comfortable bed. The location is really nice. 15/20 minutes by walk from the peers. The breakfast is simple, no space to eat but you take it in your room. on top of that few parking places available, you cannot reserve it. And Yogi at the reception is adorable, friendly and helpful.

Definitely recommend. Perfect location, you can walk everywhere you want to go and the big bus stop isn't too far up Lombard. We received awesome service, they were always happy to help with booking taxis and little things like making sure we ate breakfast before our big days.The room was clean and tidy, it had quite a good little set up. Very happy overall
