Beds are so comfy. Rooms are clean and breakfast is served in the reception area. Pastries, fruit and tea coffee and juice available. You take it back to your room to consume. The motel is on a very busy road and the noise travels through the doors. Take ear plugs and you will sleep fine. There are some restaurants nearby, but fishermans wharf is about 20 min walk.

I found the bed to be awesome and it was very clean. It is very convenient location. Walking distance from shops and gas stations. We left our cell phone and netbook behind. The host reached out to us numerous times to remind us that we left these items behind. The lady was very kind and helpful in making recommendations.

Spent 6 nites. Ou room was sparkling clean and smelled fresh. The front desk person went beyond the call as since I cannot walok steps, she even walked the steps once to get me a bucket of ice The breakfast is adequate with fruit, juices, coffees and tea. The sweetrolls are pre-packaged but very tasty. I'd use this place any time visiting the area.. NOTE: They have free limited parking which is scarce in the city.

Hotel is very comfortable. Really clean. Fab location. Breakfast is just fruit and pastries but perfectly acceptable. Yogi seems to do everything from front desk to servicing the rooms. Such a lovely helpful lady. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Our first stop on our California road trip was San Francisco and we stayed at the Sea side inn. We had a king size bed in our room that was super comfortable, we slept late and soundly. There is off street free parking which was unexpected and much appreciated. Yogi the owner was friendly, there a very nice continental breakfast as well.

We recently stayed at this small but ideally located motel and would recommend it to anyone who wanted to be close to all the sites. A 15 minute walk to Fishermens Wharf and views are spectaular along the way.The rooms were very clean and very well stocked and Yogi, the manager, was so accomadating and the best PR person we have met in all our travels. If anyone is traveling to San Francisco and want a great motel, this is it. Location, Location,Location. Thank you Yogi for making our stay so memorable. We look forward to a return trip.

Recently stayed 2 nights at the Seaside Inn and rooms were very clean and comfortable! Yogi the receptionist was one of the friendliest people we have encountered during our travels. I would highly recommend this small hotel, for anyone looking for reasonable, clean and friendly places to stay in San Francisco.

We recently stayed at The Seaside during a 5 night stay in San Fran. This hotel is close to everything, you have plenty of choices with Lombard Street but we chose Seaside for it modern look and its reviews. We were not disappointed. Yogi at the front desk was extremely helpful and cheerful. I have since read some mixed reviews about this place and I have to say, the service is of a high standard. Although Lombard Street is busy, you are a short walk from the beautiful Filmore and Union shopping districts as well as a short walk to the Marina district. We spend a bit of time in both places. Fisherman's wharf is a longer walk but absolutely doable, or you can take an Uber which will only cost you $10 or so. We walked everywhere, a few Ubers out at night and a bike ride from the hotel thanks to the hire store next door. The rooms are spacious and clean, with modern fit outs. We slept four friends in there comfortably. A little more space for luggage would have been helpful but not an issue. Wifi was excellent and although I've seen some poor reviews in terms of breakfast, it was actually a bonus that it was provided. We just grabbed a piece of fruit and headed out, if people want a sit down breakfast then perhaps they should book more than a 3 star motor inn. Our only issue was on our last night when the couple next door decided to make a LOT of noise at midnight until about 3am. The walls are perhaps not as thick as first thought! We soon called Yogi and the noise ceased. No noise was heard from the street from our room, which was at the back of the building.I would stay at Seaside Inn again when travelling to San Fran

We arrived in San Francisco from Singapore at 9 am after 14 hours flight, very tired, we waited till 12 and we asked for an early check in. This hotel is run by and Indian couple, the Indian husband, once we arrived, didn't even say hello to us and send us away telling us to come back at 3 pm, without even double check or offer some rest! Extremely rude. The room is extremely expensive compared to the condition of toilet and forniture !! I've been traveling 86 countries and you can check all my reviews here in Trip Advisor, most of them are very positive, but this time I was extremely disappointed ! It's the first time in my life that the hotel room has not even a bottle of water inside !! We had to go to the supermarket to drink !!! But the worst part is the breakfast .. never see anything like that !! Breakfast served in the reception on a table big as my bedside table, few bananas, thè and milk, muffin and croissants from supermarket still in the plastic bag, disgusting. I strongly recommend to avoid this place . San Francisco is amazing city, choose a nice stay with polite owner, not this one !

We were in San Francisco for just the day and exploring the Presidio, so this turned out to be a great place to stay and location. We actually walked to Presidio, which took about 30 min.The rooms are the best part--they have been totally refurbished. You can tell they made the effort to make sure everything was updated. We dropped off our bags in the room and headed out, so we didn't spend any time in the room except to sleep really.We had a room with double beds, so it made the room feel a little smaller. If it was a family of four, then it might be a bit cramped. But, the beds were amazing--slept so well. We did not have a car--used Uber, so we didn't have to worry about parking. But, we did notice there is a limited number of parking spaces.It was worth it!

The hotel is a family run hotel,rooms are clean and hve amenities.But please use the 2 bed room for two and not 4 as it is recommended,it is not possible to accomodate 4 people unless 2 are kids.The position is not so quiet and parking not always available.Breakfast is not recommended as only coffee,juice and muffins that you have to take to your room. As there is 2 chairs in the room,it is impossible to enjoy breakfast for 4 in these conditions.Rooms have no space enough to accommodate 4 people's luggage.There is a microwave and refrigerator in the room.For 2 people with a king size bed is OK.

First time in SF. We stayed two nights and spent maybe a grand total of 10 hrs in our room. It was clean and beds were comfortable. Definitely a place to stay when you only need a bed in an expensive city. Close to the centre and 2 blocks away from the greatest Safeway in North America.

Just returned from a four night stay in San Francisco. After each exhausting (but fantastic) day, it was a relief to know we had a very nice room to return to....the bed was SO comfortable. The bathroom and bedroom were kept very clean, with fresh towels, coffee replacement etc every day. Would highly recommend this Inn to anyone

This accommodation was in a reasonable location and about 20-30 minutes walk from the harbour and tourist attractions. The reception on our arrival was not welcoming and the lady who checked us in was rather abrupt. Her interpersonal skills did however improve over the time that we stayed and she became quite helpful.It was more of a motel than a B&B. Breakfast was appalling. There was nowhere to sit and eat and we had to stand in reception for our'breakfast'. Breakfast was set out on a counter and the croissant provided were dry and of poor quality. There was also a basket of rather soft apples and bananas. We ate out every morning and I would rather have paid less for the room and not been let down by the breakfast on offer.The rooms were clean and functional. The bed was large and comfortable. There was coffee making facilities in the room, which was welcome. However, the lack of a safe meant I had to carry all valuables around with me, which was a nuisance.We managed to park, but the fact that spaces were limited meant we dare not use the car during our stay, for fear of not being able to park on our return. Parking generally in SanFrancisco was e pensive and difficult.

We booked on the fly and found a terrific San Francisco local hotel. Yogi was a great hostess and very gracious. Only a few blocks from the water front on Lombard St. Room was clean and met our needs perfectly at a reasonable price. We were fortunate to have off street parking in their lot.

It's a motel though it is listed in TripAdvisor as a B&B. Two levels of rooms (book upstairs), small parking lot (get there mid-afternoon if you want a parking place) but in a great location on Lombard St. We walked east to Fisherman's Wharf during the day and west to Chestnut Street at night. We did not use the car the three days we were in San Francisco.Check-in was typical. No elevator upstairs but staircases were wide and easy to navigate. Our room was very clean with a nice king bed and pillows and good flat screen TV. The bathroom was small but in good condition. Our main issue with the room is that we could not close the drapes. There was a sheer white panel over our windows but it did not completely darken the room. It was disconcerting, even with the interior lights off.Breakfast was basic motel food-cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc.Compared to other lodging in this part of the city, this inn is a value, but the location is the reason to stay here, despite some deficiencies.

What a little gem! The place was spotless and clean. Service at the front desk was pleasant. The rooms were pleasant and the beds super comfortable. Location was within walking distance to fisherman's wharf and to mel's diner. We would definitely consider another stay here prior to another cruise.

If I could do 1 star i would. So much to go into so I'll try spare you...owner is rude and shady, husband speaks no english and is left at the front desk sometimes. Owner gets very defensive when asked about rate information and bill details. Not helpful at all when we asked for help regarding transportation and neighborhood information. Lied about how much she charged us and would not discuss/argued about bill. The coffer maker in the lobby was half broken, she would not let me get tea that night and then rang my phone off the hook 10 minutes later saying it was ok (totally confusing). No coffee carraffe in the room, was not replaced when I told her about it missing. Breakfast was sub par, no real cream for coffee just fake cream packets, no butter for the dry pre packaged croissants. Bed was made incorrectly (no bottom sheet, it was made with a top sheet as a bottom sheet) so the feather bed mattress topper slid off the bed. I could go on and on. Its simple. Look elsewhere. I discussed some of the issues with her but she is so mean and combative I finally gave up saying anything to her. She made us feel very unwelcome and uncomfortable

Rooms are nice but small. Breakfast was poor. Fire alarm went off in room at 3am and beeped every 15 minutes throughout the night. Called the front desk but got no answer. Explained what a poor nights sleep we had received, I thought a discount would be in order. She said she would get it fixed after we had checked out. Homeless person going thru garbage for food and asking me for clothes. I guess you can make your own decision before staying at this hotel.

This place has a great location off of Lombard Street. Parking is free, but tight and limited! A rarity in SF. Room was clean! Two complaints are horrible towels and improper sheets on bed! It's a no frills kind of stay, but it served the purpose as I am hardly in a room when vacationing!

A few streets from the 'seaside' but is well positioned to explore San Francisco. Parking on site - we parked our car for 5 nights & did not need to use it while here. We had a room no. 205 upstairs, no lift, no in-room safe. The bed was really comfortable with good linen. The air conditioner is noisy & there is no privacy if window curtain open. Breakfast, of sorts, is supplied. The lady on duty was helpful with bus information. We enjoyed our stay here - San Francisco is a great city.

Welcome at the Seaside-motel. By now you found out that hotels in San Francisco are more expensive than expected. Which means that you are checking the various motels on Lombard street.I can tell you that choosing this place is an ok choice. The location is fine: you can rent bikes on the street (the rental location 3 blocks west is 10 usd cheaper per day); and there are public busses on Chestnut which bring you to Fisherman’s Wharf. The expensive tourist hop-on-hop-off bus stops 2 blocks away.From the inside the rooms have been nicely updated; to a decent hotel level. It’s not very spacious; but nothing is in SF. The wifi works, the fridge works and there is a microwave in the room.Tips: if you come by car; you can park for free. But there are more rooms than parking spots.And if you have 1 of the 2 rooms with a window on streetside: eventhough you have double-glass in the window, it is very very noisy. And don’t count too much on breakfast: there is coffee and juice to drink or you can chew on some banana’s, croissants or prepacked rolls. It’s better than nothing though!

Married couple and Dad stayed here for 3 nights. Dad is 70 so was grateful to be on the ground floor whilst we were upstairs. Don't remember there being a lift so needs considering for carrying cases upstairs. Excellent location close to lots of shops, bars and restaurants within 15 minute walk. Excellent transport links, we had a 3 days hop on/off bus pass and the stop was nearby. Traffic noise is quite loud but didn't really bother us. Parking is tight and very limited. Fortunately we got a space and didn't need the car for 3 days so able to just leave it. Good fast wifi. Easy check in and helpful staff. Room wasn't huge but perfectly adequate. Clean, tidy and modern. Usual commodities for America - fridge, microwave and coffee machine. Breakfast was pastries or fruit - enough to put you on for a couple of hours. Also coffee, tea and juice available.

Lovely boutique and convenient boutique hotell. Staff is attentive and personable. Everything is clean, comfortable; rooms are quiet. Filtered water is a great touch.Terry at the front desk is hilarious and makes check-in a charming experience.The evening happy-hours with live jazz band is a lovely touch.When was the last time I had a hotel room with a walk-in closet? Nice surprise.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: This hotel was a great start to the beginning of our USA trip. We were greeted warmly by happy staff. Check-in and out was very quick and efficient. Staff were able to answer all questions we asked and we were given all the information we needed about the hotel, places of interest and the surrounding area. The complimentary nightly social wine and live music is a great way to meet and greet other hotel guests from all over the world and share stories of your travels, just a wonderful idea. We loved the quaint and unique décor which makes you feel right at home. The rooms are just like pictured on line, very quaint, clean, and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is modern and very clean. Be mindful of: 1) There is no fridge in the room - although not that big of an issue really; and 2) Inconsiderate guests that travel in groups and they have rooms on the same floor, leave their doors to their rooms open and have conversations from room to room, from outside their rooms into the hallways, speaking very loud and at times laughing till late into the night, not realising that there are other guests staying there that can hear all their conversations as well, although this isn't the hotel's fault, guests should be more considerate and respectful to other guests.We would definitely stay here again if we ever return to San Fran. The hotel is in an excellent location. Loved it here.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Old dated hotel room that appears new on the picture. The hallway smells and the rooms smell. Our closet smelled like smoke so we told the staff. They came to spray it but failed to open the windows to air out. Had to sleep next night in the room with the nasty chemical spray. Didn’t offer to move us or anything. The only thing that’s good about this place is the location and water filters on each floor. For the money you are paying to stay there definitely not worth it. Parking overnight is $30.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: This place served its purpose just fine but wasn’t anything special. The room was very small but clean, however it was very loud making it tough to sleep. When we checked in the person doing it didn’t tell us anything, so we didn’t know there was any ice, and that there were refrigerators available upon request etc. I wouldn’t stay here again just because I don’t think it’s a good value, but there wasn’t anything overtly wrong with it, just personal preference.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Good Place to Stay and close to the Downtown Area. The hotel is vintage but good and tidy. The staffs are nice and really reasonable for services. They had been really helpful. And there are fun places and restaurants around the places as well.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: 1) great friendly staff2) great location - close to all the great neighbourhoods: Russian Hill, Castro, Haight-Ashbury, Chinatown, Union Sq, Pier 39, Civic Centre. Close to Bart St, Civic Centre (walk along Polk St or Van Ness mostly flat and cleaner st to walk through the Tenderloin part of town). Unfortunately, the streets of the downtown Union Sq and Tenderloin part of town is very dirty with the stench of urine due to the state of homelessness in SF.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: This was our first hotel after arriving in San Francisco. Whilst the foyer and reception was informal, the staff on duty were welcoming and informative, although a little pushy trying to book you on to trips, etc. The room, 414, was at the back of the hotel, not much of a view, but quiet. Well equipped, save for a fridge which was shipped in before we got to the room by the housekeeping staff. Very clean with everything we needed. Nightly complimentary wine in the foyer during a happy hour. Food in the restaurant was good in the evenings, less so at breakfast. We were advised by the reception staff to “always turn right when leaving the hotel”. Why? We suspect the area to the left is less salubrious.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: We booked to stay 5 nights and lasted 1The hotel doesn’t have aircon. The beds are terrible, the lifts are from the 1800’s.The renovated bathrooms are nothing more than a coat of paint.It’s not in a good part of town. For the money we’re now at the grand Hyatt!!! So much betterSkip the Carlton it’s bad
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The bones of the building are pretty old, but everything inside is clean and well designed. Staff is the best! Gio was so kind, funny and attentive our whole stay. He'd always greet us with a smile and a joke, remembered my name right away and was just a pleasure to deal with. Social hour and live music were a hit. And the restaurant makes amazing food!!! I'm definitely staying here again if I'm back in San Fran.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: We are an english couple in our early sixties driving up the coast.We stayed for 4 nghts.The hotel does not look great from the outside, inside it is OK.The reception staff are excellent, very friendly, very helpful, knowledgeable.There was often live music in the large reception area in early evening with free drinks etc - this would have been great but we never seemed to have time to stop!The hotel is situated, we were told, at a point where the desirable area of San Fran meets the less desirable area of San Fran - so as we left the hotel we always headed towards Fishermans wharf - never in the opposite direction.Our room was OK, large and recently decorated / furnished to a reasonable standard.we had a very large wardrobe ( useful for our cases) and an ok bathroom with shower over the bath tub and a shower curtain (Yuch - we do not like shower curtains!)There are machines dispensing free water on each floor and water jugs in the bedroom - we thought this was great.Our room did suffer at times from street noise.Breakfast was quite good with normally friendly service - the decor was a bit alternative!
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: I had high hopes but they were dashed when I was told at check-in that the rooms do not have A/C. This is an old and "eclectic" hotel called boutique but it felt like lipstick on a pig. There was an old ceiling fan and they offered me a box fan but it was sweltering and I woke up dripping in sweat. I heard it was unseasonably warm for SF but it's June. I would not stay here nor recommend it unless you're on a serious budget and don't mind having no AC. Front desk staff was very nice and welcoming though.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: This hotel whilst on an initial welcome seemed ok, we booked a queen sized room and got a small double, on querying it we were told all the rooms were the same size, however our travelling companions had a queen sized room, the hotel was poor value for money and across San Francisco you get taxed twice, the state tax and a SF tax, which is new to other trips I have made to sf. The restaurant was within the hotel but not part of it, it is expensive and you have to complete a form if you want it added to your room. Whilst the location isn’t bad, it is quite a walk to all the key attractions, if you have any mobility problems this is not a good location to stay and there were no accommodations made to help anyone with a disability.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Having travelled around the World, this was nothing more than a 2/3 star Hotel. Dirty, needed a refurbishment and a decent restaurant. Too far from Front in a not very nice part of Town if you went out and turned the wrong way.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Stayed at the Carlton for 3 nights on a Cosmos tour.Very comfortable hotel big beds room size ok for a city hotel. The walls a bit thin so some noise.Staff are very helpful.As for location it is near Tenderloin just keep out of that area staff on desk will advise you and you are ok. No problem walking to Van Ness or Chinatown area even at night.Like any city be aware.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Good location for getting around. Friendly and helpful staff. A bit tired, but fine if you just want to use as a base. Bathroom is small but adequate. Room was clean. Free wine during happy hour was a nice touch.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: I was disappointed with the layout of the room. Room size is very small and so is the bathroom. There is no space in the room to walk.There should be more lights on the room.I stayed for 1 week and paid 300 dollars a night. Not worth it.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: No air conditioning. No parking. No luggage help at the checkin. Good location, too small of a bath, nice staff. Fan and open window helped but street was noisy disrupting sleep. Water stopped working for two hours.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Hotel has great character but was lacking in a few areas that I would think would be easily corrected. The Wi-Fi is atrocious; don't rely on it if you need it for work or something else important. They charge you 15 bucks a day for the privilege of using the barely functional Wi-Fi...along with some filtered water and a daily paper.The room was cramped, but a different layout could improve that and add space for more countertop/shelving to place luggage and items. Most of our belongings stayed on the floor. The rooms include a Keurig coffee maker with fantastic coffee pods, but they're chintzy on supplying sugar packets, which seems weird given the rest of the great coffee setup. Our biggest beef was that there is no fridge in the room. Even cheap Motel 6's have a mini-fridge in the room! There is a large closet with a safe and an ironing board and iron, which would be easily big enough for a mini-fridge (or more shelving/countertop space).Complaints aside, the hotel is tastefully decorated, has great character and the staff are all first-rate and very helpful. It was a pleasure to speak with any of them, but Theo in particular was a fantastic ambassador of the hotel and the city overall. As long as a visitor is aware of the shortcomings, I would recommend the hotel.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Hotel Carlton is such a charming property in a great location. The team is always extremely friendly, personable and engaging. Parking is easy and for SF standards, very affordable. The GM, Ron, Theo at the front desk and every team member we came in contact with was so pleasant and made us feel at home. We look forward to our next visit.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Just had a week in hotel carlton, absolutely fantastic, desk staff fantastic always willing to help and very polite, got a free room upgrade and complimentary fridge, walls a little thin sometimes heard things we didn't want to,but overall brilliant hotel, well placed to see city,Miller's rest next door was a great bar,Alcatraz is a must really eerie, had a great week, thanks hotel carlton .
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: I came here in 2016 and had a decent stay, but have come back a few times since and have had a much better stay. They have a water machine (I think one on each floor?) and a pitcher in each room to stay hydrated instead of overcharging for water bottles. The staff is wonderful and memorably friendly, and it's located within walking distance of many fun bars and restaurants - it's now my go-to hotel when I'm traveling to SF.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Nice rooms and very helpful staff. The hotel is though located near the tenderloin area which is infamous for a high crime rate and drug use. During our 4 night stay. Two of the nights were interrupted by screaming and fighting just outside our hotelroom. The other nights we woke up from other hotelguest slamming doors etc.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: It's not the fanciest, newest or most deluxe hotel by a long shot, but the Hotel Carlton (a 1920s charmer) is a great value in a screamingly expensive city and with all due respect to SarahFromChicago, it is well located with plenty of nearby sights and conveniences.Where do I start? The staff. What a nice group of people. When we arrive a computer glitch was preventing keys from being programmed so Gianni (Johnny?) swept us and our luggage upstairs and made us comfortable. The desk staff are a delightful bunch who remember you and wave hello and goodbye and do what they can to show they care. Leo (again name?) has actually organized musical events with free wine at cocktail hour--and those bands and singers, musically diverse combos, were a real pleasure and not just a noisy feature.Room 317 had no view at all but that simply didn't matter. It was quiet and comfortable and the cleaning staff were efficient. Unlike several places we have stayed recently, there was no arriving back at 4:00 and finding the room had not yet been tidied. The rooms are modest in size but again--unless you have several people spending a lot of time in the room, just how much space is necessary? The television was decent sized and good quality. The bathroom was efficient and well lit. There was ample space in the closet and several large drawers in the bureau. On every floor is a watercooler and a pitcher in the room makes that a truly nice feature. Oh, and the glasses are actually glass and the coffee cups are ceramic. I can't tell you how pleasant that is. Ice is on the main level as is a microwave should you need one. We used ice daily and the microwave twice. We had not originally planned to have a car, but we ended up borrowing the grandson's car so we could get back and forth--and because the garage on the immediate next corner, really only a hundred feet away has a $25 hotel rate. The staff there are delightful and in the end, this great value saved us a ton on Ubers.Need a Walgreens? It is two blocks away. Want to return your Alamo rental? The service at Union Square is a pleasant 1/2 mile walk. Need a bite? There is a huge range within 1/2 mile and mostly much closer. Common Sage offers Ramen. There's Middle Eastern inside the hotel and across the street. Two blocks further up Sutter is the Slider Diner for those that just want an excellent burger. Next to the hotel is the relaxing Miller's Rest. And my favorite, across Sutter and a few doors down is Le Marais open at 7:30 am with its French pastries (amazing pain aux raisins!) and hot coffee. Light lunches also available. Okay, SF MoMA is perhaps a bit too far to walk but there are busses and there are Ubers. So many Ubers.And the parks and Fine Arts Museums in them are a couple miles away or so, but parking is a headache and public transportation of some kind is a much better choice.The effect is a little shabby chic with a touch of South Asian color and a wee bit of camp. We were entirely happy with it. I would unquestionably stay again and recommend the place highly.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: We stayed in Room 716, the view was of rooftops but we were not in the room enough to care. The room was clean and an appropriate size for a couple. It appeared the room must have been remodeled recently as all flooring, bathroom fixtures and paint looked fresh.The desk staff was very friendly, polite and helpful. Check-in and check-out went very smoothly without any issues. They made a great recommendation from breakfast (MyMy) only a few blocks walk away. In the evening, they has complimentary wine for guests and live jazz music in the lobby.I gave them 4 and not five because I like to sleep in. I found other guests and the housekeeping staff can be very loud or at least easily heard in the room from the hallways.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights during our tour of the west coast and its fairly average once you get past the reception. Rooms are basic and the bathroom facilities that of your standard budget hotel. Prices within San Francisco are very expensive so i will say this offered a good rate in comparison to those closer to fisherman’s wharf. I can say that the scent they use in the reception is amazing! It really makes you feel at home. A word of caution for guests venturing out at night! Its not in the nicest part of town. But be streetwise and you’ll be fine. All in all i think i’d spend a bit more and go closer to the action next time I’m in the Bay Area.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: This hotel is well located and easy to get to most parts of the city from. The room was spacious and well decorated and very comfortable. The staff were very accommodating. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable and tasteful accommodations.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights whilst visiting San Francisco. There are good and bad points to this hotel:Good: - Location - not in the tenderloin like many of the hotels. Can walk to most places. - Price - we got a very good price for 5 nights compared to many of the other hotels we looked at - Friendly staff - Complementary wine and live music every evening in the reception- The room (deluxe king) was spacious with a comfortable mattress- Cool water machines on every floor Bad:- The walls are so thin you can literally hear the next door guests turning on the light switch! - Terrible lumpy pillows! - The room service to make the beds ect in the morning come very early! Overall a pleasant stay for the price we paid, but by no means a luxury hotel! Bring some ear plugs and your own pillow!
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Great boutique hotel, especially for the price - it makes you feel fancy even on a budget. Wonderful staff, very helpful and kind. Clean rooms. Awesome interior design.When I visit San Francisco again, I will stay at Hotel Carlton.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Firstly, the front desk told me to use breakfast coupons collectively, when I went to the Resturant, waitress blamed the front desk and food quality was bad. Bad start to a trip.Next, the hotel manager got back on a query with booking agent only after 5 business days and when I asked the front desk for updates, they mentioned manager is busy on the phone consistently. Dissapointing.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: What a great place! We stay in SF often and we finally found THE hotel! The restaurant was great. The room furnishings were so cool, very eclectic and funky. Clean and tidy. Glass water pitcher to fill at filtered station.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Cute boutique hotel in great location. About a 35 min walk to the Fisherman's Wharf. Room was small but had everything one needs. Very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again! Staff were helpful.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The hotel has been updated and is very comfortable. It's age shows in some places but it very clean. The internet is fast and there are sufficient convenient power outlets. The beds are excellent. There is plenty of storage space. The staff was friendly and efficient. The wine and music at 5:30 was fun and well attended. It is not in the tourist popular Union Square area - which was ok - but be careful not to wander into the nearby Tenderloin. The restaurant was just so-so. But who cares when the amazing and awesome Mr. Holmes Bakehouse is right around the corner? We attended Hamilton at the Orpheum Theatre and afterward caught a #19 Muni bus from the front of the theatre to 2 blocks from the hotel. Way cheaper and faster than a ride hailing service. My high marks for price are because we got a spring special price.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Staff was very friendly. Rooms were small but well setup. Wine reception was a nice touch. Street noise is significant and hard to sleep through. One night with earplugs, okay, but not more. The restaurant was ok, but lots of options nearby that are worth trying.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Great stay central to all location s staff very welcoming and helpful if you need to get to a location in San Francisco the desk staff will supply you with a map and point out the location on it for you.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Carlton San Francisco is a renewed retro style hotel near tomany attractions and with a very friendly staff.They don’t have parking area in the hotel, but there is one in the next block with a very reasonable price for this city - US$ 25 for 24 hours.I would stay in this hotel again.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: From start to finish this establishment has character, warmth and high service levels. It has the feel of a family well-run hotel. Our room was spacious and warm, a lovely bed, actually everything you need (almost - no fridge!). The welcome is informative and warm, the jazz and wine each evening generous and convivial. I can't recommend this place more highly!
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: A very clean and comfortable hotel with a friendly atmosphere. Staff were very helpful. Walking distance to Union Square and Civic Centre and close to bus stop 47 that takes you to Fisherman’s Wharf. Enjoyed the complimentary wine and music in the hotel lobby in the evenings.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Outstanding staff; very comfortable and close to many SF attractions. Great service and great value. Evening music and cocktail hour was added bonus. We requested connecting rooms and hotel staff saw to meeting our request and expectations. Would stay at this hotel again, without question.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Arrived early and room was available for check in. Front staff friendly and informative. Room was excellent, a good size, clean and bed perfect. Bathroom had all requirements met. Interesting facts about the history and current owner.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Easily one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed at. The service was excellent, and the complimentary wine really made our evening a pleasant one. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning a quick trip through San Francisco.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: I read a lot of reviews before booking at the Hotel Carlton. Some of the negative comments concerned me but I decided to take a chance because "the price was right." We were very pleased with our 3-night stay here. Upon check-in we received a warm and friendly welcome at the front desk (thank you, Theo). Our Deluxe King room was on the seventh floor and faced east toward the Financial District. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was spotless. In fact, the tile work and fixtures seemed to be brand new. The bath towels were oversized and absorbent. To address some of the negative comments I'd seen in other reviews: 1) yes, the walls do seem to be thin. On Saturday night of our stay there seemed to be a "girls getaway weekend" going on and we did hear voices through the wall. For the next two nights I believe there was a guest in the same room but we didn't hear a peep. 2) The neighborhood. We found the street to be quiet and safe and there were several really great restaurants and coffee shops within a few blocks. Just down the street we stumbled upon Chisme Cantina which was a new discovery to us and so delicious. It was also nice to have a Trader Joe's just a few blocks away to stock up on snacks and drinks. And as you walk up into Nob Hill the neighborhood is full of interesting nooks and crannies to explore.We found the other guests to be friendly and people seemed to enjoy being there. Overall, the hotel met all our needs and we'll be happy to stay there again.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The staff was really exceptional. Beds weren’t the most comfortable and the walls a bit thin, but everything else about this hotel more than makes up for that. It was a great price in a nice, central location.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Great stay and great room. Loved the amenities. Centrally located near Union Square. Walkable to Union Square. The restaurants around the hotel are great. Room was really nice and decorated beautifully. LOVED being able to open the windows!
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: From arrival till the day I left, the over all experience was awesome! So many things to do that are within walking distance of hotel was very convenient. A must stay if you plan to be in city for a few days.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: You will love the decor and authentic feel at hotel Carlton. Room was exceptionally clean, fan above bed kept me at just the right temperature, walked to all my meetings. Bars and coffee shops within walking distance, you will truly enjoy your stay at Carlton!
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: We enjoyed our week’s stay at the Carlton. It is 10/15 minutes walk from Union Square and you can get a feel of a large American city. The hotel was very comfortable and the staff were friendly and very helpful.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Friendly boutique hotel with proximity to everything SF. Mattresses were a little too hard for my taste. Front desk staff was engaging and very helpful for directions and suggestions. Neighborhood is very close to the underbelly of the SF, but there are great eating options in the TL! Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: We could keep this short: this was the best place I stayed in in SF so far!Entering the lobby, you already are greeted with a great atmosphere. Theo at the front desk always greeted with a smile and was quick with recommendations for dinner or answering any other question I had. The room was spacious and very clean. For SF I would even say extraordinarily clean. SimilarlY to the rest of the hotel, also the room had this early 20th century atmosphere (although there was a huge flat screen TV). Water filters are available on every floor and a carafe is available at every room.There's just one negative thing: the walls are really thin. Especially with a road facing room or loud neighbors you will have a hard time getting to sleep without ear plugs.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: we had a great stay at this hotel. Hotel with a lot of charm, comfortable and in the center of all neighborhoods to visit. A special thanks to Theo who welcomed us and helped us on various needs. Thank you for your kindness and your efficiency, Théo.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Overall it is great and the bed is extremely comfortable to sleep well. It also provide cold water and capsule cafe. The hotel staff is so kind to arrange our two rooms are closed to each other, however, the room inside also has a closed door, which greatly reduce the sound insulation. we can hear each other clearly in the different room. This is the only uncomfortable part when we stay there. Beside this part, this hotel is fantastic.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The stay was great! Everyone was very welcoming and seemed very nice. The place lies near many places to visit. Some were a walk away and others, we just had to uber. The restaurant inside was very clean and the bartender was very nice. However the only thing we noticed was the walls are easy to hear through. Other than that, it was well worth staying there.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The staff couldn't have been nicer during our 3 day stay there. Upon checking, they greeted me with a glass of wine (during social hour). The music was great. Such a nice way to spend a few minutes relaxing. The only downside is that social hour is 30 minutes, but during the 30 minutes, it's really nice.Room was spacious and had great view of city.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: The room's decoration was very nice and feels very authentic. Also it was very clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my stay overall and happy with it. I was only disappointed with the view from my room. My room was on 2nd floor and facing towards the roof, has no view. But on the website, it says all the rooms have a San Francisco view. Luckily the receptionist could change my room to a better one, but still no San Francisco scenery, but just a bit more open in front.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Stayed here two nights on a business trip. At check-in the front desk clerk treated me like an old friend, handing me a glass of wine and inviting me to sit with the band that was playing in the lobby. Once in my room, I called the front desk to notify them that the radiator was leaking onto the carpet; they sent a maintenance person up in less than 15 minutes, and they not only stopped the leak but offered to have staff blot the carpet with towels -- I declined, since the room was more than large enough to ignore that spot (I could have slept in the enormous closet!). The bed was plush and comfortable and I slept well. Check-out was smooth and fast; I don't know how they recognized me, but I didn't even have to tell them my room number. They just emailed me my invoice and I was on my way.
hotelName: 21    Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

review_body: Right in the heart of Japan town and close by the Chinese Embassy.Many great eateries in the area. Parking available in the hotel garage or park at Japan Town parking garage to save a few $$. Has a wonderful on-site restaurant as well.

It was the first time I stayed at a Kimpton. I wanted to love it, the staff was friendly and helpful. However the building is older, and the Plumbing was bad. I stood in 3 inches of water while taking a shower each morning, ut drained so slowly. Great neighborhood walking distance to plenty of places to eat.

This hotel was clean, staff extremely friendly, always helpful, and always able to give advice of places to go, eat, and how to get around. Very convenient location to a lot of tourist sites in San Francisco area.

Nice location in Japantown, close to sights, restaurants and shops. Easy base for exploring Japantown as well as a very short walk to Fillmore Street for great shopping and eating. I enjoyed staying in this quieter San Francisco neighborhood and loved the Kimpton Buchanan Hotel. Staff could not have been nicer! Included bonus: a coffee bar in the morning and an early evening wine hour.

Going location. Fantastic staff who were all very helpful and thoughtful. The morning coffee in the lobby was wonderfully strong and delicious. Hotel was quiet allowing for uninterrupted sleep. Well located too.

We stayed for just one night but everyone treated us like gold. We didn’t need to go to the airport the next day until 6:30pm so they gladly held our luggage for us. Gerardo & Rey at the front desk are the best; so nice and helpful. I ❤️ Kimpton.

It’s fun and it’s funky (but in a really good way) with the TV mounted on an artist’s easel and the monochrome tie-dyed effect in the hallways. It’s enough off the beaten path to be a quiet place but close enough via MUNI or cab to get to all the attractions San Francisco has to offer. And it’s proximity ro Japantown offers great dining possibilities along with unusual shopping opportunities.

Excellent hotel in Japantown, close to Asian restaurants & shops. Many things are at walking distance, including parks and churches. Nonetheless, this is a quiet place. The only complaint is the price, which is quite high (not for San Francisco, though). We will likely go there again whenever in San Francisco.

This was our second visit to the Kimpton Buchanan and it did not disappoint. Room was spacious, bed was comfortable, pillows just the degree of firmness, HVAC highly efficient and quiet, and the windows open. Table and chairs were a good addition so we could dine in one night. Location is perfect if you enjoy exploring the city on foot and want to walk to the de Young, SFMOMA, the Ferry Building, Telegraph Hill and the Coit Tower, Union Square and so on. It's also on several Muni lines and has reasonable easy access to the BART and SFO. Has a little restaurant attached, Mums, that serves an excellent breakfast. Free NYTimes available in the lobby, even on Sunday. All in all, another great stay ... Thank you!

A business associate recommended the Klimpton Buchanan for a recent trip to San Francisco & I owe them a nice bottle of wine. Located in the heart of the Japan Town neighborhood the Buchanan was an Oasis of comfort. Check out the "patio rooms"...great option not found at many downtown hotels. Convenient to everywhere in the San Fran area. Sophisticated slimplicity and professional service.

We were in for 1 night to visit the Spanish Consulate and the staff were incredibly accomodating and friendly. It was nice to arrive at 5:30 PM for the happy hour :) The room was well-appointed and included robes and plush, super comfy pillows. We had to attend to some business at 1 AM and the front desk person went over and above to help us out. We loved the outdoor cornhole and jenga space too.

Terrific hotel - great locationWe booked this hotel based on a revommendation by a local friend who knew of itGreat location, wonderful staff Michael & Rey who could not do enough for us, rooms very clean, pretty good value for San Francisco, handy little restaurant on 1st floor and overall a very pleasant time overall.Also really close to Japan Town with dozens of great and inexpensive places to eat

delightful stay, i wanted something a little outside the central SF bustle and this fitted the bill perfectly. quiet, stylish, fun to explore japantown a little bit, got a nice glass of sake on arrival. a

I had mixed feelings about this hotel. The location is good - walking distance to Fillmore St. shops and restaurant, Hayes Valley, Pacific Heights, and even the business district if you allow enough time for the hills! Staff was friendly and polite.My room was comfortable enough but the bathroom seemed like a motel with the tub/shower combo and the bedroom had a distinct musty smell that did not go away even tho I opened the window. At close to $400/night, I expected a bit more in terms of room quality - no balcony, no robes or slippers, not much of a view, small bathroom. An acceptable stay but don’t know that I’d return.

Beautiful design. Great neighborhood. Very walkable with lots of restaurants near by. Hotel staff was very helpful. Room was comfortable with a cute patio. Didn't see room service, but maybe I missed it? Wish there was bottled water in the room.

I very much enjoyed by stay at Kimpton Buchanan. The Japantown location is quiet and charming (good ramen!) and centrally located. The front desk staff was very courteous, and allowed me to check in early in the day of my arrival. The rooms were nicely appointed, but casual. I had a balcony which was lovely. I did find the bed to be a bit too firm for a side sleeper. The hotel offers a 5 pm happy hour with free wine in the lobby which was very nice. There is no coffee pot in the room or coffee kiosk in the lobby from which to grab a beverage in the morning. But overall a great stay. I would stay here again.

Everyone on staff was helpful and genuinely friendly. The room was perfect, with tastefully minimal decor, an extremely comfortable bed, no outside noise, a great view of the Japantown neighborhood, and a roomy shower/tub with great water pressure. With excellent free coffee and a complimentary copy of the NYTimes in the morning and a free glasses of a decent wine in the late afternoon, what more could you ask for? There's also a small gym and a very decent restaurant on-site with great prices and tasty fresh food, with shabu shabu (which I didn't get a chance to try) in the evening.. Bottom line,the price was a great value for a clean/safe neighborhood in San Francisco within two blocks of cafes, bars, and shops on upper Fillmore and next door to some amazing food and all purpose shops in Japantown. Everyone at the front desk was great - a big shout-out to Rey, Loreen, and Mike!

I normally stay near Union Square when I visit SF, but this time I had my dog (labrador retriever) with me, so chose the Kimpton due to their wonderful dog policy. Many hotels in the city claim to the be "dog friendly" but have restrictions on pet weight or impose extra fees. Not so with Kimpton hotels! I stayed in one of the patio rooms on the first floor which had some extra outdoor space for Fido as well. There is a quiet neighborhood park 1.5 blocks away which the dog and I both appreciated. Felt safe walking her there at night.  Neighborhood was lovely. Clean, quiet, and IMHO much more pleasant than Union Square. There are many restaurants within walking distance and not all Japanese. Loved the evening wine and morning coffee. Absolutely no issues with my room or the service. Will stay here again.

Spent 4 nights. Room was cleaned before 10:00 every morning. Very spacious rooms and bathroom, and very clean. The pictures on the official website are accurate. The lobby offers complementary wine tasting everyday from 5-6pm AMAZING. One of the friendliest staff Ive ever dealt with. Special shoutout to Heraldo and Rey who were exceptional during our stay (hellos, good evenings, good activity suggestion, etc) overall pleasant gentlemen. They made a huge positive impact in our stay at this hotel. Hotel is accross Little Japan. Very quiet neighborhood. Walking distance from many restaurants. Would definetly recommend staying here.

If you understand that Kimpton Hotels are not Waldorf Astoria, it is easy to add an element of interest to any trip by staying at Kimpton Hotels. I have stayed at approximately 5 different Kimptons, and the latest stay was at San Francisco's Buchanan Hotel. As I have come to expect from Kimpton, the Buchanan was equally unique. The reception area is dark and sexy, with seating in the common area inviting and visually inspiring. My room, like many in the Kimpton chain, was extra large and easy to spend time in. Loved it!

Great location. Good costumer service, especially the front receptions. I love that they give free bottle water. Happy Hour Was great. Japan town is just across the hotel which have a selection of restaurants, an ice cream shop and bakery.

Good location for Japan Town and a short drive to Fisherman’s Wharf. Rooms are decent size for family of four. Need to have vending machines with drinks and snacks for kids. Parking is very limited and expensive.

We love staying with the Kimpton properties as all offer boutique experiences and exceptional service. The Buchanan upheld those standards with room well appointed and service excellent - a special nod to Phil at the front desk who looked after every detail upon our late night checkin. Great central location for touring all the Cherry Blossom festival celebrations.

Staying in the Kimpton Buchanan gives a peak into what SanFrancisco living is away from the hustle of busy tourist locations. Great walkability in Japantown with Fillmore street nearby, Walk to the waterfront less than 1.5 miles away or Lyft to Union Station or Chinatown in minutes.The understated, lovely room design and the usual Kimpton goodies makes staying here again a must for us.

I always stay at Kimpton's and this one did not disappoint. Right across the street from the heart of Japantown, there is a ton to do. The rooms are quite large and incredibly clean. WiFi was great and the front desk is incredibly helpful. I forgot to reserve a hypoallergenic room and they were super patient and able to accommodate me. Cannot recommend enough.

I stayed at the Kimpton Buchanan recently for three nights while on a business trip to San Francisco. The hotel is clean and the rooms are a good size, however, it is a bit dated and the rooms feel like they are unfinished. For example, there was no desk and there was no coffee maker. There was a small fridge, however. They did bring me a Keurig machine when I asked about coffee, as there are no coffee shops in the area and I am someone who likes to start my day with a hot coffee. So for me, this is not somewhere that I would return, but it is based more on my personal tastes and needs when I travel and not anything inherently wrong with the hotel or location.

I had hoped for an oasis of zen-like calm in San Francisco while in the city for a very busy conference. Unfortunately this hotel did not live up to the Kimpton brand. It was quiet and the bed was comfortable. But as I walked into the bedroom, the smell of mold from the wash basin area of the bathroom was really strong, and bothered me the whole time. The carpet was not exactly sticky, but felt like it hadn’t had a deep clean for years. One of the towels wasn’t clean, and there was a hole in one of the bedsheets. The location is great, but I won’t be returning.

I stayed here for 3 nights in March 19 and it was delightful. The staff are so helpful and attentive and the free use of bikes was amazing. The hotel is ideally located for tourism, with a short walk to union square. I will definitely be returning.

Loved this hotel. Location is right outside Japantown. I felt it was a very safe place outside the downtown area but still within walking, public transportation, and ride services. The staff are very friendly and attentive. Nick and Ray at the front desk were always pleasant and helpful. Room 703 was clean, comfortable, and large enough for 3 of us. Free wine hour daily was a bonus. I highly recommend this place.

Right in Japan town. Access to bus. Awesome place. Staff are so friendly. Parking is good and location is great. Bed was so comfortable extremely clean. There is a restaurant too. And you can order and take to your room. Free coffee an happy hour

Stayed here one night, room was large if not that well furnished, a computer desk would have been nice. Very well-kept, good coffee in the morning, but overall on the small boutique site. Great location adjacent to Japan town & the Fillmore

Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and gracious. They were professional and went out of their way to help us with any requests we had. The location of the hotel is great, the facilities were good (the gym, however is not much larger than a closet), and the restaurant was very good. We will definitely stay there during our next visit to SF.

I really enjoyed staying at this property a few years ago and looked forward to visiting it again. Just like before, I willingly paid extra for an upgraded patio room - Room 103. In fact, I think I stayed in the same room the last time.Unfortunately, this time the HVAC system was defective. Whenever it would cycle on, approximately 4x/hour, it would make a huge noise. It literally sounded like someone tossing a metal trash can across a concrete driveway. This disruptive noise occurred 24x7.Also, the sliding glass door that opens onto the public patio could not be locked. After the little lever was moved into the locked position, any movement of the door handle or shaking of the door would cause the lock to disengage and become unlocked.The little bedside tables have nifty built-in outlets and USB charging ports. However, the table on one side of the bed contained defective ports - the bedside light worked fine so there was power to the table, but the ports were dead. Of course, my wife didn't notice that until the next morning when she discovered her plugged-in phone did not charge overnight. Lastly, the in-room refrigerator was barely cool... probably no colder than 55 degrees. There was no control knob or other means to adjust the temperature downward. I reported these problems to the front desk staff and the response was, "Oh, I see... we'll have someone look at it." The guy didn't take any notes or indicate surprise. I have to believe these things didn't mysteriously fail when I appeared. They were most probably on the maintenance list for a while but were simply ignored.Paying nearly $700 for two nights lodging with these deficiencies is unacceptable. As mentioned above, I stayed in this hotel previously and enjoyed my visit immensely. I wrote glowing reviews about that visit on social media praising the facility and staff. I do not plan to return to this hotel.

Loved this hotel. It was perfect for our spa getaway at the Pearl. We will be back. It was clean and very comfortable. The beds were very comfortable, pillows room etc. loved their overall atmosphere.

I was in SF with my sister for a family reunion. We stayed 4 nights. The Pros: the quiet, clean room and courteous staff and near shops restaurants. Very walkable, esp Fillmore street. Loved the soaps. Very quiet, not in tourist area. The Cons: coffee service stopped at nine so if we slept in, had to pay at restaurant. Room very spartan with small bathroom and not enough seating. We are women of a “ certain age” and probably needed more amenities. Should have 2 luggage racks, towel bar over the sink.

Comfortable, relaxed atmosphere, convenient hotel.Truly enjoyed my stay thanks to attentive staff, amenities like morning coffee in the lobby (which is far better than the usual crappy in room plastic coffee pots), and complementary wine, sake, and juices in the afternoon. Attractive and pleasant lobby. Minimalist decor in the room is pleasant and functional. Great place to stay!

I stayed at the Kimpton Buchanan for an evening and had a great stay. Short but restful. Great location in SF, with a very capable staff and several very nice amenities for guests. Parking was in hotel and quite convenient. It was nice to stay outside of Union Square area for a change although I miss the old Kimpton Monaco hotel.

Nice staff - friendly but not over the top. Restaurant in the hotel is delicious. I got in pretty late and they saved me a glass of wine at the front desk. It was nice to unwind. Room is clean, if a little bare. I liked the spa products - the geranium shampoo smelled delightful! It looked like furniture had been removed and never put back. Seriously bummed out there wasn't a coffee maker in the room - I don't want to walk down tot he lobby in my bathrobe! Having a refrigerator was nice but there was no microwave - that also made things difficult. I feel for the price I paid there should have been more. I have paid 2/3rds less than what I paid and the room had a kitchen in it.

Loved everything about the hotel, the friendly staff, free bikes, yoga mat, and modern room. Thanks for a wonderful experience. My room overlooked a nice quite patio. Location is great, close to city center but not crowded. I would definitely stay again in this hotel.

I can't believe I've never stayed here before! Everything was stylish and updated, the hotel wasn't run down like another hotel in the area which I won't name. Easy check-in/check-out. Very kind employees. Nice big room. Great value!

Check in staff are the best anywhere! They are friendly and helpful. Wine hour 5-6 pm is a nice added touch offering red or white wine, Bailey's or sake. Rooms are not large but are clean, stylish & with a nice bed. Could use more electrical outlets for recharging. Has fridge but no microwave or coffee maker. Has safe, yoga mat, robe & umbrella. Also has free bicycles. Location is central to Japantown & Fillmore Street. Hotel feels very safe especially for women traveling alone as the elevators are directly in front of the check in desk. Hotel is a little pricey, but worth it if you have business in the area.

Nice, clean hotel in waking distance to much of San Francisco. A bit expensive, but I think everything is here. There is a restaurant on first floor that has a simple, but good menu to get your day started.

The city views are amazing! The staff was awesome and very attentive to our needs. Definitely recommend. Thank you for the Proseco and the sweets, we really enjoyed our stay at the Kimpton Buchanan. Big Thank You to Jillian!!!

There were problems with our booking when we arrived but Gillian on reception sorted it out while we went out to explore. When we came back all was sorted. During our stay others on reception were very helpful with information, directions, booking taxies and re-confirming pre-booked shuttle.Our room on the 7th floor was clean and comfortable we were aware of noise in the corridor in the mornings.

i've stayed here 4 or 5 times over as many years and i love this hotel. the staff is always helpful and friendly. the rooms are clean and well-appointed. is in a nice area of Japan-town with more than a few good restaurants very close (Jitalda Thai and Sweet Maple and faves.) they provide little amenities such as umbrella and robes that make a difference. is a solid, go-to place in SF.

The hotel was conveniently located for traveling around the city and had great walkability. It was close to a variety of great restaurants as well as many different retail stores. The staff was friendly and helpful and the beds were comfy. I would stay here again.

I booked the Kimpton Buchanan for work. I will be there for a few weeks, so decided it beset to stay close to downtown. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable and cozy. The room is really neat. It is a older property (seems historic...but I haven't researched this). The only drawback is no coffee makers in the room. They do offer a coffee bar in the lobby every morning...which is also amazing. Every type of tea, great coffee, as well as a hot chocolate bar. They also offer complimentary wine/cocktails in the afternoon (5-6 I believe). I will be staying there for a few weeks, so I'm really excited to find such a great property at a reasonable price.

Great location, quick and easy check-in! Free wine tasting when we arrived and the wines poured were good rooms were spacious and beds were sooo comfy. Located in great neighborhood with plenty of wonderful food options nearby

We spent a family weekend with our 2 dogs at this nice hotel. Nice to find a hotel that doesn't care about size of your dog! Staff was very friendly. Nice free wine hour from 5-6pm! No coffee maker in the room but there is coffee in the lobby every morning. No room service but there is a restaurant in the hotel and lots of places to eat (it's San Francisco!)

Rooms and amenities were perfect and clean. The hotel is situated in the awesome Japantown neighbourhood. We had a slight billing issue but the kind staf fmembers at Kimpton were able to resolve this to our satisfaction very quickly!

Hotel- Kimpton Buchanan (San Francisco, CA) Date: 03jan2019 – 04jan2019Overall: Average. Japantown location. Friendly staff, Limited facilities. Accommodations- Average. We were assigned a Balcony King room. The bedding was enticing & comfortable, and the room contained the usual furniture. Some furniture should be repainted/maintained; the bathroom door had no handle or latch to keep closed. A refrigerator was provided but the usual Kimpton minibar was not present. The heater had limited functionality, only very limited space was available on the bathroom countertop for toiletries. The balcony, bed, & television met expectations. The carpet was in really good shape.Loyalty Program Recognition- Above Average/Very good. As a Kimpton Inner Circle member, my room was upgraded. A welcome amenity of chips, nuts, water, and 2 sodas which was present in the room upon arrival, and we were given branded cloth bags containing water, chips, nuts, & Kind bar, as a substitute for a minibar. No ‘Complementary Chefs Taste’ was applicable.Staff- Excellent. Ed, at the reception, was excellent; he checked us in and explained the hotels amenities and offerings, along with a handout of local stores for food & shopping; Prior to checkout, he helped with printing & faxing service. He was a model employee and deserves special kudos. Emily, the manager, was very kind and professional. The wine hour ‘sommelier’ could not pronounce the wine offerings. For this Kimpton, appetizers did not accompany the wine hour, but two select alcohols were.Housekeeping- Poor. The bathroom was not good. The tub had scum buildup around the sides and bottom, and on the floor at the bottom of baseboards, dirt was accumulating, in part due to flooring choice. A bug was smashed on the ceiling. The carpet appeared clean. Scuffs were present on the walls. The bed was clean in appearance.Pool/Gym: not evaluatedMeal Options-. Average. The restaurant Mums provided the only food and beverage available within the hotel, and no room service is offered. The food is excellent, in price, taste, & service. Unfortunately, not even a menu is available in the room; you must go to the restaurant to even check what is available. It is not a Kimpton restaurant, but can be charged to your room, we were told. A full mall is located across the street, as an alternative, during select hours.Laundry- Poor. No laundry price list was available. Not evaluated further.Computer/Printer/WiFi- Good. WiFi was strong, and video streaming was possible. No computer or printer were available; printing had to be done via emailing the front desk. Property Appearance- Good. Exterior- The building is seasoned. The entrance was inviting; steps leading downward bring you to the lobby & reception. Interior- The lobby was appealing. A ceiling artwork created from glass bottles captured my attention, many of the other decorative items and furniture were appropriate.

Was in-town for JPM and on a crazy schedule. The hotel staff was overly gracious and accommodating with my late hour arrival and late afternoon room cleaning. Hotel was very clean, the beds and linens were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept on, and the bath products are my favorite brand :-)

Good hotel but very expensive far away from downtown. Good restaurant in house. Close to japanese quarter. Breakfast is reasonable. I was there with several colleagues who shared largely the same assessment.

Booked the hotel for a friends wedding and couldn't have been more pleased. The room was large and clean. My wife forgot a number of items she needed to get ready for the wedding and the staff were so helpful in making sure she got everything she needed.

Very cozy room with newly renovated bathroom. Room size was perfectly fine and the room had everything I needed for my one week stay (desk, TV, safe, steam iron, etc). Bed was good. Nice location close to Union Square and the cable car, with lots of restaurants and shops around. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free coffee and tea all around the clock in the hotel lounge. I took breakfast only once due to the high price - it was good (cheese, croissant, jam and a variety of warm dishes) but for me a sandwich from one of the supermarkets around was sufficient. I definitely recommend this hotel. This area of San Francisco is quite expensive anyway, and I found the hotel offered a good value for the money.

My daughter and I stayed at this charming hotel for two weeks as temporary housing while we searched for an apartment and we couldn’t have picked a better place to stay! The highlight was definitely the friendly and accommodating staff. This was our first time visiting the city and from the moment we arrived, we were given good suggestions for dining and exploring the city. Chatting with Emmet, Jose, and Grace as well as the two lovely ladies who cooked and served breakfast made this place feel like home. There’s a wonderful French restaurant in the hotel, Restaurant Jeanne D’Arc, which was an added bonus if you’re looking to enjoy a delicious, authentic French dinner. The location was central to everything San Francisco has to offer with good food, shopping, and the cable car right outside the door. Hotel guests may park at the garage across the street at a discounted rate. All in all, it was a comfortable, clean, and inviting place to stay. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

I surprised my mother with a night in the city for her birthday. We recently went to Paris so I really wanted to find a French inspired hotel. I stumbled upon this place as I was googling French Hotels near me. As I went on their website, I was completely surprised that my stay included dinner at their lovely french restaurant on site as well as parking and breakfast! We didn't know what to expect. From the moment we parked we knew it was going to be a wonderful experience! The parking garage is literally right across the street from the hotel. We approached the front desk and the gentleman checking us in could not have been nicer! We were greeted by a beautiful golden retriever. Joseph, the bellman let us into our room and explained all the lovely art we were seeing. We felt spoiled! The room was a cute room with a view. Very comfortable beds. Every one we encountered were so friendly. During the dinner, a violinist played and when it came to dessert, there was a candle in it for my mom and the violinist played for her personally. Great dinner and breakfast in the morning. We most definitely will be back! Keep up the amazing work!

Stayed for two nights in the "junior suite". The rooms are small, but comfortable; the elevator -- straight from the 20's -- is charming; the location can't be beat. The more-accomplished-than-one-would-expect mini-murals are, dare I say, delightful :-) They certainly make the exploration of all the floors, and the downstairs, and the two sitting areas into an adventure. We also had a dinner at Jeanne de Arc restaurant in the bowels of the hotel which I will review separately. The minor quibbles are as follows: 1) the hotel has no room service, even for breakfast. I understand it's a bit of hassle, but breakfast hours are a bit short. 2) the "room+dinner" special ended up costing $50 more than simply booking a room and having dinner separately. I am not sure what I was expecting, but it was the very same standard prix fixe dinner.3) because they now only offer free breakfasts if the hotel is booked on their website (which is not a great website, by the way, with disappearing and re-appearing specials and unclear availability, but I digress) -- they have a system of little coupons that one must carry to have breakfast for free. It seems that saying your room number should be sufficient and the restaurant should get a daily list of the "entitled" rooms. It is precisely these points of friction that unnecessary detract from an otherwise excellent, friendly hotel. Would we stay there again? Certainly.

We stayed at the Cornell Hotel de France again to see an art Exhibition and we ortet for the Hotel,Dinner package which turned out to be a good choice.The Restaurant put on a great Dinner and we didn't have to drive anywhere to eat dinner.The hotel was excellent as always.Mike

Very nice boutique hotel with a fun theme. The staff are excellent and brought our bags to the room and escorted us to the room. The free coffee in the cafe lobby was always great. The rooms are decorated with hand painted murals and embellishments. The location is central to the city, on the same block as a cable car stop, and surrounded by restaurants of all cuisines.

Service is exceptional and location is great. Convenient location on cable car route within walking distance of many popular sights and many restaurants. All staff are very friendly and helpful. Can’t beat a hotel with resident Golden Retriever.

I stayed at Cornell Hotel de France after a Giants game. It's located about 6 blocks from Powell Street BART. The hotel is charming, and in line with it's name does have a certain European flair. The breakfast room in particular looks like it could be pulled from any 100 year old hotel in Europe. My room and bathroom were small, but functional and comfortable for one person. I enjoyed my short stay very much!

In selecting this hotel, I did note the decorated walls and extensive range of artefacts throughout, all emphasising the french theme. Entering the hotel, the décor was initially a little overwhelming, with painted flowers on walls and ceilings everywhere, an enthusiastic homage to French impressionist art and in the restaurant, to Jeanne D’ Arc. Vases with fresh flowers are a welcome touch. The 1910 elevator is a piece of the history of the building. Located in Bush Street, the hotel is convenient to the cable car and it is an easy walk down to Union Square and major galleries. It is close to the Financial, Downtown and Nob Hill districts. There is definitely a French presence in this section of the city: there are restaurants, cafés and the Eglise Nôtre Dame des Victoires nearby. Throughout my stay, I gained a genuine appreciation of the excellent service and practical assistance with local information. This family run boutique hotel is small, cosy and friendly. Tea and coffee making is available in one’s room and downstairs next to the lobby. A comfortable lounge area is convenient to sit in and read the paper. Arriving too early to check in, I left my bags and went walking. On my return, my bags were in my room, my coat in the wardrobe for me.  Dinner in the Jeanne D’ Arc restaurant was a treat, and next day’s breakfast plentiful. Again the service was efficient and pleasant. The positive and helpful staff are a major draw card at this hotel.

Stayed for a week at Cornell. Whilst I didn’t take advantage of the restaurant the hotel itself was great. The room was extremely pleasing and clean. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom restocked with toiletries. Located on Bush St it is really central to San Francisco. Would I stay again.... it’s a big yes from me.

I hate to write this review. The secret will be out. Cornell Hotel de France has been our only Hotel in the City for years. We always have the dinner and breakfast packages and the staff can't be any better. The rooms are "old San Francisco" with a French charm.

Recently stayed at the hotel for 5 days. We booked our rooms on the hotel website, so breakfast was included. The hotel is close to Union Square near the top of Powell Street hill, so there is a very steep, but short walk up to the hotel from Union Square. The available breakfast included French toast, pancakes, eggs or either a cheese or mushroom omelet with hash browns and bacon. There is also fruit, cereal, croissants, cheese and yogurt. The options are the same each day. The hotel is older, but the room have been updated. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean. We would stay at the hotel in the future. It is a good value if you are looking for a mid-price hotel.

You don’t have to be a Francophile like me to find this hotel charming and a great found gem of a place for its great location, clean, quiet room and friendly staff.I found this hotel by chance after all the hotels catered to my convention were all booked out and I choose it for the price and its rating 8.9/10. I spent five nights here but had to move to Fairmont hotel, a 5 star hotel a block away for the 6th night when I decided too late to add on an extra night. I would give Cornell Hotel de France 9/10 and Fairmont 5/10 for its location and value. Cornell Hotel de France is 15 minutes walk to the convention; passing several coffee shops and eatery on the way as well as the cable car and neighborhood convenience stores are just blocks away. I would definitely look for this hotel for my next stay. I had sent this email to the establishment:Salut!C’était un grand plaisir de passer un petit séjour à Cornell Hotel De France.Je pourrais dire que j’ai trouvé un coin de la France dans le coeur de San Francisco.Merci bien et à la prochaine.L. Nguyen. Seattle, WA.
