This is a really stunning French inspired boutique hotel, in a super location about 5 mins walk from Union Square. The staff were so pleasant and helpful. We needed to check out really early which they were very accommodating about. Rooms are very quaint and had everything we needed. If you’re planning a trip to SF I couldn’t recommend this place more.We used the parking facilities across the street (as the hotel gives a preferential rate), with no problems.

Having dined at the lovely Jeanne d'Arc restaurant at this hotel in the past, my husband and I decided to try the hotel, which came highly recommended. We were not disappointed. Our room on the sixth floor, overlooking Bush Street was reminiscent of Paris apartments that dominate the city. The old-style elevator is a treat! In the room, there was a small nook with a table and chairs for a nightcap, and the decor - wall fresques and French paintings- were a lovely touch. The cleanliness of the room and bathroom were impeccable. Most remarkable was how quiet this busy street became at night. We slept very well and heard no noise. Finally, this hotel is centrally located to the tourist mecca, Union Square, and offers an excellent rapport quality-price. A special thank you to "Joe", who personally carried our luggage and showed us to our room. We will be back!.

We selected this hotel for its location and many positive reviews, and we were very pleased with our accommodations. It offers old world charm and the staff was pleasant and helpful, There are some gritty areas in the city at night, however, we felt fine walking back to this hotel from Union Square. A freshly prepared hot breakfast was included with our stay since we booked directly with the hotel. The coffee is excellent! They even offer gluten free bread for toast. It is served in the hotel's restaurant area located on the lower level which is not serviced by the elevator. Not a problem for us. Storing our luggage for our afternoon departure was quick and easy.

First of all, I highly recommend this hotel for those who wish to be in a central location in San Francisco. Our room is extremely clean and the hotel has all of the crucial things I look for--closets, coffee, full body mirror, chargers for both USB-type and plug-type devices on both sides of the bed, and a small table. It's perfect! The bathroom toiletries are all L'Occitane, which I really like--the scent of their shampoo is divine. There is artwork and stylish French-inspired decor everywhere you look and the ceilings/walls are artistically hand painted. Pretty impressive! They also offered valet parking just across the street with "in-and-out" privileges at a discounted rate. I've been to many hotels in Europe, North America and Asia. This place is head and shoulders above the rest. I highly recommend that you experience San Francisco while staying in this stylish hotel.

I have just stayed 6 days at this vert nice little hotel and its great locations. The hotel is old but very nicely and clean and the front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. I can warm recommend this hotel is you are going to San Francisco.

Friends suggested we stay in this hotel for at least one of our nights in San Francisco, and it was not disappointing. The elevator is tiny as is common when they have them in Europe, but we enjoyed using the old stairs to the 2nd floor. Our room had a window overlooking a tiny, hidden pathway, and old style radiator heaters that fit the European decor. One caveat, we couldn't control the heat and our room was too warm, but when we asked the front desk sent a fan to our room. With it in the window it brought back memories of France. Service from the porter, the valet and the office personnel was friendly and efficient. We had other plans and didn't get a chance to eat in the cafe, but our friends recommend it and we plan to include it on another visit.

Loved this hotel and its great location. Very clean, comfortable and decorated nicely. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Dropped our suitcase off before the Giants game and it was in our room when we got back.Will definitely stay here again.

Definitely not a characterless, boring hotel. The room was clean, interesting and unusual. The staff were extremely friendly and genuine. The location was close to perfect. An older-style European feel, with French guests. Would stay again.

So quiet... as if all the rooms on my floor were empty. Never saw housekeeping in the halls yet my room was spotless! Love the French decor and the elevator is unique and lovely. Good value and great location. Also no street noise (how is this even possible?)Shhh.

Excellent. Check in and check out were really easy. Small room but comfortable , clean and well equipped. Nice breakfast available when you book through the hotel website. Great location, walking distance from Chinatown, Union square and other interesting places. A cable car stop just a few steps from the hotel. Very helpfull staff. Parking option, for a fee, on a garage building on front the hotel.

Charming European style hotel with a great breakfast ( included when you book through the hotel website) and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again! They were very accommodating when we asked to bring a guest to breakfast.

Our stay was very pleasant. Reception and service were very good. Room clean. An old hotel with a ton of character. Noise from adjacent room was a little problem but still a great stay at a rest hotel!

Thankfully for a disabled person I'm quite mobile. This would have otherwise been a disaster. There is no ramp through the front door for anyone wheelchair bound, but I was able to climb with assistance. Finding an room with two double beds was a huge bonus. The complimentary breakfast was difficult to maneuver in, as their dining room is very small and even with reservations, we still had to wait. BUT the service was fantastic, from arrival to departure Jose' and the night/morning bellman went out of their way to accommodate two road weary women.

We wanted to spend our anniversary with a bit of a change of scenery, and an excuse to visit places in the area that we hadn't been too. We also wanted to find a quaint, cute place instead of your typical luxury or ritzy modern hotels. We loved our stay here! The staff was really friendly, of course we love the neighborhood - its not too far from Union Square - and the rooms were adorable.

Not at all the cookie-cutter business hotel. The obsessive Francefulness of all of the decor was quite fun; the room was small but comfortable, clean, inviting, uncluttered, and functional. The older building is well-maintained and full of hospitable touches. I enjoyed the painted ceiling!A short and pleasant walk from BART; easy check-in and check-out; free Internet; would be quite happy to return.

Perfect little spot tucked in right at Union Square! I loved the small details, like thematic painting throughout and charming decor in the rooms and restaurant. I booked directly through the hotel website and was able to get breakfast included in my rate. I much prefer a spot with some character to generic (giant) hotels - loved having an actual key to my room, a petite wood secretary desk to work at, lovely lamps, etc. Staff was very friendly, everything was clean and well maintained, breakfast was delightful. Highly recommend!

The Cornell Hotel is comfortable, well maintained, and in a great location. Rooms are cozy, tastefully appointed and functional. The service and staff are top-notch! Beautiful restaurant on site, and parking across the street.

This is a really quaint hotel, with French/English speaking staff. The room was small, but it is an old building. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable. Plenty of wi-fi outlets, too. The best part of the stay, however, was eating at the restaurant in the basement. I had a "salad" that was a delicious flaky puff pastry with scallops inside and a sauce that was so good, that I'm still thinking about it a few times a day, over a week later! (the filet mignon was a little disappointing, though) Don't forget to get a discount card from the front desk when you are staying at the hotel. We only stayed one night, but we're so glad we did. We uber'ed there from the airport, so I don't know about parking.

Yes, the building is old, but well maintained. We booked two Premium Queens. Room sizes were good, well equipped, charming decor throughout the building. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Within walking distance of Chinatown and other attractions. Parking a few doors down across the street was expensive, but with hotel discount was less than other hotels in the area. Jeanne d'Arc Restaurant at the hotel was excellent for our special occasion.

I can’t say enough positive things about this hotel. The staff was friendly, the decor is inviting and fun, and our room was great. It was more than enough space for two of us and the bed was comfortable. We weren’t able to eat dinner at the restaurant- recommend a reservation a week in advance for eating on the weekends. The location is perfect for any kind of transportation. We’re walkers and it was even easy to get to Fisherman’s Wharf!

When we come to San Francisco, we come to the Cornell. We've stayed many times over many years and look forward to future visits. Charming, comfortable, unique, family-run. The central location only adds to the inherent appeal. It's an open secret how exceptional this hotel and its restaurant are. Very many thanks to Claude and Micheline Lambert.

I absolutely love the Hotel Cornell!!!! The staff are all fantastic - front desk, cleaning, in the restaurant downstairs. You name it - everyone is professional, nice, responsive etc. Many of the staff have worked there a long time which is a credit to the owners. They love their jobs and it shows. It is clean, peaceful, friendly. Food at Joan D'Arc is fabulous also! Lastly, their mascot, a lovely golden retriever often greets you at the end of the day for a little "animal therapy". A sweet, happy puppy at the end of the day -- the best.

The hotel was quaint. The room was clean and comfortable. My only small complaint was the heat in the room. For me too hot and no way to turn it down for a comfortable sleep. Other than that very nice location and stay

Quirky and cute, and in places a little over the top with French kitsch that borders on clutter. It does not feel French, it feels more like someplace in Ireland trying to be French. The hotel is a climb from Union Square and not as convenient as it may look on a map. Inside the hotel the stairs are steep and the elevator is iffy. At first I thought the dogs (there were at least two while we were there) were neat, but their barking at odd times was annoying. The rooms are heated by a radiator, which I like because it is a great type of heat, but no room controls meant our room in the back was often very cold with no way to warm up with a note telling us not to attempt to adjust. Although the room was advertised with breakfast, it seemed to be a simple coffee and toast affair in a cramped and crowded room. We skipped and went down to Sears Fine Foods for an enjoyable experience. I would return, but only if no other options were in the area.

I love staying at this peaceful boutique hotel just up from Union Square. The service is gracious and friendly, and dinner in Restaurant Jeanne D'Arc is just superb. The hotel is near many sites of interest, like shopping and Chinatown, as well as good restaurants, and there are transit options nearby, including the cable cars.

We stayed over the holidays and we walked into a Holiday Wonderland. The hotel is in a great location, very safe. Parking garage is right across the street. The whole staff was very welcoming and helpful. We had a room on the 6th floor, (great lift), that was very clean and quiet. The bathroom was very large with a wonderful corner shower and super soft towels. The bed was just right, comfortable. Check their website for specials. The restaurant should not be overlooked! This is our new goto hotel now in San Francisco.

Lovely small hotel near Union Square. Easy walking to shopping and Chinatown. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The antique elevator was a treat. Our room was on the 5th floor at the back. Quiet, very clean, well-appointed. The decorating was very French -- sweet and unique. I would definitely stay there again.

Great little French hotel. Great staff. It's small but clean. Has everything I need and is superbly located. Breakfast is great and the dinner is good, but no obligation to eat there if you want. It's quiet and peaceful too.

I thought I was getting more for my money. Smelly, noicy, old, but friendly staff and I give them 7 out of 10 for clean table tops etc. The rest, even the admosphire was strange. The location if very good. The elevator is very cool, probably over 100 years old. The free standing Victorian bathtub in my room was odd but very decorative and the sheets around it were overwhelming. I feel I paid way to much for this kind of accomodation.

The Cornell Hotel de France is nice, clean hotel centrally located in the heart of San Francisco. Just off the Cable car line at Bush and Powell, we were within walking distance to transportation, good restaurants, China Town, shopping at Union Square. The hotel room, while small for three people, was comfortable and clean. The beds were great with plenty of pillows. By reserving our room online, we were able to have free breakfast in their restaurant. It was a small menu of eggs of your choice or French toast, or assorted cereals, fresh fruit and drinks.With the use of the three day Muni App visitor pass, we were able to get to anywhere in the city at a reasonable cost. The hotel has a great atmosphere and the staff was helpful and friendly. If you’re lucky, you might meet Michele, the Golden Retriever. Have a good stay!!!

This is the cutest little hotel near Union Square. The staff is very courteous. We always stay there New Years Eve and have their prix fixe dinner. The restaurant is lovely with a singer, accordian, and violinist playing. New Years eve is a festive french party !! They include breakfast the next morning, and the only complaint is the tiny portion of the hash browns that accompany the breakfast. Everything else was lovely. Clean rooms with newly remodeled bathrooms. You can park across the street in the garage.

We loved the charm and quirk of this hotel - the rooms, elevator, common areas etc. It was clean, comfy and in a great location and has everything you need. The basement dining room is especially quirky! Would highly recommend

This small hotel is located two blocks north of Union Square, as well as being close to Nob Hill and Chinatown. The french theme is carried throughout the hotel. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. Based on conversations we overheard from other guests, many of them are regulars who stay here whenever they visit SF. Hotel room 601 seems to be very popular! There is a small parlor for relaxing with other guests as well as small dining room with coffee and tea.There is a full restaurant downstairs in the basement. We booked online thru the hotel website and got breakfast included in the room rate. This is a plated meal of eggs, omelettes, pancakes, french toast. It was very good. Our room on the 1st floor was small, but this was not unexpected for an older city hotel. It was certainly sufficient for given the convenient location. We could not find the thermostat for our room, and it was a little chilly in the December morning.You can get a discount on parking at a somewhat sketchy parking garage across the street or you can self-park at a large garage a block away at Bush and Stockton. We would definitely stay here again.

just returned from our 5th or 6th stay at Cornell Hotel de France. the price is right, the rooms are clean, the lay-out is quirky/ cool, and parking is conveniently across the street.  we always have a good time there.looking for your pied-a-terre in SFO? this is it!

From the moment we entered the lobby, we were impressed and thought we were in a charming hotel in France. The exquisite hand-painted decor is tastefully done. From the beautiful stained glass windows, crown molding, to the old-world wall treatment and flooring it all looks authentic. We had an outstanding dinner at the Joan de Arc Restaurant on the lowest level where it felt like we were dining in a castle and the cooked-to-order breakfast the next morning was a delicious value. Stay here when you're in San Francisco. It is an easy walk to Union Square! Ask for a room on the fourth floor!

Our stay at Cornell Hotel de France certainly won't be our last. We were surprised and delighted with so many special touches that added warmth and individuality. And staying there during the Christmas Season was a special treat -- the decorations sparkled! We ate dinner and breakfast in the lower-level restaurant, Jeanne de Arc, and were impressed with the delicious food and excellent service. A delightful overnight stay -- everything was perfect.

Our room on the 6th floor with bay window overlooking Bush St. was exceptional. It was beautifully decorated in soft blue tones with paintings directly on the walls and ceiling, even in the bathroom. Although the historic architecture meant narrower halls and stairs, the room was spacious enough with chairs and a small table, good place for luggage. The bathroom fixtures were modern. The doorman and desk clerks were very helpful and friendly.The Jeanne d'Arc restaurant in the basement was decorated with French tapestries, a stained glass window featuring Jeanne d'Arc, and armor from the middle ages. It was beautifully decorated for the Christmas season with greens and twinkling lights. On top of that the food was outstanding and authentic French cuisine.We felt that our package price for one night, one dinner, a delicious breakfast and parking at the garage across Bush Street was a wonderful value. Location is 2 blocks north of Union Square, an excellent spot for walking the area.

We love staying here as it is cozy, well located, and the people are friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable. The breakfast is great and don't miss at least one night having dinner there. Only a few steps from the cable car, two block from Union Square and other hotels and restaurants.

This was my first time at this hotel. It was so much fun to stay in a hotel that felt like a home! Our room was simply decorated but charming, and I loved the pale pink walls! The elevator is original 1910. It's an old building that has updated double-paned windows and modern bathrooms, fresh paint, beautiful carpeting and decor. Bush is a great street to stay on because the cars are "cruising" downhill. It makes for a very quiet stay. The front desk person was extremely nice. The lobby consists of three rooms: a sitting area much like a living room, a small coffee/tea station with seating, and then the registration office. It was a bit of France in the heart of San Francisco! Loved it!

My sisters and I have been staying at the Cornell every December for 25 years. It’s continues to get better every year! Staff is wonderful; decor is beautiful and unique. The food at the Jeanne d’Arc Restaurant in the basement is SO good, especially the orange soufflé. The Christmas decorations are breath taking. We look forward to next year!

Our room was super small and had maybe 1-2 feet of space from the bed to either wall. Our window was facing a brick wall which was unfortunate but at least we weren't in the room much. Super quiet and surprisingly large and clean bathroom in our unit. The receptionists and doorman were all very friendly. The elevator was a cute surprise as it's the old french style ones with a door you have to open. You can't beat the price for the location though (2 blocks from Union Square). Great cafe and restaurant just right across the street. Parking at the garage across the street is $36 (includes tax) paid to the hotel which includes in and out privileges.

We were planning to be in San Francisco for one night during our recent road trip and wanted somewhere clean, safe, and not ridiculously expensive. After reading countless reviews of many properties, we settled on the Coventry Motor Inn and booked a room with 2 beds for our family of 4. The free parking, free WiFi, and location were all extremely appealing. Some reviews mentioned street noise and small rooms, but we weren't bothered by any noise (our room was facing the street and we brought a small white noise machine) and thought the room was very spacious with a separate seating area of a loveseat and a table and chairs. The bathroom came with toiletries and there was a coffee pot/coffee as well. The iron and ironing board worked like a charm. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. The rooms are dated, but it wasn't stuffy or dusty or musty. We appreciated the air conditioning. The men working at the desk when I called prior to our stay and at check in/check out were very friendly. Our room happened to be ready prior to check in time, which was great for us. And they had no problem with us leaving our car until the evening on the day we checked out while we continued exploring the city. The Coventry Motor Inn was a very pleasant surprise and we would absolutely recommend it and stay here again for sure. We thought it deserved all the good reviews and was even better than a lot of them made it seem!

Good location. Well maintained property. Parking on site. Staff was terrific. Clean.Loads of restaurants in a 5 block area. I would definitely stay here again. If you're traveling to SF this summer be aware that some hotels do not have air conditioning. Coventry HAS air conditioning but does not serve breakfast. Ask for a room away from the street - it can get a little noisy in the morning.

Have never stayed been to San Fransisco, but had a very comfortable stay at this Inn. It was clean, the beds were comfortable and security was good. The only drawback is that there was no parking the night we arrived and that is one of the things that attracted me to this Inn. However, we were not getting our rental for another day, so worked out okay for us. Honestly, would stay here again.

Good value motel with parking in SF. Room was clean and as you would expect, staff were very friendly and helpful.Location was ok, 10 min walk to the marina but over 30 min walk to the start of Fishmans Wharf.

I was looking for a hotel to stay at for my visit to San Francisco. This one came across my mind when looking for free parking as city parking is paid and expensive!Moving on to the room. It was spacy, comforting and enjoyable. The night light touch was pretty cool. I couldn't find a thing wrong with my stay!The staff was courteous and helpful. Would stay here again!

The Coventry Motor Inn was very comfortable and clean. The room was quite large and overlooked the side street. The front desk was very helpful in directing us around town. The fact that we could park our rental car on the premises was a huge bonus.

If you're looking for a good value and a good location in the city, here is your spot. We stayed here for three days and it served as a good jumping off point for sight seeing each day. The rooms are 'standard', but they get the job done. There is a separate table and chairs to sit at, so you don't have to sit on the bed all the time, which I appreciate. I would say the rooms could use a couple more outlets for charging purposes though. I travel with a power strip, so I was fine.As far as location goes, this hotel has FREE PARKING, which in the city is a plus! We left our car here and took a Lyft to the tourist areas most days, and due to the central location, each ride was less than $10...way less than the parking fees down at Pier 39, etc. In all, I would recommend staying here...I'd do it again.

It’s not entirely clear to me how this place gets so many good reviews. I can only assume that they bought them. It is basically a motel with zero facilities and character to match. When I got out of the lift on my floor there was a funky smell which may or may not have been caused by the huge stain coming from underneath one of the vending machines there. This smell was still evident in my room. It faded over the days but I may just have got used to it.The room itself was OK. It was dark and outdated but the bed was comfortable enough and the WiFi worked well. In the bathroom the shower pipe came out of the wall at an odd angle which made showering a bit awkward.The real problem with the place, however, seems to be the management. When I attempted to negotiate a late checkout, the manager became rude and aggressive and could not have been less accommodating. In the end he suggested I should check out there and then. I couldn’t believe my ears. I have never been spoken to in such a way by any hotel staff. Not content with being a miserable jobsworth in person the manager chose to follow up on this by putting a nasty little note under my door the next morning. He also attempted to ruin my day by refusing to store my bag. How petty!! Fortunately, the hotel next door was happy to oblige.There never seemed to be many people around so I imagine that the place is on its last legs financially. I intend to help it on its way by never staying there again and I suggest you do the same.

It is tuly a motor inn. The staff is very friendly and helpfull with a lot of humor. Rooms are a bit over the date and need refreshing here and there. But is is clean and well equipped. WIFI works good and the bed is comfortable. Only minus: we had a room right on Lombard and the street noise is very "present' Insist on a room not on Lombard

Clean, spacious room, although a bit drab, as reported by other reviewers. The bed is very comfortable; nice big t.v., hair dryer, toiletries, drip coffee pot and coffee, iron and ironing board are in the room. We arrived probably an hour or so before check-in time of 3:00, and they did not hesitate to allow us to check-in early. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is very safe and just a couple of blocks to several restaurants. We ate breakfast both mornings at Mel’s Diner, just down Lombard Street. The hotel is in walking distance to the curvy part of Lombard Street, but I would recommend against walking (uphill) to it; catch a cable car to it from Fisherman’s wharf, instead, and walk (downhill) back to the hotel. My husband and I are in good shape, and it’s not the distance but the crazy incline of that section of Lombard street that will challenge you. We took an Uber to catch the ferry one morning, and it was about $10, I believe. You could certainly walk it, but we opted ride to insure that we got there on time...stress-free. Our room faced Lombard street, and the traffic noise was loud in the evening but quieted by the time we were settling in to sleep. I would certainly recommend this hotel for your stay in San Francisco. The hotel has a good size parking garage attached, but we did not have a vehicle.

Our first time in USA so we were a bit apprehensive. At first glance not much going on around the Motel but we found the Silver lining bar just up the street., Great little place for drinks. Not many food places near but the Fisherman s Wharf was not too far away. If you can walk or get an Uber. The motel is great. Its clean and has everything you need .bed was really comfy and we slept like logs every night of our 4 night stay. The staff were really helpful and on site all night. Parking on site was really good. There was a little convenience store right across the street and we made the most of that. Tea bags are an essential item to take as every hotel has coffee but awful tea. Would definitely stay there again.

This is seriously a no-frills, dated hotel. It was clean and conveniently located. The desk staff were all very pleasant and helpful. It was about 2 blocks to a bus stop, which we used rather than trying to park in various places. Bed was very comfortable. Cable quit working, due to equipment issues in building, so we were without a TV for 1/2 of our stay. Furnishings and decor looked to be from the 80s. One main draw was the free parking, which is difficult to come by. We chose the free parking over a place that had free breakfast. It seemed a little high still, for what it was, but it wasn't bad. I'd consider it a possibility if we were in San Francisco again.

Our stay was so enjoyable. Room was large, comfortable, clean. Staff helpful and considerate. Location was great for restaurants and close to sites and tours. We were pleased that a coffee maker was available to make a pot for the morning. Great little restaurant near by.Would definitely stay again!

Stayed in San Francisco for 2 nights and this hotel was perfect for what we needed. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but it was comfortable, affordable and in a good location. Would recommend to people looking for a base that plan to spend days exploring San Francisco.

We stayed here for three nights in January 2019. The room was comfortable and very good value for San Francisco. It had no restaurant and it would have helped if there had been a fridge in the room so that we could breakfast in the room. But within 5 to 10 minutes walk, there was a good selection of cafes for breakfast and other meals in Union and Chestnut Streets which were lovely shopping areas too. We were also around 10 minutes walk from Greens Restaurant which is a delicious vegetarian restaurant. We were able to travel on buses - the stops were a few minutes walk away - into town. It took about 20 - 30 minutes. I thought the area in which the hotel was located was excellent and felt safe, even when walking around at night. The reception staff at the hotel were very helpful and allowed early check in and a later departure. Ask for a quiet room so that you wont hear the traffic on Lombard Street.

I really liked this hotel! The bed was very comfortable but the sheets were a bit on the rough side. It's not a newly modernized room but it is clean and quiet. Even though it's on a busy street, we didn't hear much noise because our room was on the backside of the hotel, facing the quiet neighborhood and streets. We were awoken by some trash trucks early in the morning but nothing too loud. Later on, more noise due to street construction, but not a big deal. There was no fridge or microwave in the room. This is a no pet, non smoking hotel, which I appreciate. Parking is free and there are a couple of restaurants within walking distance (5 minute walk) The room is spacious, as well as the bathroom. Definitely recommend this hotel!

I stayed here for a few nights during the end of the year. The hotel does not serve breakfast, but does have free parking! I searched extensively but free parking is a rarity in San Francisco. Location: There is a good restaurant nearby where you can get great breakfast, it’s called Mel’s diner and is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. As an added bonus, this diner has the retro diner feel as you would see in some movies. The famous Lombard street is a 30 minute walk (partly uphill). You can get to the golden gate park with Lyft or Uber for around 16$. I wouldn’t recommend driving yourself in San Francisco due to the high parking prices and break-ins are a real danger in San Francisco. From the Golden Gate Bridge you can take bus 28 which will take you in 10-15 minutes to the hotel. Tickets for this bus can be purchased via the “muni” app (2.50$ for a ride) or via the driver (2.75$ per ride). Even fishermans wharf is a 30-35 minute walk. The hotel staff: Mo of the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Other staff members were also very friendly. Nothing to complain about that!The lobby is essentially located in the first floor of the parking garage, but there is also an underground floor. I read some reviews complaing about the parking garages being very narrow. However with our SUV Jeep Cherokee parking was quite easy. The room itself: the rooms and the hotel are a little old, but well maintained and propely cleaned. The airconditioning/heating might sometimes make a little noise, but nothing too major. You can easily sleep through it. The beds were also very comfortable!The price: the price might seem steep for a hotel, but if you look at the price level of hotels in San Francisco, this price is almost the lowest you can get for a decent hotel. On top of that there is free parking which will cost you around $60 per day in other hotels!

The location is safe and not far from the SF bridge. We had a car and parked in underground parking lot with out an extra charge. The bed was very comfortable and the room large. It had all that we needed. don't let the small check in office scare you away. It turned out to be a perfectly reasonably place to stay and would stay again. Enjoy

Chose this hotel because we had a car. Parking at most other hotels is about $60 a night. Here it is included. Hotel was very clean and welcoming. Front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful, always watching what is going on in area. The room was very spacious and clean. We were pleasantly surprised with how much we enjoyed the hotel and location.

Best beds... Best rates... Best... Staff!!This is my go to spot when I come to SF! If not here (only if they are sold out), I'll go to one of their sister properties that are right down the street.You can park your car for FREE! Yes.. I said FREE!! No one does that in SF!!So, park here and then just walk or catch the metro bus which is right at the corner! It's .7 miles from here to the curvy part of Lombard Street.It's .7 miles to Fisherman's Wharf!Walk it and enjoy the City!I love staying here and the beds are simply WONDERFUL!!

Easy access, free parking at hotel basement.Arrived at 20:30, was difficult to find something around to eat ...Room is typically decorated, good bed and big TV.No breakfast offerred.Coffee machine was placed to bathroom (!!!!!)

We stayed here recently during our quick trip through the Bay area. We chose Coventry based on the reviews, the value pricing and our desire to explore the neighborhoods a bit more than just frequenting tourist spots and union square. We typically stay in nicer chain hotels but decided to try something different this time. The skinny: the hotel is decent but no frills, clean and well maintained for sure but make no mistake - definitely budget so it depends if this is for you. It was a reasonable experience overall for us but definitely marred by the check-in experience. After a long drive from the central coast, we were tired but grateful to be in SF. However the front-desk staff, a crusty old gentleman by the name of 'Vince' literally growled at us when we appeared for check-in. He was literally cursing under his breathe as he checked us in and could not have made us as guests feel more uncomfortable, we were glad to be done with him. Courtesy note to management - attitude makes all the difference in the world, please staff the front desk with individuals who actually care about service. Note to Vince - if you don't like people please do not work in the hospitality industry, simple as that. Fortunately, there all kinds and stripes in this world and the rest of the staff we bumped into during our trip from housekeeping to when we checked out were pleasant and courteous. We enjoyed our few days in SF, the location of Coventry Inn is quite good and you are only blocks from Chestnut street which has plenty of dining and shopping choices. A few tips, there is underground parking entry by the side of the building, it isn't only what you see on street level and go for a room facing away from the main street.

You get all the basic things you need. Plenty of space, comfortable beds, well-equipped bathroom. No breakfast or anything else, but that's really not an issue. I've stayed here a couple of times now and have always been welcomed very warmly.

Convenience was the key for us at the the Coventry. A short walk to Fishermans Wharf, close to the Big Bus Tour routes, a spacious room at a good rate, a 24 hour concierge; the deal was done at the mention of on-site car parking at no extra cost. So we could stow the hired car, walk to the restaurant precincts, hop on/off the sight-seeing buses and generally uncover San Fran at our pace.Which is what we did.Bloody beautiful!!Hence the convenience.

This hotel is reasonably priced considering it's only 20 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf plus has parking included onsite and to be honest, when we booked, we weren’t expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised.We stayed 3 nights and the front desk staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and the bed very comfortable. It faced the back of the hotel and was quiet at night. There was a small safe in the room and internet was good. I would definitely stay here again.

We were very pleasantly impressed by the high standards here ... cleanliness, location and great facilities Bathroom- had clean towels daily, toiletries, excellent bath and shower, hairdryerBed was amazing - couldn’t fault comfort factorPlenty of storage and no issue with furnishings as other reviews have mentioned Our room was on a high floor facing Moulton St so quiet here Staff at hotel very helpful Restaurants in and around hotel very varied - Union St, Chestnut St Bus stop recommend Chestnut St to catch bus 30 to most areas Also worth downloading Muni App to purchase 5 dollar all day pass per person for bus, street cars and Muni subway ( does not include cable car) Cable car - good to download 12 dollar all day pass which will cover all above forms of travel as well !Urban Trek for walking tours is definitely worth doing - we took Trek 4 with Anton the guide who was very informative and helped us see hidden parts of San Francisco Enjoy!!

We stayed two nights here with our friends to see a Giants game and enjoy the city over the weekend. We found this hotel was clean and reasonably priced when you figure the savings from onsite parking. The staff was friendly and helpful. We’d come again next time.

The hotel was spotlessly clean throughout, the staff were really friendly and helpful, our room was massive with memory foam mattress on the bed. Lovely and quiet. Excellent on all counts, book with confidence.

Conveniently located with ample rooms and two level covered parking make it a convenient hotel in San Francisco. Elevators are sloooowwwwww and make going up and down a 15 minute procedure. Rooms are clean, there,s no fridge and WiFi works fine.

Huge room, free parking, excellent location which is easy to walk everywhere. Excellent value for money I would highly recommend this hotel. Try and get on level 1 or higher to avoid any road noise. Top choice

The hotel is positioned perfectly for downtown trips, as we realized parking in central SF is difficult and expensive. An Uber to e.g. ferry building is $10 so you can easily take the trip 2-3 time for the parking fee. The personal is friendly. Parking was included in the room charge and we always found a space. BUT the room was very noisy, it was like having an open window all the time and as the hotel is situated on Lombard street a lot of traffic is to be expected, better windows could solve the issue. Another annoying thing was the heating/air conditioning which was noisy both during heating and cooling.

We stayed here last year on our family road trip. When I booked this Hotel, I did it for the location, free parking and cost. We were not disappointed, location was quite good on Lombard Street...15-20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Close to Public Transport. Hotel was clean, the room was clean and decent size. Good value for San Fran.

San Francisco is expensive. This hotel is reasonably priced and to be honest, when we booked, we weren’t expecting much. We were wrong!Firstly, the rooms aren’t as brown as they look! Nor are they as dated. The furnishings are actually really nice and decent quality. Loved the bed and had loads of space in the room. Nice and clean too.Great, welcoming staff from the off.Parking on site which is a massive bonus for San Francisco. Liked the area too with nice restaurants and the bay a very short walk way.A bit of a gem of the trip and really, it’s a lovely hotel run by some top people.

Great location! We walked to Fiahermans Wharf took 20 min. Took the bus regularly to Union Square. Clean and comfortable. Maids came every day very helpful and Friendly staff especially Mo. Who supports Liverpool.....Loved it!! Oh and we parked our car for 4 days. Was perfect. Will definitely go back

Based on hotel prices in San Fran this hotel represents great value for money . We stayed here 8 years ago on our last trip to the city and it has fully maintained its standards in terms of comfort and cleanliness. We stayed for 6 nights this time and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel , it is well positioned to get around the city using local buses with some great restaurants on Union St and Chesnut Ave about 5/6 mins walk away.Finally a mention for the reception staff Tony and Mo who were great , very approachable and friendly with loads of advice whenever we had a query.

We needed a place that was under $300 a night and this place was perfect! Location is very good. There's a bike rental facility right next door, so we rented bikes and rode all over (it's quite the workout going up the hills). But it is close to Fisherman's Wharf and restaurants. There are coffee shops that are walking distance as well. The room was spacious and clean. A little noisy because our room was right on Lombard street. But overall a good place to stay!

The Coventry Motor Inn is clean, quiet, and easily accessible to all major destinations around San Francisco. We stayed two nights and enjoyed our stay here. Staff was friendly and quickly answered any of our questions.

First time in San Francisco and we were not expecting much from this small inn even though the reviews were mostly good. It turned out to be better than we expected! For motels and inns in SFO, the room in this inn was considered a good size for 2-4 persons. We didn't mind the dated furniture as the beds were comfy and clean. We were lucky to get the room facing the side street so it wasn't as noisy as those facing the main street. But the walls and doors were quite thin so you can hear voices and sounds if other guests talked loudly. No breakfast here but there are some eateries within walking distance if you care to explore. Most of all, the staff are friendly and helpful in giving directions or recommending good eating places. Will definitely stay here again if we visit San Francisco in future.

Free parking and close enough to walk or Lyft to lots of attractions. Clean rooms and elevator access. Lyft rides are less expensive than parking at any of the popular sites. Not the Hyatt, but well worth the price.

We were on the top floor of Coventry Inn staying late May 2018 when we discovered a bedbug. The mattresses are double covered in mattress protectors, so you would not be able to tell unless you spent an hour taking out the mattress. They deducted $50 from our stay and put our clothes through their commercial dryer. When I asked how they would get rid of the bed bugs, they said they do a deep clean of all rooms every couple months. Only serious heat and fumigation will get rid of bed bugs. You've been warned!!!

We stayed two nights in a 2 queen room with sofa. We chose this property in large part due to the free parking for our rental car. We arrived before check-in for our first night (around noon). Mo graciously allowed us to park early so we could attend a Giants game. He also extended our parking time period for after our check-out because our flight departed late that night. Both of these gestures were greatly appreciated. We liked how our room was laid out, nice bathrooms, and extra seating. We were able to use the Muni very easily from a block or less walk from the property. However, we had a broken commitment about our room request. Mo had arranged, per our request at booking time, to have a room away from Lombard St due to noisiness. Upon arrival, pre-check-in time, there was a room scheduled to be available that fit that criteria but still being cleaned. We were promised we would get that room and not room 315 which was on the corner facing Lombard St. When we returned around 7, we were given room 315 by Vince since it was the only room left. Room 315 was incredibly noisy from the street traffic, and not even earplugs could completely block it out. This room needs to have a white noise or other background sleep noise machine. You can request a room away from Lombard St, but be sure to arrive promptly at check-in time for the best chance to get it.

We do a reservation in this hotel in 05-24-2018 for the date 05-28-2018 to 05-31-2018. We got some problems in our trip and tried to change the day of check-in (not cancel and just CHANGE) for 06-09-2018, when the price was the same, and they just not accepted, charging us $200 dollar (we called the hotel in 05-26-2018, two days after the reservation). Tried to speak with the hotel several times, unsuccessful! Always have a excuse for solve this.

Had a couple of 2 night stays either end of a California road trip. Rooms were good size, spotlessly clean and free parking was an added bonus! Great convenient location and Tony and Mo could not be more helpful.Great value for money, could not recommend highly enough

Nice clean room with view of city lights. Great private parking garage. This is a big plus here in San Francisco. Easy walk to shopping, restaurants, cable cars & public transportation. Would stay here again.

Check in easy, very professional staff. The room was quite large, comfortable bed, clean & tidy room. Free parking a real plus in SF. There are many nice restaurants in the Marina district & also you are a short walk away from Fisherman’s Wharf. The only negative is street noise. Try to get a room in the rear. You definitely don’t want to face Lombard St.

If you have a car this place would be quite good for the price and the free parking but if you don’t it is too far away from everything.Rooms were dated but clean and comfortable.The older guy at check in needs to learn some people skills but mo was great and friendly.Would I stay here again probably not

This was our second stay at this motel and we think it's terrific! Tony took care of us again upon check-in, and he couldn't have been nicer. We had a clean and comfortable room away from Lombard Street, and with free parking, this motor inn provides exception value for the money.

Spent one night here before departing for the east coast. I completely agree with the recent positive reviews. This is a budget lodging option, but the rooms are clean, spacious, and in a good location to access the city. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was generic but in excellent working order. They offer some basic toiletries. And, yes, FREE PARKING! Would absolutely recommend this hotel and would stay here again myself.

We’ve just had 3 very pleasant nights here. The staff are lovely and while the hotels a bit dated it is clean, comfortable and comparatively cheap to other hotels in San Francisco. We liked the location and had a quieter room round the corner from Lombard. I would recommend this hotel as a good base for sightseeing.

We had requested a quieter room away from Lombard street and that is exactly what we received. We had no view as we were looking on a square bit between buildings but this was fine as it was quiet and we had good sleep. The room was clean and comfortable. Parking facilities were good. Overall a great stay with helpful staff.

Was recommended this motel by a friend. We required 2 nights in San Fransisco at the end of our 3 week trip around the states. We initially stayed in union square when we first arrived in the stated but found it very busy. This motel is a no fuss place to stay in a safe area. A short walk to restaurants and bars. We used uber everywhere and when we ordered a car it would Leah’s take less than a 5 mins for the car to arrive. Decor is abit old but for the price you pay and the time spent In your room it is a bargain. Spoke to the front desk and they informed us that they have recently replaced all their beds. The bed we had was one of the best we had on our entire trip!! Mo at the front desk was great very friendly and very welcoming. Highly recommended

I had mixed feelings about booking this hotel as the look of it wasn’t all that impressive but reviews seemed really good. Checked in quickly, by Vince, looked like a villain from a scooby doo cartoon, no offence Vince!! When we booked we requested a rollaway bed but was told it wouldn’t be possible in our room. Got to the room and there was a roll away bed, huge bonus as we were travelling with two 17 year olds who didn’t like the idea of sharing a bed. Location was good, we always caught a bus from chestnut street, one block north. It’s dated but clean, good size room and FREE PARKING!!!

We just did a quick two day one night trip to San Francisco. We didn't want to take a car, so we found the Coventry Motor Inn. We flew in to Oakland, took the BART to San Francisco, and the bus to Motor Inn. It was a two block walk from the bus to the Inn. We were early for check in, but they checked our bags, and off we went. Back to the bus stop and a five minute ride, we were at the wharf. And a very easy return. The rooms were a little dated, but clean and roomy. There were not a lot of amenities, but that's not why we were in San Francisco. This is mostly a residential area so it was pretty quiet. Near by there was a whiskey martini bar, but we were too busy to visit it this time. For the money there is now way you could beat this hotel. If you brought your car it's free parking and pretty close to everything. We will be back.

After along travel we arrived at an average looking Inn, We went to the front desk to be met by a very polite person who checked us in quickly and told us of a few good places to eat. The room was very clean but dated, but we never spent much time in the room due to having so much to do. With magnificent views, the sea, and various other attractions close by. Can't praise the front staff enough as so friendly and couldn't do enough to help

I arrived at night to a warm and inviting lobby with a fire burning in the fireplace. . Every member of staff I dealt with was lovely, friendly and very helpful. Great location near Union Square and close to Bart.

Galleria Park is a nice boutique hotel in great location in heart of San Francisco. It's location is convenient to everything including a BART station with direct access to the SFO airport. Nicely renovated rooms and helpful staff. Went for business but would stay for leisure too.

Stayed here in June 2019 on business.Stayed here again, after a positive experience last time around. The hotel didn’t disappoint, as the room was large for SF. The bed was comfortable. WiFi worked. Cleanliness levels were good.Special mention to the Housekeeping Staff that proactively helped with some laundry issues.The two things I still don’t like are the window aircon, which can be a little hummy. And the blinds aren’t blackout blinds. Other than that it’s all good.I would return to this hotel.

Beautiful and authentic San Francisco experience . The location is near to everything around town , we walked to everywhere, from union square to china town and all . Loved this place . Highly recommended to all kind of traveling

A nice hotel in a nice location. They got coffee in mornings and martinis in evenings and give you some water. Apart from that, not much to say except that we had no issues as we came in only to sleep at night.Great location to access market street and well connected to most of the tourist spots.

great location in center of Financial Center and next to China Town, close to Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach and the Ferry Building. Great restaurants all around and a short ride to Giants Stadium. enjoy!

We arrived on July 4 and checked in very quickly with Kristi who had let us know to use the amenities especially because of the fee (which is mentioned beforehand on the website so we accounted for this) and let us pick “courtyard” or “street view” we picked courtyard which I think was a little quieter but who knows. Anyways they give you an espresso maker which was clutch, and water bottles. All the basic hotel amenities (soap, shampoo, conditioner etc) we didn’t use the TV because I brought my laptop for Netflix, and I had no problems with the WiFi not working. We asked the front desk for more coffee and they sent it up, overall the stay was excellent rest from walking the city all day. The staff was always welcoming and wishing us a good day on our way out and offered us water when we checked out. I would definitely stay here again for the price too

We stayed at the Galleria Park Hotel for three nights and could not fault the service, room or location. The staff were so helpful and accommodating. They provide ‘sips’ at 5:30pm for guests offering wine/a cocktail. The room was spacious. The bed was super comfortable. It is located in the heart of the city near so many of the local attractions (China Town, cable cart, Union Square) restaurants and shopping are on your door step. Would definitely stay there again if we visited SF.

The Galleria Park is conveniently located near Market Street, Union Square And a BART Station (closest is Montgomery ST). We had seen it on previous visits, but we’re pleasantly surprised at how centrally located it is. It’s a small boutique hotel, and does not serve breakfast, although there’s coffee in the lobby in the mornings and a wine happy hour in the late afternoon. However, one of our favorite bakeries/breakfast and lunch places, La Boulangerie, is literally across the intersection from the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, both at check-in and when we had requests afterwards. They also have a “joyfully green” program, where there is partial service to help conserve energy (and really,who needs their room vacuumed every day?) which we opted for most days. We did have an inside room, meaning that it opened on the atrium and did not have street noise, and we heard someone at the desk asking to be moved, so perhaps it’s important to request an inside room. Overall, we’ve had a wonderful stay and will be staying here from now on when we visit SF.

Great location! Excellent service! Overall wonderful experience! The staff we kind, responsive, and accommodating. I truly felt welcome as soon as I walked into the hotel. Great location! Just a few blocks from Union Square and the shopping mall, close to the BART and a few blocks from the bay. It was easy to find transportation to and from the hotel. Our room was quiet, had AC, and was comfortable. The staff did everything they could to make our experience a great one! Truly loved our stay and this will be our place every time we are in the city.

Excellent hotel, the room was small but perfect for our needs, our room was in the back away from the street so it was super quiet. The location is great. Sipping Hour had martinis which was a nice surprise!

I couldn’t fault this hotel! Excellent location, spacious room, friendly staff. Will definitely recommend. One night I walked to Tony’s Pizzaria (which was the best pizza I’ve ever had) and there were lots of other bars and restaurants along the way that I would have loved to explore more of I had the time. There is a bus stop half a block away for the hotel as well as the cable car which was about 2 blocks. Expresso machine in room was great to have.

Galleria Park hotel is exceptional. And I commend all the staff as they are all super nice and making sure we are doing well in hotel. And is walkable to UnionSquare and a lot of pub and restaurant around the area.

This is touted as being a 4 star resort. However there isn't anything about this hotel that even closely resembles 4 star quality. I was duped by hotwire into thinking I was getting a quality 4 star room. The rooms are small, the fridge is filled with high priced drinks that there is little room for any of our own bottles of water. The air conditioner didn't work ( they did fix it but that should have been checked before selling the room). The toilet overflowed all over the floor. It's ok but it's not a 4 star hotel. They charge $25 a night for a resort fee, but nothing about this property is resort like. Resort hotels have pools and bars and lounges and activities for kids and family. And on top of that it costs $60 a night to park your car.

the issues we have had are always outweighed by the positives. location, cleanliness, staff, valet, and Easy neighborhood walking distance to union square. high three low four...had a few issues with a late night check in (extremely slow for being the only customers)and allergy free bedding(the pillows they brought up were down), but was corrected by day 2 and a fresh morning staff on hand.  i will not be booking through hotels2night again as the run of the house rooms are usually crap, and this proved to be true once again at yet another location. staff was happy to tell me that this is the case with that app, but also was happy to upgrade me to a queen for $20.00 a night, i was happy at the time because we hadn't slept and were exhausted. not sure how i feel about it now. but the new room met most of our expectations. valets are super cool and full of information. wine hours, coffee in morning..pretty good find overall. this is not our first stay here. we have returned because although its close to union square its quiet and the neighborhood(financial) is def a step up from the edge of the tenderloin that many of the boutique hotels are on. you are unlikely to be harassed at all here. will come back again.

very nice accommodations, friendly helpful staff, easy check in and check out. Room was very quiet and great for sleeping with comfortable bed and linens. The only thing I might want to see different is better lighting in the bathroom,

Great hotel that's walking distance to many shops, restaurants and cafes. Walkable to fisherman's wharf too. Staff was very friendly and we loved the free wine from 5:30-6:30pm. The only downfall was it was a bit noisy in the morning when trying to sleep but that's understandable being in the city so just remember to bring earplugs. Overall, great hotel.

We have stayed in many hotels in SF, this one is outstanding. The staff was super helpful, the valet especially. The "sipping hour" was lovely. The french restaurant, Gaspar, was fantastic. Both the room and the hotel were very clean and beautiful. Can't wait to go again!

We absolutely loved our stay! It was an easy walk to union square to catch a cable car, great happy hours and coffee with newspapers in the AM and very friendly staff. The room was cozy, chic and extremely clean. Love this place!!

The service here is outstanding. Everyone was trying to help our stay be a little better. The rooms and amenities are nicely done. Alma is a treasure. The location is very good, and within walking distance to Union Square and China Town.

The Galleria Park Hotel is a great place to stay in SF. Conveniently located, and quiet at night for sleeping. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern stylish, clean and very comfy. Some nice pluses are the illy coffee and the Sipping Hour. We’d return!

Our hotel room was large and quiet and the staff (especially Alma at the reception) was very friendly and helpful.Coffee in the morning and wine hour in the evening was a nice bonus and we enjoyed it every day.

Great value, great room, great staff and the wine and coffee service in the lobby is a bonus. The hotel was stylish and the service was delightful.Close to shopping, restaurants and parking garage was safe and just a block up.

Wonderful and friendly team members! Beautiful hotel with relaxing garden terrace. Parking on site. Close to Union Square and Chinatown. Wonderful experience during every stay! Highly recommend staying at this lovely hotel with the most amazing hotel staff :-)

booked the room bec of its convenience to work and Oracle park. was happy with the experience although price is a lil high. I would consider the hotel again.why my review must be 200 characters minimum may affect my overall thoughts abt the process

The hotel is older (duh! location) but it's well kept, and clean. I liked having a walk-in shower, and my room was very clean. The bed was too firm but the bedding was quality and the room was easy to keep a good temperature in, well stocked, coffee was good, happy hour is kinda fun. And the staff treated my like I was genuinely appreciated. That goes a long way for me.

Overall this is a very good property. The rooms are nice, but a little small. Lovely reception area.The location is Generally accessible to most Of the nearby amenities. It was convenient to the convention center as well as local eateries.

I stayed here in early January, 2019 and here it is, four months later. Finally getting to the review of this great hotel with outstanding staff. Super shout-out to Jeffrey Rosenkrantz (perhaps the very best front office manager ever), Suzie, Jared, Jessie, and Joao, all of whom provided exceptional service. Friendly without being sappy and professional without being officious. Room was better than most San Francisco rooms, especially for the price. Free cocktail hour was an extra bonus. This is my new place to stay when visiting San Francisco.

Everyone at the hotel was incredibly friendly and accommodating! The wine hour was terrific and the lobby was inviting! The rooms were quiet and comfortable and the location was great--we had a great time!

room was clean and elegant. a great place to stay and get a feel for historic detailing and contemporary amenities. I would recommend to friends. the hotel was located conveniently to city destinations

Business trip : nice place, rooms, good welcoming. Free drinks (hot in the morning / wines in the evening is a nice to have) . Location is good, except that it far from the caltrain station (I was working in Palo Alto). Nice people to attend us. Beautiful cheminé :)

Excellent location. Clean hotel with fine amenities. Nicely renovated classical building. Responsive and efficient staff. The only downside was that my room was a little small. This limitation was offset by the clean, modern state of my room and the overall pleasantness and efficiency of the facilities and staff.

Great location near BART line Montgomery station and couple blocks from the street car. Our room was quirky but comfortable and our friends was larger and more traditional. Loved the idea of a night time gin martini but not a good martini drinker! Staff were really helpful and we enjoyed our stay!!

We had a great stay. The staff was super helpful. Amenities were nice, it was refreshing and it was nice you didn't have to pay for the water in your room. The location was perfect to connect to all our stops on our visit.

Only minor complaint or small issue was our room number 503 was facing the alley behind hotel so all street noice echoed and Sunday morning the garbage truck came at 6:30am minor but tough on the kids. We will still come back!

When I arrived at the hotel after a long day travelling, it was the best feeling ever! The warm welcome and cosy reception was just what we were looking for. The location was brilliant - The hotel was really close to the metro stop for the train from the airport and there was a supermarket just over the road. There was also an Amazon Go store round the corner, which my husband was excited about! It's also within walking distance of China Town and Union Square, including the stops for the cable car and sightseeing bus. There did seem to be a lot of homeless around but think that's a problem everywhere in San Francisco.The receptionists were so friendly, really helpful with any questions we had and always said hello / goodbye as we arrived / left. Another highlight was wine hour every day! We missed it when we first arrived and they sent some wine up to the room. There was also free tea and coffee available in the mornings. The room on the small side but the bed was so comfy. Unfortunately, I had requested for no feather bedding due to allergies and we had feathers when we arrived. Although they did sort it out quickly. The room was a bit dusty in places and it was noisy with traffic and people so take you ear plugs! The wifi was good and there were lots of plugs for charging things! Nice touch with a torch in the room. There was a safe & a lovely big shower with nice cosmetics!There's a nice garden & walking track in the hotel but we didn't use it.There was a room tax but I think it's reasonable considering the pros of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Decent hotel, but one of those places that has a very bad business practice of surprising you with an extra “resort fee” at check in. Very lame that they artificially post online a lower price, only to surprise you at check-in with higher fees by way of the resort fee excuse. Where is the “resort” in this small hotel?

I dont know what I expected, but was pleasantly surprised with the boutique feel, attention to details, service. Plus espresso machine in the room!! Lovely place. Excellent value. Hope to be back. Thank you!!

It was just a short stay, a Friday night, but everything was perfect. Check in went smooth, as did check out, and the room was spotless and very comfortable. Comfort and class, very friendly and we loved the Happy Hour!

It was our first visit to San Francisco, and we were so pleased to have picked this hotel. We had one of the suites with a perfect seperate sleeping area for my daughter. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room and lobby were both lovely. Good coffee in the morning and wine or martinees at night for those that wanted a drink. Highly recommend.

Love this spot for its convenient location to Union Square and the Financial District. Newly remodeled and awesome amenities. Love the evening happy hour and the coffee bar in the morning. Parking is easy with the valet service and the gym/running trail is perfect.

Excellent Service and Location! A short walk to Chinatown and several local eateries! We really enjoyed the daily Evening Sipping Hour and the coffee bar each morning! We highly recommend the Galleria Park Hotel!

I booked a twin room and requested a rollaway bed for our party of three 3 months prior to arrival through Expedia. Upon arrival after a long flight from the UK, I was told they could not accommodate the rollaway bed in a twin due to fire regulations - which I accept. However, they could see my request on their system yet no-one thought to contact me so that I could make alternative arrangements. Instead they told me that I would have to book a separate room - effectively doubling what I had already paid. It was their error, which they admitted and were apologetic, however to expect a customer to just pay for a second room on he spot due to their error is absolutely unfair. They were not willing to offer any discount except waive the resort fee for the room. The whole situation caused so much stress and ruined the first day of our trip - that we had been looking forward to for months. I cancelled my booking with them and booked an Airbnb instead. Was probably the same price as two rooms but I didn’t want to give Galleria Park Hotel my money out of principle.

Excellent hotel for hospitality and location. Decorated in chic and modern styles. Sipping hour was a real treat. Staff were very friendly and provided a complimentary bottle of birthday wine for our room. The parking valet was convenient and helpful with driving directions.

The guy working at the front desk name Jeffrey was friendly, kind and helpful in providing information on SF. The extra service eg happy hours every evening provided by the hotel was certainly a plus. Their housekeeping was also excellent at their job in cleaning the room and the price was just right considering its location which is walking distance to literally everything.

The rooms are on the smallish side and you should definitely ask for a room on the courtyard, not the street. The happy hour martini offered by the manager was just gin refreshed in a shaker with a lemon twist, no vermouth...the staff was extremelyhelpful, particularly Jacob who really makes you feel welcome and is a great resource for places to go and things to see.

Overall this hotel was a great choice. It was in a location close to restaurants and not far from the piers. Being in the business district it felt a bit quiet at night on the weekends but it was still a good location and easy to navigate to and from. Upon our arrival they were just finishing up cocktail hour in the lobby and offered us a drink as we checked in. The hotel was nicely decorated and had a comfortable lobby space with chairs and tables, perfect when meeting up with friends staying in different rooms. Housekeeping did a nice job every day as well. I would recommend this hotel.The only thing I would say wasn't fantastic was the size of the room and bathroom - super small but when I looked at the floor map it appeared that our room was among the smallest on the floor. Also, we were on the 8th floor but still could hear lots of outside noise (garbage and recycling handling) in the early hours. Light sleepers may want to bring some ear plugs but this is common in a lot of city hotels.

The beds were nice the room was Daiso location was great the park he was expensive and very little but everything you need is super close the front desk half of the really nice and helpful and the other half was extremely rude

So impressed by this hotel. Super location, brilliant staff, fresh and modern rooms, immaculately clean! Got a great deal on travelzoo, cannot complain at all! Would stay again in a heartbeat and will recommend to all!

We enjoyed booking our 30 year Sorority reunion at the hotel. The staff was beyond helpful and the hotel was beautiful and perfect for our group! The rooms were good size, the layout of the hotel was so sweet and our group enjoyed the quaintness of the surroundings!

this hotel is a favorite and my recent stay confirmed that it is a top notch hotelThe rooms were attractive and the beds were superbly comfortable.Everyone on the hotel staff is attentive and courteous

Galleria Park is a great hotel. Truly. We were welcomed upon arrival with smiles from everyone. Our room was spotless, modern, spacious and comfortable. The location was perfect for us with easy access to BART, shopping and sightseeing. This will always be "our" San Francisco hotel.

The hotel was in a good position for walking to China Town, Union Square and many cafes. Although the hotel did not provide breakfast, there were many local cafes along the road that did. Also there was no restaurant on site on the Saturday or Sunday we were there. Having said thet, we found many eatteries nearby.The hotel had a Happy Hour between 5:30pm-6:30pm where they served drinks in the reception for free. This was a lovely way to conect with other travellers.

The hotel was centrally located and within walking distance to tons of shops, cafes, restaurants, China Town, Union Square, etc. The hotel and rooms are clean and exceeded our expectations! The staff is over the top friendly and helpful. This was a great stay in San Francisco! If you do stay here, try to request an interior room with an courtyard views. The street view rooms are a bit noisy in the evenings, which is to be expected when staying in the City. We came prepared with ear plugs and a portable fan to drown out the noise, but it's good to be aware.

Excellent hotel and while not in the downtown area can ride the old Victorian cable car up and down the hill. Service and room very good. Breakfast very good. Only comment doorman on arrival could have been more helpful with luggage through revolving door.

I’ve stayed at Fairmont before and they always out do theirselves. This location was the Knob Hill. Perfect to get to main area and downtown. As you all know the steep hills of San Fran can be tough and this hotel is located on one.Check in was amazing Michael at the front gave me a great room over looking the garden. The o Ly odd thing about the room was the bathroom door opened out to block the hotel room door. So if you left the bathroom door open and someone walked in the doors collided into each other.The rooms were clean and roomy. The garden is spectacular. I worked outside every morning while getting some great vitamin D. The bartenders in the hotel restaurant were great. They serve fever tree tonic so that was a huge plus.The Tonga Hut is a fun corky place if you want to experience it. worth making reservations.

This is a very beautiful and well restored hotel with a lot of history that is lovingly preserved and presented, without being too stuffy about it The rooms are clean and large and the bed is very comfortable. We got a Bay View room and had a nice view of the fountain below and the SF skyline and Bay Bridge. We ate from the in-room dining a few times and loved the food. Highly recommended as a business hotel or as a luxury treat for yourself

A truly Fantastic experience staying at this Beautiful San Francisco Fairmont Hotel. Very Professional and Friendly staff graciously caters to the supreme experience in every area of your stay. Check in and check out are very easy with very little wait time if any. The guest rooms are sparkling immaculately clean. The restaurants offer an elegant and exciting dining experience. Even the garage area is spotlessly clean.

The staff was nice and friendly. The hotel was very clean. It was a beautiful hotel. Located in a good area. We went for a business meeting. The meeting was in the hotel and the food and service was great. Highly recommend it.

Stayed here in a standard room that is to a high standard. The building and public areas are pretty opulent with marble columns and floors. The reception area is spacious and there is ample privacy to relax in the easy chairs under the palm tree. The rooms are also spacious and beautifully appointed with everything you would need.The only misgivings are that for British visitors the supply of teabags is mean at 2 per day. We also thought the staff a bit stand offish but still welcoming.

The Fairmont San Francisco is a beautiful hotel conveniently located. We stayed in a double bed room which was quite nice with good sized rooms and bathrooms. However, for what you pay for a room here you'd think what I would call "standard" amenities would be included (e.g. WiFi and fitness facility access). Instead, both these costs extra which I think is ridiculous.Also annoying was the fact that it took quite some time for the water to get hot in the bathroom, and the faucet in the sink was set too far back in the sink bowl.  You couldnt even wash your hands without hitting the back of the sink bowl. This could easily be remedied with a longer spout on the faucet. I also found it surprising that the front desk didn't have an Ethernet cable available when we asked.  My kids wanted to hook up their Xbox and this required an Ethernet cable to access the hotel's sign in page (you couldn't access the sign in page on wifi with the Xbox). Further, the bell man at front didn't give proper advice on Uber stops for getting to the start of the Golden gate bridge, which resulted in us paying more than we needed to for the Uber. I know this couldn't have been the first time someone asked where to stop in order to walk across the GG bridge.  So overall a nice hotel, but for the money I would expect the "extras" and better knowledge from the bell service.

Had an amazing and memorable stay, filled with excellent service, friendly and informative staff and efficiency, from our check-in to the last day of our stay and check out.At check in we were swiftly ushered to our room. When I went down to get assisted by the concierge, Payal was ready, willing to assist and was amazing. She made some recommendations and booked some excursions for us.The following time we needed services of the concierge and we made contact with the legendary Mr. Thomas Wolfe, wow! what a gentleman. The passion for his role reflects in the way he deals with guests, making each guest feel important /special and attention to detail and the professionalism of his communication and feedback is worth mentioning. All I can say to those working in his team, WATCH and LEARN!The fact that the hotel has a complimentary car service to transport within San Fran puts this hotel above its competitors/to another level, yes I know its based on" first come, first serves' or availability but its available for guests to use it and we managed to use it when we really needed it.Then, the nightly wine down was just a great treat and the beautiful way of ending your day before going out for the evening or dinner, although, I would recommend a variety in wines but the cheese platters were amazing with good quality product. some locally sourced. The rooms were serviced daily by friendly and attentive staff however I was disappointed that a hotel of this caliber didn't have a turndown services and hotel slippers. Furthermore, if you are going to provide your guest with complimentary tea and coffee ( NB: great tea selection and coffee) , it would make sense to also provide them with complimentary water.Lastly, you really need to look at your breakfast selection and how its served. We had breakfast at the hotel only once and the other days we opted for eating out. The cost of it, is really not worth what it is served. But if you ask me whether I would stay at Fairmont again, the answer is YES without any doubt and I would recommend it to anyone planning to travel to San Francisco.

The Fairmont is a beautiful, historic hotel built in 1907. The location in Nob Hill is very nice and centrally located. We stayed in a junior suite in the main tower. It was beautiful and had a large sitting room with pull-out couch (the kids said it was comfy for sleeping) and a separate master bedroom with a king bed. The balcony was spacious with 4 chairs and overlooked the rooftop garden. The bathrooms are small but they placed a nice storage tower in the corner and the closet nearby is spacious. The lobby is all marble and very beautiful. We ate breakfast in the hotel each morning. The buffet is $35 for adults and $17 for children. They also have a kids menu with items around $8. Buffet is pretty standard... omelet station, pancakes, bacon, sausage, bagel/toast, pineapple, cantaloupe and strawberries. Be sure to have a drink or meal in the Tonga room on the lower level. We didn't eat there so I can't speak to the food, but it is a unique, fun experience. What used to be the hotel pool decorates the middle of the room and a "thunderstorm" happens inside the restaurant every 15 minutes or so. It is decorated like a ship with a Hawaiian theme.Also, check out the rooftop garden. There is corn hole and beautiful flowers as well as some nice couches to sit and enjoy the weather and views.Getting around from the hotel: It is too far to walk to the main tourist attractions, however both lines of the cable car have a stop next to the hotel.
