For $12 you can purchase a MUNI pass on your phone and ride the cable car unlimited for the day. An uber will cost between $6 to $15 each way to some of the "main spots" like Lombard, Little Italy, Pier 33 for Alcatraz, Fisherman's wharf, California museum, and the Presido beach area. There is also a Hertz rental car desk inside the hotel but be aware parking is $75 a night. Chinatown is walkable but it is downhill on the way there and uphill on the way back.

Had the pleasure of staying here for 3 nights with my daughter. Very welcoming reception lovely 2 queen bedded room with lots of windows. Had dinner and breakfast through room service which was efficient. Concierge excellent with advice. Obviously SF is extremely hilly and hotel is at top so nice to walk down but grab a tram on way back up.

Nice hotel with neat history. Wish it had a micro fridge for personal use. Be careful of the workers offering you a nicer ride to the airport. It is nicer and the driver was great. Glad I met him, but we weren't able to charge it to our room or a card. Needed cash. A $40 Lyft ride turned into an $80 ride.

So glad we picked this hotel, pure class, beautiful old hotel, reminded me of many like this in Europe. Great history, beautiful rooms, great restaurant and our room on the 20th floor over looking the bay and Golden Gate Bridge was stunning. Service was top notch. No complaints well maybe one silly one....no slippers. Thank you all for making our stay so special.

Recently stayed at Fairmont Hotel for a family getaway and had a wonderful experience! We booked the hotel not knowing what to expect and were very satisfied on the cleanliness, hospitality, and location of this hotel. Our room had a fabulous view of the waterfront/Alcatraz Island and the city. Housekeeping made sure our room was clean and that we had plenty of toiltries and blankets. Had our last dinner at Tonga and let me say, the service was amazing. Our server was quick and attentive, the atmosphere was one of a kind, and the food was delicious. All in all, we were beyond satisfied with our stay and can’t wait to come back on our next trip. Thanks Fairmont Hotel!

The hotel is a landmark. It’s beautiful inside. The room(s) we had were clean and comfortable, but boy.... for being a “4-5 star hotel,” this was one of the most disappointing experiences I’ve ever had. Pros: Clean, super friendly staff, good and timely food from room service. And that’s about it. We love the history of the hotel, and Nob Hill is a great location. Cons: 1st room - the AC didn’t work. It took hours before someone finally came up to check it out. The mechanic that came up was very nice and helpful. It was mainly the fact that the front desk kept telling us they would call us back. Meanwhile, our room was 80 degrees and stifling. We called several times before my fiancé had to get very stern. Finally that’s when the mechanic came up. They ended up moving us to an upgraded room, which sufficed. 2nd room - After hours of walking around San Francisco’s hilly roads, we come to our room to find that our keys are not working. We sit in the hallway by the elevators for about ten minutes after speaking with the front desk. A guy comes up with two new keys, not very apologetic, and tries to open our room with the new keys they made. Surprise, surprise.. these keys aren’t working either. “If my key doesn’t work, I’ll have to get engineering to come check it out.” Really? And what should we do? Sit in the hallway and wait? Like WTH. Sweet guy from engineering comes up, changes battery, and keys still won’t work. So we are stuck sitting here. Front desk could seriously take some customer service manner lessons from the engineering department. Those guys were apologetic and tried to be so accommodating. For the amount of money we spent, I just expect the bar to be raised. If I’d spent a few hundred less per night, this kind of stuff happening, combined with the front desk’s lack of hospitality would have been expected. When you spend money to stay in a place like this, you expect the highest level of service, and that’s just not what we felt we received. Again, the guys from engineering were the best part of the customer service that we received. One more thing - the first room we had, had amazing shower and water pressure. The second, which was a suite, had the worst water pressure ever. They had a little sign in the bathroom about low water pressure shower heads and preserving water. I am ALL FOR preserving our resources and not wasting water, but my showers took twice as long because I could barely rinse the soap from the hair. Just another thing that was annoying and made no sense. So, as beautiful as the hotel is, the rich history, and cleanliness, next time we come to San Fran, we will be looking at another hotel.

It's unfortunate to pay my money and for the past two days. I am not able to sleep. We complain to the front desk and they refused to switch this lady to a different and smaller room. If you have someone who snores so loud, you would think they will switch her to a smaller room and keep the bigger room full. Or make her pay for a private room since this doesn't bother one person. This is horrible

Hubby and I stayed after a long tiring day, only to found that the room they gave initially was not cleaned. We were about to drink water when we found messy goblet(see photo) with wine. Also, we found spider webs inside the closet and bathroom was dirty. I called several times after 40 minutes, finally somebody answered my call to request to switch room. They moved us to 5th floor with roughly the same size. We were just so tired to request another upgrade and just ended up sleeping instead. Very sad and disappointed with breakfast buffet as well, we just enjoyed the fruits and paid 85 dollars. In summary, it is not the service and accomodation that we are expecting from a 4/5 star hotel in the SFO Bay unfortunately.

We spent 4 nights here while visiting the wonderful city and had an awesome time. When we arrived at the hotel it was in lock down with secret service everywhere. It was the same the next day when we arrived back after an exhausting day exploring the city's delights. Apparently the Polish President was also staying at the Fairmont - if it's good enough for him then it's good enough for us. Check in was very easy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and spacious. We had a walk-in wardrobe. The bathroom was a little on the small side with the shower over the bath. The room was spotless and we had a reasonable but restricted view of the bay. There was a very good selection for breakfast with a choice from the buffet or from the menu but expensive. We also availed of the restaurant in the evening. I don't normally like to single out an employee but one waiter called Rami in the restaurant was exceptional. We received VIP treatment from him every time we dined there. The hotel is located at the top of the famous Nob Hill (which we walked up twice) and all 3 cable car routes stop outside it. It is close to China Town and the Union Square shopping centre but about 3 and a half miles from Fisherman's Wharf - all down hill. We would definitely stay at the Fairmont again.

Beautiful hotel full of history and beauty! Had a wonderful stay with my husband and 12 year old son! All of us enjoyed it! We were even given a beautiful plate of gourmet treats with honey on our first evening there. The rooftop garden is gorgeous! Definitely a great place to stay!

We ate at the Laurel Court for a celebratory lunch, and were not disappointed. Although a casual dining venue, the service was very efficient and our waitress quite personable. Our food was tasty and ample, with the menu very diverse. This was a most “civilized” luncheon meal.

I am still processing the experience of staying here. We upgraded from a queen/queen room to a main building balcony suite upon check in. Initially things were great. The balcony really is beautiful and quite large. However, the first night we were awoken at 1am by the sound of the guests in the adjoining room having incredibly loud intimate relations. I was shocked by how much we could hear through the wall. I called down to make a noise complaint and was told they would send someone up to knock. I have no idea if that happened but approximately 5min later we could hear the phone ringing in their room, and again 10min after that. Once again, it essentially sounded as if we were in the same room as them. We eventually fell back asleep but again, at 7am the next morning, could clearly hear the guests next door engaged in the same activity. At that point I called down and requested to be moved to a different room immediately. I wasn't particularly impressed with how the hotel handled the situation. They made it seem like they were doing us a favor by allowing us to move rooms. I appreciate the fact that they cannot control who stays in adjoining rooms, however the original price of a balcony suite is almost $800/night. The walls are basically paper thin. And it wasn't as if the room next door was playing music, we had to listen to strangers having sex. I hate to think of what would have happened if a child was staying in our room. We were eventually moved to a tower suite. We had no issues with with noise after moving and the views were quite nice.In addition to the noise issues, when we checked out I was told I had a balance owing of $900. I found this confusing as I had paid in full when I booked (through the Fairmont website). The woman at the front desk informed me that it was my room upgrade charges...however it shouldn't have been anywhere near $900. I paid the bill because we had to get to the airport but when I arrived home I called the hotel to get some clarity. I had to speak to three different employees (none of whom could explain the charges) until I was connected with the Assistant Rooms Division Manager. She also could not explain the charges and asked me to send her a email with my original booking. Within 24hrs, she had replied that it was an error on their end and they have overcharged me by over $300 (!). As a gesture of goodwill they refunded my destination fee ($30/night). I was shocked that such a situation could happen, and if I hadn't been persistent about the incorrect charges, I would have had to pay!The hotel itself is very beautiful and the location is great. I had read rave reviews of the customer service at the Fairmont San Francisco, unfortunately I didn't experience any of it. I would recommend taking a close look at your bill upon checking out.

Room was very big and clean. The hotel staff was great. They temporarily lost two of our bags but promptly found them and returned them so no big deal. The rooftop garden was gorgeous! So nice and peaceful. Location is super central which was a plus. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. We even ran into the young lady who was helping us at check in when we were outside finding our way to a cable car and fisherman's wharf. She was so friendly and helpful even on her own time after her shift at the hotel. Wonderful visit!

My first room had a view of total concrete. I left the room and told a very nice young woman that I could not spend four very expensive days in that room. She immediately moved me to a beautiful room with a view. I wish I could remember her name. She had a cute accent and was very pretty! I will definitely come back! Btw, a glass of rose wine was $21.00. Come on! That's beyond crazy.

This hotel was beautiful, rich with history, design and taste. We were blown away by how big the rooms were - a walk in closet in a hotel?! Beds were a dream, staff was amazing and we had a wonderful 2 night stay.Trolley car stop right outside the door, quick walk to China town and so much more!

We spent our 33rd wedding anniversary at the Fairmont atop stunning Nob Hill. Our spacious room was elegant and comfortable. The view was amazing. The historic hotel is such a treat, and the staff were so kind.

This 5 star hotel was one of the last 5 star hotels that my wife and I wanted to stay. We chose her 70th birthday weekend with our sons and girlfriends and brother and sister in law. It was last but definately not least. Our rooms were roomy, city view, well decorated, and a big walk in closet. We had a king bed that gave us all a good night sleep. Had shopping, restaraunt, bar, dining room. All very accomadating and convenient. Very nice tub/shower and large bathroom. Yes reservations were needed for the Tonga room(bar,nightclub). Transportation from the hotel is very accommadating. Uber, taxis, and Hotel cars avilable but hard to get.

Very beautiful Hotel steep with history. Excellent staff who were friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Great location in downtown San Francisco. Very close to Chinatown, Fishermen's Wharf, and great restaurants

We spent 6 days at the Fairmont. The hotel is obviously steeped in history and is ideally located close to all the sights of the city. We found all staff to be very attentive, however we felt the meet and greet could of been more informative. We have no issue with the hotel having a dog policy but we did have a barking dog staying in the room next door to us which had to be reported.

We stayed in this hotel from 13th to 17th of April 2019 in two signature king tower rooms with panoramic view. The hotel used to be of a high standard maybe ten years ago, however it is not the case now. To begin with, we were checked in with over an hour delay to one room and even with more delay to our second room. Thus, after a long flight from London, UK, we had to wait in a lobby for additional 1.5 hrs. Not a good start, I must say! Secondly, the hotel itself leaves a biter impression of warn out/outdated building, with dirty windows (there was no point really for us to pay extra for panoramic view for that reason). Room service at night? Not in Fairmoint, unfortunately. All of the above is far from what you expect from 5* hotel. But what was the most surprising yet disappointing is they way how management handled our complain: in a defensive, aggressive manner as if we had no right to ask for a slippers in the room, cup of tea at 1 am or were meant to sit in a lobby past check in deadline. AccorHotels had definitely lowered the bar and made one of the formerly best hotels in SF below average yet it cost a fortune.

It’s location on Nob Hill provides scenic views, but the interior of he hotel is equally impressive and the rooms were ample in size and beyond comfortable. I can list nothing negative about my six days at the Fairmont!

This was our second stay at the lovely Fairmont San Francisco, perched atop Nob Hill, just to the north of Union Square, but sitting above it. We were back in San Francisco for a series of business meetings for my wife, and predicated on our previous stay in March, we returned in November, before heading to London for more meetings. We are also Fairmont Gold members, so there are usually a few nice “perks,” from the hotel chain.We arrived in the early afternoon, and checked in. We were assigned Room 1006.The Hotel:This Fairmont Hotel is located 950 Mason St, and sort of “overlooks” the City of San Francisco, and down toward Union Square. It is an wonderfully elegant building, both inside and out, and harkens to a more glorious time for travel. “Opulent” is the first word, which comes to my mind. While it is an historic hotel, it has been refurbished, and modernized in many ways, so while basically older, it does not lack for the accouterments that one expects from a luxury hotel nowadays. One of those accouterments is the in-room tablet, which control several functions in the room, and also acts as a “personal concierge” service for the hotel, and near-by dining and entertainment.We got to see many things, which we had missed on our previous stay.Room 1006:Room 1006 had an entrance foyer, a very comfortable King bed, with nice pillows (an issue for me, at so many hotels), a nice bathroom w/ walk-in shower (ideal for my wife, with two artificial hips) and a soaking tub, but only a single sink, with small horizontal flat space around it. The small sink/vanity area was one of the few weaknesses in the room. There was a desk, and chest-of-drawers, with a large, flat-screen TV. The décor was “turn of the previous century elegant,” but the furniture was much, much newer, and in great shape. While not the most spacious room we have had, it was more than adequate, and would have been comfortable for a much longer stay.Our view was different this time, but still lovely, and probably one of the most impressive aspects of the view, was the tower section of the Fairmont.We had more than ample storage areas (remember, this was a very short trip/stay), and could easily have accommodated a week’s worth of clothing. We had a safe, iron and ironing board, and a full compliment of Rose 31 amenities in the bathroom. This is the standard Fairmont line of bath amenities, and we find them very nice.We had plenty of AC outlets, and most were near horizontal surfaces, so plugging in a handful of devices, for charging, was easy.Room 1006 was very quiet (as was the entire property), and we heard zero noise from either the outside (even with the California Cable Car Line beside the building), or inside the hotel. The air conditioning system was very quiet too.The Property:As this was in early November, the lobby still had some of the Halloween pumpkins (including some from the employees’ pumpkin-carving contest), but the hotel was transitioning to Christmas, and a “dine-in” gingerbread house was being constructed in the lobby. Even in the transitional state, the common areas were lovely.We printed out our boarding passes for our upcoming flight at one of several computer stations in the lobby, and my wife got to do some shopping on-property, at the various retail stores, just off of the grand lobby.Roof-top garden was lovely..During our brief stay, we had the opportunity to dine on property, and also visit the bar off of the lobby.The Location:The Fairmont is located atop Nob Hill. which can be a bit steep, depending on where one is coming from..On this stay, we did not use any transportation to/from the hotel, beyond our driver taking us from/to SFO for flights, but on the past stay, the doorman always got my wife a taxi, within moments. Due to its proximity to two other major hotels, there are plenty of taxis on Nob Hill, and good Uber/Lyft service too.Conclusion:We had but few interactions with staff, but each was excellent, as the staff was friendly, welcoming and fulfilled our every need.In summary, this was a wonderful, though albeit too short stay, and I am just glad that my wife finally had the time to explore this grand property. We will be returning.

Trip to San Fran, Napa and Manhattan Beach for wedding. Awesome time! The Fairmont was high end and worth it. Our time in San Francisco was such a treat. Such an array of restaurants, museums and things to do. Definitely go back.

What a beautiful hotel. The bed was so incredibly comfortable and the linen crisp. It's a completely different experience staying in a hotel like this vs a modern one. The feeling of luxury is evident with the marble in the huge foyer. Staff very courteous and helpful.I have to say, the breakfast (omelettes made to order) was so delicious.I love the ambiance and the location and can't wait to come back. We hosted clients there and they all said it was one of the best hotels they've stayed at.

What a very pleasant weekend. We arrived late Friday and were greeted by Riley at the Front Desk. What a wonderful lady. She instantly made us feel right at home. We had their standard room, which was amazing! The hotel is perfectly located with ease of access to all the popular areas of the city. But the best part of our stay was the staff. All were the epitome of professional. Samantha and Julie were so sweet. Cameron at the Bell Desk was a great guy to talk to as was Eldridge. I can’t wait for our next trip and stay at the Fairmont!

My wife Amy, daughter Kate & I just returned from a memorial Day Weekend @ The Fairmont in San Francisco and we had an AMAZING TIME. Benjamin at the front desk was able to get us an upgrade for a fairly nominal fee, early check in and late check out in a BEAUTFUL SUITE "Dublin Suite" We ate at the Tonga Room which the kids LOVED and we had a spectacular visit and ca't wait to return. Benjamin, Bianca and Maggie made sure ALL of our requests were met and were especially accomodating at this BEAUTIFUL 5 STAR Landmark in SF!!!

We loved the Fairmont. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated although not necessarily the most beautiful we’ve stayed at, but the public spaces are phenomenal. We couldn’t think of another historic hotel quite as extraordinary. The history added another layer of interest and attraction for us. The staff are superb and really do fit the style of hotel as an excellent historic property used to royalty, politicians and so forth. The only downside is the coffee shop downstairs is really subpar. Disposable cups, no toast for breakfast, overly sweet pastries on small plates that are really saucers for tea cups, plastic cutlery and no napkins whatsoever..... really trashy for a 5 star hotel. But apart from this -Thanks Fairmont for a lovely experience.

This used to be my favorite hotel in San Francisco. It had charm, history, everything. The rooms were luxurious and sumptuous - each very unique. This current stay was less than satisfactory. First, the windows in the rooms barely opened, and in my second room, the window operation was cracked and broken. Paint is chipped everywhere, the rooms are worn, and the walls are paper thin. In the morning, I had called down to the front desk/housekeeping for a dental kit as I had misplaced my toothbrush and it took over 20 minutes and 3 calls just to get one sent up. Outlets didn't work and even lightbulb not changed.It is unfortunate as it used to be my location! And I have Gold Accor Status, and love earning points at Fairmont. Other Fairmont properties are great. This one has become average. I should note that I booked with Amex FHR and will let them know the feedback as well.

A group of friends and I just finished our stay at Fairmont San Francisco this past weekend. From the moment we pulled up to when we left everything was perfect. Every staff member we met was incredibly helpful, to note Pablo with the Guest Services team, Tadeos at the front door, Lindsey at the Wine Down event, and Julie from Housekeeping - all so pleasant and welcoming! Rooms were clean, spacious, and welcoming. I can't wait to come back to this gem on Nob Hill!

Excellent property, pleasant staff, perfect trip. I couldn't have asked for a more welcoming and relaxing place to stay while in San Francisco with a great location with the cable car immediately outside of the hotel.

Hotel is located close to the Bay and you can walk to the Fisherman Warf and other tourist areas. It's a beautifuly maintained heritage property. Rooms are spacious clean and tastefully decorated. The views from the time on we're nice. Best part of the stay was the staff. They have excellent staff very helpful and courteous. I has reached earlier than the check in hour Lady on the check in desk worked out a room for me with best views and no extra charge .All in all it was a great experience.

A warm welcome from the minute you check in staying at the Fairmont was a most pleasurable experienceStandards are clearly well maintained and nothing was too much trouble for either the first class concierge service to the ever helpful staff. Highly recommend but for those who find climbing hills taxing, the hotel's situation on Nob Hill is a give away; it is at one of the highest points of San Francisco. Worth it! Keep up these high standards!

The location is great, the hotel is classic and has an air of another time. Our room had a great view and the only real complaint was that there was only one sink. The staff was friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend and would stay again.

This hotel was booked on a room only basis as part of a honeymoon package. The hotel is in the Nob Hill district and therefore more expensive than we would usually book. Location is ideal for visiting the city. 2 of the cable car lines have stops right near the hotel or it’s a half hour (max) walk down the hill to the bay. For a top end hotel however, it was disappointing that there is no free WiFi in the rooms. The lobby does have WiFi that lasts for a day. All the staff are lovely & helpful and the room was clean & services well. We did splash out on room service on the first night as we arrived late evening. Although they didn’t have the pasta option I had chosen, an alternative was offered. The food arrived in a reasonable time and was hot. On our last day we were able to leave our luggage safely while we went out until it was time to leave. We ordered the airport shuttle that is advertised by link on the website & on the Fairmont ipaddevice in the room. That was a poor experience as the shuttle is a minibus which has seen better days. The driver seemed rushed and had multiple collections which we had planned poorly. We circled back on ourselves several times downtown & it was packed. The seats were small & we were squashed in. The seat belts were a revelation! Definitely stick to Uber next time. We paid $48 coming from the airport plus tip. The shuttle was $38 for the 2 of us. Needless to say we didn’t tip that ride!

Arrived for a week at this hotel with high expectations, yes it has the history and it looks the part but that is where it ends in our experience and hence the reason I give it four and not five stars. The front desk on arrival, and the concierge when we asked about a concert were indifferent, the only time the front desks ears picked up was when I informed then on the day we left that we had observed a take away container with left over food at the top on the fire exit stairs visible through the glass door when we arrived and it was still there 7 days later! We did have one breakfast in the restaurant, which was OK if you think $28 for continental buffet is good value, maybe it is for San Francisco. The room, we had one on the mezzanine; was comfortable, it had half a window which was ok, but as with any city with low floors you do get noise, including feeling the vibration from what I suspect were the cables for the cable cars when they start up at approx. 6am we had no need for an alarm, maybe I was sensitive to it. On a positive note it is in a very good location, close to the cable cars as I might have previously intimated.

Very enjoyable few days. Beautiful room and lovely hotel. We were very impressed with the friendliness of the staff. We used Peter for the airport limousine service and he was terrific--very helpful information and good knowledge about the area. He provided a very nice introduction to SF.

I was really disappointed by this hotel. We previously stayed in the Fairmont Miramar in Santa Monica, which was not great, but this was even worse. Quite frankly, the service in this hotel is below their standard and charges. I was already unpleasantly surprised by all the taxes being charged in California, but here they add another 30$ every day for ‘hotel services’ like WiFi or the Spa facilities. Even if not used, you are penalized for the heavy overheads in this hotel.The check-in experience was also very bad. We arrived late around 23.00h and finally after visiting the 3rd option room we were satisfied. The guy at the reception was really bad and not helpful at all. One of his colleagues finally solved the problem. Really terrible. No, this was not what we expected, but it seems the ‘standard’ in Fairmont properties.

You can't go wrong with the Fairmont. It is a wonderful hotel with some amazing people. Eldridge especially made my stay special. The Fairmont can be proud to have him on their team. It was a very rainy and cold day and Eldridge asked me to wait inside to stay dry and warm when he was waiting for my car, watching my luggage. All the staff I encountered was just wonderful and they truly make your stay special. Thanks so much for your hospitality! Really enjoyed my stay!

i stayed to Fairmont in the middle of March with some friends of mine. The lobby for me was excellent with really nice and good furniture, very chic. The check in process was really quick and smoothly, friendly friendly staff from the concierge till the housekeeping.The room was quite spacious, with king size bed and an office to work. I did not tried the breakfast(as with all the taxes the rate was a lit of bit high) but on the ground floor it has a coffee shop for take away with excellent coffee croissant etc. The location for me is the best as it is walk able 15 minutes from the union square and not noisy at all. if i ever have the opportunity to go back to San Fransisco probably i would book again here

What a fantastic elegant, grand hotel. We stayed in the original section which was very nice. The room was updated and very high end. The service was excellent and the location cannot be beat. Don’t miss the rooftop garden which is an oasis in the middle of the city.

My partner and I are doing the obliquitous ‘road trip’ and we started our vacation in San Fran with a three night stay here - The Fairmont has the ‘wow’ factor. Our driver arrived at the hotel, and the doorman opened our car-door with the biggest smile and welcome; our luggage was whipped away seamlessly (arriving in our room just minutes later) and the reception and concierge staff couldn’t have been more attentive. The lobby is beautiful, the bar and restaurant wonderfully presented and staffed, and our room, spotlessly clean, well maintained, with a great bathroom. The Fairmont’s location atop Nob Hill make it perfect for exploring - Fisherman’s Wharf, Union Square, Coit Tower, only blocks away...cannot recommend highly enough for the discerning traveller! Quick tip - check out the beautiful garden - we saw a hummingbird family!

From the time I drove up to the hotel to the time I left, I had an amazing experience. The rooms are large and clean, the views are amazing and the staff is stellar. The hotel is large and have small shops inside, so it’s best to pack small snacks and water if you don’t want to pay hotel prices. Other than that, you can’t beat the location!

Such a beautiful hotel with impeccable service. There is so much history here! It's also located in one of my favorite neighborhoods, Nob Hill. It is up a very steep hill, that is not for the faint of heart. Truly a magical place. Can't wait to go back.

Beautiful property, excellent service/staff and location. The rooms were clean, maintained, and we had a good view of SF. Liked being downtown and able to take mass transit and being able to walk and/or taxi/uber/lyft to local destinations. The food and service at the main restaurant was very good. We want to relax, rest, and enjoy SF and we did. Thanks.

Our family stayed at the Fairmont for two nights using an Amex Platinum rate over easter weekend. We booked the lowest rate rooms, had free breakfast and a $100 resort credit. For breakfast they give you $44 per person which covered us easily including juice, latte's, etc. The buffet was satisfactory for a hotel of this class, not particularly amazing. Service was good, seating was plentiful and the venue is attractive. There were two Easter brunches as well, we did not attend either. There was also an egg hunt that looked cute but our kids are way too old sadly. Our rooms were on the 6th floor and had beautiful views of the Bay (I think) Bridge, city and the water. Comfy beds, nice decor. The hotel is older and I did hear noise from the hallway on a few occasions though the hotel tries to encourage a 'quiet time' from 10pm to 8 am. The location of the hotel is excellent as far as I am concerned and if you like to walk, it is at the top of a STEEP hill. The hill top is spectacular with a darling park, historic church and several stately older building. A respite from some of the seedier and busier parts of the city. The trolly is right there to take you up and down the hill and other BART stops. We used Uber for the most part and never had to go much further than 15 minutes. We have stayed in other areas and find this location to be much more pleasant than the hotels in the downtown area. We would definitely choose The Fairmont or also The Ritz over other locations in the city.

I was here in 2017 with my son who had passed his exams. It is a really nice place to stay, felt at home immediately, mostly because of the friendly and profesional staff.We could sit for hours in the kitchen/lounge just to have tea or breakfast and just feel at ease.Beds good, showers clean and small.Part of town: conveniently walking to Fishermans Wharf but also to China town.

I booked the Green Tortoise Hostel for a one-night stay for $47. It’s best to book on their website as not all travel sites have access to their full inventory. The place is a very social & party headquarters, so this may not be the best selection for those expecting to get quality sleep every night. At check-in payment with credit card incurs a $1fee/night, so best to pay cash or use a debit card. There is a $20 key return deposit upon check-in. There are multiple bed rooms, so inquire for a room with fewer (4 vs 8) beds. Guests tend to be under 30 yrs. old. It is a non-smoking facility. **The reception is located on the second floor and there are no elevators. One thing that really impressed me was their info corner. This corner offered one of the best cheat sheets of TO DO/TO GO lists of any property I have ever stayed and this includes five star hotel properties. These little sheets, for example, listed FAQ’s, local foods, local coffee shops, local bars, a brewery list, and more. Each little sheet was pre-cut, so you could just grab it and go. The sheets listed hours for the businesses, clientele, mapped the area, favorite items to purchase at these businesses along with price categories. A simple idea, but excellent information source for all guests.Room:The rooms were probably a bit more dated, but still comfortable. The 4-bunk rooms were tight, but functional. Beds come with a reading light, power outlet, large storage area for each unit under the bunks. I was able to get my large suitcase under the bunk, just remember to bring your own lock. Linen is provided. I happen to be in a co-ed room.Amenities:Free Wi-Fi, free breakfast (07.30-10), pool tables/games, entertainment, lobby massage chairs, huge ball-room, computer lounge, laundry room, community kitchen and fridge storage, coffee/tea, and numerous free dinner nights in the community kitchen during the week. Check the activities board for numerous events each night of the week in-house and around the city. There is a sauna for guests by request only.Overall, the place is a bit more dated and the rooms can be cramped but the hostel certainly offers one of the best activity calendars of any of the SF hostels I have booked in the past. The staff is efficient and very friendly. More mature guests may want to take into account the youthful activities and events and may want to consider other hostels.

Stayed at this place in Feb 2019. Really liked location. Very nearby from Chinatown and Fisherman’s wharf. Close to most party places. Staff is great and helpful. Any questions you have just ask on front desk. Liked the idea of san Francisco landmarks and instructions to reach there. As a traveler you want to keep those info handy.Rooms are good with clean bed and sheets. Clean washrooms. Every evening new activity. Very nice ball room to hangout and eat. Pool table is an additional fun.Only drawback was kitchen utensils hygiene. Probably when I was there the washing area tap was not fixed properly. Utensils were all sticky even after wash. If you provide free food then can make sure utensils are neat and clean. Apart from this i would say this is one of the best place to stay if you visiting SFO.

I stayed at Green Tortoise for four days. I chose a hostel as I was travelling solo after a long time and wanted people around me. As a working professional I also wanted a place where I could work or use the computer if I wanted to. Green Tortoise was the perfect choice. The staff, like 70% of the people who choose to stay there were quite young. And very friendly. As there is no elevator,they helped me carry my luggage up. Then about the rooms,the dorms have bunk beds and a washbasin too. The basin is quite useful as you can use it when the common washrooms-cum-showers are occupied. The rooms are fairly neat, but the overall infrastructure is a bit old. They have fun themes on different nights. You get free breakfast everyday and on some nights too. If you buy food, you can label and refrigerate in their fridge. Bottom shelves usually have free food you can eat anytime of the day. It can range from salads and meal boxes to leftover cooked the night before. Location wise too it's quite central and has Italian restaurants around. They let me pack free food in their boxes and take it when I had to rush for a tour. They also have massage chairs and a dry sauna room that you can use for free. I felt a little grown up for bunk beds and the very young vibe, but also happy I stayed here as it was hassle free and super friendly. Would surely stay again. They also have a discounted shuttle service to the airport.

We were two travelling so we got a private room with bunk-beds. The room was clean, the bedsheet were clean and the matresses were awesome to sleep on! Perfect night sleep! The room was a bit hot and humid, opening the window fixed that. It was better to close the window for the night as there was quite bit of noise coming from the street.Free breakfast was a nice plus.The location of the hostel is perfect. Walking distance to Pier 39 or Union Square. And eventhough the neighbourhood is full of striptease clubs etc, never we felt unsafe to walk around, even at night time.Would definetly stay here again!

I love the Green Tortoise! I recently stayed at this hostel during my weeklong adventure In San Francisco. In a word.... STUPENDOUS! The staff (aka Tortoises <3) are welcoming and warm! Daily activities and community dinner on Monday/Wednesday/Friday - Be sure to volunteer! The rooms are clean and serviced often by dedicated staff. Private bathrooms and laundry available and also free wifi!! I felt at home at the Green Tortoise and met so many amazing domestic and international travelers. Thank you Green Tortoise community for making my week in San Francisco unforgettable. I highly recommend this fabulous hostel. Joseph

The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, charming dinining hall, a lot of great events are organized including cooking dinner every other night! I felt like I was part of one huge family. Fantastic vibes!

I've been here three times. Once in 2014, once in 2015, and once more in 2018. Good times were had each time. They really are delightful, very social and friendly, and very clean. People from all over the world stay here. They have many options for stays that include private rooms, dorms, triples, etc. They also do dinners every monday wednesday and friday that people are encouraged to help prepare and then everyone gets to enjoy regardless. I'm something of a picky eater, so I didn't have much of these dinners, but it's still a lovely way to get people to gather. Their cook, who gives speeches during the dinners, is quite a character. They are really nicely located, you can walk straight to the piers and the Exploratorium(which I love) pretty easily. Pier 39 and 41 are a distance away, though. Some good pizza is a few blocks away and there is a place that makes excellent wings that is close enough to deliver. Just all around excellent. They have some policies that are kind of annoying but also make sense, like not allowing food or drink in the rooms. Bathrooms are a bit packed in the mornings. Regardless, a beautiful place in a beautiful city. Recommend any day of the week. Five stars! ALL THE STARS. (I only give a four on service because of some less than ideal experience with the cleaning lady not coming back to clean our room when we said we'd be out in five minutes. They also just choose odd times to do the cleaning, it seems(though sometimes I choose odd times to sleep).

Stayed only for a couple of days and was out exploring the city for most of the time. The private rooms were good with bathrooms near by. Good spacious dining rooms and events were organized later in the evenings. I could not join the events as I was out. Union square, Fisherman's wharf, China town were just walking distance. Plenty of eateries and clubs near by. Overall a good place to be.

A basic room, but clean, enough space & not far from the nearest showers/ bathrooms. We only stayed one night & fortunately it was a monday - so free dinner (where everyone helps to contribute), so a good chance to meet others & enjoy good fresh food!

The staff here is amazing!! They had an answer to every question, provided everything I needed, and the chef was great!!! Felt like home even though I was 3,000 mikes away from home. I will definitely be staying here when I return to San Francisco!!

I frequently fly between South Korea and Reno, Nevada and use the Green Tortoise a stop over between Baghdad by the bay and The Biggest Little City in the World. I serves admirably as a place to rest my head as I pass through San Francisco. The staff is friendly and service oriented. I regularly meet fellow guests with whom I share tales of travel. The dining room lends itself to meeting other travellers of all ages and nationalities which for me defines wayfaring.This year's stay on Halloween included an evening tostada bar which preceded a pub crawl through selected watering holes in North Beach. The North Beach neighborhood provides some excellent walking with viable access to downtown and the water front. Additionally, the dorm rooms are clean and comfortable as are the shared shower and bathroom facilities.

This is the second time we have stayed here, and I would stay again. We loved the friendly atmosphere here and the evenings where you could volunteer to help in the kitchen to cook for everyone in the hostel. It’s in a great location and in walking distance (15 mins) down to the bay. We stayed in the annex just down the road rather than the main hostel which suited us but others may prefer to be in the main part of the hostel. Thanks for another great stay!!

Good hostel, a great common room with ping pong- and pool table and a big kitchen!They also have a sauna and very fun activities (e/a beer pong turnements and pub-crawls, both for those who stays at the hostel and in other places!Fair warning though, there's a lot of stairs!

You need to know what to expect, but at half the price of hotels in the area, the Green Tortoise is a great option. The rooms are small, but clean; the shared bathrooms likewise.All of the staff were extremely welcoming and attentive. There's a free breakfast every morning, good WiFi, and it's located in a pretty great location. Walk only a block in any direction and you'll find something worth seeing, or more importantly, eating or drinking. The hostel IS nearly surrounded by strip clubs, but we never felt unsafe or uncomfortable. Branding itself as a 'party hostel', you'd expect the average age to be pretty low, but there were plenty of older folk during our two-night stay, and even a family or two. They have nightly outings, but we were never kept up by loud music playing into the night or the like. That said, the walls are pretty damn thin, so make sure you bring earplugs!We visited in October, but I imagine it could be pretty sweaty in Summer. Our room only started cooling down a couple of hours after sunset.

Excellent place to stay! Great friendly and helpful staff. Good community feel with lots of areas to socialize and get to know other travelers. Good cost for the city. Would stay here again for sure.!!

Green Tortoise was great. Everything a hostel should be. Hotel taxes, etc. make San Francisco not the cheapest city for hostels. GT makes up for it with the free massive breakfast, the weekday free dinners and general good+safe vibes. I also liked that the clientele wasn't all 19 year olds looking to get wasted, but if you're looking for that vibe, they were able to provide that too with nightly outings. Location is near a bunch of touristy things (SF is not huge, lots is walkable from the hostel), sort of traditionally seedy neighborhood, but the hostel felt safe nevertheless. A stone's throw from City Lights Bookstore. Sj at the front desk was super friendly, conversational, accommodating :)

Fantastic start to our trip in San Francisco. There is a very welcoming feel about the place and a sense of community. Breakfast and dinner were great too. Reception staff are super helpful. Would definitely come back.

It's a nice little place to stay short-term. The service was excellent, and staff were friendly. The bathrooms were clean. But in my opinion, what really makes or break your experience here is the people that you end up sharing a room with. There can be some sketchy individuals but it's not that bad overall. It's expected that you will have be adapt to the others in your room (people in and out, moving things around, snoring, etc.). It's probably best to bring earplugs. My belongs felt secure and safe as they have lockers under the bed. The area isn't bad either, it can be noisy outside - especially on the weekends but it's safe as there's usually lots of people hanging around. Buses are close by, and a lot of the tourist places are in walk-able distance (Fisherman's Wharf. Chinatown, Financial District, etc.).It was my first hostel experience and it took a day or two to get used to it, but it was good after that, would stay again.

I don't know why everyone is saying the location is that great, because it isn't. I counted at least 4 strip clubs just walking to the hostel from the main road, the hostel is also not near any transport station in particular.Bathrooms were quite acceptable, with some being modern and clean. Rooms were also acceptable, you get what you pay for.

The shared and free breakfasts and dinners were a super lovely surprise and was a nice way to meet the other travellers! I felt super comfortable and at ease. Location was also central and accessible. I didn't realise I had left an item behind and the staff were very helpful in contacting and sending it to me.

If you're the type of traveller that likes boring, stereotype, cookie cutter venues then the Green Tortoise is NOT for you. But if you want a memorable stay in a fun place, friendly staff, and mixing with people from all around the world, then consider this venue. The money you save in accommodation you can spend at the excellent

Absolutely loved this hostel. Brilliant staff, clean rooms and tonnes of space. Each day there was a different deal from free dinners, free bar crawls or activities in the main dining room. Worth every cent with great free breakfast every morning.

Stayed here for 5 days and can honestly say this was one of the best hostels I’ve ever stayed at. Great location - the hostel itself is on a slightly dodgy street but very close to Chinatown and North Beach. There were lockers in the rooms to store your things safely and the single bathrooms were all super clean. The hostel environment was super friendly with events on every day including free dinners, pub crawls etc. The rooms are far away from the common areas so it was also nice and quiet when you didn’t want to join the party. Highly recommend this place. I would definitely stay again!

The hostel is really well equipped and located. The staff very friendly and the rooms clean. It's a good occasion to met unique and amazing people from all around the world. I really recommend this place!!

I have been going here for the past six years while I am running the San Francisco Marathon. Hotel staff is always warm and welcoming I feel like I’m going home to San Francisco or like I have a family in San Francisco when I stay at the Green Tortoise Hostel.  A great location to see the city and a safe clean reliable place to stay .

I stayed at the Green Tortoise a few years ago and had an awesome experience. I’ve since recommended it to lots of friends and family and they have all stayed. So when I had two nights in SF I straight away booked here again. We had a rough day and our two flights were delayed and we arrived at the hostel just after 2am (I had emailed the staff to let them know in advance) we arrived to the hostel and got our bags inside and my partner waited at the bottom of the stairs as I went to check in. As soon as I got to the top of the stairs I was yelled at by the receptionist “don’t kick our doors”....I was baffled and told her I hadn’t done anything to the door other then bump it with my large suitcase. Which she snapped back “you kicked it, I watched you!”. We were off to a great start and it only got worse. The receptionist VELL was rude, condescending, and incredibly unwelcoming. She snapped at me for asking her legitimate questions and gave sarcastic remarks. At this point my partner (who was down the bottom of the stairs) heard the way she was speaking to me and came up. He was also greeted with the same foul attitude. After snapping at us and taking my payment she said “room 36, go right, left, right” and threw the keys on the counter. No explanation of the facilities or perks this hostel offers. Then the following morning we were leaving early (5am) and the same staff member was sitting at the desk...scowling at us as we walked past, not so much as a smile or hello. We have been traveling all over the States and Canada for 12 weeks and this is the WORST customer service, hands down, we’ve ever encountered. Vell - you are in the wrong line of work and the Green Tortoise should be ashamed to have someone like that on their otherwise great & friendly team. We stayed in a private room, it’s was on the 3rd floor and was adequate. Bed was not the greatest but did the job. The bathrooms are great and they even offer shampoo/conditioner/soap. We didn’t eat at the breakfasts as our schedule didn’t allow but in my past stay it was great. Overall, the Hostel is cool & in a great location but our stay was completely ruined by the attitude of one staff member...and it ruined our time enough for us not to want to return.

I stayed in a small room with my two teenagers, and we had a blast. Green Tortoise has an amazing location near everything we wanted to see, so it became not just our hostel but a base for operations. For example, we came over mid-day to have the free tea/ coffee they provided and rest. On our last day, they allowed us to store luggage after check-in. The staff at the hostel were all super-welcoming, and the gorgeous front-desk person Jo was gracious enough to listen and laugh to my teenager's jokes for about an hour in the evening. All the free food was a huge bonus--there are some free dinners, free breakfasts and etc. GT became a highlight of our vacation, and I would not hesitate to stay here again. GREAT JOB!!!!

My friend and i stayed here for 6 nights and had a wonderful time! The location is perfect. You can walk to China Town, Fisherman's wharf, Pier 39, and so much more. The hostel is nice, I was worried about it being promoted as a 'party hostel' but the rooms were quiet and there werent any loud groups that we noticed. The bathrooms are clean and nice, you may have to wait but i only had to wait about 10 minutes. The busy time is after 730am til about 830am. Breakfast was basic but filling and the dinner was good. Sometimes they have food brought in for you to have as well. The shuttle that they are partnered with is very reliable and quick! its 15 each way. I would stay here again anytime!

I stayed here for three nights in a three person room with two friends. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They were knowledgeable about the city and best ways to get around. The hostel had a lovely atmosphere. There were shared bathrooms and shower rooms on each floor, all were very clean and I saw cleaners working around the building every day. The room wasn’t very big, especially considering it was for three travellers who would obviously have luggage. There also isn’t any elevator, which made bringing suitcases in and out a bit difficult. There was free breakfast every morning and free dinner three times a week. Also a lot of posters advertising social nights each night and trips the hostel staff could help you plan. I would stay here again for sure.

This is exactly what you expect and pay for! Great service, good vibe, friendly staff. Clean and comfortable! Good location!Rooms are very basic, bathrooms are communal but clean. Has a certain charm about it.Downside - the steps ! No lift. but its all part of the experience!

I have stayed in so many hostels in U.S. and other countries and this is the first one that I have unpleasant memories. My bedroom (shared, 4 beds) had a strong stuffy smell. Getting back to the hostel at night very tired, ready to sleep and smelling that was not good at all. Also it didn't feel easy to meet other travelers as the other hostels I have stayed. There were some armchairs in the computers area and also the big dining room, but I missed a "cozy" and welcoming room to simply hang out on the couch for example and meet people. I didn't feel that "hostel vibe" and it didn't feel like a "party hostel" as they promote themselves.Besides that, it was always tricky to open the bedroom door with that key (I have seen others having problems too). And I had just one backpack, but the hostel has many stairs so it is hard for travelers with many bags.Otherwise, good location, breakfast was ok, most of the times I could find a bathroom available, safe (room to store bags is locked, also there were cameras in the hostel and we had to show our room key when getting back to the hostel), and not all, but some staff members were friendly.

Ok, we were a little skeptical when booking our stay - we are young retirees, not the general demographic for a hostel. As soon as we began the check in though we knew we had made the right decision. The staff are all warm and helpful, and we felt comfortable immediately. We had a private room in the annex building down the street, which was very comfortable with clean modern bathrooms, a clean and complete little kitchen, and a nice view of the city and bridge, especially at night, from the little patio space on the top floor. It was peaceful and quieter at night than a lot of hotels we have stayed in. The community area was great for hanging out and sharing meals, which were very good. We will definitely be back.

This beautiful place is full of love and attention for the traveler. The staff is fantastic and passionate, always kind and patient (also with foreign visitors). Rooms are what you expect from an hostel, plenty bathrooms (enough for never have to wait), free breakfast in the beautiful saloon where you can meet other travelers and enjoy night activities. I will forever and ever come back there when I come to San Francisco. The prices might look a bit high, but it is so worth it you won't regret it for a second. The area is beautiful, is quite fun that you cannot smoke in front of the hostel but don't worry, there are handy stairs nearby the hostel. Thank you guys!

Had an emergency and needed somewhere to stay. Booked online without a hitch, and had a roof over my head for a great price. Rooms were secure and clean. Beds had curtains, fans, and storage. Bathrooms were wet, dirty, and usually full, so pack your patience. Kitchen was great and they provide ample breakfast. Wifi was unreliable.

So, I am a wrinkly old coot of 63; the sort one just doesn't see that often in a hostel. I found the staff to be enthusiastic and efficient. They are accomplished in the art of banter and laughed at my jokes---this always earns a couple of extra stars. The facility is clean and well maintained throughout, and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast is scheduled for 7:30, but coffee was ready much earlier. Thank you. The dining area is spacious which let guests spread out for quiet and privacy. There was also an assortment of old well used guitars to play before hitting the pavement. Also, very nice.The layout was simple for adequate to fuel up for a day of walking the city. Now, the North Beach location, a few steps away from the intersection of Kearny and Broadway is excellent as I like the neighborhood. My literary themed walk took me to City Lights Books and Cafe Trieste where I communed with the ghostly presence of Ginsberg, Kerouac, and the other beats. Yes, I will stay at the Tortoise again.

I am a solo female travelerThis hostel is in a great location. It has old school charm. Helpful staff and great breaky and facilities. I'd stay again. Thanks lots!They have connections with things to do and places to see with helpful maps and guides that you can access. I loved it

I had booked a private room. For the price you pay for a centrally located hostel in comparison with normal hotels it is a okay deal.Very friendly and accomodating staff, had good tips of where to go and how to get there. They are interested in how you are and how your day was. The breakfast is limited for the price paid. Also the exact same breakfast is there every day, which isn't really special. And served a little late (07:30) in the morning. Early starters need to find breakfast elsewhere or make your own.The room I was in (29B), has a window facing the hallway. The curtains aren't thick enough to block that light from illuminating the room. That should be fixed, as rooms to sleep in should be really dark.Other than that the room was clean and the bed comfortabele with a locker box that holds a suitcase and a trolley underneath the bed. Showers are kept clean and provide enough water at a good hot temperature. And there was always one available for your needs.Other guests could consider sleeping guests a bit more, woke up at night when conversations were finished in the hallway.Other than those few points, I really had a nice stay and would consider them for a future visit.

Great comfy beds, lots of history. Breakfast facilities great. The craic is mighty. Must stay if doing one of their awesome trips. Lots of good food places nearby. No downsides for me. They are good at letting you leave suitcases

I had a wonderful time staying in Green Tortoise hostel. I booked an all-girls dorm room and got the lower bunk bed(I had requested for the same prior to coming to SF). They had good breakfast options, with bagels (choice of spread- cheese/butter/peanut butter), juices, milk, eggs that you cook by yourself. One thing that I liked was that they already mentioned on their site about the noise that would be there at night from the street. Location of the hostel is perfect, very near to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Telegraph hill, etc.The only thing that was a concern(just on the very first day because I had not expected it) was that though the hostel was centrally located, the block it was on was full of strip clubs. It got ok the following day because expectation was now set :)I had a very good experience overall and made some new friends too!!

It was my first ever stay in hostel and i was very skeptical. However it turned out to be amazing, nice clean bed and the room where i stayed. Good room mates. The hostel had a nice ambiance and decent workstation area. They had ample activities to be done in the evening which can help residents to meet and network with each other and of course explore the city together. I had been part of the pub crawl and played rock paper scissors for the very first time in my life and went all the way till semi finals :) The community dinner preparations were most enjoyed.

Friendly staff, great breakfast, convenient kitchen and bathrooms, comfortable rooms with some space to store your luggage, clean and extremely well located, the Green Tortoise is a very nice hostel!!

Clean. Helpful staff. Friendly Guests. Great environment. Shared bathrooms seldom all booked at once. Solid general location near great Italy area of town and great little restaurants - if gentlemen’s clubs on street of Hotel do not flummox. Felt safe. Solid value, good experience. Recommend.

We were booked for two nights, but in different rooms each night. There was a slight mixup when we arrived, but they were very fast to correct it, and actually upgraded our second night for free!Staff very helpful; good food/kitchen setup. Comfy beds etc. Lots of services: internet, luggage storage, shared bathrooms (but lots available, and were clean). If you don't have things to do they have advice and events going on.Would definitely recommend!

I had the best time at the Green Tortoise. Everything about this place was great. I was traveling on my own, the front desk staff are super friendly and happy to answer any questions and made me feel very comfortable. I ended up extending my stay by an extra 3 days because it was so great.There are activities on every night to help you meet people in the hostel where you can get cheap food and drinks (this is especially good in a city as expensive as SF), The common area is awesome and is also set up to help you make friends. There are free meals 3 nights a week which you can (and should) volunteer to help prepare. I met some of the best people at the hostel when I did this. The leftovers are also kept in the fridge to provide free meals the day after which is so great for backpacking on a budget.It is in a great location close to Downtown, China Town, Little Italy and Fisherman's wharf.The rooms and bathrooms are also very clean and soap, body wash, shampoo and conditioner are all provided which is a bonus too.I could go on! Loved it and will definitely stay in Green Tortoise Hostels again after this experience.

Already from the outside you can see a odd building. As you enter you discover a great old fashion style, that bring you back in the years! I've found it so cool! The staff are friendly, bathroom and bedroom keep clean everyday! The dining room so cozy! Excellent wifi and free use of computer! There is also a Spa!! This is not just an hostel!

The hostel is clean, people who work in the hostel are very friendly and help me for any request. breakfast very good, parties, activities if you wanna join them are nice. thanks to the green tortoise hostel for the great days I have spent there in SF. !!!!!!

This was my first time ever staying at a hostel and it was a great experience. Very friendly staff and good price! The only thing I would have done different was book a private room instead of a group room but that's just because I like my privacy not because I had bad roommates. The group rooms were the only ones available at the time that I booked which was last minute. The location in the city was great and within walking distance to the nightlife! Would stay again!

Green Tortoise Hostle is a good value for San Francisco, the common room is large and breakfast is well done. Shared rooms feature lockers, a large frig is available, nice location would recommend for solo travelers.

I have stayed there at female dorm for 7 days because of my bread baking course in SF , the location is very convenient that able to go tourist spot by walk or bus , the room is super clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful too , the most favourite I recommended to you because there were many event and gathering for you to meet other guests in breakfast or dinner time, that is really really worth it comparing other hostel i lived before. however, there was some homeless at the alley to coit tower nearby this hostel , solo female must pay attention if walk alone this alley. but i'm still safe to walk alone to train station at early morning , so just avoid this alley or some dark area is alright .

I spent 4 nights at the hostel in a double room. There was a heavy stink in the room, probably because of a lack of cleaning. That really ruined our stay. Apart from that the hostel was OK, good location and breakfast included.

Returned to the Green Tortoise for my second stay and it it is still as amazing as ever! Great location, comfy beds but the best part really is the ethos and atmosphere! They really want you to enjoy your stay and there are a host of freebies including delicious meals and breakfast in their gorgeous ballroom! Such a lovely place to stay-would recommend to anyone!

A very good place, perfect location between Chinatown, Little Italy, Downtown and Fisherman Warf, 5 miles from Golden Gate. Safe, and clean and really great social atmosphere: 2 free dinner a week an daily free shared food from neighbour pubs and cafè. Appreciable campaign against wastefulness. Great breakfast too with valuable healty choices as oats, plain yoghurt, fresh fruit and cream cheese. Special mention among the staff to Diego, the Italian guy in charge to prepare free dinners e keep the kitchen shining clean, Very committed, thank you very much.

The Green Tortoise is largely a place for the younger folks, ones who are generally more agreeable to bunk room situations. I'm not, but the Green Tortoise does have about five single rooms in a separate building, just a couple of blocks from the main building. I chose one of those room. The bed was comfortable and the sharing the bath was not an issue.My room had two large windows that opened. I love that! With a double / queen bed in a room designed for something smaller, it was a little tough getting out of your own way, but I understand that putting in the larger bed probably makes more sense. There was a box fan in the room, but it was not needed. Just as well because it was filthy. I have little patience for neglected and very obvious maintenance items. The bath has a rod that holds three rolls of toilet paper. All were empty, and there was a separate roll on the windowsill. I had noticed the afternoon before that the rolls were empty. I think we can agree that's a big no-no. Check-in was easy and friendly. Since the room was in a separate building, someone walked me over to it. There was a (big sigh) tip jar on the check-in counter! No, no, no, i'm not going to tip you for checking me in! For a place like the Green Tortoise, who goes to lengths to be fun, the presence of a tip jar for checking you in is a mite pretentious. (If the place were the Hotel Costa Plenty, instead of the Green Tortoise, I'd be equally annoyed.) I was looking forward to the breakfast in the morning - the "hostel feel". Everyone had to cook their own breakfast. Maybe there were other items to cook, but all I saw were eggs. After cooking your breakfast, then you clean the dishes you just used. Even with just four or five people cooking or cleaning, it was literal case of "too many cooks in the kitchen." I found it terribly impractical and very poorly laid out. Even small considerations such as "where is a cup for the coffee?" was more challenging than it needed to be.

We stayed at Suites at Fisherman's Wharf for 3 nights recently. It was significantly better than we expected, based upon some of the reviews we read on TripAdvisor. Location can't be beat, the room was spacious and all the staff were super friendly and helpful. The rooms are slightly (and I really mean slightly) dated and the bathroom small..but the rest of the room (1 brim) had more than enough space for 2 adults and 2 teens.

This is the best place to stay when exploring San Fran! Great location within walking distance of The Fishermans Warf. There is a trolly stop out front as well as a bus stop if you don't have a car.We had a one bedroom apartment/suite and it was huge. Full kitchen with everything you would need (similar to renting a vrbo condo). Large living room with a couch that converted to a queen bed as well as an additional lounging chair. Balcony with chair and tables. Master room had a King bed. Bathroom was the only thing that was a little small but we did not mind. We are a family of four and we fit very comfortably in this room. The staff is so friendly and helpful! In addition to the big room our other favorite part was the rooftop deck. Amazing views from up there of both bridges and Alcatraz. We had a picnic dinner up there one night to enjoy the views during sunset. We did have a car and they do have parking for a small fee. Being a big city, the garage is very small, so getting our SUV in and out of the spots was nothing short of a miracle. Would definitely stay here again!

I was a bit hesitant to book this place at first given the photographs of the property as it looked a bit dated. Typically we like to stay in a little higher end places but this just seemed to be a colossal waste of money given the price of hotel suites in San Francisco. With that being said, I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations at the suites at fisherman‘s wharf. We were given a one bedroom unit on the first floor with a city view in fact right across from world famous restaurant Gary Danko (If we were on the 3rd floor we would be able to see the bay, but it seems that all of the units are obstructed views except the very top floor). There is a fabulous balcony area on the roof with great views over the bay. Our unit certainly did look dated but was clean and adequate for our needs. The location was truly amazing you are only One block from Ghirardelli Square and a short walk to the waterfront fisherman’s wharf area, and literally right on the cable car line. Parking situation worked fine for us as we pretty much just used Uber or Lyft. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful at all times. If we return to San Francisco I would certainly consider staying here again

Awesome hotel with a gorgeous view from the rooftop patio of the Bay! Easy walking to Fisherman’s Wharf! Room had kitchenette with coffee, hot chocolate, & microwave popcorn! Beds were very comfortable. Room was clean & the staff was so friendly and helpful!

Hubby and I decided San Francisco would be a wonderful place to celebrate our 35th anniversary. We had previously visited individually, but never together. We wanted to have a "tourist" experience.After a warm welcome from reception including a glass of champagne, we entered our home for the next four nights. Pleasantly surprised at the size. Unfortunately, no balcony, but we are on the quiet side away from the main street. The suite is nicely furnished and well stocked with kitchen necessities. The king bed is comfortable with plenty of pillows. Everything is impeccably clean. We can hear the occupants above us occasionally because the floor squeaks in places, but it's not intrusive. This speaks to the age of the building. Had they not been so considerate, there could have been a problem. The location is excellent. We had no problem walking to the piers and there is a cable stop just outside on the corner. There are plenty of amenities: self-serve laundry, filtered water, Friday night wine party, and the roof-top area has a million-dollar view. I read in some reviews that there were problems with staff. EVERYONE on the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to ensure our needs were met and exceeded. We had a fantastic stay and would definitely return.

On a recent trip to San Francisco, we stayed at the Suites at Fisherman’s Wharf. It was an apartment type complex right in the heart of the city’s busiest and best area (Fisherman’s wharf) and it was such a perfect stay during our time here! From the moment we checked in we were treated very well by polite and helpful staff, also being spoiled with champagne! You have great facilities in the rooms to cater for your any needs, from cooking to relaxing, and if you want to enjoy the sun and the views, there is even a rooftop seating area where you can eat, drink, sunbathe and soak in the amazing views that San Fran has to offer, with a great 360 degree view from the bay bridge to the golden gate! Would definitely recommend the Suites at Fisherman’s wharf and if we come back to San Francisco we will be staying here again definitely! 5 stars!

I can reliably state that my second stay here after 7 years was identical to the first - suites were still impeccable, clean, well maintained and comfortable. Our 1 BR with a full kitchen and full sized fridge served 3 adults very well. The bathroom may be dated and small but adequate. Pullout queen sized bed and rollaway bed were OK - one cannot expect too much comfort vs the queen sized bed in the bedroom.Security box, full amenities in the bathroom, great complimentary WiFi, small balcony with chairs - add to the comfort. As mentioned in the past, noise from traffic and tourists may be bothersome when the windows and balcony doors are opened - as the weather was cool when we stayed both times, this was not much of an issue, However, this may be more challenging during the hotter periods as there is no air condition.Staff, as in the past, were consistently friendly, helpful and warm - this made our stay extra special!Location - a stroll to Fisherman's Wharf, great walks to the pier, and eateries galore.Suites at Fisherman's Wharf might be small, "dated", with no facilities (like gym etc), but the staff, comfort, security and great maintenance, pack a big punch.

I knew this was an older building but took the plunge anyway. Excellent location and just right outside are the cable cars. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The suites itself is in good condition. Very clean and the rooms itself were updated. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Oh, and there's parking on-site. Price of parking is better than ones nearby, and of course the convenience.

We love staying here because of the location. Minutes from the wharf. Rooms are a good size and comfortable. They have renovated parts of the rooms. It can be noisy fron other guests in the suites, not the city noise. The beds are comfortable. The shower hardwarev has been updated. The shower head and pressure are good. The staff are ok. Not the best for customer service, seems like they do not like their position. The roof top deck is great. The view is perfect and a great spot to bring a snack and a beverage.

We stayed at the SF Suites for 4 nights at the beginning of our USA tour. The property was chosen on the basis of its location and the fact that, for the same price as a room-only basis hotel in the area, it had its own kitchenette. We were accommodated in room 101 on the 1st floor, a one bedroom apartment. Check-in was swift and everything in the apartment was clean, tidy and working which was what just we needed after a long flight. We did not hear too much noise as other reviewers have noted, it appears we were lucky that our fellow guests were a quiet, respectful bunch. There is no kettle, some pictures show a kettle that can be placed on the 2 ring stove plate but our apartment did not have one. Fortunately we had our travel kettle but at 110 volts it takes ages to boil! There is a coffee machine and a combi microwave oven as well as a toaster and a large fridge. The location of the SF Suites is good for access to Fishermans Wharf, Ghiradelli Square is a block away as is the Buena Vista Café. There is a posh restaurant across the street, many options in Ghiradelli Square and loads more cheaper options at the Wharf itself. 5 blocks away is a Safeway supermarket where we stocked up on breakfast items. 1 block away is the start of the Hyde-Powell cable car line – best to get on here. You can get right into the centre of SF on this line. All in all good value for money given the hotel prices in the area especially given that you can make our own meals.

Perfect location to see downtown San Francisco. Able to walk to China Town, North Beach, Little Italy as well as peer 39. Take cable cars. Booked a two bedroom as we travelled with friends. These units are small with only 1 bathroom. Rooms are not the same “Shell Property “ standards we were used to. Roof top patio makes the resort as you can enjoy a panoramic view of the bay area with your wine ! Stunning! Would I stay here again - yes but only 1 couple.

This is a hard place to review because it has both strengths and weaknesses. The location is really fun and it is great to have a one bedroom apartment with a reasonably functional kitchen. The rooftop patio has wonderful views and is a cool place to hang out.On the other hand, the unit itself is pretty dated and uninspired. Some rooms have balconies, but they overlook a busy street. The units in back are quieter, but pretty dark.A All of the bedrooms back onto the central atrium and are dark and windowless (other than a high window onto he atrium.) We had quite a bit of noise from the unit above us. I don't regret going as we had a lot of fun playing tourist in SF, but I doubt I would return.Oh, and don't fall for the pitch from the "concierge" to do the "free breakfast." She will tell you that it is not a timeshare presentation, but it absolutely is. Ugh.

Fantastic location in walking distance to lots of activities, close to buses and the cable car, spacious apartment with all the facilities we needed, wonderful welcoming staff, easy access to communal computer and printer if you need to print out bookings. Great rooftop balcony with views. We would definitely recommend to others.

The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf is in a great location for exploring San Francisco. It is on the corner of Hyde St and North Point St. It is 2 blocks to Ghiradelli Square and a walkable distance to Fisherman's Wharf. There is a cable car stop and bus stop right by the building. We used the on site parking for $22 per day with in and out privileges. Compared to other hotels I looked into when booking this trip, the parking is a steal! The parking area is little so parking a big truck or SUV could be tricky. The room was good. It was clean and had a spacious living room with a pull out bed. The room decorating was a bit dated. The bathroom looked to be freshly remodeled. A downside was the lack of bathroom fan. The room was very humid and steamy after showering. Above the shower was a small window to the hallway. Opening the window helped with the steam but if you were sitting on the toilet with the window open, the people walking on the floor above could potentially look right at you! Needless to say, we rarely had the window open. The other downside is that at times, we could easily hear our upstairs neighbors. The day we arrived we planned on going to sleep early but the room above was still awake. We could hear them walking around and the children talking. There is a roof top patio with a few tables with a great view. Overall, a comfortable place to stay. It is an excellent location at a reasonable price.

This place is perfectly located. Less than 5 mins walk to the shore, in easy reach of the piers and right next to the cable car to take you to China town and Union square. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. All was clean, in order and well serviced. It’s nice to have the cooking facilities should they be wanted.
