Service at the front desk was courteous and helpful. The only reason to score a 4 and not a 5 was the noise that was transmitted from the room above. It seems that talking, walking, water usage and TV can all be heard. Why the clowns in room 204 wanted the TV on loud at 5:50 I will never understand!

Average Suite: PROS you can cook especially if you have special diet CONS 2 bedroom suite has only one bathroom and toilet. The rooms have awful smell from previous guest(yuk). Not sound proof, I can hear the snore from downstairs bedroom. Amenities: PROS kind of ok CONS no kettle and Nespresso machine , ( i drink tea and espresso), washing machine isn’t in the room. Location: PROS closed to the bay CONS far from union square Staff: We had a champagne welcome with Jose and Mari. So far they are my best. Some staff are not friendly and I have to agree to few guests review. Overall: Rated 3 (average). My stars so far are Jose and Mari.Will recommend.

I stayed there with my wife and 2 children (2 & 5) in late October for 9 days, and we found it very well suited to our needs. It really is a great location, right where you need to be so any travelling to see attractions, though necessary in a large city, is minimized.What I really liked about the rooms was the space. There was a large lounge and bedroom, and although the bathroom and kitchen were smaller, they were just fine for our needs. The staff were also very helpful, and anything we asked for was quickly attended to.There were two large televisions (lounge and bedroom) with plenty of channels, and a large fridge/freezer. The view across the Bay to Alcatraz from the balcony was a nice extra feature.If I had a moan, I would say that the decor was somewhat dated and a little old, and the kitchen could do with an update in terms of the units weren't of the best quality. But I would emphasize that this in no way impacted on the quality of our stay.It isn't the upmarket, modern,type of place you would get at a large modern hotel chain, but it is a well located, spacious, and enjoyable space to stay . I read some negative reviews claiming that the 'heavy doors to the lift were a fire hazard', and I really have no idea what that was talking about, these criticisms are absolute rubbish in every way.This place deserves the high rating it currently enjoys.

Exchanged timeshare for a weekend stay for 2bdr suite to celebrate 50th anniversary of my in-laws, when we arrived it was miss-booked as 1bdr. The receptionist (Mary) apologized and offered us a second 1bdr the second day. She was so nice that we simplify couldn’t blame her. The stay turned out ok, both 1bdrs had balconies overlooking the bay and Alcatraz island, the cable car stopped right at the door and there were beautiful Victorian row houses across the street. Lumbar street is 3 blocks up away, parking is tight but acceptable in SF. The rooms are spacious although appliances are old. Overall nice stay.

The Suites at Fisherman’s Wharf is at the corner of Hyde and North Point. The cable cars run along Hyde and the buses, along North Point. Thus making it an ideal location, transportation wise. It is also a short distance from Ghirardelli Square. Although the cable car stops right in front of the hotel, it is best to take it from the terminus, a short distance downhill, if you need a seat. You can also get your tickets/passes at the terminus. This hotel has one or two bedrooms, mainly one-bedroom. Parking is self parking and cost $25/day. Self laundry costs $1.50 per load. There is a lookout patio on the 4th floor where one can see Alcatraz and the surrounding area. Hyde St Pier is within walking distance. This hotel is not very big but the staff is nice and friendly. Coffee, tea and hot choc is provided in the lobby, as well as a fruit bowl.

This funky apartment conversion location is PERFECT if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, the cable lines.. they start right outside the door. From the rooftop deck, you can see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge, and all of San Fran. You're 300 Feet from the world famous Buena Vista, famous for Irish coffee. GREAT food, cool, comfortable rooms with tiny but functional kitchens, tiny elevator, character!! We love it. We get delivery from the best local pizza place, too, when we visit. My only complaint is the parking - OMG, it's treacherous. Be careful in there!

Overall, it's a pleasant hotel. I enjoyed my stay. I felt the hotel staff was pleasant and accommodating. The location is fabulous. The only downsides were the late checkin (4:00 is quite late) and the elevator not staying on the floor if you didn't enter right away. One may wonder why this is an issue. The elevator door doesn't open. It's an old-fashioned elevator, where you need to open the door. So, if you are distracted at all and don't see the elevator coming, through the small window, you might miss it. It immediately goes back to the main floor. I think they should get rid of the outer doors so one can see when the elevator comes or, if they can, change the elevator behavior so it waits until someone else calls it. For one or two nights, the elevator is charming, but for a longer stay, it becomes annoying.Regarding the late checkin, I feel 4:00 is quite late as a checkin time and they were not at all accommodating about an earlier checking, even if informed ahead of time that I was coming and needed access to the refrigerator. They also did not have my allergies noted in the record, despite having been called a week beforehand to have them noted.So, 4 stars is appropriate. The overall experience was excellent, but they do have room for improvement.

This location is situated two blocks north of the bay. It is within easy walking distance to all of the Wharf activities and transportation. The resort itself is the problem. Actions in rooms above the room can be heard thru the ceilings. Shower activities can be heard thru a false window into a common area. Queen sofa bed mattresses are too thin. There is a heavy door covering the elevator door which presents a fire escape hazard. Parking is limited and too close to park comfortably. Fee charged to park is ridiculous. Staff is only as helpful as required.

Stayed here for 3 nights in July 2018 - a great location for exploring San Francisco. Staff were helpful & car parking was $20 a night - we only needed it on our last night. My only issue was I left my car/house keys behind when we left - I appreciate that they found them & advised me - but it cost me $94 via ileftmmystuff.com to get them sent back to the UK which I felt was excessive.

Accommodation was clean and staff are friendly but what can I say We were given a welcome pack the day before we left and to me this should be given on arrivalCharged taxes even though accommodation was prepaid in Australia and we were not informed and credit charges just appeared on our cardPhone call made immediately and I’m still waiting for an email and that was 5 days agoWould not recommend at all as photos on website have been photoshopped as this is an old and I mean old building that has been painted modern colour only. Everything is old and definitely needs a makeover and I do t just mean paint Customer service in my eyes is non existent and I’m very disappointed that they cannot even respond but that’s fine because they have been given a poor rating

I think that this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is really excellent. Ride outside is the Hyde Street cable car stop. Fisherman's Wharf is down the hill. Really great location and view from the front door! The suite itself (we were 5 people in a 2 bedroom suite) is exceptionally well equipped. The kitchen is great with eveything you could need (CVS is four minutes away for provisions). I think that the traveller and official photos don't quite do it justice. It is really very nice there and I would definitely stay there again. Polite staff, fruit and drinks in the lobby, even offered some fizz on arrival! Very good stay for 5 nights.

This is a fantastic place to base yourself and your family for a stay in San Francisco. The rooms are clean and spacious. The location is fantastic and central to everything. And the views from the top deck are wonderful. The only small downside was that we thought the lady sitting in the reception area was chatty and helping us book our Alcatraz tour. After wasting alot of time we found that she was only interested in signing us up to a Holiday Club and she told us to go online and book the tour ourselves. So if you steer clear of that you will have a fantastic stay!

Had the most amazing view of alcatraz island from the property. Great place to stay to make it easy to walk around. The staff was so very friendly and helped us get to all the places the family wanted to see. Everything was clean and that is very important to me. Wish we had more time to explore the city.

Beautifully located right next to the trolley line5 min walk to the wharf its self and walking distance to the area attractionsThe apartment was of great stranded and over and above what was expectedView from rooftop area was fantastic with Alcatraz in the back groundGreat Place to stay

Great hotel, wonderful staff, room was very spacious and clean. Had a view of Alcatraz island from the room close to all amenities. The street was busy but was very tolerable, very handy for the cable car stops right beside the hotel so no need to walk the block to the turn around area. Required the maintenance staff to change a light bulb in the unit and they very good at setting up a time at our convenience to complete the work. Didn't get much time to use the roof top deck but it was very nice. Will definitely try and stay at this hotel next time in San Francisco.

Booked for 4 travellers (with luggage), and was happily surprised to see the size of our suite. The bed (in separate bedroom) was HUGE, and the bed-settee (in the main sitting area) was as comfy as you could expect.The room itself was spotlessly clean, and the kitchen area had all the necessary items on hand (IF you want to self-cater, which we didn't).The hotel is extremely well situated, and you're only a downhill walk to the corner to a main tramcar terminus. Otherwise it's another corner on to the start of the Fisherman's Wharf boardwalk, with as many bars, cafe's, gift & tourist shops and restaurants that you could hope to fit in on your holidays without duplicating at any time.It has a rooftop sitting area as well, so you can take advantage of the views out across the bay on most nights.Any of the staff that we came into contact with were extremely helpful. It doesn't have a huge amount of suites (spread over two floors if I remember correctly), but it meant that the place wasn't overrun (and gave it a great ambience).

The room space was adequate for a 1 bedroom suite. However, the walls were paper thin, floors squeaked when upstairs neighbors walked, and bathroom was very small. Parking garage had inadequate space and was overfilled making it difficult to get into and out of. Having just stayed in a Wyndham Shell location in Napa, this Wyndham Shell location was not up to the same standards. However, the room was clean and the staff was very friendly, which goes a long way toward making a pleasant visit.

We booked 5 months in advance and received confirmation. One week before we fly out we receive an email: 'Unfortunately, we don't have anything available on your requested dates, but we will notify you as soon as there is an opening'. No explanation and didn't even have the decency to address us or sign off the email.

Stayed here for four nights great location easy to walk to nice restaurants and bars. Cable car and bus stop both right outside. Suite large and comfortable and very quiet. Has laundry facilities at a great rate and hotel staff helpful with sorting out taxis and giving directions.

Stayed for 3 days-2nd floor with balcony. It was perfect for us-2 parents, 1 teen. Had a parking space for our car and did not charge $50-60 like other hotels-$20. Rooms really big. Not super new but clean and kept well. Had no noise issue (as others have reported-thinking avoid the first floor where people might be outside your room in atrium area). Rooftop area is wonderful for views!! Everybody helpful, friendly. Enjoyed out visit very much. They did try to get us to go to breakfast and hear pitch on buying timeshare for Shell Vacation Co. We said not interested and that was the end of it-no high pressure. Close to everything-cable car outside door. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square. Son and I walked up to Lombard St and walked down it-About 3 blocks away.

My family of 5 stayed for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom unit. It was absolutely perfect for us. In a safe location and close to everything in fisherman’s wharf. Cable and street cars were within a short walk and there’s a bus stop in front of the building. The rooftop patio was closed for maintenance but we wouldn’t have spend any time up there anyway, as it was raining most of the time we were in SF. The cable car runs up and down Hyde so if you’re a light sleeper you might have trouble with that.

Stayed here for a week the end of February. Excellent location just a couple of blocks from the bay and walking distance to a great many sightseeing areas. Easy access to streetcar, cable car and busses. Grocery store just a few blocks away,also walking distance. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and the accommodations were clean and spacious. Would definitely stay here again if I came back to the city

Excellent location, just two blocks from the waterfront/Fishermans Wharf, and a very easy place from which to access cable cars or other municipal transit. The suites were large, comfortable and well appointed. Can’t say enough about the friendliness of staff. Thank you.

Stayed here 3 nights as a married couple and 18-yr old son in a 1-bed suite at rear ground level 1 (no views) with pullout queen sofa bed in living area. The big pluses were the great location and spaciousness of the apartment. Ours was also quiet both from internal atrium and outside street noise. The negatives were its slightly dated decor and appliances and the lack of light in the rooms. All bedrooms and bathrooms here seem to open into an inner atrium, so have no natural light ... and the atrium could do with a bit more ventilation. If you can't get a room with a view along the front (North Pt) or side (Hyde St) you may be in for a dim time. Having access to the roof terrace would help, but unfortunately this was not available for us in February due to renovations on the terrace. Check what sort of room you are getting and where it is before booking as the difference between being at the back and low down versus the front and higher up is significant if you care about views and light. Also ck whether the roof terrace is operating.

This is a small hotel with 24 suites. Our suite had one bedroom, a living/ dining room, an office nook, and a kitchen with a full size refrigerator. It was less than three blocks to the bay where the street cars stop and the beginning of Fisherman’s Wharf. The staff were polite and well informed about the area. It was easy to find with GPS. Make sure you reserve parking because there are not many spaces.

This hotel is spacious and in a fabulous location.Unfortunately they advertised the courtyard as a communal living room. All the bedrooms face this communal living room, so when guests decide to avail themselves of additional space at 2 am speaking loudly on the speaker phone, or when they decide to use the computer to play games, it will be right outside your window. Also when guests slam doors at 6:30 am on Christmas Day when they go from room to room, it can be frustrating.We had the room 103 on the first floor and it was right next to the computer, which was used frequently by guests during our stay. Choose another room and bring ear plugs.

Best thing was location. Loved exploring by foot and found that many must see sights were nearby. Gorgeous roof top views! The hotel itself is old and has a musty smell. City noise and lights carry into the rooms. The rooms are clean however housekeeping did not come very often or at all-can't recall. We had to call for more shampoo, towels and toilet paper. If parking on site, be aware that the garage it very tiny, allowing about 10 cars if not less. We drove in with a full size SUV and had a rough time. The hotel had nice touches, coffee, fresh fruit and cucumber water in the lobby. Once a week they hold a guest social hour with complimentary wine and appetizers. Overall, would recommend and stay here again when returning.

This was a very clean, cozy establishment. I found it equipped with everything that's needed. A fresh bowl of fruit in the lobby everyday is a nice touch. If your plan is to explore this area by foot, this is the place to stay. The lobby door gets locked at dark. I did like that security feature. The staff was very helpful. Being able to go chill on the roof top was awesome. Great place to sit and drink your morning coffee, while watching the city wake up.

Located within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Our unit was spotlessly clean and the bed comfortable. The room was a little musty smelling but that was the only negative. Excellent price for the location. We would choose to stay again if we were lucky enough to come back to San Francisco. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Just a short walk to Pier 39. This is quite an old building, and there is nothing fancy about the apartment - but it was very clean and quite comfortable. The staff were excellent and very helpful at all times.Try to get an apartment that isn't facing North Point Road, as it gets very noisy with buses stopping outside almost all day and night and plenty of noisy people coming and going.

As a couple and an unrelated adult, we thought our suite #105 would have some separation for sleeping, however, the pull out coach in the living room was disturbed by the noisy refrigerator and upstairs guests loudly talking and playing their tv until after 2 a.m. Insulation for noise control is very poor. Our bedroom window opened onto a central atrium where people were going and coming throughout the night talking loudly and slamming doors. On the other hand, the kitchenette was quite nicely appointed with dishes, silverware, microwave etc. There were even 6 wine glasses and a dishwasher. The location is terrific, only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Our room also had its own outdoor patio with a table and chairs. Obviously we thought we were getting a 2 bedroom suite. The view from the rooftop patio, which is shielded from the wind was terrific. We took wine and cheese up our first night and really enjoyed it. Not Sure why Sunday night was $200 more than Saturday.

We stayed 2 nights in a sizeable two bedroom suite, which provided lots of comfort and space for 5 adults. This location is an easy walk from Fisherman's Wharf, the ferries to Alcatraz and the cable cars. At check in we were treated to a welcoming glass of bubbly on the roof top terrace, The unit was very clean and well furnished, with a functional kitchen including a dishwasher. We enjoyed the quiet atmosphere of the suites, and the friendly nature of the staff. Recommended for a short holiday stay in San Francisco.

Spent 4 nights here visiting from Australia in a 1 bedroom apartment - 2 adults, 2 teens. What a gem of a find this place is! Perfectly located just a short walk from all the action but nice and quiet at night (we had room 304). Staff very friendly and helpful - greeted with a glass of champagne on check in!! The view from the roof is so much better than the pictures and is the perfect spot to enjoy a quiet drink at the end of each day. Whilst in SF don't miss biking across the bridge to Sausilito - get your bikes from Blazing Saddles just down the road, these people know how to do customer service!All in all, I wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else. My travel agent had booked us into a hotel on Union Square - so glad I changed us to this place!

We just spent four nights in unit 107 which is a 2 bedroom suite of 800 square feet or so. The kitchen is well equipped if you wanted to cook which we didn't but it was nice to have a full size fridge and dishwasher and plates, bowls, etc. as we did eat breakfast there. The staff is super nice, not only the front desk but the maids and the guys who move the cars around and do maintenance, etc. There are lots of restaurants nearby and the cable car and the 30 Stockton bus or the F train will get you a lot of places quickly. A 3 day Muni pass is $32 and includes the cable car. The rooftop deck is amazing with its panoramic view of the bay. The garage isn't big enough but they do the best they can moving cars around. We got lucky so just left our car in the garage for 4 days. Will definitely be back. And nobody bugged us to buy timeshares!

A little gem in a sea of gouging hotel prices elsewhere. OK a little dated but was clean comfy spacious and had nice comfortable beds.Nice to have your own sitting room without a bed taking up all the room.

Large suite-room conveniently located near Pier 45 and Hyde Cable Car stop. The hotel is a bit old, no luxuries at all, but you get a bedroom, a good living room, and a functional kitchen. And all of it for a similar price at a resort double queen bed room in the area.Good for larger stays (>2 days) when by cooking yourself you can avoid the hypercaloric american diet offered by restaurants. The kitchen was our target here.And nice people, very helpful.

I booked a one-night stay for me, my wife, and our 17-year old daughter. The facility is hard to find and does not look at all like a hotel from the street (which is not a big deal; just worth a mention). When I went to check in, I was greeted by Jason at the front desk, who confirmed my reservation, took credit card details for incidentals, and gave me the card keys for the room. After taking the tiny elevator (for those who are at all claustrophobic), we entered our room to find it was a one-bedroom suite instead of the two-bedroom suite we had booked and prepaid. I immediately went down to the front desk and spoke with Jason, and showed him the itinerary confirming we had booked and paid for a two-bedroom suite. Jason said "oh, you booked through Expedia," and then said that Expedia describes the room we were given as a "two-bedroom suite" because the sofa folds out into a queen-size bed and there is a separate bedroom. Although I was fairly certain that Jason was lying, it was late, we were tired, and my wife and daughter said not to make a big deal of it. After we returned home, I verified that there are indeed two-bedroom suites as well as one-bedroom suites, and there is a significant price difference of sixty bucks per night between the two. I immediately wrote to both Expedia and the hotel group, but over seven months later have not received a refund.

When you book it and you get a confirmation, a surprise is waiting for you. Sorry we don't have the room for you due a leak and pluming work!!! We have relocated you to our sister hotel. It's a scam hotel and they sell rooms on other hotels!!! YOU ARE SCRWED know your rights

Stayed here for three nights and a great central place to use as a base. Close to harbour, bike rental (use Alcatraz bike tours - brilliant), trams stop right outside, short walk for breakfast and good choices to pick from. Restaurants a short walk away and a good selection too. 20 minutes stroll to the Italian area.It also has a good roof terrace looking out towards Alcatraz and harbour. Couple of down sides. One, the walls aren't that well insulated so hearing noisy neighbours with less consideration than others could be an issue. Two, the pull out sofa bed needs replacing. It's knackered and broken. Would I stay here again. Definitely yes.

Great hotel! Very specious, clean. It is a bit outdated but didn't bother us.We enjoyed making our own food.The parking lot is very little - but once you get it the first day you have it till you leave.Be very specific if you consult with the Concierge unless you want to buy tours or spend your day on sales & promotion. (I didn't - so I stayed very specific)The roof balcony is beautiful! We took our breakfast there - was Great!!!Will stay here again.

We stayed at the 2bdr as we are a family of 6. The hotel was a great surprise for us as we had no high expectations, however, employees are very friendly, we got parking in the hotel for the entire 4 nights. Location is awesome and the top floor terrace is super. If you are looking for luxury, this is not the place for you, however, if you look for a clean, good size room with very helpful staff and perfect location this is the place for you. I would definitely come back if we will visit in SF again.

This place is so much nicer than the pics show. The suite itself has a good sized double and a comfortable pull out sofa. Large living area, separate kitchen area and big tv. Ours had a nice balcony and a view of Alcatraz. Very warm welcome from Jason - the glass of bubbles is a nice touch. Great location - a few steps from Buena Vista, Hyde Pier, Fisherman's Wharf, great restaurants and 15 mins walk from Pier 43. Not quiet as it's parallel to the Trolley route (ding ding) but really, it's fine and we all had great sleep. Clean, comfortable and free tea and coffee and cucumber water in the lobby. Highly recommended.

We stayed here for 4 nights and it was excellent . Very nice and clean apartment with spacious living room , good bedroom and well equipped kitchen. The location is close to Wharf and Pier 39. There is a cable car stop and public transport stops right at the door. But we did not hear much noise.

I stayed here for 10 days and it was excellent. The location is terrific. Only a few minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf. Also, the public transport is pretty good such that you can get downtown fairly easily. The apartments are nice and spacious, particularly for a couple. One thing to note, the hotel can be a little noisy if there are families staying.

We just returned home from San Francisco. We stay here 2 different times within the week. We were greeted with champagne at arrival, which was a nice touch. Parts of the hotel could use some upgrading, but nothing too major. Our room for our first stay had an upgraded bathroom, but our room during our second stay did not, but it was fine. The kitchens are well equipped even though we didn't use it. We booked this hotel because of the separate bedroom and pullout couch in the living room. The living room is quite spacious. The layout of the these rooms would make for a great weekend girls trip. The roof top patio is awesome. We went up there several times to take in the view of the Golden Gate bridge, etc. There is a cable car stop right at their front door. It's just a few blocks to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

The facility is located two blocks from the Hyde Street pier and about a twenty minute stroll from Pier 39. The cable car line stops in front of the facility. There are twenty-four (24) units consisting of a bedroom, small bath, large sitting area, and a small kitchen. The décor is somewhat dated but comfortable. Our unit looked out towards Alcatraz with the street below us. However, we did not hear much street noise. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There is limited parking available at the facility, but it does cost extra.

Great location, friendly staff, good kitchen, reasonable price for the area. These are the good points. The bad points? The room interiors are dated and/or a bit shabby. No fan in the shower. The lift is very small and doors are awkward to operate if you have larger luggage. The sofa bed is horribly uncomfortable for an adult. But my main complaint is the ludicrous check in time of 4pm. I don't want to spend hours on the road to arrive at the hotel to be told to go for a walk, I want to settle in and relax. The explanation was that they are a small hotel so it's hard to get all the rooms prepped. Here's a suggestion for the management genius running the place, employ more staff! Don't give me a boring story about getting things perfect, it's not the Ritz for heaven's sake. It's a good hotel in a good location at a decent price (for the area) but the check in time means that I'll be staying elsewhere in the future.

The building's design at the Suites captures and echo's the street noise. At night, the trucks and motorcycles sounded like they were inside the atrium--and I had a room away from the street. Suites should have informed us of the noise issue, both in person and on their website. Several other complaints were voiced during the visit, but none could be handled by the staff. At check-out, I reviewed my stay and the issues encountered, but no adjustment could be made. When I inquired several days later, I was told that all complaints had to be brought forward during the visit, and nothing could be done afterwards. Needless to say, this is unacceptable customer service and indicates that the Suites really didn't want to hear from their guests. If you don't mind the noise, the location is terrific.

Lovely airy lounge well stocked kitchen but no plug for sinkComfortable bed but bedroom dark as no windows Dvd player did not workHelpful reception staffDon't forget the taxes not included in room rate

GENERALWe been to San Francisco many times, as it is one of our favorite cities, so stayed 7-nights over spring break with family, in a 2-bedroom timeshare condo exchanged through Interval International. LOCATION and PUBLIC TRANSPORTATIONThe condo is in the perfect location, one block from Ghirardelli Square. About a 5-minute walk to the Wharf area and 10-minute walk to Pier 39. Public transportation is so convenient—the Powell-Hyde cable car and MUNI buses both have stops literally right outside the front door! Grocery store (Safeway and Trader Joes) are 5 blocks away. Get yourself a MUNI pass (1, 3, 7 day) which will let you get around the city; note it does not cover BART, which is the train to/from SFO. We picked up our 7-day pass ($42 each) at information booth in baggage claim. Don’t forget to also pick up a $3 MUNI map with bus/cable car routes.PARKINGWe rented a car so we could visit family in Sacramento and took a couple of other day trips during our stay. There is limited parking (about 15 spots for 25 condos). Parking is $22 a day. If you are lucky (like us), once you get your spot, you have it the rest of your stay. If not, supposedly you can park in a nearby (more expensive) public lot temporarily until a spot opens later during your stay. If are not planning to leave the city, DON’T bother with a car; you’ll just pay a lot for parking.LIKES* Renovated, good-size condo, especially for SF. Very clean.* Beds: 1 king-size, 1 queen-size, large sofa bed. * Roof-top terrace with gorgeous unobstructed view of the bay and Alcatraz* 2 washers & dryers near lobby ($1.50 each), though 1 dryer was broken* Large in-room safe* Kitchen: 2-burner, fridge, toaster, microwave, blender, dishwasher, dishes and utensilsNEUTRAL* Older building so doors, cabinet and floors creaked* Small, simple lobby. Small business center (computer, printer)* No traditional oven—microwave is also a convection oven* No A/C, although did not need it in April* Minor sales pitch for their timeshare, which we declined with no further pressureDISLIKES* Quite noisy (NOT condo’s fault) because you are next to cable line!* Quite dark in living room* Beds not very comfortable* Bath tub clogged; told front desk but was not fixed* Large master bedroom closet but none in 2nd bedroom and no drawers for clothes* Free Wi-Fi very slow (<1 Mps). Can pay for faster Wi-Fi ($50 for the week) SUMMARYCan’t beat location especially with a large accommodation

I stayed here for three nights while visiting San Francisco with friends. We had a total of two rooms for 8 people which might sound a little small but it worked out great because the living area is quite spacious. We loved the rooftop terrace and had drinks and appetizers up there with a fantastic view of the bay and Alcatraz. It is just two short block up from the wharf area and one block from Ghirardelli and the cable car station. The rooms were clean and nicely soundproof for a great night's sleep! The reception staff is friendly and helpful and had no problems splitting our bills for our group. I would definitely stay here again, it is quite a find!

Stayed at the Suites at Fisherman's Wharf March 2017 while visiting the Bay area. Room was clean, spacious and ours had a balcony where we could enjoy our morning coffee. The beds where very comfortable and the staff was wonderful. The best part of this hotel was is proximity to everything including Wharf, trolley, Ghirardelli Square etc.

Stayed for 5 days with my son and husband. Upon arriving they offered us champagne, staff was super friendly. Room was super clean and BIG! We stayed in room 200, it had its own balcony that you could see alcatraz from. The rooftop you can see a lot of the city and bay. It was amazing. Beds were comfy, had a ceiling fan in bedroom. Stove full size fridge (we only used for drinks bc we ate out every meal), plenty of dishes and pots, pans, etc if you want to cook. One block from Ghiradelli square, within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, all public transportation stops right in front of hotel. Very safe! We parked one night (rented a car one night to drive to San Jose) was 20.00. Staff is incredible, the ladies that cleaned the room were incredible. We also used the washer and dryer and front desk will give you laundry detergent. We will always stay here when we come back. If you are up in the air for a family trip choose to stay here over Union Square. This place is a gem!!! Cannot say enough things about how great this place is!!

We were in San Francisco for three nights, so we appreciated the spaciousness of our suite. The living room was large and comfortable, with a nice kitchen attached. The kitchen contained a small stove, full sized fridge, microwave, and dishwasher. The included pans and dishes were of good quality, and the kitchen was spotless. And there was a 12 cup coffee pot and really good coffee to brew. The bedroom contained a comfy bed and lots of storage space. The bathroom had been recently renovated and was clean and efficiently laid out. The suite was very quiet-- we heard no noise over the three nights we were there. We had no view from our room, but the hotel has a lovely roof deck with nice views of the water and Alcatraz. The hotel is conveniently located near Fisherman's Wharf. We walked a lot and took conveniently located busses, and the Trolly is only a block away. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if we are fortunate enough to have a chance to return to San Francisco.

It was so relaxing to stay in Suites at Fisherman's wharf. I stayed here for 8 days during my family trip in San Francisco. The staff were all very nice and friendly. They always tried to do their bests to accommodate our needs during our stay. I felt like home so much! Thank you! And the location of the suites is great, easy to go around the famous spots surrounding us. :)

I was attending a conference at the Moscone and all the downtown hotels were booked so I found this place, which turned out to be perfect. It's literally on the cable car line and 100 yards from the Fisherman's Wharf turnaround on Hyde St. I bought a 3-day pass and rode the cable cars back and forth each day. The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf is a small (24 rooms) modern place where the rooms are built around a central atrium. There's a rooftop deck that gives you views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Plus my suite had a balcony and chairs facing the Bay. The suite was amazing in terms of the square footage for San Francisco. Big bedroom, separate spacious living room with wraparound couch and table. Full kitchen. You're a stone's throw from Fisherman's Wharf, which is touristy, but does have some interesting restaurants, especially ones overlooking the water. In the other direction, you can walk to Fort Mason, which a scenic area. Couple of other points: 1. No breakfast is served. 2. This is apparently a condo/time share type of thing owned by Wyndham, so I got a sales pitch type of call, but not high pressure. 3. It's not really a hotel in terms of amenities, gift shop, soda machines, etc. But you're in the heart of SF, so it's all good. I would definitely return to the Suites. Oh, and the Internet wasn't the fastest.

The condo was beautiful, spacious, and very well equipped. The bed and pillows were super comfy. We faced the bay and had a perfect view of Alcatraz from our second floor balcony. The location is just a couple blocks from the wharf, Ghirardelli Square, and the trolley station. Staff is friendly and helpful. No timeshare pressure sales. Thanks for the tip on Michael's deli - awesome sandwiches!

Close to all of the touristy attractions - Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, pickup for Dylan's Tours. One bedroom suite with a FULLY furnished kitchen (two-burner cooktop, fridge, dishwasher, countertop convection/microwave oven, pots & pans, dishes, glasses, flatware, knives, toaster, blender, hand mixer, colander, salad bowls, etc.). The staff was great. Our only complaint was the HVAC system - no air flow despite the ceiling fans and the thermostat didn't seem to do much. The room was always too warm despite the atrium and lobby being freezing cold.

This is what I might call a boutique hotel but it has nice sized suites with a full kitchen so perfect for the longer stays. It is well situated being only a blcok from Fisherman's Wharf and the tram passes right by the hotel. It is well appointed and clean but things are alittle dated. However, the quality of the stay, the friendliness of the staff, and location definitely made up for the slightly dated look. Our young adult children slept on the pull out sofa and found it uncomfortable compared to some others they have slept in. Maybe younger shildren would be fine.

The location of this little gem is terrific. Three blocks from the Wharf which has something for everyone (check out the Gold Dust for adults, the Raintree Cafe for the kids (pricey but one of a kind), and the lighted boats at Christmas time.) The famed (for it's Irish coffees) Buena Vista or the BV as locals call it is two blocks from the hotel, and two blocks in another direction is the Ghiradelli Square, famous for chocolates and ice cream. Everything within walking distance without the crowds and traffic. You just feel like you are walking down any street in a City neighborhood. Want to go downtown? The cable car stops right in front of the hotel! The hotel itself is small, not fancy but clean, quiet and serene. There is only one small elevator and no bell service, so keep that in mind when packing. Of course the "crown jewel" is the sun deck on top of the hotel which, on a clear day or night, gives you a partial few of the Bay Bridge in one direction and the Golden Gate Bridge in another! The only complaint was the garage is first come, first serve and needs to be up-dated for newer models of cars.

Absolutely fantastic find in San Francisco - a suite with a full kitchen and separate bedroom for the price of a hotel room (it was originally an apartment building). Great location on the trolley & bus stop and a block from Ghiradelli's. There is a terrace on the top of the building with fantastic views of Alcatraz & the city. Limited parking is available if you are lucky enough to grab a spot. Very clean and family oriented.

Location!! Location!! Location!! Close to Fishermans Wharf only a few minute walk away. A block away from Ghirardelli chocolate company. The cable car pick up right in front of resort , Buena Vista Cafe. The front desk was very helpful and friendly when we arrived late to check in . The resort very clean and home like feeling. All the kitchen necessities for all your cooking. Kids loved the resort. We will be back .

For several years now I have stayed at the SFW for an annual reunion with a group of old friends. The location is perfect for an intimate cocktail party prior to walking to a restaurant--either at Fisherman's Wharf, the Cannery or even North Beach! Each time my appreciation of the area is renewed. You have a choice of a view or a garden, near the clanging sounds of the cable car or a more isolated room for a quieter stay. The only negatives are (1) Parking (ground floor parking space is limited and first come-first served) and (2) No breakfast served (but your basically stocked kitchen provides the essential tools for any general cooking desires). This may well become your go-to place for a relaxing and memorable stay in The City By the Bay.

Great Service. Nice room. Stayed many times. Location excellent for Fisherman's Wharf Area. There are many good sites Pier 39, Submarine and Liberty ship Tours. Also, tour of Alcatraz, Muir Woods, and Sausalito.

We have stayed here many times and enjoyed our stays. My wife and I had made reservations to spend the Thanksgiving week here in February. This was to be a special trip because my cousin and his wife just had their first child and this would have been our first Thanksgiving with the new member of our family as well the first time my wife, mother, my cousins mom, and I would have got to meet him. Today my wife and I called to confirm our reservations as we always due and we were told that we in fact did NOT have a reservation and that the establishment was filled and there was nothing they would be able to do for us for that week. As I pressed the woman I was speaking with she asked if I had the email with the reservation on it, unfortunately I was unable to find the email because it had been deleted. Her reply was if I had no email conformation then I had not made a reservation (essentially calling me a liar) and there was nothing she could or would do for us. Basically, thanks to an error on their side I now have plane tickets, food being sent specifically for our Thanksgiving dinner, my cousins expecting us and no where to stay. Needless to say this has been a very disappointing experience because up until now we loved our little place and now it will be forever tainted.

Enjoyed my stay. The location was perfect for a majority of the activities we did and food. The cable car passes right outside making it a fun ride to union square. The room was large with lots of room to relax and chat. Great view from our balcony down to the bay and Alcatraz. The staff was extremely helpful and patient with our large group.

We stayed at the Suites in August for three nights. We found the apartment very spacious and liked how close it was to Fishermans Wharf. The bed was extremely comfortable and the kitchen amenities were great. The roof terrace was fantastic and looked over the bay with a clear view of Alcatraz and Golden Gate bridge in the distance. The apartments were in a great location and the area felt safe. Ghirardelli square is close by and we bought ice-cream and ate it on the roof terrace, which was lovely. The cable car also stops right outside the hotel which is handy if you use it to get around. However all the attractions at Fishermans Wharf are in walking distance and we walked to other tourist attractions too such as Lombard Street, Coit Tower and the Alcatraz Ferry. We loved San Francisco and would definitely recommend the Suites to people visiting.

I stayed at the Suites July 2 - 9, 2016. I had a one-bedroom apartment with a huge balcony facing the Bay and a kitchen with a stove and full size refrigerator. The rooftop terrace was beautiful. It faced Alcatraz. Watched the Fourth of July fireworks from the terrace. It was so magical. I took the #47 bus right out front to Safeway and purchased my groceries for a week. I took the #3 bus to Little Italy and Chinatown. The cable car stopped right in front of the entrance to the rooms. I lived like a local for seven days. I can't wait to go back. The staff was great.

My husband and I are here for our anniversary and love how close this location is to Fisherman's Wharf. We've been able to enjoy runs and great food, as well as shopping - all within walking distance. Parking in the garage is tricky, but convenient. The room feels more like a friend's apartment, which is great in that it's comfortable, but it doesn't feel particularly exclusive or luxurious. The best part of these suites is the rooftop deck. Great views of the city and water. Gorgeous sunsets and sunrises!

The spaciousness of our lodging as well as the quiet, tranquil view from the rooftop deck was just what we needed following our cruise. The rooms were immaculate, the linens welcoming. I can recommend this lodging without hesitation.The location is within walking distance of nearly all of Fisherman's Wharf. We also rented bikes nearby and rode across the Golden Gate Bridge and returned via ferry. Lots of wonderful nearby places to find every food that you might desire.If you are able to book early, do so since rooms go quickly. It is a tad pricey but worth it!

Our family of 4 stayed in a one-bedroom suite for 9 nights of vacation. We were very happy with our choice overall. We have two boys (15 and 11) and wanted enough space. We typically stay at Hilton type hotels on vacation for that reason. Hotels are so expensive here that we were priced out of suites or taking 2 rooms. We looked at VRBO, but didn't find any in as good a location as The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. Plus it's nice to have the reassurance of 24 hr front desk for any problems and cleaning, etc.Loved that we were close to wharf activities without being in the center of tacky souvenir shops and all the noise. You are 1 block into the neighborhood of Russian Hill which feels less touristy. Buses and Cable car right on hotel corner. The stop for The street car to wharf and ferry building is a 5-10 minute walk.Loved our balcony and the roof top deck to enjoy a bottle of wine and the incredible views! So great to enjoy the San Francisco air and vibe and not be in a tiny sealed hotel room. Also loved having coin operated laundry downstairs, so we didn't have to overpack or waste money on cleaning service.Areas of improvement? Well my kids were bummed there was no pool, but we knew that going in. The rollaway bed wasn't available until our 2nd night. The pull out and rollaway weren't the best, but with smaller kids it would be fine.The housekeeping was appreciated, but minimal. I.e never changed pull-out sheets, changed our bed once, but always had fresh towels and was tidy.The staff was eager to please and helpful with suggestions.I recommend it! Enjoy lovely San Francisco!

Overall an excellent place to stay on Fisherman's Wharf - parking is unique but very reasonably priced. Room/suite is slightly above average - grandparents and two 15 yo in suite and worked well - the roof is a great place to relax on a sunny day - would stay here again without a problem

Stayed here with young kids. Location is perfect. Just a short walking distance from Wharf and bus/trolleys just outside the front door. Kitchen was fully stocked with necessities. Kids enjoyed the "old fashioned" elevator. The place is older and appears to have been painted over many times (interior door frames, etc). Our room was clean but outdated and appeared so. Stayed on upper floor so did not have any "thin wall" noise issues. Being we had a great view of the bay, and transportation stop is right outside, we did hear the busses and cars traveling all night but got used to the noise. Had room vacuumed and trash emptied upon request, as well as more towels, soaps refilled, etc. My only complaint is the odor. I could not get used to the old, wet wood, musty odor. It just smells old. My family wasn't as bothered by it as I was although it has bothered me enough to rethink my stay here again. It is clean, and plenty spacious, just smelly.

We booked a 1 bedroom suite. It was very nice, but the view from the roof top deck was gorgeous! My picture doesn't do it justice! The parking was very reasonably priced. The cable cars pick you up right outside the hotel!

Perfectly acceptable base but not luxury. San Fran very expensive for hotels so this is reasonably value for its location.We absolutely loved San Francisco and the location of the Suites would be hard to beat.Concierge and staff friendly. Room has what you need but the shower is pretty poor and wifi non-existent in the room.

We stayed for 3 nights from 21 June. The suites at fishermans wharf are in a great location, ideal for walking to pier 39 and fishermans wharf, plus a pleasant uphill trek via Lombard street to union square. The suites are very spacious, clean and ideal for families. The rooftop views were spectacular.

Stayed 2 nights -- a Fri and Sat. The room (5th flr) was great even if outside our window is O'Farrell and street corner -- street noise (not too bad) and the pub next door. The free breakfast (early AM, ends at 9:30am) and round-the-clock coffee in the dining area (2nd flr, by the gym where you can refill your free water bottle at the water cooler) was awesome! Typical continental breakfast including pre-made omelettes, sausages, cereals, various milks, yogurts and fruits. Also, complimentary fruit infused water available in the lobby's snack shop.Clean guestroom and the use of space was smart; the bathroom is pretty big actually! We were out all Sat at Union Sq and Dolo -- we really love this location, so central for most of what we visited! The hotel is surrounded by hotels, eateries including several boba and other Asian delectables, and the brand name stores of Union Sq. We even got to leave our luggage with the front desk when we checked out early as we had an all-day wineries tour departing from Gray Line (Post St.) -- less than 10min walk to get there.We highly recommend this place.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The room was clean. The hotel is near the public transportation, lots of different restaurants and within walking distance to the union square. The complimentary breakfast was nice. Our room was above the Irish Pub on the 3rd floor. We only heard some music around 12pm one night and it was fine for us. So do consider the possible noise from the Irish Pub if it might be a problem for you or request for a room away from the Pub when checking in. Overall, we will consider staying here again when we are around this area.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This is far and away the best Holiday Inn Express that I've stayed in. Modern rooms that are spacious given the city centre locale. Super staff all around, from the friendly front desk to housekeeping, who keep the place spotlessly clean. The location couldn't be better. Two blocks from Union Square, the Cable Car, and the Powell Street station, making it easy to reach from SFO using BART. All sorts of restaurants, bars and cafes in the immediate area, and you can walk to Chinatown and North Beach in 15-20 minutes for delicious food.Sadly I have to take off a star on this review for the appalling amount of waste that is generated in the breakfast room. Especially the plastic cutlery and non-recyclable cups. Yes, they offer paper plates, but those will also end up in a landfill. There is absolutely no reason not to be using dishware and cutlery that can be washed and used again. IHG needs to be more environmentally conscious.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is in a wonderful location in union square. around the corner from cable car start. Parking is expensive anthe rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. I didn't spend a lot of time in room so it was ok. the service was excellent and the only issue was the cold omlets at breakfast. it was understandable because there was quite a few people and the 1st batch went really fast. I would stay again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. Room is very clean, great location there are a lot of restaurants within walking distance. Very convenient. Street noise at night can be annoying, the higher floor would be better. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Valet parking is not a problem, but there is only one spot to park for the valet.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Right on Union Square, great location to everything. Cable car very closeBig Bus stops close alsoweather was warm (April)Staff at the hotel very very friendly and helpful and a good mix of hot and cold eatsPlus fresh fruitBreakfast included I would stay here again
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We went to a hotel in Fisherman Wharf but the area is not what is was, so even if Booking charge me the entires three nights!! We relocate to Union Square and we enjoy very much this modest almost hidden hotel, where from we could walk the entire downtown!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is on really good location. Not fancy, but not worn either. Rooms are smallish on US standards, but works for the purpose very well. Friendly staff. Breakfast is quite simple, on third morning started to miss some variety. Overall value for money in SF.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: So glad we booked this hotel. Everything you need is here...food, pharmacy, lots of shopping in the area....Burger King down the street...Starbucks across the street. Short walk to Chinatown. Love Holiday Inn Express breakfast...this one is really good...dining area is super clean. Irish Pub next door. The building is secure, front door is locked at night, you'll need a key card to get in. Surprisingly quiet at night .... the beds are great...good sleep every night. Good water pressure in shower,,,,hot water. Professional management, they are very helpful....front desk crew is as good as it gets....customer service is 100% a priority to them and it shows. Didn't have a mini fridge or microwave oven in our room....that would have been nice. Too many positives here for me to score less than "Excellent" .
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Great stay, Everything perfect. Staff all, during my check in and check out were great, and professional . I would like to make a special comment for Rona, the afternoon front desk person. She is an asset to the staff.Friendly all of the time, professional and helpful. My stays when Rona was working was, he was great. She remembered my name without having to look it up or me telling her. That means everything to me.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed for a week of business meetings. Hotel staff was very helpful and nice especially Ana. The room was fine. Not very big but had a closet and a specious shower. Breakfast is 100% standard HIE. Basic but can do the job. Would have recommended it more if it had safe, minibar, complementary water bottles and other small extra like that. Although it’s an HIE it does cost 300usd per night so I think they should try to give a bit more.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The best thing about this property is the location. It is located a half block from Union Square and Powell St. The rooms are small with a spacious bathroom. The room had one window with a view of the neighboring high rise. The only window covering was a well worn shade that no longer rolled up.The breakfast was the standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast, no better no worse than every other HIE.The biggest problem we had was that our room was subject to a very loud rumble that sounded like a big diesel engine idling right outside the room. I suspect that the noise was coming from rooftop HVAC equipment on the neighboring building right outside our window. Both my wife and I are Spire elite and feel that if this is one of the better rooms, what are the other rooms like?
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: My stay at HIE Union Square was for four nights. I had a conference to attend at the Moscone center and the location of the hotel was a good advantage. They are very close to everything imaginable for a traveler. Their staff is also very cooperative and supportive. However, the negatives are the extremely small, rat hole sized rooms and the disturbance from the street. There's a bar adjacent and you can't cut out that noise. They should have invested on sound proofing the room.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed for 3 nightsPros:-free breakfast-WiFi worked fine-location - within walking distance to the Market and Powell Streets cable car turn-around, Walgreen, Macy’s, Boudin Bakery, Westfield San Francisco Centre-friendly staffCons:-no in room safe-no mini fridge-no microwave -no self serve laundry-loud street noiseNotes:-Valet Parking is $55 plus parking tax of $13.75 per day-cannot stop in front of the hotel on O’Farell Street to unload luggage-the valet parking spot is at the corner of Cyril Magnin Street and O’Farrell Street-have to park at the valet parking spot to check in first then unload luggage-ask for a room away from the noise of the Irish Pub next door
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: To begin, the positives: The entire staff (front desk, bell desk, and Fast Start breakfast area) were extremely helpful and very pleasant. Although our room was not going to be ready early due to a late checkout request by the prior guest, the front desk stored (then placed in our room) all of our luggage stowed behind the desk. When I called down for extra towels (more on that later) and a TV remote, the staff providing everything promptly and with a smile.Now, the negatives: The front desk never asked about a vehicle. Are you going to charge me the daily parking fee regardless? There is no guidance for guests who have even have a vehicle. Is there a valet? Do we self park? Did they assume we took a Lyft/Uber/taxi to the hotel? Secondly, the room was extremely dusty. I wondered if it had been vacuumed recently it was so bad. Lastly, I provided and confirmed my Stay Preferences in advance. With four adults listed on the reservation and as requested in my Stay Preferences, there should be four, full sets of towels. There was an odd number of each: (3) bath towels; (4) hand towels; and (2) washcloths; thus, forcing me to call and wait for additional to be brought to the room. A TV remote was also lacking (but was brought up by request later.)The negatives are relatively minor. The location makes up for a lot. However, even as a HIE, you will pay a premium for the proximity to Union Square.I'd come back and stay.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed just one night, but loved the location and the cleanliness of the rooms. Plan ahead for parking - the garages are all very expensive and a few blocks away. The hotel offers valet, but it is even more expensive. Breakfast is provided, but expect very basic continental. I would recommend this hotel for a one or two night business stay, but not much longer.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: You have to be a midget to enjoy this hotel. You bump into everything.This has to be the world's smallest Holiday Inn. For 4 dollars less why not stay at The Hilton Financial Distric with views. READ MY REVIEW OF THE HILTON FINANCIAL DISTRICT OF SAN FRANCISCO
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I find that the Downtown or Central City Expresses are always very well located and this one is certainly that. Just a block from Union Square it s near all the main transport hubs. Check-in was efficient and help was given with my somewhat excess luggage. Sweetly, the receptionist rang to see if I had settled-in OK. The room was modern and spotlessly clean. While the breakfast room was small, it was never overcrowded and the fare was good with a reasonable cross-section on offer. San Francisco is probably one of the most expensive cities in the USA and it is a popular conference venue. In common with hotels worldwide, this chain increases its room rates when demand in high. On the Sunday night my rate went up to GBP465 - a high rate for a three *** hotel. I decided to stay all the same - but I spent the next five nights at an out of town hotel. I would return, but not at any price. In the 2nd week of January 2019 the rate is already $900 a night excluding taxes.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I checked in very late at around 10:30 pm and stayed 2 nights. Already upon check-in I requested a late check-out at 3:00 pm, because I am an IHG.com gold customer and therefore have the privilege to benefit from a late check-out. In fact that was the reason I booked an IHG.com hotel. The receptionist told me very firmly that check-out was at 11:00 am. I reminded him, that I was a gold member; but no mercy, except he could grant a late check-out at 1:00 p.m. Arrived in my room, which had no safe. All cups and mugs were made of plastic. Also the breakfast restaurant had plastic mugs as well as plastic cutlery. Ironically, the hotel reminds guests, that it cares about the environment and therefore recommends guests to use towels and linens again, in order to save detergent and the environment. What an irony.My bed was extremely soft, indeed too soft and no good for my back. I did not sleep that night for this reason. The following morning I informed the receptionist, this time a young woman, about the extremely soft bed. She told me, that I could change the room, but said that probably all beds are the same. (I hastened to add, that later that day housekeeping left extra blankets and a duvet in order for me to sleep on the floor). I slept well the following night. I took the opportunity to ask the receptionist, if she could extend my late check-out until 3:00 pm. She could not, although she granted a late check-out at 2:00 pm. Ironically, after my first night, the room was not cleaned until after 3:30 pm (I left my shopping bags in my room at 3:30 pm, at which time my room was not cleaned). I am concerned, that this hotel does not care about the environment, because it uses plastic mugs as well as plastic cutlery throughout the hotel. Save the planet, please.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We came for a convention and thought we’d got a deal. The price Online was $176 per night. When I booked it was nearly $400. We stayed because prices were up 2-3x normal because of another conference. When I complained they offered an “upgrade” to a suite. Well the room was a suite - right over the Irish pub. Loud thumping music until 2am every night. It was impossible to sleep. The whole room vibrates with the loud music. For $400 a night, I should have been told about the loud music and given an option. Don’t stay here or if you do, demand to not be near the rooms over the bar.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I love this hotel and how close it is to the shopping center of Union Square. It is minutes from Westfield mall, financial district, Chinatown and all the top-rated restaurants. We couldn't be happier to walk right out and everything is within the fingertips. The room is a little small, but equipped with high-tech gasgets. It's nice and clean with good breakfast choices. It's great for family with small kids because food is very costly when you travel. The price is fair for this expensive vacation destination. It's the best value you can get in San Francisco.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Attended a conference at the Moscone center which is about a 8 min walk from the hotel. I stayed in room 316 which was comfortable - no view, essentially looking at a brick wall. There is a pub nearby that can be a little loud but only a minor amount of noise penetrated into the room. For some reason, they don’t get around to cleaning the rooms until late - twice during the week I returned to the room between 3-4pm and the room wasn’t cleaned yet. Breakfast is simple but worked perfectly fine for me as I like yogurt, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal and coffee which were all available. The location is perfect - right near the Powell cable car, union square and lots of shops and restaurants. The staff were all really great and the room rates are more reasonable than other nearby hotels.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Lets start with the location, it is perfectly located in the center and nice restaurants, attractions and shops around. And then lets continue with the staff that have energy and is viable and make you feel welcomed and guarded/safe. The room I was in was great size, good equipment, liked the sleep quality and breakfast to just start your day easy in a basic way, nothing fancy but variety of options and it served me right. Then the last thing I want to mention is Susan from the front desk. She greeted me when I came early at 7am after 15 hour flight. She was emphatic and welcoming. She helped me feel that she hear me and promised to call when the room will be ready which she did later and I knew I can trust her. She and other staff members continued to greet everyone when we passed by the entrance. They simply raised the head and made a verbal or eye contact acknowledging the presence. Susan energy was viable, as opposed to some hotels where there is attitude Susan gave great service at eye level! If I need to visit again I would consider staying there. Prices were good.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We arrived into San Francisco airport and the BART took us directly to the area (only a couple of blocks to walk). At the exit from the BART was the information office and they were very helpful. The hotel is not well marked and it would be easy to miss, but once inside we had everything we really needed. We would have appreciated a small fridge and an in-room safe. We were able to lock up our valuables at the front desk, but it made us slightly uncomfortable. Breakfast was good and the room was clean and comfortable. We were very impressed with the staff. The location had both positives and negatives. On the plus side, it was easy to access the cable cars and MUNI bus system and thereby travel anywhere in the city. We bought a 7 day MUNI pass and it paid for itself within the first 2 or 3 days. There were lots of shopping and restaurant options in the vicinity. On the negative side, this hotel is located only 2 blocks from the Tenderloin and the area was inundated with people on the sidewalks begging. The streets were soiled with urine and the air was foul each morning. We saw city workers out sanitizing, but it is a huge job. We were warned not to walk west from the hotel at any time of the day. Mental health issues, drug use and homelessness were evident. Look carefully at the map and decide upon your comfort level with the location. We appreciated the nearby Walgreen store and made good use of their snacks and deli selections. There is lots to see in San Francisco and this is a central location.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We (couple) stayed at this hotel for a week. Some of the positives were that breakfast was included, the price was better than many other hotels in the city (especially in relation to hotel ranking), the location was good for public transportation (a bus or trolley (or cab) can be easily accessed), it's a good area for shopping and eating (we really enjoyed the Asian restaurant next door), the staff were friendly, the wifi was good, the bathroom/shower was nice, and the bed was comfy. A few minor things that we'd consider cons were the small size of the room (not major as you should be out exploring and not hanging in the room), also we didn't have a fridge in our room which we thought was odd, and some outside (we were on a lower floor) and between room noise. The gym is small, but they do have one. Breakfast isn't elaborate but it's adequate with some hot food like eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, pancakes and cold food such as yogurt. There's also pastries, juice, coffee, cereal, toast, bananas, apples, etc. There's a Walgreens around the corner which was really helpful as we saved a lot of money grabbing drinks and snacks there; we even grabbed lunch there several times which left more money for nice dinners. Overall it was a good stay, and we'd stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is in a good location for shopping in Union Square. The hotel is clean and breakfast is sufficient. Be aware that you need to pull up at the side of the hotel for valet parking but it says "no waiting" and something about 'towing away' on the pavement/sidewalk but you have to leave your car to run round the corner to the hotel to get help. There is an extra charge for parking. I later noticed that there is a public car park over the road which is probably cheaper, certainly worth looking into. Friendly staff.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: From our title, the biggest beef we had with this hotel was it doesn’t offer any laundry service which was a bit of a problem for us as we were traveling from an international location and had limited time available. We ended up finding an online laundry service that would pick up and deliver to the hotel, I would’ve thought the hotel could do a deal with a laundry service like that to fill that gap. The hotel is in a great location near Union Square which makes for easy restaurant selection as there are many nearby. We had the King Suite as my wife and I were traveling with our 2 teenage boys, the room was a little tight for all of us and our luggage but the reality was we didn’t spend a lot of time in the room anyway. I’d recommend this hotel if you don’t need all of the extras like room service etc. The hotel does offer breakfast which includes the usual basic offerings, better than spending big bucks for a bowl of cereal at a full service hotel.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Hotel seems small, but the double room was a nice size. Reviews warned about noise from an adjoining bar next door, but the music was done by 11:00pm, so it wasn’t a big deal. Breakfast left much to be desired. Staff was very nice & helpful. Location is 2 blocks from major transportation hub.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We stayed two nights, our room was on the third floor. Under the room is a pub, which kept us awake until 01:00 am. Nobody at the front desk told us !!! you can feel the music in bed. The room was o.k. If you can sleep in a pubBreakfasts was as bad as the noise
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Great location and the staff is soooooooo helpful and friendly. Helped with directions to everywhere and calming when it came to the valet parking. Had a king suite and with kids it was great. Even being in union square was pretty quiet. Expensive but hey its San Francisco!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Small, neat, comfortable hotel, cheaper than others, at an ideal place, near union Square. Your proximity to union Square and from there , accessibility to all transportation and places , in San Francisco, makes it an ideal , getaway place for tourists, wanting to really experience the magic of San Francisco.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is located in Union Square. This makes it very convient to get around the city. There are a number of shops nearby too.There are also many public transport locations ie, BART, buses, trams, trolleys. The rooms were clean and modern. It was also fairly quiet. They have a free breakfast each morning.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I booked this as part of my trip to the US after more than 10 years. This was a trip with my two daughters. The location is superb with easy access to shopping, site seeing places, museums and transportation. My daugthers both loved the room that had a separate bedroom on the 6th floor and a sofa bed for myself. I would say the room exceeded my expectations for a holiday inn express. I would like to call out 2 individuals who made this stay even more pleaseant. John and Sagar at the front desk. Polite, attentive and helpful. It is this type of customer service that will bring me back to this hotel rather than the Hilton or Westin nearby.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Wedged between parent Holiday Inn, this hotel was beautiful. Inside was decorated very classy. Made me feel I was in another hotel with high society! The security was way above...you had to use your key card to get into restrooms off the lobby and elevator. Breakfast for very good. Coffee excellant.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This is a small hotel and the rooms are smaller than other Holiday Inn Express hotels I have stayed at. They have bed, desk, chair, bathroom, closet, coffee maker so the room is basic but has the essentials. I would not hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Perfect location for seeing the city! Hotel is completely renovated and very clean. Staff is wonderful and very helpful. Nice to have a complete breakfast in the morning. See you next time we are in the city.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I just wrote an review for another IHG property on how IHG top tiers are losing sheen. Well its properties like this HI Express hotel which probably is keeping loyal members like me still tied to IHG. Wonderful staff, going out of the way for help. Excellent location. There is a bit of noise but thats okay if you want to feel living at the city center. The suite was very spacious. Breakfast was available everyday and they didnt hurry to finish for late risers like me :) Will surely stay here again when i visit later this year.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The staff was super helpful and very friendly. They were able to satisfy my request of being on a higher floor; however, the the noise from the street can easily be heard from the top floor (5th floor). If you’re a light sleeper then this hotel is probably not for you. Unless you get a room towards the top, back, and off the street. Breakfast was the typical for a hotel that offers free continental breakfast. It did the trick. The room was very clear, but I thought the shower floor could have used some extra cleaning. The grout looked a bit dirty. The hotel is in a pretty decent location close to Union Square. If you don’t mind walking, then it’s a nice walk to different neighborhoods. Beware that it’s close to the sketchy neighborhood, but you shouldn’t be bothered unless you specifically walk through the Tenderloin neighborhood to the west. Overall an okay stay, but would highly suggest management look into upgrading the windows. That would have made my stay that so much better.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Cute little boutique hotel, easy to get to via BART. Cable car turnaround just around the corner. Great staff, good service. Breakfast room well lit and clean. Loved the pillows. Would stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I am Spire Elite member for Ihg and travel for work/ pleasure almost every month and i stay in hotels more than a few nights. This is by far the worst in terms of sleep quality and value for money. + Room size fair - well furbished -bathroom size good - location central - friendly/help-full staff- No safe in room Windows not double glassed and dont close properly therefore you have the outside noise as if sitting on the road. We changed rooms 3 times during stay Over 5 nights due to unbearable noise. —————————-After 20 hours of flights you expect to come and sleep peacefully! Due to excessive noise from surrounding areas of hotel the sleeping experience is a Nightmare. Most of the windows overlook on a truck LOading bay area where at any point in time they work therefore you wake up on the noise of trolleys and stuff moving. Under hotel you have an Irish pub where they play music until 1:30 am which you hear as if you are sitting in the pub.The hotel staff have been responsive and changed room as per our request and they were trying to help but the solution is not in their hand.———To management : have you ever thought of Installing double glass windows to cancel noise ?? All hotels install them when in cityCenter. I do understand its a holiday express but this is not even close to the standards! Out of 5 nights had booked 1 with my points - 50,000 ! Thats equivalent to an Intercontinental in any other location in the world .Sorry dont recommend and wont be coming back.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Great hotel for exploring Fisherman’s Wharf and Alcatraz. Clean, comfortable rooms. There was some confusion with the right number of beds for a family of 4 in our first room but they did eventually sort it out. Great breakfast, lots of choice. Would recommend!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed over the weekend, and had a great time. Special thanks to Ana, Sagar, and Jon.. awesome location close to lots of different locations. It was a little noisy at night but not so much that it would keep you awake.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Booked this hotel for a few friends who are coming into town for conference. The hotel front desk staff is responsive and helpful. Rooms are clean and newly renovated, including free breakfast, wifi right in downtown San Francisco. Given the number of old and moldy hotels downtown, Holiday Inn Express is a solid choice for group travel in a well located building walking distance to union square, moscone center and
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Central location... was there from 20th Feb-24th Feb 2018. Have shopping center around.. lot of places to eat around the property! The hotel was neat and clean.Mr Sagar at reception was very helpful. He was available whenever we needed help. Was a cheerful n a very good guide....In all a great stay!! Arun & Anjana kapur
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square
