review_body: I am getting ready to check out of this hotel after a six night stay. There are many good thing about the hotel. The staff are excellent, pleasant , helpful & friendly.. The hotel is very clean.. The bathroom was great and had all the complimentary toiletries . The location is very central. . Very large comfortable bed.. Breakfast was surprisingly very good with eggs, cereal, bacon, toast, yoghurt, bagels, muffins, sausages , fruit etc etc etc. All day coffee/tea.Some things which may enhance visits would be a small fridge in the room, our room had only one chair to sit in ( double room) and only one bedside table. Have safes in rooms and not in basement area who wants to run up and down each time to get something out/ put back.The only con would be the Saturday night noise from people leaving the bar next door and across the road, nothing earplugs would not help with. This is an excellent hotel .
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The hotel was clean and conveniently located, but other than those qualities, there is little else to be said good about this hotel. After booking 7 nights, but not prepaid, we requested to leave 2 nights early, we were told we had to lose a full nights stay in order to do so. After complaining of the unfairness, we were then told we had to pay a $100 early departure fee which was never communicated verbally nor in hotel reservation confirmation. After calling to IHG to get support, hotel management then agreed to waive the early departure fee. In addition the hotel is in a very noisy area and sits atop an Irish pub that is extremely loud to the point of disrupting Sleep nightly, but especially on Saturday nights when the music plays to 2 am. After complaining to hotel management about excessive noise, their solution was to offer ear plugs to sleep in. We requested a partial refund for the night we wereunable to sleep and the hotel management refused. When we complained, the General Manager was not on property but said he would respond within 48 hours. We needed an immediate response, not a delay of 48 hours, as were would check out with 24 hours.Again, it was necessary to contact IHG to receive their assistancein resolving this matter, they had a case manager assigned that was very helpful in resolving this matter for us. San Francisco was a great place to visit! This hotel was NOT!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I invited my fiends to San francisco for Birthday trip.we stayed in this fantastic hotel from 01-31-2018 through 02-03-2018. we amazed by the location is perfect for people who do not rant to car. from this hotel we can walked to anywhere of the city that we really want to see. the services were very thoughtful.the workers were friendly.the free Breakfast were very good.the rooms were so clean and big enough .I am a traveling person and I had been so many hotels in world. staying this hotel is wonderful experience I ever had. Thanks so much for what they did for every guest!!!!!!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: If you are planning on sightseeing in San Francisco, this location in Union Square is great. The hotel is new, but the building is old. Rooms are a bit small, but adequate. Breakfast was well done and the usual Holiday Inn Express fare.We could enjoy the evening walking around the square....the Irish Pub next door was a bonus. We also walked to the Embarcadaro, Fisherman's Wharf, the market through the Financial District and Chinatown. Allowed us to drop our luggage early in the morning so we could begin our tour immediately.One thing: noise is a problem and you need to be aware that there is music and alleyway noise until the wee hours of the morning. It wasn't awful, but it was enough to wake us.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This place was quirky, but I liked it. Room was small, but very tasteful. Bathroom was really nice. Since the whole place is newly renovated from its previous incarnation, everything seems pretty fresh. It has my two most important features I want when I come to SF each year: breakfast and a fitness room. Some are bothered by the noise of Foley's or the street. I was on the fifth floor and didn't hear a thing. I'd come back, as long as the price is reasonable.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: If you don’t know the address, you might miss this hotel, because there are no big signs hollering out its identity. Minimalist entry lobby. Room furnishings equally modernist/minimalist. Clean. Pleasant, efficient staff. Breakfast in a small 2nd floor dining room, where coffee is available self-serve all day. Room 312 had a window that opened (!) onto a side street that wasn’t noisy. I wouldn’t want to be in the front, room numbers ending in 01-05, because O’Farrell St can be noisy. We feared that the hotel’s having only 1 elevator might cause a “traffic jam” but it didn’t. Again, location is terrific.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: All i will say is this. Staff are nice and polite but.there is a bar that has a live band playing LOUD rock music until near 2am and you cant escape the noise. Even on the 5th floor which is the highest. But... if you dont care about noise.... its an ok hotel. Buffet isn't great but there is cereal etc. Would I stay there again? Not a chance. 2 sleepless nights ruined my holiday. You have been warned!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The hotel is very well located and close to several stores and restaurants. It could have a small fridge, it would be a plus. Good breakfast, but the price is a bit high. The people working at the hotel are very good.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: The hotel was clean & comfortable, breakfast was just right, staff was very nice and accommodating, the location was perfect, however, the noise kept us up ALL night. Two reasons: 1) The Irish bar next door had live music every night (one night was especially bad; the band played until 2am, mgmt told me many people complained about it); 2) Our room faced a garage where there were work trucks in and out all night long, beeping of the trucks backing out, pipes banging on cement. I hate to give a bad review as the noise was not the hotels fault at all, but I would not stay here again due to this.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: A very nice, recently remodeled, hotel which is close to downtown. Very clean rooms, reasonably priced, good breakfast included, good competent staff. No on-site parking, but very reasonable ($35 compared to $65 at other nearby hotels) parking garage 1/2 half block away. There is some outside noise which is a problem with all downtown hotels.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: A friend and I chose this hotel because she accumulated enough Holiday Inn rewards points for us to get two complimentary nights. The location is ideal in the middle of everything and the hotel is fairly new or renovated.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I am a fan of Holiday Inn normally. This one was clean, friendly staff and, typical of San Francisco, frustrating to get to. But it was the noise level that disappointed most. If you do decide to stay here I highly recommend staying above the 2nd floor and as far away from the Johnny Foley's Irish hoise bar located just below the hotel on the corner of Cyril Magnan & O'Farrel street. Veey loud until very late. Plus San Franciscans love their horns & the constant honking of them is challenging so close to the street. I will not be backnto this particular Holiday Inn Express
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed here for almost 10 days. Courteous staff. Hotel has break fast option. Located very near to Union Square, shopping place of San Francisco.Room was a bit small but good enough for one or two people.They have Gym facility as well. I definitely recommend this.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Quite a surprise, not at all what I expected from HiEx. Very nice hotel with friendly staff located just minutes away from all transportation options. Adequate free breakfast. Wonderful suite with separate bedroom and living room which had a sleeper sofa in it. Clean, modern bathroom. Many late dining options nearby.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: A week in San Francisco and wanted to stay downtown, so booked into the Union Square... Super location! And only a 30 minutes cab ride from the Airports.... If the traffic is right getting over the bridge!So at the hotel, checked in nice and smooth... Great room, nice and fresh and clean and modern too!The location of this hotel at 235 O'Farrell for us was perfect! Really right in the downtown area, we could walk to the center, we could walk to the bus at Van Ness... All other sights were just a $10 Uber away...Even just a 4 minutes walk to the Dollar car rental station!Great breakfast, fresh every day... Nice light breakfast areas too. There was a mini gym, but I did not go in there.Security is good with key access to the elevators.Staff were always friendly polite and curtious.I would recommend and would stay here again if back in town :-)
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I had to attend meetings in a nearby hotel and decided to stay at the HIEx to get an "affordable" room. This is not my first stay in a HIEx so I was not surprised. The room was definitively small but still large enough for a guy leaving early and coming back late. I needed a good bed and got it. I needed a clean bath-room and got it, even larger than I'd have expected and pretty up-to-date [great lightening]. The room had a terrible view but was wonderfully quiet. I needed early breakfast and all was ready at 6:25am. So I've been happy.Special KUDOS to the front-desk people for their great assistance, specially on the last day when I wanted to change before going to the airport.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is newly remodeled. The rooms are great - large and well designed with nice large bathroomThe staff are fantastically helpful and friendly. Free breakfast more than adequate. The hotel was well priced to cap it off
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: In the build up to stopping in San Francisco I did what most responsible travellers would do to get the most out of their holiday, research research more research then spend days checking for price alterations. After an exhaustive search I ended up selecting the holiday inn express, union square and I haven’t looked back, I now wander around San Fran marvelling at my choice looking at the tacky looking 3 and 4 star hotels most of which costs at least 50% more, San Fran is a really expensive place. The hotel is located around 2/3 mins from Union square. The rooms are clean, well maintained and serviced, the shower is quite large and no mound in the grout. Staff are also very pleasant. Breakfast is included and this is really useful if you are looking to save on costs, it is undersold on their website and actually includes a really good variety for which you can get a good fill that will last until mid afternoon. You can also usually pop back into the breakfast room to get a coffee or tea at any point during the day (not evenings or night).Room tip:Get at least the third floor as on certain days you can hear music from downstairs however, it isn’t on until late and you should be out enjoying the cityBooking tip:Register with TopCashback then book through hotels.com. All fees included then usually get around 10% cash back
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Great breakfast, clean, friendly staff, near a bus stop. We took the Yart from Yosemite and than a bus from the transportation station $5 for the the three of us to take the bus across town two blocks from the hotel.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: It was our first visit to San Francisco so I had not really a clue what hotel in which area to book. After a research on the internet my partner and me decided union square would be a good location to go for. I've never stayed at holiday inns but visited once for a meeting as I'm from the hotel trade and was pleasantly surprised. So I went ahead and booked it but still didn't expect as much as basics. When we arrived we've been warmly welcomed by reception staff and checked in. Hotel staff realised we were exhausted from our flight so they made it quick and sufficient. We've booked a basic room but were surprised of the high quality standard and cleanliness. After a little wander through town we were welcomed back and went to our room. After a good night sleep (very comfy bed) we headed down for breakfast and again were surprised with plenty of choice. From hot buffet items like scrambled egg and bacon to cereals and a fridge filled with yoghurts and fresh milk there was everything you needed to have a good start of your day. Very helpful reception staff which always went the extra mile and helped where they could. Every time we enter the hotel we were greeted and welcomed back. Sorry didn't get your names but you were brilliant. Would I recommend it? Definitely! If you want a hotel room which is not too expensive and you are only there for breakfast and want to discover town, this is the right place for you. They even have a basic gym which we didn't use. Keep it up guys. You're doing a great job.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I was recently forced to modify my 3-night hotel booking twice due to flight cancellations (climate conditions), and this change resulted in a rate increase of over USD300 total from my initial reservation and the new one. I contacted the manager and told him I fully understood how room rates fluctuated on a daily basis, however, given this particular situation, where niether party had control over weather factors, I kindly suggested him to consider a middle point where I would be charged 50% of the rate increase so niether the hotel nor myself would be totally affected by what had happened. It´s worth mentioning I also told him the rate I had originally booked, was a non refundable one,and that I felt frustrated to have to assume the 100% rate increase when it was not a change I personally requested, but rather forced to do so.His blunt answer was the hotel could not honor the rate adjustment due to conventions in the area during that week. With this answer, he completely disregarded my situation, and missed the opportunity to actually demostrate real customer care. In the end, it felt like the hotel took adavantage of the situation since I did not have another accommodation option to look for, but rather accept the rate increase or loose all my money. I didn´t let this ruin my stay (the rest of the staff was very cordial and professional), but it will definitely be my last one at a Holiday Inn chain hotel.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Absolutely perfect location and very easy to get around. I felt quite safe even at night and there are some convenient restaurants nearby.Room was clean and maintained well.Only downside was breakfast room was a bit small so you need to get in when it inst too busy.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We selected this hotel for proximity to our friend’s hotel. In our research we saw that it received high marks from visitors. We are in agreement that this is a nice hotel. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was pretty good and the staff was amazing. Each and every one was very friendly and helpful. It is close to the F Line to get to Fisherman’s Wharf. A short walk will get you to some very nice shopping. There is a ton of construction in this area which limits mobility a bit but hey when is there not construction in San Francisco?!? The only thing keeping a 5 rating is that for the last two nights of our stay they didn’t provide any wash cloths with rest of the linens. Not sure why and no explanation provided. Maybe it’s not a big deal for most but we like showering with wash cloths . Otherwise a very pleasant stay and we would certainly return.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I gave this a one star rating because the two reception staff actually earned it.We looked online for a reasonable 24 Hour stay between flights in transit from USA for our Australian return. We were two women travelling alone, and after confronting issues after Hurricane Irma, we had our travel plans turned into disarray.We did not have a lot of time to put a lot of strategy for hotels after leaving Florida with a diversion into Canada before this unexpected stop.We fortunately arrived in the daytime into perhaps the worst side of the city,confronted with homeless people and bad shop fronts. We stepped into the lobby which was basically not much more than a matchbox and spoke with the 2 reception staff about our feelings of the location.We had paid a deposit online of one nights stay UD $270. After seeing two rooms, we asked if we could transfer our money to another hotel of the same chain IHG (Intercontinental) The first room had a faulty cloth Blind on the window and was unusable. It could not be fixed after staff were sent up on our arrival. The second room, like the other, had an unusual odour. The bedrooms offered an attractive bed with white linen plus a clean, perhaps newly renovated bathroom. On the downside, there was no room whatsoever to leave our cases except between the bed and side walls, and would have to stay closed at all times. We decided that security was at a risk because there was no safe except at reception, with a dubious situation that they locked their doors from 10pm each night due to the unsafe area.The staff also confirmed we were correct in our assumption, and we would have been at risk if we turned left and not right leaving the lobby into the street. After an hour of unsuccessful bidding for a fair and justifiable situation with the receptionist speaking online with their Manager Raj, it was non negotiable even though we were members with so called benefits.We then decided to take a taxi to the Fairmont and it was a huge relief to go to a safe location.As we would have had to walk the city with our passports and valuables, also no facilities we could use, we believe that we may have turned an unforeseen unsavoury situation into a total positive by leaving this hotel.All in all, do yourself a favour, and do not consider this hotel nor this Chain of hotels as there is no loyalty whatsoever to members, and even more so to basic travellers.It is a HUGE NO from us!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed here Friday 15th September 2017.Very comfortable rooms, had issue with Wifi but reception staff were very helpful. Breakfast was basic but plentiful.Location was very good, 2 or 3 blocks from pier 39.Would recommend this hotel.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Stayed 2 nights. Finding the hotel was interesting. You cannot park your vehicle in front of the hotel to unload your luggage. Front desk staff directed me to park where indicated just around the corner (valet stop at Cyril Magnin Street and O'Farrell Street). You'll see a sign indicating where to park. Note: Valet parking is currently $55 / night plus tax of $13.75.Location is fantastic! Especially if you love to shop! I selected this hotel primarily based on the following factors: its proximity to Union Square shopping; its proximity to catching the cable cars; and complimentary breakfast.This hotel is located very close to Macy's (on the next block) and is a short walking distance to Westfield San Francisco shopping centre and other fun places to shop. Starbucks and Boudin Bakery are quite close. Walgreens and Trader Joe's are also not too far.The Powell and Market cable car turnaround is nearby.Ask for a room on a higher floor and away from the elevator if you are a light sleeper. As other reviewers have indicated, there is a pub next door. I did not hear any street noise as I requested a room on a higher floor.I only wish our room had a safe and a luggage rack.A special thank you to John N - Front Desk Manager. Very friendly and helpful!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Visited the San Francisco for the first time recently, and stressed about the right hotel. After doing a bit of research we chose this hotel and we were sooooooo pleased! The hotel staff couldnt have been more helpful (Susan at the front desk is always ready to help out), the hotel is sparkeling clean, and the location is fantastic. Easy on/off isf you want to use public transportation, and centrally located for all taxi/uber service. Lots of great resturants around, easy walking distance. The only bad news, is like many hotels in downtown San Francisco you can expect small room sizes, and a fair amount of traffic noise. But, if you want to be in the center of it all, you just have to be ok with that. On a final note, the continental free breakfast here was really nice in comparison to a lot of other hotels I've stayed at. I would book this hotel again instantly if I were to return to SF
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Just got finished staying here and have to say John N and his staff are great. Friendly service no problem with them calling a cab for me and my family. Breakfast was clean and well kept. Lobby was bright and clean this hotel is convenient to all types of transportation in the city. Room was clean we stayed here from a Sunday-Saturday would stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was sufficient for what we wanted. Location was great, close to restaurants, shopping, bars.Breakfast was better than expected - There were hot items (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes as well as cereal, yogurt, bagels, toast, and fruit.Employees were friendly and helpful with directions/questions.Air conditioning, tv, and bathroom all functioned well and everything was clean.There are a few improvements that can be made, but for the price we paid, the negatives did not matter much to us. The bed was not comfortable, both of us woke up sore the next day. The rooms smell like an old, musty house. We got used to the smell, but it was off-putting at first.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This is a very new, modern, clean, energy efficient hotel near Union Square. Signage is a little limited, so it can be hard to find at first. Rooms range in size from very small to larger. One negative: we checked in later in the day, and because the hotel was completely occupied, we got a smaller room, and there were no rollaway beds for our son; he ended up sleeping on the floor with extra blankets.Fitness room is small, but clean and has several new machines. Breakfast room is definitely adequate, but good selection of food/drink.Definitely good location - near lots of restaurants and shops and a cable car line. Parking garages are down the street.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This property has a lot going for it. It has two queen beds in the rooms, a rarity in San Francisco, where full beds are the norm. We were staying for five nights with two kids and appreciated the extra room. The hotel is relatively new and feels like it. Very sleek and urban, not imposing the cookie cutter approach more common in suburban Holiday Inn Express locations. The Wi-Fi was consistently reliable and strong. The breakfast room is compact, though well-stocked and kept clean. Margarita provided friendly service there. In fact, all of the staffer met was both affable and helpful. Main knock and could be a deal breaker for some: the hotel is right next to a pub that often has live music. You'll hear it. Management knows that but is powerless to do anything about it. We eventually fell asleep, but at times it took some doing. Our kids were too exhausted at the end of the night to be bothered. At the end of the day you have a good hotel in a great location. Just know who your neighbors are. You'll be getting to know them when the sun goes down.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Great location, 2 blocks from MUNI/Bart. Nice Large room, quiet in the back of the hotel. Front desk was the nicest I've interacted with at ANY H.I. property.I would go back again, assuming the rates fit my budget.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Really nothing about this hotel worth raving about...not that an HIE ever warrants a rave, but I've stayed in a few that were surprisingly clean and well appointed. This one, while fairly new, is just "meh." Signage is poor...2 taxis and an Uber thought I didn't know where I was going because they'd driven by it 100 times and had never seen it. Lobby is small, stark and sparse...who cares? No biggie...just saying. Room was good sized and well appointed.,,but be advised: I was on the highest floor (5th) and was nearly thumped out of my bed on Saturday night. Why? Because the adjacent pub host live music every night...but especially rollicking on Saturday. It goes on 'til 2am. I'm not opposed to a rocking good time...still, pack ear plugs....and even then I'm not sure it'll block the bass and drums. Breakfast...is served in a small room next to the small fitness area on the 2nd floor. (From a traffic and aroma standpoint, I was glad my room wasn't on that floor.) Breakfast itself was typical powdered eggs, sausage and a few cereals...Coffee was decent tho.Staff was plenty friendly. Location: Okay...Close to Union Square but SF is so overrun with homeless that I don't know where'd you stay to avoid the walking triage. Price per night was insane...the fact that I paid $1,100 for 3 nights made me hate myself for contributing to the unconscionable reaming.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Location is key and this hotel is in a great location. Trolleys are around the corner, cable cars a few blocks away. Breakfast is included and there is a variety of items to choose from, from cereal, yogurt and oatmeal to hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, omelets and sausage. They even have a pancake maker. Beds are comfortable, rooms are small though.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This place has no negatives - the front desk was friendly and accommodating (the room was without a hair dryer - they sent one up in a flash; we requested more towels - we had a stack of them within 5 minutes). The breakfast was very good, the breakfast room was clean and orderly. The location of the hotel was perfect --- steps away from great restaurants, shopping and cable cars. The beds were super comfortable. I loved this place!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel was the perfect location. Access to everything. Very helpful kind staff. Great breakfast. Caution...lower floors can be loud at night. Local pub next-door does some rock and rolling. I had been warned. We had a fifth floor room. Didn't hear a thing. Beds were super comfy!
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I recently stayed in a holiday express and I was unsatisfied. The breakfast room is about the same size as the room if not smaller and the food selection is quite small. The elevator is the slowest in the city, you could walk up and down the stairs twice before the elevator got to your floor. The worst part was when I was trying to sleep it sounded like a bunch of dump trucks were having a roller derby on the street below. Also there is no refrigeration unit anywhere in the room. The only good thing about the place is that you walking distance to almost everywhere.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: On a road trip coupled with the San Francisco Marathon, this was the perfect place to stay. Downtown next to Union Square & only a short walk from the start of the Marathon, it was perfectly located. Parking garage across the road, although the hotel does offer valet parking, great rooms, great king beds, all the usual amenities, breakfast included.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This is a downtown Holiday Inn Express so logically things are likely to be on the smaller size. The staff were always friendly and keen to help in anyway they could. John (manager's name I think) has high expectations and his staff live up to them. My nephew became ill on the day we were checking out, we were given late check out until 2pm. However the hotel was fully booked that night and they could not extend it further, instead they allowed him to lie down quietly in one of the property's staff rooms, I cannot imagine many hotels going to these lengths. The rooms were spotless and size was surprisingly good for downtown. Beds were very comfortable. Everything felt new and modern.The breakfast room was small, again you're downtown and space is a premium. The breakfast room was spotless. The breakfast was good especially when considering it's just a part of the room at no additional cost. Location was excellent. 100 yards to start of cable car. 100 yards to Union Square. Walgreens around the corner for convenience. Many restaurants within 5 min walk. 40 min walk to Fisherman's Wharf. 20 min walk to Ferry Building. Very convenient. Thank you.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Brand new hotel with state of the art infrastructure. Perfectly appointed modern rooms and very clean.The breakfast room is a little small when the hotel is fully booked.The internet speed is consistently very good.Housekeeping services are discreet but excellent and the Front Desk staff are spontaneously friendly and very helpful
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel is in a great location and the rate was very good for SF. It was modern, clean, with smallish rooms and fine in general for our needs. No safe in the room. In one room, the last day we were there, the coffee maker didn't work on the day I tried it.The staff were friendly and responsive about our concerns, which led to us staying in 3 different rooms. They told us the manager was not around. In the first room the side of the bed was very close to the translucent bathroom door so at night when the other person used the bathroom and turned on the light it was enough to wake me up. We changed rooms and the location of the bed made that problem better. In the second and third rooms, at the same location in the hotel, but on different floors, we had 3 nights where the shower water was cool after the first person had a hot shower in the evening. The manager insisted that the plumbing was all new and no one else complained but we definitely had cool showers on 3 of 5 nights spent at the hotel. The manager offered us points enough for a one night stay in an IHG hotel in SF as a result of our experience.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: I booked a room with 2 twin beds through Expedia and when we arrived we arrived we were given a single queen bed. We were told that we would definitely move to a room with 2 beds the next day, as one would become vacant. When we got back from our tour the next day nothing had been arranged and we could not get the room we paid more money for again. The staff were not helpful at all and made no attempt to rectify the situation but just gave more excuses. At the end we spent 3 nights in a room we did not book. The location is very convenient but also noisy at night due to the pub next door. The rooms were small and did not have a fridge. The breakfast room had about seating for about 20 people' which was totally insufficient for the number of rooms and caused queues for breakfast. All in all a really disappointing stay.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Small hotel (59 rooms) walking distance to everything. Clean, modern. Only downfall is the parking $60. But if you park at the corner parking lot a block and a half down it's much cheaper. We paid $35 for 24 hours. I think it was a special. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: Good Location safe to walk around, walking distance to almost everything. Very clean rooms. Close to good restaurants. Very Helpful staff. Definitely will use this hotel again ,if I will be in the same area.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: This hotel only opened in Jan 2017 (so 6 months ago), and you can tell. It's fresh and clean with a modern feel. The staff are friendly and helpful also advising where not to go. NOTE: this is on the edge of the Tenderloin district, so as long as you turn right when you leave the hotel you'll be fine. I was a sole female traveler and felt safe but just something to be aware of (this is also the advice of the hotel staff). Very close to the cable car turning circle and Powell street bart stop this was easy to find and a good base to explore from. The breakfast isn't inspiring, so if you like nice and fresh big american breakfasts this isn't your place. I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the location. A bit over a block from Union Square, Cable Cars and shopping. The rooms are spotless, beds comfortable and a nice, large shower. Hot breakfast with many choices and an attendant that replenished the food and kept the tables cleared and clean. The staff at the front desk were very nice and will help you with sightseeing choices and some tickets. Would stay here again.
hotelName: 29    Holiday Inn Express San Francisco Union Square
